name: Madagascar Card Game
description:
From the manufacturer's site:

I have Alex the Lion! Who has Marty the Zebra? If you have the right cards and the right speed - you win! Kids will love playing with their favorite Madagascar characters as they race to respond in order to win the game. This game also helps children build letter recognition and strengthen their reading vocabulary by using picture clues. Housed in a sturdy travel-tin, this card game includes two decks for two different ways to play. Includes 24 animal cards with green borders and 24 animal/letter cards with blue borders.

Ages 4 and up.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: SilverHawks
description: SilverHawks is a simple war type game that has players attempting to stop the Evil Mon'Star. The game makes use of spinners in order to determine if targets have been hit. Game comes with 6 cardboard characters and 2 spinners.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: O Guerreiro
description:
The WARRIOR is wargame to combat foot in the pre-Renaissance period. Your system of simple game allows animated simulations and pleasure without sacrificing the realism or the coherence of the simulation unnecessarily. With him it is possible to simulate any combat foot of the pre-Renaissance period. Each scenario of the game (to be published) it will contains a brochure with your add rules supplementary.

O GUERREIRO é wargame de combate a pé no período pré-renascentista. Seu sistema de jogo simples permite encenações movimentadas e agrádaveis sem sacrificar desnacessáriamente o realismo ou a coerência da simulação. Com ele é possível encenar práticamente qualquer combate a pé do período pré-renascentista. Cada cenário do jogo (a ser lançado) contém um brochura com suas regras adcionais.

http://www.riachuelogames.com.br/guerreiro.htm

name: Blackjack Dice Game
description: This is a fun way to play Blackjack! This set includes two 10-sided dice for the Blackjack game and three regular spotted dice (numbered 1 - 6) for the C-Low & Craps games.

name: Largada de Campe√µes
description:
Largada de Campeões is a dice rolling racing game.
There are two colored dice, one for vertical moves, another for horizontal moves.
Higher number indicates faster movement, which is not always the best play. Players may choose not to move one direction but if move is taken, all dice points must be used.
High luck factor, but it´s important to chose the correct moves.

name: Jetsons Out of This World Game
description: This 1962 Transogram Game is a simple roll and move game which also featured the playing of cards which were accumulated by landing on particular spots on the board. Game included playing pieces for George Jetson who worked for Spacely Space Sprockets, his wife Jane Jetson, teenage daughter Judy and preteen son Elroy, the housekeeper Rosie the Robot and the family dog Astro. On the show Astro could mumble words. His catch phrases were "Ruh-roh!" and "Right, Reorge!"
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Lion Squad
description: A two page wargame designed for a now dead contest. Lion squad is about a battle that took place on Mars in 2200 between the future king and rebels. Soldiers from the Kings army (Lion and Hearts) had to defend the outskirts of the city from the invading rebels, who were using a quickly built but unrefined tank.
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Succession
description:
For 3-4 players

Background : This game is not meant to be historical by nature. Instead it is a very rough sketch into political maneuvering and backstabbing used to get people into high positions of power. Since it is not historical, in the process of designing no real names were used. Even though some cards have images on them of famous people, they do not mean or correspond to anything (instead they are merely a card.)

Goal : At the end of the game who ever has the MOST of their color at the front of the line wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Memory, Print & Play

name: Meet Me at the Mall
description: Meet Me at the Mall is a mall shopping game in which players rush to purchase items before the mall closes. When the shopping bags are emptied, the player with the largest value of items wins.

name: Winnie the Pooh Honey Tree Game
description:
From the box:

"The bees have left the Honey Tree and are busy at work. Winnie-the-Pooh has climbed up the Tree and is filling himself with the honey that the busy bees have stored in their hive. His friends must save him by rushing to the Honey Tree to help him down before the bees return."

Players move along a modular cardboard path which is assembled prior to gameplay, towards a plastic three dimensional tree where Winnie The Pooh is stuck up a ladder. The path consists of colored squares; these colors correspond to cards which are drawn from a stack to determine the movement of each player.

Once a player reaches the tree they must drop a marble down a hole located in the top of the plastic structure; this may or may nor trigger the mechanism which causes Winnie to slide down the ladder, ending the game.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: Grave Digger
description:
Description from designer's website:

There's a vampire hiding in the cemetery, and the town council has offered a large reward to the first grave digger who can find the creature and destroy it. The tools you'll need are scattered around the cemetery grounds, but the vampire has summoned several phantoms to break those tools before you can use them. You also might dig up the wrong grave and miss your chance to destroy the vampire. But such is the life of a grave digger...

Object Of The Game:

Try to destroy the vampire by digging up the right grave. You must have three tools (a pick, a shovel and a stake) to dig up and kill the vampire. The phantoms will try to break your tools.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Little Prince Protects his Planet
description:
Players help the Little Prince protect his planet from Baobab Tree saplings, which, if they grow into full trees, will destroy the Little Prince's planetoid.


There are two to four players in this game. The winner is the player who helped The Little Prince Protect his planet the most. Each player gets an equal number of "Star" Tokens to play on the Little Prince Star/Bird Sheet. The goal is for a player to have the least amount of Star Tokens left in their possession.

In the game box are flowers and baobabs cards. The roots are shown, and must be pulled out to reveal whether the saplings are baobabs or flowers.

The game involves rolling a six sided die with four images corresponding to four sides of the game box. The images on the die are the Little Prince's three volcanoes and his Rose (x3).

Rolling a Rose:
If a player rolls a Rose, he or she must turn the box so that the rose side of the game box faces them. They must pick up any root (in the box) with the cardboard tweezers and if it is a flower, they add their Star Token to The Little Prince Star/Bird Sheet and leave the flower face up. If incorrect and a Baobab was picked up, they must put the baobab root side up back into the box, and add a “bird” Token to the Little Prince Star/Bird Sheet.

Rolling a Volcano:
If a player rolls a Volcano, he or she must turn the box so that the exact Volcano image side of the game box faces them that corresponds to the die image. They must pick up any root (in the box) with the cardboard tweezers and if it is a Baobab, they place their Star Token on the Little Prince Star/Bird Sheet and remove the Baobab from the box planet. If incorrect and a Flower was picked up, they must put the Flower root side up back into the box, and add a “bird” Token to the Little Prince Star/Bird Sheet.

The game ends when either all bird tokens are placed in their allocated spot on the Little Prince Star/Bird Sheet, all flowers are face up on the planet, or all Baobabs are pulled out from the planet. The player with the least amount of Star wins because they have helped The Little Prince the most.


Die Spieler helfen dem Kleinen Prinzen, seinen Planeten vor Sprösslingen von Affenbrotbäumen, die so groß werden, dass sie den Planeten zerstören können, zu beschützen.

name: Mickey Mantle's Big League Baseball
description: Mickey Mantle's Big League Baseball is one of 6 games that were included in a grouping of games from the Gardner Company. All games came in the same box under the title of Big 6 Sports Games. This is a simple spin and find the results game. Also included in the box with this game was; Gardner's Championship Golf, All Star Basketball, Gardner's Stock Car Race , All Star Football and Verne Gagne Wrestling. Mickey Mantles Big League Baseball is a simple and easy game to play. On each play the team in the field flips a colored die and the team at bat spins a spinner. The color on the die and the number on the spinner determine the results of the play.

name: Letra-Mix: Spiel mit S√§tzen
description:
This game complements the Letra-Mix game in Schmidt Spiele's range, which is a dice game with individual letters on the faces of the dice.

Spiel mit Sätzen translates as 'game with sentences' and the dice in this game have words on them, rather than just letters. The game comes with 24 word dice, a timer and a dice cup. The rules say the game can be played in a group or in partnerships, but it does recommend that when more than six play, they do so in partnerships.

Each player (or partnership) casts the dice and attempts to form complete sentences before the timer runs out. Words can be placed crossword-style, which means that a word could be used in a horizontal as well as vertical direction. The score is 1 point for every word that forms part of a sentence (words used in both vertical and horizontal sentences score 2 points). However, 1 point is deducted for each die that is not used.

name: Newtonspillet
description:
Newtonspillet is a spin-off from "Newton", a science program from the official Norwegian Broadcasting (NRK) aimed for youth.

Players move around the board and answers science questions from the following four categories: "Sea and Water", "Land", "Air and Sky" and "The Universe".

name: Gulljakten
description:
In Gulljakten (The Goldrush) is a children's game where the players use a scale to measure the amount of gold they dig.

When landing on a green square, the player gains gold, and when landing on a red square, the player must purchase food, drinks or being robbed.

All actions use the scales to weigh the token on the square, and balance them with an appropriate number of lumps of gold on the other side.

Contents:

Game board
Four gold diggers with plastic feet
Four digging tools
One die
Lumps of gold
One pair of scales

name: Phractured Phrases
description:
Phractured Phrases is a party game where players try to recognize and correct alterations in famous phrases from famous speakers, literature, film, culture, and history

Players divide into two teams. While a timer runs, one player on a team reads cards with famous phrases that have had words replaced in them. The rest of the team tries to identify the wrong words and correct them. For example, the phrase "Don't fire until you see the SIZE of their THIGHS" would need the corrections of "white" and "eyes."
When time is up, the other team can then score points by correcting any phrases missed during the round. Score is kept on a board with various bonus spaces and other incentives.

name: The Family Game
description:
Loosely based on Chuck Barris' short-lived 1967 game show hosted by Bob Barker, each parent and child begins the game with a pawn on Start. The father reads a question aloud to one of the children and both write down their response. If the answers match, the father scores a card worth 25 points and he advances his pawn the number of spaces indicated on the card. If the answers do not match, the child’s pawn advances one space. The game continues with all players changing roles as questioner and responders. The winner is the player who scores 250 points.

Three of the spaces of the gameboard are marked "toy store". A player gets a chance card whenever landing here. Should a player land on the space indicated by the card held, that player is declared the winner immediately.

The game can be played by one family with the participants playing as individuals, or as a contest between families.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Oil Barons
description:
Oil Barons is a board game based on buying and selling in the oil industry.

On a player's turn, the player rolls 2d6, with doubles giving you extra turns. When you land on a square you get options to change your position on the board, such as buying/selling oil wells or opening/closing oil pipelines.

The winner is the first player to deliver a specified number of oil barrels to the Refinery, usually 15 or 25.

Contents of box:-
Playing Board
Rules
2 d6 dice
24 Bank Cards [similar to Monopoly chance cards]
1 pad of 50 Scorecards
225 Bank notes [6 different denominations, 5,000, 10,000, 20,000, 50,000, 100,000, 500,000]
8 White Discs marked OFF on one side, blank on the other
6 Hats [white green black yellow red blue]
18 grey Oil Rigs
72 Barrels [12 of each colour - white green black yellow red blue]
72 Flags [12 of each colour - white green black yellow red blue]

name: Cleveland Sports Trivia
description: This is a basic trivia game focused on sports relating to Cleveland, Ohio (USA) and can either be used as a card set for trivia games like Trivial Pursuit, or as a stand alone game. The game includes Cleveland sports trivia cards, spinner, score card pads,a pencil, and instructions.

name: Sesame Street Scrabble
description: A child's first crossword game. Sesame street theme, Ages 3 - 5.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle, Word Game

name: Monster Tykes
description:
From the product description:

In Monster Tykes, players lead a Team of young fantasy Monsters or Heroes who just can't wait to grow up and be like their parents. Too anxious to wait, they bully other Teams around the town, in schoolyards, and underground caverns. The first Team to send the other home "Crying to their mommies" wins!

name: Helmsman: The Game of Table Top Sailing
description: Helmsman The Game of Table Top Sailing Made in England by Minimodels LTD. The object of this game is for two or more players to complete the sailing course on the board by fair sailing and superior skill thereby beating your opponents.

name: Malha√ß√£o: O Jogo
description:
In "Malhação - O Jogo", players are challenged to answer correctly questions about... the other players! Each turn, a player reads out loud a card with a question, and secretly choses one out of three options about how he (or she) would react in such situation. After that, it's time for the others to try to guess which was the chosen answer.

The game always have two winners - each player has a separate score with every other player. In the end, the pair that has the highest sum of points wins the game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Monopoly: New York Jets Collector's Edition
description: This is a version of the Monopoly game based on the National Footbal League (NFL) team, the New York Jets. Players can Buy, sell and trade the team's most valuable players, from Joe Namath and Mark Gastineau to Chad Pennington and Curtis Martin.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Gotta Second
description:
The object of the game is to beat your opponent's time at a fun task. The fastest times score points. Be the first player to peg to the finish and you're the winner.

Contents of the game include a timer, timer arm, plastic tray, game board, 264 Gotta Second cards, 2 pads of paper and 12 game pegs (2 each of 6 different colors).

Game instructions are printed in English and French.
categories: Math, Memory, Number, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Acting, Memory, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Singing

name: The Shirt Tales Game
description: In The Shirt Tales Game, players choose to be there favorite Shirt Tales cartoon character and move around the three-dimensional board to collect their four shirt tokens. The first to collect their tokens and get to the top of the large oak tree is the winner.

name: Shark!
description:
The aim of the game is to get both your harpoons into the shark and tow him to one of the ports.

Play consists of rounds with players moving their boats and putting out the bait followed by the sharks move.

First the shark surfaces and then moves towards a boat where the shark tries to overturn the boat or the boat attempts to harpoon the shark

The game uses both spinners and Dice for movement and determining the outcome of actions.

name: Meistertrainer
description:
Das realistische Futballspiel von Premiere World

This game features the teams of the German Bundesliga for the season 2001/2002.

name: High School Musical Game
description: This is a game aimed pre-teens and teens using the theme of "High School Musical" Players compete to make it through East High School(represented on the game board) to be the first to collect six different cast cards while trying to avoid detention. Players succeed by answering trivia questions or singing/dancing along with an included interactive music CD.

name: Hide Away
description:
Be the first to bury all of your Burying pieces!

Lift a Crown to bury one of your pieces. Play moves clockwise and each player does the same. If you uncover a Burying piece, add it to your supply. Revolve the tray as far as you like during your own turn. Bury all of your Burying pieces and be the winner!
publishers: Berliner Spielkarten, Hasbro Industries (Hasbro Bradley), Orda Industries Ltd., Skye Marketing Corporation

name: The Great Riverboat Race
description: A simple dice game similar to other Channel Craft and is a part of the Vintage Game Series. The game comes in a tin box with the rules printed on the lid. It includes 2 pegs, one dice, a playing platform and instructions. The game is also called "The Great Race".

name: Lincoln On Board
description: Lincoln On Board is a Monopoly style game where the property and other spaces represent businesses and landmarks in the city of Lincoln, Nebraska (USA).

name: Monopoly: Twin Cities
description: This is a 1997 variant of Monopoly issued by USAopoly based on the Twin Cities of Minneapolis and St. Paul, and their surrounding suburbs. Local Twin Cities landmarks, businesses, and organizations take the place of the familiar Atlantic City streets, and are grouped according to similar types. For example, the orange group, St. James Place, Tennessee Avenue, and New York Avenue, in this edition are replaced by the sports teams the University of Minnesota Golden Gophers, the Minnesota Vikings, and the Minnesota Twins, respectively. Another example of this is the yellow group, traditionally Atlantic Avenue, Ventnor Avenue, and Marvin Gardens being replaced by the hotels Radisson Saint Paul, Minneapolis Hilton and Towers, and The Marquette Minneapolis Hotel. The bank notes are also branded with National City Bank and Twin Cities Edition.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Funtastic Fitness game
description: Players compete to become physically fit by using dice rolls and card drawing to navigate paths on the game board incorporating concepts of dieting, physical exercise, and "self awareness."

name: 'The Club' Board Game
description:
The latest game from MM Board Games is now available FREE to Print and Play.

You are a Night-club DJ under orders from the Club Manager to keep the clubbers happy. The Club has many rooms (one per player), each playing a different genre of music. Each player has a board that depicts their ‘room’, which is split into 3 main areas; Bar Area, Dancefloor and Stage. Also on a player’s board are 2 record decks on either side of a sound mixer.
Players have a selection of records and must decide which to play at what time. At the start of the game the DJ must entice clubbers on to the Dancefloor (from the Bar Area), then, as the night progresses, on to the Stage.
The manager will visit your room from time to time and you will receive points for clubbers on the Dancefloor and for those on the Stage.
At the end of the night the DJ with the most points is the winner.

To acquire the game visit the site below;

http://mmboardgames.page.tl/

name: Japanimayhem
description:
Simple card game in which players representing parodies of Anime characters on a killing spree, who compete for the most victims. Weapon cards are used to modify abilities and die rolls are added to attack and defense scores. Generally, victim cards must be attacked multiple times to be "finished off," and get to counterattack. Certain cards have special effects upon the game's rules.

Similar to:

Stellar Slaughter: A Game of Science Fiction Horror Movie Madness
categories: Card Game, Horror, Humor, Science Fiction

name: Ro-jaws' Robo-Race Game
description: Originally published in the British 2000 AD comic. Play Ro-jaws, Mek-quake, Hammer-stein or Dr. Feeley-Good in a simple roll-and-move game. The first player to reach Greasy Gracie's Robo-Bar is the winner.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Racing, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Game of Seven-Up
description:
This game is a derivative of Shut the Box and is also called Help Thy Neighbor.

Each player is supplied with a number card with the numbers 2 through 12 printed on it. Players start by placing a chip in the kitty or ante or some other predetermined amount. As each player rolls the dice they cover the corresponding number on their board much like bingo. If a 7 is thrown, the player loses a turn unless it is their first throw. In which case all players put a chip in the kitty and the player keeps throwing dice and covering numbers on their board or their neighbor's boards if he/she cannot use them until another 7 is thrown. The player who covers all their numbers wins and wins the chips in the kitty.

name: The Game of Birds
description:
The Game of Birds is an educational card game which is similar to Bridge, but without a called "Trump" suit or any bidding.
The game pieces consist of 4 groups of cards - each group made up of 13 cards and each card picturing a different species of bird.
publishers: Cincinnati Game Co., Fireside Game Co., Fireside Games, H. P. Gibson & Sons, Parker Brothers, The United States Playing Card Company

name: Robin Hood
description:
Game based on the popular British television series.

It consists of 44 cards in 11 suits, so there are 4 of each suit.

Winner is the player to get rid first of his dealt out cards.

First player lays out a card face down onto the table and calls out the number, next player in line must play the following number. After card no. 11 card no.1 follows.
At any time the card layer can be challenged: If the number challenged is correct, the challenger takes all his cards and those of the opponent, if not: it's just the opposite.
If the game tends to drag on, it is advised to fix a time limit.

Again a card game in line of the Pepys series with top graphic design and card quality.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Secret Agent: The Card Game With the Magic Monocle
description:
The Pepys card game with the legendary magic monocle.

Game consists of 39 cards; 4 master agents, 5 secret agents, 5 secret plans, 5 inns, 5 trains, 5 planes, 5 cars and 5 M.T.B cards (and the monocle, of course...).

Object of the game is collect six cards:1 secret agent, 1 secret plan, an inn and 3 of the same kind of transport.
This is done by pick-up-and-discard.
In order to win none of these cards may have a secret message written on it.

If a player has collected the complete set he can call for help of the Master Agent (MA), thus using the magic monocle to reveal if any of his cards has a secret message written on it: He spreads them out and checks the colour coded strips at the base of his cards.

If there is none, he wins, if there is - play commences, now knowing which cards to discard.

As with nearly all Pepys games outstanding graphic design, the Monocle a really nice gimmick.

name: Hiiret juustojahdissa
description: Each player has his own mouse. The idea of the game is to use this mouse and try to push as many pieces of cheese as possible to your own hole. Cheesepieces with worms do not score any points in the end.

name: Progress
description:
A rather demanding card game from the pre-war area of the pepys company.
The game comes in the super-luxury padded box with silk finish box hull and thick cards with linen finish.

The game depicts the progress of the pilgrims on the american continent, with John Bunyan the joker.

There are 52 cards in 4 suits and the joker.

Object of the game is to get rid of the cards in hand first.

In order to achive this the cards have to be laid out in a given pattern following complicated rules.

After one player has finished the cards in hand of the other players count points against them.

Play ends after a beforehand agreed number of poínts.

There is also a Rummy-variant which can be played.

The educational factor is served by the fact that there is a booklet added which present a resumé of the story of the pilgrims progress as illustrated in the card game (there are notes to each card).

Known are two editions of the game: One came in dark purple and one in dark maroon. Excellent!
categories: Card Game, Educational, Novel-based, Political, Religious

name: Barbapapas familjespel
description: This card game contains 7 families with 7 cards in each family + 3 trumps. Each turn a player asks another if they have a particular card. If they do, they have to give it to the active player. The active player can continue asking for cards. When you have all cards from one family you can put the set in front of you. The goal of the game is to collect as many sets of families as possible.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Memory
publishers: Alga, France Cartes, K. Hjelm F√∂rlag AB

name: Guessit
description: Guessit is a fast paced game played like charades. Instead of acting, however, you give verbal and physical clues to your teammates, who are trying to guess the items you are describing before the time runs out. There are 4 categories of play - Places, People, Objects, and Actions & Activities. On your turn, you roll the dice to determine which category you get. There are 7 items on each card and you get 1 point for each item your team correctly guesses. The first team to 45 points wins.

name: Stacktactica
description: Stacktactica is an abstract wargame where players stack numbered chits in piles of two and move them about the board. When two stacks are adjacent, they engage in combat and the total values are compared with highest winning. Advanced rules and playing pieces allow for some modification of the rules. The last player on the board is the winner.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Groucho TV Quiz
description: Quiz Game based on the NBC TV show starring Groucho Marx.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Whozat
description:
Each player tries to identify the celebrity represented on a card.
The card has 4 sections, each one showing more and more the whole caricature of the celebrity.
If a player guesses at the first clue, they move forward 3 spaces, second clue, 2 spaces, and so on.
Mistakes will cost players the same: 3 spaces back if they make a mistake on the first clue.
The first one to cross the finish line wins.

All the game's illustrations were done by the artist Marshall Jay Kaplan.

name: Flower-garden
description:
Four young gardeners have a communal garden in which each sets out to plant a row of flowers However, that can be a complicated undertaking; sometimes the bed a gardener chooses is already planted or is reserved for a different color of flower.

Each player chooses a color peg and takes 8 flowers, two of each color. The players take turns rolling the die and moving their pegs in any direction he chooses but only in one direction. If a player lands on an un-planted flower bed and has a flower of the same color as the bed, he can plant his flower. But if the bed is already planted or the player does not have a flower to match the bed, he may not plant a flower. After a player moves, his turn is over.

The winner is the first play to plant all his flowers.

name: Suomalainen Yleisurheilutietopeli
description: A unique game full of sports trivia. Produced in cooperation with the national federation Finnish Athletics. The game contains hundreds of questions regarding Finnish sports heroes and events since the beginning of the Finnish independence in 1917. Includes also fabulous picture cards, in which the players try to recognise athletes and glorious moments from the history and present-day of Finnish sports. Do you know... How tall is a hurdle in men’s 110 m hurdles? And how many Olympic bronze medals did Paavo Nurmi achieve? Find out all this and much more in the awesome Sports Trivia game!

name: What's a Dame To Do?!
description:
From the Offical Press Release:

What’s a DAME to do?!™ The socially-interactive board game - designed to spark
conversation, camaraderie and laughter - asks women to candidly predict co-players reactions to prescribed dilemmas…with extra points awarded for hilarity.

name: Piratenh√§ndler
description:
A game created for BGG.con 2007, loosely based on Sid Sackson's original game of Haggle.

1800 cards were created, numbered 1 to 600. Each card has five values corresponding to five different treasures. Each card also has a special ability which modifies one more values on one or more cards. The object of the game is to collect the best set of cards with the highest value in one or more of the five treasures. Cards and card information can be traded or wagered.

Special abilities include hidden information and logic puzzles, optional combat, and dozens of different themed avenues to combine cards that affect your final values.

Scott Alden of Board Game Geek helped clarify the rules, and contributed to components of the theme, names of the cards, card layout, and the game's name.

name: Ankeborgsloppet
description:
Ankeborgsloppet

Age: Ages 5 and up

Follow Donald Duck and his friends around the board game. You have to have luck on your side to reach the finish line first. Easy to learn.

Content:
1 Board game
6 pieces of wood
1 Dice
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Arthur's Game
description:
An imagination, memory and storytelling game.

Arthur's stories are waiting to be discovered and shared! Find your five matching story tiles, arrange the tiles from left to right, and tell the story you have created.

This is two games in one - Memory and storytelling.

Contents: 50 square story tiles
10 rectangle character tiles

name: P√• nya hyss med Emil i L√∂nneberga
description:
This is a game that is based on novel-writer Astrid Lindgren's most popular stories.

The game will take you on a journey on mischief, so hurry up, the one who will do the most mischief will win this game!!

Childrens game Ages 5 and up.

Contents:
1 Game board
1 dice
5 playing counter
8 card with Emil-mischief
1 Emil Card

name: Roundtable Games
description:
Roundtable Games consists of four different 2 - 4 player games that are designed to be played on a common game board, called the Roundtable. The four games are Roundtable Chess, Roundtable Checkers, Wordstack, and Checkers Roulette. The game includes 4 complete sets of chess men, 4 complete sets of checkers (15 per set), and four sets of letter tiles (45 per set) that are used for playing Wordstack and Checkers Roulette.


Roundtable Chess is extreme and exciting chess play for 2 or 4 players. Each player plays with a complete set of 16 chessmen. Chessmen move and make captures as done in the traditional two player chess game. Chessmen in Roundtable chess can also be move in circular directions. Each player’s objective is to gain control of the center of the Roundtable by safely moving his/her king into that position without it being checked or captured. The first king to control the center of the Roundtable wins.
Roundtable Checkers gives traditional checkers and extreme twist of excitement and face lift. It's designed for 2 or 4 players. Each starts with 15 checkers and can choose thousands of ways to set them up. Players can also move up to four different checkers per turn in a circular, diagonal, horizontal, or vertical direction. Like regular checkers, you make single or multiple jumps to capture the opponents' playing pieces. The player that captures the greatest number of enemy checkers wins.
Wordstack is an exciting 3-dimensional word game that plays 2 or 4 players. Each player selects 15 lettered checkers from her set of 45 tiles ranging from A to Z. Players may move up to 10 different lettered checkers per turn in diagonal, vertical, horizontal, or circular patterns. The player's objective is to earn points by combining (joining) her checker(s) with an opponent's checker(s) in order to spell words. Words may be spelled forward or backward, and in a diagonal, vertical, horizontal, or circular direction. Players may also capture (jump) an opponent's checker(s) to form a stack of checkers. The stack of captured checkers becomes a "Wordstack" when it is combined (joined) with an opponent's piece(s) to form words. The player who earns the highest number of points wins.
Checkers Roulette is numbers fun for 2 or 4 players. Each player uses 15 numbered checkers that include the values 5, 10, 25, and 50. Players may move up to 4 different checkers per turn in a circular, diagonal, horizontal, or vertical direction. You score points by capturing (jumping) an opponent's checker(s), and lose points when your checkers are captured. For example, if your checker with the value of "5" captures an opponent’s checker with the value "10", you earn 50 points (5 × 10 = 50), and the opponent loses 50 points. You also earn or lose points by setting up plays. The player that earns the greatest number of points wins.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Educational, Math, Number, Word Game

name: Fenced In
description:
You’ve got the farm. You’ve got the feed. You’ve got the animals… but you ain’t got no fences! In this classic game of squares, players build fences to hold in their livestock. The first player to fence in all of their animals wins! But be careful, other players can use your fences to finish their own animal pens. A game of forethought and strategy, Fenced In is fun for all ages!

Though this game is virtually the classic game of Boxes, the difference is that a play wins when he or she disposes of his or her animals, rather than a final tally of "who has more". Additionally, the game is playable by up to 4 players.

Re-implements:

Boxes
publishers: Front Porch Classics, Sababa Toys, Inc.

name: Trollspelet
description:
Trollspelet (English, The Troll Game) is a Swedish children's game. Each player controls a happy-go-lucky troll. The object of the game is to find the lucky beads that are hidden in the forest. Opposition comes from a naughty bat who causes havoc among the beads. but there's also help to be found - a magic fish swims in a nearby pond.

The first player to collect all his/her beads and return to the troll nest wins.

name: Deckarspelet
description: Deckarspelet (English, the Detective's game) is a card game for children based on the popular books and television shows about Lassemajas detektivbyrå (English, Lassemajas detective agency).

name: Bruce Lee
description:
Old Polish game inspired by simple computer version of Bruce Lee game. Even on the boardgame box is written "Bruce Lee - Computer Game without computer".

In fact this is classic roll and move game. Bruce Lee explores Abby levels, fights encountered enemies, and tries to complete four mission objectives. Bruce Lee can use some equipment, and use special moves-spells.

When there is more than one player in game, everyone leads his own Bruce Lee, or some players are ninja leaders, and try to disturb Lee in his quest.

name: Las 7 Puertas
description:
In this Dungeon Crawler game, you must explore the seven rooms of the temple in order to achieve the seven spheres of power of your scepter to defeat Karnú the immortal dragon.

In every room you must avoid the traps, resolve the hieroglyphics, defeat your enemies. Then you'll find magic treasures and weapons that allow you defeat your most powerful enemies.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Codswallop!
description:
Players form two equal teams, and each team draws a card (about 50 are included). The card has a real word on it, and it's definition, as well as a fake definition. Each team has 60 seconds to make up an additional definition, and then reads the word and all three definitions to the opposing team.

Points are scored by guessing the correct definition, and by having the other team pick the incorrect definitions.

Also included: Two pencils, a one-minute sand timer, and a score pad.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Klopf, Klopf!
description:
(From the box):

Knock! Knock! Who stands outside the three piglets' house? All of the players try to find the visitors of the enchanted magic forest and quickly place their hand on the corresponding card.

name: Pipeline
description:
In Pipeline the goal is to make a pipeline out of 10 or 12 board pieces on the 8X8 board. In the beginning every board piece is turned upside down.
Each player has 3 pieces. The "piper", the saboteur and the guard. The piper will manipulate the board pieces, the saboteur makes the piper go to the corners of the board and the guard protects the piper.

name: FanDooM
description:
FanDooM - Zaglada Fandomu (Destruction of the Fandom) is Polish non-collectible card game. It was is a tongue-in-cheek play on Polish fandom, given away for free to every attendee of the ConQuest 2004 gaming convention in Kraków, Poland.

The setting is Con(vention) organizing. Each player is a Coordinator, and has to get sponsors, staff, guests and create a program. Only one Con will prevail...

With the exception of 3 fictional convention (setting) cards, majority of the rest represent real people from Polish fandom. Several cards represent groups (ex. players of World of Darkness).

The game consists of 62 cards (+1 blank), each player should have their own set.

A 21 card expansion was released at ConQuest 2005.

Official game website: http://fandoom.rpg.pl/

name: Quick Call
description: A card game wherein players attempt to make sets of three cards that share a common theme. All players must agree on the appropriateness of the declared sets.

name: Diktator
description: The four team partners are supposed to bring down the dictator in a common action. They succeed when the dictator pawn (red double pawn)can be beaten. When one color of the team partners has dropped out, the dictator has won.

name: Red Lorry, Yellow Lorry
description: This simple children's game from the Clementoni Young Learners series of games is based on dominoes. The playing pieces consist of a starting piece (a crossroads with 4 roads leading from it and attached spinner) and 24 domino-like tiles with 2 vehicles on each of varying types and colors. To start the game each player is dealt an equal number of the vehicle tiles and the crossroads is placed in the centre of the table. The players then take turns spinning the spinner, and must attempt to place one of their tiles on whichever of the roads is pointed to. Tiles placed must match either the color or type of the vehicle currently at the end of this road. The winner is the first player to get rid of all of their tiles. Some strategy is provided by one of the tiles being a police car which can be placed at any time and permanently blocks off the road it is player on.

name: W√ºstenk√∂nige
description:
Who rules the sand?

In Wüstenkönige you decide this question with a tactical race through the changing desert. The winner will be the new lord of the sand.

But take care! There are many traps on your way. Sandstorms menace to overwhelm your camels, flying carpets cross your way and even within the oasis your are not safe of epidemics.

A smart coordination of your camels and a visionary use of your powers will bring you to the throne and send your enemies back to the desert.

name: 'Ohana Proa
description:
Ohana Proa models a gift economy in the Polynesian islands. It is a game of route building, deliveries and gift giving. The challenge of the game is. How to get ahead when the primary method of gaining points is by improving other player's positions?

'Ohana Proa was developed publicly via a blog on BGDF.



IntroductionThe societies of the South Pacific were characterized by gift economies in which wealth and status were defined by what was given to others rather than personal accumulation. In Ohana Proa players will compete for prestige via gift-giving and thus improving the other player's positions.

During the course of the game players will explore and claim routes among the islands. The number of routes a player may explore and claim each turn is limited by the number of explorers the player has (maximum 2).

Players will also join markets among the islands by moving them along 'claimed routes and in doing so attempt to gather them into groups. A group of three, four or five markets (player choice) is "satisfied" and is removed from the game. The number of routes that a player may move a market over during a delivery is limited by the player's proas (boats, maximum 7).

By delivering markets through islands where they have network presence players will receive fish or shells. Fish and shells may be used to gain an additional explorer, to acquire more proas or kahunas, to bid for turn order, to claim explored routes and to make and enhance kula items. Kula items are gifts that may be given to other players in order to gain prestige (but give the recipient points).

Fish rot quickly and are lost if not spent quickly enough. Shells rot more slowly and kula items decay. Kula items can be enhanced with fish or shells to increase their value when given.

The game ends when all of one colour of market has been delivered, a player reaches 33 prestige or the players reach deadlock. The player(s) with the lowest prestige score are eliminated from the game and do not score. The remaining players receive additional points for their prestige scores. The highest score wins.

Ohana Proa supports 3 through 5 players, is particularly recommended for 4 players and plays in around 150 minutes.

name: realpolitik
description:
From the publisher's website:

Realpolitik is a fast-paced, tongue-in-cheek game of blackmail, backstabbing, and brinkmanship. Each player represents a dirty-tricks organization of a country, complete with their own funding and political clout. Each round, players draw an Agenda: a person, place or event that is of particular importance to their nation.

Player hire Agents to neutralize other country's Agendas (by smearing their good name, bribing the right officials, or simply kidnapping or killing the target) while protecting their own interests. The player who bests safeguards their own Agendas while removing their opponents, wins.

Realpolitik comes in a convenient storage envelope with:

* 105 cards:
o 25 Agents
o 55 Actions
o 20 Agendas
o 5 References
* 1 instruction manual

To play, you'll need:
o Markers in 2 colors and
o a way to keep score (or markers in a third color)
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Wahr oder gelogen?
description:
660 incredible stories that are true or a lie.
"Elephants drink water through their trunks .. Is this true or is it a lie?" The Bremen Town Musicians have known fairy tale in the city of Bremen never reached .. etc.

Each player tries to get chips of each color. You get chips when you know after a story is read out whether it is true or false. Eight chips let you win the game.

Contents:

110 cards with a total of 660 true-false stories,
dice,
winning chips

name: Brummi
description: People in the zoo are excited: The food for the animals ran out. All children work together to collect food in baskets and carry it to the zoo by truck (=Brummi). Whoevers basket reaches the zoo first, is the winner.

name: The Fish Game
description:
From the rules:

Five dice spotted 2 to 6, with a fish replacing the 1 spot. the fish on the one spot is a Black Crappie.
The object is to catch the most number of fish.

Players have three rolls of the dice. The player rolls all five dice on his or her first roll, trying to produce a 6. If on the first roll the player gets a 6, the player sets that die aside and scores any fish thrown as part of his or her catch. The player then rolls the remaining four dice two additional times, trying to increase his or her catch of fish.

Each turn is played the same. A player must get a 6 before scoring the catch of fish. If a player does not roll a 6 during his or her three rolls per turn, the player cannot score fish on that turn, and passes the dice.

The player catching the most fish after each player has had three turns, is the winner.

Contains: 5 green fish dice
instructions

name: Van Dale Familiespel
description:
Every player chooses a hidden word, they try to collect the letters which make up this word. In the mean time the other players try to guess the word of the other players. If they guess it correctly they have to think of a new word and start again.
The player who is the first to collect his letters is the winner.

name: Davy Crockett
description:
Object of this card game is to take trick containing the main character cards depicting RED STICK, GENERAL JACKSON, GEORGE RUSSEL and last but not least DAVY CROCKETT.

Trick taking follows special rules, a complete game ends after 6 rounds, scoring only the cards in the tricks containing the above mentioned characters.

Game hails from the heydays of the company regarding card artwork: 44 cards with brightly coloured pictures are a joy to play...
categories: American Indian Wars, Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Cooking Up Sentences
description:
Players spin and move around a board trying to collect word cards to put together a grammatically correct sentence. Uses a theme of chefs trying to "cook" up correct sentences using recipes.

From the publisher: "Proper grammar is easy as pie when "chefs" follow recipes to make complete sentences by gathering and correctly identifying parts of speech. Draw a free ingredient card and add the funny word of your choice to the mix. Read complete sentences aloud for giggles and spoken grammar practice. Parts of Speech Cards feature color-coded backs for self-checking."

name: Exploring the Depths of Uranus
description:
From the covers:

Sure...NASA is sending missions to Mars...
...but we're preparing to go...
Exploring the Depths of Uranus!

A mining game of strategy and resource management set at the very edge of the solar system.

Exploring the Depths of Uranus is a planning and resource strategy game where every decision you make will leave profound consequences. Trade, explore, or just shoot anything that moves...the choices are yours to make. Find priceless artifacts, valuable ores, and friendly (or possibly hostile) natives, but remember: this is Uranus, a harsh environment filled with toxic gases and unpleasant surprises.

name: Preisfischen
description:
Content:
1 board of two parts,
4 fishermen,
4 baskets,
20 chips (things that can be drawn out of the water)
4 magnets
1 die

Family trip to the lake: Everyone is eagerly hoping to draw the best fish out of the water. There are fish, of course,
jewel bags, secret treasure chests and unusual implements.
Who got most of the points by fishing precious things wins the game.

name: Schmetterlingskind: wach auf geschwind
description:
Content:
board, 12 butterflies in 4 colors, 40 sun beams, 1 cloud, 1 special die

After a long and cold night the butterfly must awake. The sun rises. When a sun beam reaches a sleeping butterfly, he awakes and flies to a flower. The player who waked up all three own butterflies wins the game.

name: Huskeropoly
description:
Monopoly style game based on the University of Nebraska

Tokens include: Alarm Clock, Pencil, Gym Shoe, Bicycle, and Graduation Cap. Board Spaces include: Herbie Husker, Memorial Stadium, Love Library, and Nebraska Union
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Rapid 4 More
description:
An evolution of the game "Rapid 4", "Rapid 4 More" sees players try to get four marbles in a row by dropping them into holes at the top of a vertical tray much like in Connect Four. The drop, however, is filled with levers that shift as the marble drops through them; players must drop marbles to shift the levers so as to drop marbles into scoring or blocking positions on the slotted gameboard below.

"Rapid 4 More" utilizes two boards instead of one, and introduces an element of negotiation between players -- block a winning opponent, make a move of one's own, or forgo moving altogether in order to block another.

http://www.uncleskunkle.com/

name: Walkabout: Race to Uluru
description:
In this roll and move game, each player is in a race to be the first to complete the journey from Tasmania to Uluru. The game uses traditional Aboriginal style artwork to depict the many native animals to the Australian Outback.

Most of the spaces that can be landed on feature one of these animals and each animal has a different power. These powers affect anyone who lands on the space and often a series of powers can be triggered in the one turn as a player's piece is sent in multiple directions.

The game includes shortcut options, return to start spaces and the chance to catch up to the leader.

This game is really suited to Ages 5 - 10

name: 1x1 Obelisk
description:
An educational game focussing on multiplication (up to 10 x 10).

The game's main components are 30 "multiplication dice"- dice that have a multiplication problem printed on three sides, and the results on the opposite sides.

The rules sheet suggests three different variants that can be played:

1) "The stacking multiplication adventure"
The aim of this game variant is to build an obelisk as high as possible.
Players take turns throwing two randomly chosen dice. If one die shows a multiplication problem, the player has to solve it. If both dice show a multiplication problem, the player can choose which one to solve. If both dice show a number instead of a multiplication, the player repeats the throw. If the player correctly solves the problem (the other players can check on the opposite side of the die), he/she passes the die on to the next player, who uses it to start building an "obelisk" (by stacking one die onto the next). If the active player cannot solve the multiplication, he/she has to start building the obelisk. Then it is the next player's turn. Each turn, another die is added to the obelisk, either by the following player (if the active player correctly solves the problem), or by the active player (if their answer is incorrect).
The game ends when the obelisk collapses. The last player who managed to stack a die onto the obelisk without collapsing it wins the game. If the players manage to stack all dice before the obelisk collapses, they all win together.

2) The multiplication pyramid
The aim of this variant is to be the first to complete a pyramid.
The dice are evenly distributed among all the players. Players take turns throwing two of their dice. If one die shows a multiplication problem, the player has to solve it. If both dice show a multiplication problem, the player can choose which one to solve. If both dice show a number instead of a multiplication or if the active player can't solve the multiplication, they lose their turn. If they correctly solve the problem, they use the die to start building a pyramid (by stacking dice). Then it is the next player's turn.
The first player to have used up all their dice in buidling their pyramid wins the game.

3) Speed multiplication
The aim of the game is to find the fitting multiplication problem and grab the correct die.
The first player chooses four dice and puts them on the table with a multiplication problem facing up. He/she then has a look at the results (without the other players looking) and puts them back. They then say one of the results, and all the other players try to grab the die with the multiplication that fits this result. The player who grabs the correct die earns this die. Then the next player chooses four dice.
The game ends when all dice have been claimed. The player with the most dice wins the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: Golden Balls
description:
A game of luck, intuition and barefaced bluff. You have one simple task - get rid of the "Killer Balls" while keeping the highest value "Golden Balls" in play.
Vote out your opponents in the first 2 rounds (1 round in 3-player play), to make it to the "Bin or Win", and choose your "Golden Five" jackpot balls.
Face your last remaining opponent in a tense head-to-head to "Split or Steal".
categories: Bluffing, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pokerface
description:
Can you bluff your way to £1million? Based on the hit quiz show, you don't necessarily have to get the questions right to win, you just need to bluff your way through the rounds and pressure your opponents into folding.
You don't have to be the brain of Britain to win, you just have to be clever enough to make them think you are! (taken from back of box)

Players secretly answer 5 multiple choice questions, then try to bluff their opponents into folding a 10second countdown. If no one folds, then the player with the least correct answers loses all their money.
categories: Bluffing, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: IAGO Chess
description:
IAGO Chess is unique in its nature. The best way to view IAGO Chess is a system used to manage the wide range of interests on the part of people who like to play, and an approach to acclimate new players to the system.
Because of this, you won't find one set of codified rules, as you would with other chess games. The IAGO Chess system accomplishes its objectives by the use of multiple versions (classes) of the game that represent the fullness of the chess experience. These versions build upon one another,
to allow a person to get fully familiar with the game. There are six versions (classes) of the game. These versions are: A-Class, B-Class, C-Class, M-Class, V-Class, and X-Class.

This version of chess is more than just a chess variant, it is a system by which chess can integrate variants and evolve. It has multiple layers and is robust enough to change over time. Its mission is to be a forever evolving version of chess that will provide a migration path for changes.

It is also meant as a framework for playing all versions of chess relating to the International Abstract Games Organization.

For the actual rules, check out the Chess Variants website:
http://www.chessvariants.org/index/msdisplay.php?itemid=MSia...

name: Mein erstes Wortschatz-Quiz
description:
A German card driven game for kids from 6 to 12 years to build up knowledge for German Language Pool of about 3,000 words.

100 cards for German substantives
34 cards for German verbs
70 cards for German adjactives
4 empty cards for your own words
80 chips
1 hour glass
2 dice (a red and a blue one)

It's not only for German kids. Even adults can use it to master proper German. Try it yourself!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Team-Based Game

name: Bokstavsjakten
description:
This is a childrens game from Ages 5 and up.

From TV " five ants is more than four elephants".

In the game you will pick up a card and try to spell that word correctly. The letters in your word will be your markers and you need to take them across the board without getting caught by the elephant.

name: Magnetic Space-Venture
description:
A very simple roll-and-move game played with magnetic pawns on a small 'travel' gameboard. Players roll to move, check to see if they landed on a space with instructions and then resolve the instructions, if any.

No decisions made by any player.
publishers: Chenghai Ubon Toys, The Toy Network

name: Liskosafari
description: A Finnish game where players try to collect a set of lizards for the zoo. Two sets of rules are included: the first one is for adults and children over five and the second one for younger children.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: Darmstadt
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μœåνος (alone or single) + polein πωλε·øñν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Darmstadt, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Alien Conspiracy
description: Players control one of eight competing Alien Factions, each of which has a Special Ability. The players receive a varying assort of Action Tokens each turn. These Tokens may be spent to draw cards, put Faction members into play, and roll on the Intrigue table. Players gain Influence Points by controlling Faction members and Plot cards. The winner is the first player to gain 100 Influence Points.

name: Battle Magic
description:
A game of large scale fantasy warfare. The object of the game is to destroy all of your opponent’s castles. The standard game involves wars between Human empires, each of has five castle counters. Variant counter mixes are given for the Dwarf empire, Orc empire, and Undead empire, which have counter mixes with four to seven castles. However, each player starts with only one castle, one army, and one ship on the board.

The game uses a deck of cards which serves several functions. Move Cards are used to initiate movement. Sword and Magic Cards are used to aid units in combat. Gold Cards are used to recruit new units.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Custer's Last Stand
description:
“American West: Indians vs Soldiers. Each figure represents a group of cavalry soldiers or Indian braves. Victory: Destroy your enemies completely.”

The game is played on an 8x8 grid or chessboard. The middle four squares are each occupied by one Soldier. All edge spaces each contain one Indian. A custom deck of cards is key to the game play. The players draw hands of cards from the shared deck. Card play determines when units may move, attack, or defend.

name: Fantasy Skirmish
description:
“Board & card game for 2 players. Battle between two Fantasy Armies. Abstract skirmish level combat. Each figure represents a single hero, monster, or unit. Victory: You win if you kill all opposing units with Leadership Skill.”

The game is played on a chessboard or any other 8x8 grid. Miniatures or counters are used to represent the combat units. Each player purchases sixteen units using an equal amount of points. A custom deck of cards is central to the play of the game. The players draw a hand of cards from this shared deck. Card play determines when units may move, attack, or defend.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play

name: POW
description:
"Solitaire Card Game.You are a POW trying to survive and/or escape. Victory: You successfully escape if your total Escape level is ever +3. If you go through the whole deck and survive, you are sent back Home after the War ends. Death: If your Health level is ever –3 you die from physical ailments. If your Sanity level is ever –3 you lose the will to live and die."

The player has three characteristics that start at zero: Health, Sanity, and Escape. The cards lists events and activities that positively or negatively impact one of the three categories. Each turn, before drawing a card, a player may choose to adopt one of our attitudes: Early Escape, Good Behavior, Role Model, and Bad Behavior. Each attitude can modify a certain type of card.

name: To Boldly Go
description:
"Card Game for 2+ players. Star Trek theme." The game is played with two custom card decks - the Crew Deck and the Dilemma Deck.

The Crew Deck cards represent crew members, actions and equipment. They are used to solve Dilemmas. Cards have ratings for one or more of the following attributes: Tactics, Science and Negotiation.

The Dilemma Deck cards represent episodes from the first season of Star Trek. Each card lists what levels in the three attributes are needed to solve the Dilemma. Each card also has a Victory Point value.

"Game Ending: The game ends when all Dilemmas have been solved. Victory: The player with the most Victory Points (from solved Dilemmas in his Captains Log) is the winner."
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Osbox
description:
Players push a six-sided die from adjacent sides of a 4x4 grid in an attempt to complete loops that extend both horizontally and vertically. In the basic game, one player has access only to the left and right sides, while the other has access exclusively to the top and bottom sides.

The author designed with the game with the same Celtic knot picture cubes used in Osbo, but this game doesn't make use of rotating the sides. The same face of the die stays visible once the die is entered.

name: Kickmazu
description:
Kickmazu! is a soccer card game for 2 players. It was released by a German chocolate manufacturer. You had to swap collector points for this game.

Both player get 8 cards representing one goalie and 7 fielders. Every fielder has on opponent fielder for a tackle.
Every time a player wins a tackle the ball rolls to the next row towards the goalie. If he wins a tackle against the opponent goalie he scores a goal.

name: Add'Em
description:
A math card game where the object is to dispose of all the cards in your hand. The first player to do this must shout "Add'Em!" The remaining players must then score the remaining cards in their hands.

The game may be played by up to 4 people with one deck. It can be played by more if further decks are added.

The pack of 52 cards includes 27 number cards, 10 minus number cards, 13 number cards representing totals, 1 "odd" card and 1 "even" card.

name: Cinderella Card Game
description:
The object of this game is to dispose of all of your cards in sets and score the highest number of points while doing so. This game was published in 1954 and was based on the Disney movie. The deck consists of 12 sets of 3 identical cards each, 6 "Final Cards", and 2 "Prize Cards".

The game rules vary slightly depending on how many are playing.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Schule fertig-Los!
description:
Come on, let's go to school! How exciting the everyday life of a school kid can be. Only the one who gets up promptly and is punctual at the bus stop will get to school on time. There the hurly-burley continues. With all the other children and the interesting things to learn, the day passes in a flash.

While playing, the children will learn how their day will change when they start going to school. Further on, memory and first handling of the clock are trained in a playful way. The instructions contain several variants including one for cooperative play. all of differing degrees of difficulty.

name: Cats At Play
description:
BOX DESCRIPTION
"Chasing catnip here and there"

Unique Features:

Game allows participants to understand cat behavior.
Game requires players to be responsible for the care of their cats.
Game makes players use planning and logic to win.
Game demands participants exercise patience with their cats.
Game enables players to enjoy the companionship of cats.
Game lets contestants make both offensive and defensive moves per turn.
Game provides players with variations for more difficult games.
Game promotes cooperation and teamwork.


HAVE FUN!

GAME OBJECTIVE (from manual)
The first cat to pounce on a catnip mouse is the winner.

GAME PLAY
Players work cooperatively (cats from the same house) or against each other (different house) to catch one of two 'roaming' catnip mice. Each player first moves their cat, then moves one of the mice, each with the roll of one die.

Other variations allow for players to only move their cats with another player moving only the mice.

Obstacles include: Other cats, Dogs, Identification Tag (if missing), Fleas, Health Care (shots)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Space, Trash, Politicians
description:
This game is being revised. I wouldn't suggest playing by the posted rules. 3/30/09

The people of Earth make a lot of trash, and there's no sign this will change anytime soon. Crates full of banana peels, boxes of secondhand chicken poop, industrial mumbo-whatever, it's all here, and it needs to go somewhere. At one point, a fantastic US President said, "Let's get a big rocket..." and things progressed from there.

You are a waste removal specialist, and you want to get in on some of these contracts for sending waste into space, but where there are rockets, money, and politicians, things can get messy.

A game of bidding and risk management, with just 60 little cards.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Photonic Attack
description:
The players take turns to "fire" "photons" (pieces of their color) into a 7×7 grid from any edge. A fired photon travels in a straight line until it reaches the opposite edge or another photon: then it stops, and any adjacent photons change color to match it.

The winner is the player who has more photons of their color on the board when no more moves can be made.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement

name: F' the Earth
description:
Each of the players takes the role of a business friendly, let us not say corrupt, politician. Each turn represents an election cycle in which players sell out the nation's resources to moneyed interests. In the end, there must be a reckoning, and whoever sold away the last of the store will take the blame for all the selling.

http://www.fecundity.com/pmagnus/fearth.html

name: Zaxo
description: Zaxo is a Game of tile laying to complete a line of at least 5 tiles. This is therefore just like Tantrix, but each player chooses his color secretly and can change it while playing! The layout of the tiles is different to Tantrix (only straight lines, no wiggly curves here) but there are also 4 colors (black, red, blue, green) just like Tantrix (yellow, red, blue green).

name: Corner
description:
Corner is a strategic game of wits and luck.

This game basically allows players to engage in a "battle" to eliminate the other player's pieces. Each players would have 4 warriors (pieces) and 3 chances of regeneration (By territory marking).

This game is card driven as all the pieces are determined and planned by cards in the hand. Cards consist of power card that has special effects and normal cards of movement such as left 3. For power cards, cards (on the hand) has to be paid as tribute to activate the effects, hence having the resource hand management mechanism. Every players would have Start Phase, Play Phase, (Intercept Play phase for people to intercept with Fast Power Cards), Draw phase and End phase. Cards on hand are drawn randomly, hence having the circumstantial luck element.

This game basically trains spatial awareness
(very directional oriented), brain reaction time, logic and sensory skill.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Dice, Educational, Mythology
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Phase Order

name: Hexum
description:
"Puzzling with letters"

Hexum is a word game, where the letters are connected like a puzzle. The challenge of the game is to puzzle with the letters to form the longest words.
The hexagonal shape of the letters makes it possible to form words not just in a straight line, but in a line that twists and loops over the board, like a snake.
The longer the words the more points you'll get. But each turn you'll only get two new letters.
The kings on the scoreboard keep track of the score. They also interfere with each other. They can push each other back on the scoreboard.
The king that reaches the end first is the winner.

For more information visit: http://www.magi-games.nl/hex/index_hex.html (Dutch)

name: Diploma Dogs
description:
Diploma Dogs is an educational game that features six cuddly little stuffed dog figures: Geography Dog, History Dog, Math Dog, Language Dog, Health Dog, and Science Dog. Players move around the board collecting "bones" and "biscuits" by answering questions.

Includes a colorful board, 6 dogs, bone tokens, biscuit tokens, cards, and instructions.

This is an intermediate curriculum game designed for Ages 8 and up.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Rechenk√∂nig
description:
Rechenkönig (a.k.a. King of Numbers) is a collection of number-learning games using a base set of cards that are cleverly designed. One set of cards has a simple equation, like "2 + 1" or "9 -7". Another set has solutions, like "=3".

The cards have two special features. First, on one side graphics are shown with the numbers, while on the reverse the graphics are not shown. This allows the games to played at different levels based on the age of the children. Second, each card has a hole in it, and the placement of this hole aligns with its solution cards so that when the proper answers are placed together, a wooden "king of numbers" figure fits precisely into the combined hole; if the king doesn't fit, the answer is wrong. The wooden King piece doubles as a pencil holder, which is helpful since some of the games require scorekeeping on a piece of paper.

Using this card set, the rules describe seven different games of increasing difficulty. One of these is a solitaire game, the others are for 2, 3, or more players. Each is interesting and the variability of the play with the unique cards keeps the game interesting through multiple plays and useful for children.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: Zolfaqar's Blow
description:
Ever since the mock Iranian attack with four Fast Attack Craft upon USN ships sailing though the Straits of Hormuz in January 2008, the USN had been on alert. While American intelligence, in theory, could predict the technological level of the Iranian weaponry, and their own wargames showed USN vulnerabilities, there was always the chance element. The USN had always been on a heightened alert when traversing the Straits, especially when they knew the Iranians had at least 70 anti-ship missiles within range. Not to mention their capability of launching ASMs from aircraft platforms. Not to mention, their Chinese FACs with ASMs. The threat had always been real. The USN continued to have confidence, perhaps wrongly, that their superiority in higher technology could and would keep their ships out of harm’s way.Iran had decided to attack using “swarm” tactics. The USN had itself used such tactics in their own wargames with devastating results. It was found out that using swarm tactics greatly increased the likelihood of Iranian success, even when only Fast Attack Craft were used. That was then. Now, apply the same tactics with ASMs and the scenario was even more horrific. The USN would not make a preemptive strike, that would be political suicide on the world stage. Iraq was still combative as ever. All the USN could do was remain vigilant at all times while moving through the Straits and into the Persian Gulf. If Iran attacked, they would have to make it count as America’s response would literally demolish the Iranian forces in and around the Straits.

Contains:
- 2 11" x 17" maps sheet depicting the battle area.
- One set of 280 die cut ½" playing pieces representing ground combat units.
- One rulebook
- 4 sheets of Charts and tables

name: Two Tigers Chess
description:
A 2-2 players game based on the Old Chinese Game "Tiger Chess".
A more complex game, with 2 "tigers", and 12 "human".
"human" aim at to capture the tigers, by surrounding the tigers.
"tigers" aim at to eat "human", so that the human cannot capture the tigers.

name: Suske en Wiske Spel
description:
Suske en Wiske Spel is a game based on the comic Suske en Wiske (aka Bob et Bobette, Spike and Suzy, Willy and Wanda, Suske und Wiske).

The object of the game is to collect as many sets of 4 cards as possible. Winner is the player who collects the most sets from the 32 cards total.

The players roll 2 dice to move their pawn across the game board. Cards can be collected at some points on the board by trading and by guessing. The game ends when there are no cards left on the gameboard.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: High Noon
description:
High Noon is an intense one-on-one memory game. On your turn, you can add a card to the stare down or gather the cards up and call “Draw!” If you draw, your opponent must recite the cards in the stare down from first played to last played. If your opponent succeeds, he or she gets the cards. If your opponent fails, you get the cards. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

High Noon uses a deck of cards (any kind of cards will do). A two-player game takes 5 to 10 minutes to play. High Noon is appropriate for almost any age, but matched ages are better.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Memory, Print & Play

name: Speedway: World championship formula
description:
This title is presumably from around the mid-1970's; in the box front picture, Olsen and another rider are wearing safety vests by Vojens Speedway Center, which was founded by Olsen in 1975. Production number 15504.

The box cover shows a drawing and signature of Ole Olsen, the Danish world champion in speedway.

The game has borrowed the player pieces from the Swedish Tippa Speedway, but the actual gameplay and board is very different.

The board has depicted a 4 lane track in an oval form (as is the case in speedway) which are again divided into squares. Some of the squares are coloured in one of 6 colours - and the colours determine what happens if you land on them. One game lasts for 4 rounds, as in real speedway, but there are additional/optional rules for both team and league play.

The rulebook actually suggests that since the game "aims at following the real speedway rules as close as possible", the ideal number of players is 16(!) which seems like a huge number for an old-fashioned roll-and-move game like this.

Also, the rules in various languages are all signed by Ole Olsen, giving the impression that he actually designed the whole game(?).

name: Insurrection √† Sonienvo
description:
This game is the first wargame published by the french magazine Casus Belli (Issue 11 - Nov 1982).
Map size A4.
Tactical game of the World War I. Each counter represents a soldier.

name: Duel sur Zloog
description:
This game was published in the French magazine Casus Belli (Issue 12 - Dec 1982).
Race two players to first repair your ship, while looking for resources on the planet Zloog.

name: The Mummy Adventure Boardgame
description: The game is based on The Mummy cartoons. The game is for 2-6 players and a "leader". The game is card driven. The leader hides player tokens and the players need to get their character cards to be able to get a clue card, that will direct them to their tokens. After 6 tokens are obtained the players search for the Scroll of Thebes. Whoever finds the Scroll, wins the game. This is a perfect game for children parties.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Barn-geni!
description:
A trivia game for children. Collect one card from each category by answering correctly, then move to the goal square in the middle of the board to win.

Similar to Trivial Pursuit.

name: Strawberry Shortcake Win By A Whisker Card Game
description:
This card game is like Old Maid except with a twist. Instead of being declared the loser, the player who is left with the Old Maid (in this case, the Custard card) is declared the winner.

The game begins by dealing out the 35 cards to all the players. Any pairs a player has are put down in front of them and the remaining cards are kept hidden. Players will then take turns picking a hidden card from another player. If a match is found, it is put down in front of the player that found it.

The game ends when one player is left holding the "Custard" card (Strawberry Shortcake's cat). They are declared the winner.

name: Best of Hayward
description: A Monopoly-like game produced by a non-profit organization, sponsored by businesses local to the Hayward, California area.

name: Daramutu
description:
A mancala game. From Mancala World:

http://mancala.wikia.com/wiki/Daramutu

Daramutu is a mancala game, which is played by village women in Sri Lanka with astonishing rapidity. The game was first described by Henry Parker in 1909. He notes about them:

"Without counting the seeds (...) they seem to know instinctively, perhaps as the result of long practice, at which hole it is best to begin in order to effect captures. An inexperienced person has no chance of beating them."

Rules:

The board called olinda-poruwa has 14 holes (wala) arranged in two rows (pila). Between them are two rectangular hollows serving as stores for the captures.

Initially there are four seeds (indiya, pl. indi) in each hole, usually from the Olinda creeper (Abrus precatorius).

On his turn a player sows (ihinawa) the contents of one of his holes, one at a time, into the succeeding holes. The direction of play (clockwise or anti-clockwise) is decided by the first player and then adhered to throughout the game by both players.

When the last seed falls into an occupied hole, which contained three or more seeds, its contents (including the last dropped seed) are sown in another lap.

A singleton is called puta ("son"), a hole containing two seeds naga ("daughter").

If the last seed falls into an empty hole, a puta or a naga on either side of the board, the contents of the opposite hole are "eaten" (innawa). The captures are collected in the store.

If the opposite hole is empty, nothing is captured.
