The game also comes with an electronic buzzer.

When it's your turn, you press the buzzer. The buzzer will tell you which block you have to take, this by describing the colour of the block.
You take that block and put it on the board, when you did that, you push the buzzer again, which will tell the next player which block he has to pick and place.
When putting the block on the board you only have a certain amount of time (8, 10 or 12 seconds).

By putting the blocks on the board you'll create a tower, when it's your turn you must succeed putting the block on the board or on another piece already placed on the board and by doing so trying not to turn over the tower.
If the tower falls, that player is excluded from the game.

You play on untill there's one player left.

source: user summary

name: The Great Hoodoo
description:
There are cards of three values - "one", "two" and "three". "Three" is the strongest card and it trumps the other cards, and "two" card trumps only "one" card. It is clear for a while. Then the game is some more difficult. There are cards of seven colours or suits. Each colour is a one of magic branches, and each card is a witchcraft. Players fighting each other by casting spells and trying to repulse opponent's spells. You may repulse spells by head trick of the same magic school spell than the attacking one, or by any card of the opposit magic school (trump card). The cards of each colour are the trumps for cards of two other colours. To avoid getting entangled, on each card there are special symbols marking colours for which this card is a trump.

If a player has beaten off his opponents, he may take a turn. Played cards are putting to discard pile. In the other case player take cards to his hand and missing his turn. A game is going on until all players excepting the last player, staying without cards in their hands. The looser is announcing as Not very Smart Magician's Apprentice.
publishers: Rightgames RBG SIA, Stolitsa Design Group

name: Bianco Mano
description:
With 4 families (Red, Blue, Yellow and Green), with each 8 characters, the game uses an Italian mafia theme.

The game plays with 3, 4 or 5 players in teams (1vs2, 2vs2, 2vs3)

The player (and his team) that starts the round takes the bet to make a minimum of 45 points.

If he fills his contract, he wins the rounds, otherwise he'll lose points.

Each trick is plays according to 3 rules (in priority order):

1 / - Must play the color asked by the starting player
2 / - Must play the dominating family.
3 / - Play any card if condition 1 or 2 cannot be filled

name: Bibi Blocksberg: Das verhexte Wolkenversteck
description:
The players try to form a row of five cards which depict Bibi Blocksberg and her friend gradually appearing out of the clouds.
The active player places a card face-down on a small seesaw-catapult, then hits the other end. If the card lands on the table and is face-up, he/she can check if it fits into his/her row. If it doesn't fit, it is discarded. If it doesn't land face-up, the next player adds it to his/her own card when firing the catapult, so he/she has a chance of multiple cards landing face-up.
The first player to complete a row is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Ab in die Tonne
description:
A game about garbage separation. The two players are separated by a wall. On each side of the wall there are three trash cans for different garbage classes: glass, paper, etc.
54 trash cards are dealt to the players. The active players tries to play his/her top card. Either it fits into one of the three trash cans on his/her side, or it has to be put to the end of the stack (if it is a garbage card). Special cards can be played immediately: "Inspector" turns the wall and checks if the other player has not put any cards into wrong bins; "Turning" turns the wall without any other effect; "Stray Cat" pushes out the cards from one of the opponent's bins. Special cards that are played are handed to the other player who adds them to the end of his/her stack. The first player to get rid of all his/her trash cards is the winner.

name: Salt 'n' Pepper
description:
The goal is to be the first player to return all of his pieces home by moving them across and off the 10x10 board.

Players choose either Salt white or Pepper black and, using 15 pieces each, take turns moving one piece at a time toward themselves on their respective color squares.

Salt pieces move one square diagonally to a vacant square, or leap diagonally over one opposing piece if the square immediately beyond is vacant.
Pepper pieces move one square orthogonally to a vacant square, or leap diagonally over one opposing piece if the square immediately beyond is vacant.
Pieces may not move backward and are not captured.

The game is over when only one player remains on the board.

Players should alternate using Salt or Pepper pieces every other game.

name: No More Room In Hell
description:
Stand alone miniatures rules set for survival modern horror gaming. 28mm scale (though can really be used for any scale). Book contains several scenarios providing different challenges for the zombie survival genre.

From the back of the book:

No More Room In Hell - Surviving the Zombie Apocalypse allows you to create a group of characters amidst the end of the living world...and the start of the living-dead world. Who will survive? Who will feed the Zeds? It's up to you to select the skills, the traits and the gear that you think that your survivors will need to face the rising zombie tide.

Featuring a campaign system, stand-alone games, random scenario, and quick-play random character generation, anything goes. You'll need to fight the dead and the living as you struggle to gather enough food, ammunition and food for your band.
categories: Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Player Powers

name: ¬øConoces Espa√±a?
description:
From the instructions booklet cover:

Educational game. Geography, History, folklore, industry and commerce of Spain.

Components: (User Summary):

-72 round pieces
-Map in six sections of 34x16cm each
-Rules booklet

Goal:

Players must fill the spaces in the map with the pieces corresponding to each location.

Game mechanics:

Players must fill the spaces in the map with the counters pulled out randomly from any opaque container after identyfing the correct location for each.
There are three levels of difficulty (low, medium, high).

Juego instructivo. Geografia, Historia, costumbres, industria y comercio de España.

Componentes:

-72 fichas circulares de cartón
-Mapa en seis secciones rectangulares de 34x16cm cada una.
-Instrucciones

Objetivo:

Los jugadores deben rellenar el mapa con las fichas correspondientes a cada localización.

Mecánica de juego:

Los jugadores van extrayendo las fichas de cualquier recipiente opaco y tras identificar el lugar al que pertenecen las van colocando en el mapa.
Existen tres niveles de dificultad (elemental, medio, superior).

name: Loco Lingo Kindergarten
description:
Loco Lingo Kindergarten is a collection of five word-related games that are played with 12 cards showing items, 3 wooden figures and 1 color die.

The games are:

Warm-Up: Not really a game, but an activity to identify all the cards and figures, so that all the children know what everything is.
Grab It!: The game leader reads out a story. Whenever an object is mentioned that corresponds with one of the cards or figures, the children should grab that card or figure from the table. If they take the correct item, they get to keep it. Whomever has the most items at the end of the story wins the game.
Focus Pocus!: Six random cards and/or figures are placed on the table. The game leader reads out a story. Whenever an object is mentioned that corresponds with one of the cards or figures that is not in the table, the children should react by saying "it's in the box". The first player to do so, gets an item from the table. Whenever an object is mentioned that corresponds with one of the cards or figures that is already held by one of the players, the children should react by saying "it's already gone". The first player to do so, gets an item from the table. Whomever has the most items at the end of the story wins the game.
Stories about Kindergarten: In turn, each player choose a figure and draw a card. They then tell a short story about that figure and the item on the card. The card is then placed facedown next to the figure. This continues until there are four cards in front of each figure. Then, the players take turn rolling the die. They then have to remember what item is on the first card next to the figure corresponding to the colour rolled. If they guess correctly, they get to keep the card. Whomever has the most cards at the end of the story wins the game.
What does it do?: In turn, each player chooses a card and describes what you can do with the item on the card. The other players then guess what card is being described. Whomever guesses correctly gets to keep the card. The game continues until only three cards are left. Whomever has the most cards at the end of the story wins the game.

name: Irondale: Mill of Fortune
description:
This small bonus expansion for Irondale was distributed with some of the early preorders. It adds a single new building, the Mill of Fortune. (3 are included, one for each deck)

When the Mill of Fortune is built, the player names a building type and draws one card from each deck. Each drawn card that matches the named type is taken into the player's hand, the others are discarded.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game

name: 100 Really Dumb Things You Have to do While Playing This Game
description: In 100 Really Dumb Things YOU have to DO while PLAYING this game, players will do some ridiculous things while laughing uncontrollably at each other. Players might draw cards that tell them to salute the nearest wall, do the Chicken Dance around the room and meow like a cat while wearing a cat nose. Other cards set off chain reactions among players. Your actions might cause players to tap their heels together and say 'There's no place like home,' do a hula dance using a tambourine, pretend to jump rope or hiss like a snake. One dumb thing definitley leads to another in this zany game of craziness!

name: Enter the Labyrinth and Rescue the Princess
description:
Enter the Labyrinth and Rescue the Princess is a free print and play game in which one or two players must explore a labyrinth to rescue a princess in an attempt to win her love.

The game has two paths to victory. In the first, you must try to find at least six of the princesses seven missing belongings in order to curry her favor. In the second, you must kill the labyrinth's minotaur and bring its horns to the princess to prove your courage.

The game uses a paragraph system for events. When a player lands in a square, he or she looks up that square in the paragraph book to see what happens.

In the two player game, the player who retrieves the most missing possessions wins. If one player slays the minotaur then he or she is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: A Christmas Story: The Party Game
description: This licensed board game is based on the classic holiday movie, "A Christmas Story". Players use one of the four pre-painted plastic miniatures to move across a board with a relatively simple track. The miniatures represent characters from the movie: Ralphie (the main character in his infamous pink bunny suit), Randy (Ralphie's younger brother bundled in immobilizing layers of winter clothing), Flick (Ralphie's friend), and the Old Man (Ralphie's father). Players are challenged with trivia cards and social activities.

name: Runaway Sleigh
description:
Krampus,the dark twin to that jolly elf Santa Claus, is tired of his diminished and secondary role in the Christmas holiday, and has booby-trapped Santa's sleigh. The sleigh has flown off on it's own and now it is a race: Krampus is out to ruin everyone's night by stealing gifts and Santa is trying to retreive the sleigh and deliver the presents.
The board consists of eighteen areas, the north and south poles which are the base points for the Santa and Krumpus players. The sleigh is placed in the center of the board. The game includes three dice, hand painted with both numbers and the following symbols:
1,2 :footprints
3,4 :sleigh
5 :a spring
6 :a hand
and on one die, a three is an asterisk, representing a wild face. The game may be played with normal dice, but one 3 face must be marked to represent the wild symbol.
Setup continues by rolling the dice six times (3d6) and laying cubes that represent the gift targets on the resulting spaces, which are numbered from 3-18 (1 and 2 are the poles, and will never have gift targets placed on them.)
The dice and the player's tokens are manipulated using the dice. Each turn the player may roll 3 times, keeping a die or two each time. If a die is kept, it must be used at the end of rolling, there is no deciding to reroll later. Whatever is rolled on the third roll is kept and used.
Keep on footprint to move one space, two to move three spaces, and keep three footprints to move four spaces. Movement is orthogonal only, never diagonal.
Keep one sleigh to move the sleign one space orthogonally, two to move three, three to move hour. In addition, if the player's token is in the same space as the sleigh, you must roll two sleighs to board the sleigh. Once on the sleigh, the sleigh is moved with either footprints or sleighs (not a combination of both, though you may wait until the end of the third roll to decide which you will use to move the sleigh.) Move the sleigh to bring it closer to you, or to keep the other player from intercepting it. The sleigh may not be moved remotely if the other player is riding it.
Roll and keep three springs to eject a player riding the sleigh back to his or her base. (In variant play, any gifts on the sleigh at this point remain aboard) While unlikely, it is possible to eject yourself from the sleigh if you roll all three dice three times and it pops up. If so, too bad, back to base with yourself!
If on the sleigh and in the same space as a package, roll and keep two hands to deliver the package as Santa or steal the package as the Krampus. In either case, place the package in your base as a point.
The wild symbol may substitute for any other in the above combinations.

Winner is player to pick up the most gift tokens when the last one is picked up, ties going to Santa, because it's Christmas, after all.

Variant Challenge 1: To 'win' a gift and get the point, you must return to your base with it (no roll required to drop it)

Variant Challenge 2: Use Variant Challenge 1, but the other player may also steal gifts from your base, and the winner is the first to get ALL the gifts.

name: Monopoly: Here & Now Taiwan Edition
description: From the back of the box: Wheel and deal your way to a fortune even faster using debit cards instead of cash! All it takes is a card swipe for money to change hands. Now you can collect rent, buy properties and pay fines -- all with the touch of a button! It's a new way to play the family classic that's been brought up-to-date with higher property values and Taiwan's hot spots.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Tigele
description:
Tigele is the first volume of a 4 volume game/game system. Tigele like the other Volumes is a standalone game. Meaning as it comes out of the box, it is a working game. Tigele may be added to other volumes as an expansion. Or the other volumes may be added to it, in part or whole, as expansions. Or this volume may be mixed with parts of the other volumes to form whole new games.

Tigele is a battle strategy game made up of 100 tiles comprised of 72 pictographs forming just several tile types. the game was played by a small community of individuals in the North west corner of Montana for almost 20 years. Slowly evolving into this publish version. (Long cold winters and beer)

Oddities of the game:
1) We call the game a board game, even though it is a tile game; because, the tiles in part make up the playing area, a 10 X 10 layout of tile we call a field. The field is comprised of two opponents laid out in 10 X 5 (1/2 the field we call the courts). That area once established remains a constant grid for play throughout the game. Thus the tiles making a randomized board.

2) The tiles used above are the playing board and the playing pieces.

3) The game uses the relationships of one tiles to another as a mechanic to manipulate luck, and unforeseen or uncontrolled events. This also encourages ever developing tactics and interpersonal strategies (more so when later volumes are played in concert with one another).

4) The box instructions gives two player mode instruction. but the game plays up to 4 players in the Volume One level. The 3 and 4 player modes of play are suggested on our web site.

5) The game was designed for two primary reasons. To help keep the designer brother out of trouble and as a model of one basic form of social political behavior...Don't ask me.

6) Hard rules augmented with a few soft rules. the soft rules force personal interaction and create a fog of war atmosphere...again don't ask me...it just works.

7) Players on your side of play may or may not really be playing on your side.

8) The game uses its art as a fog of war mechanism.

9) The game has a slight learning curve; but the game is basic in play.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Potion magique
description: There are three potion ingredients (toad, flower, leaf), each of which comes in three colors (red, purple green). Players take turns to be Merlin and ask the other player to find out what's in a potion. The other player plays ingredient cards and Merlin has to tell how many ingredients were correct (Mastermind-style). The goal is to find out the exact recipe for three potions in as few attempts as possible.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Mythology

name: UNO: England FA
description: An England Football edition of UNO with 112 custom cards featuring England players. In addition to the normal UNO cards, there is the "Goal" card which allows players to swap a card with another player.

name: Pang-Dang
description:
40 cards with circles on them divided into 12 parts. Each part is colored in one of the six colors lay on the table.

One of the other 40 cards (exactely the same but a bit larger) is revealed and you have to find the matching cards fastest.

name: Karten-Roulett
description:
A game board with a track shaped like an "8". I both "holes" there are each one disc (gameboard parts) that can be turned.

Every player get a set of 8 cards and plays one in each turn to get on the best spaces.

name: Quinx
description:
An abstract strategy game from designer Joli Kansil. Players roll two dodeca, 12-sided dice colored with 3 different spots, to determine how they may place a piece on the 10×10 board. Players can play only on their own color, but the dice roll determines how many friendly or enemy pieces the new piece may be adjacent to.

The goal is to form 5 quinx. A quinx is an arrangement of 5 pieces in an X shape, as found on the 5 of a standard-pipped six-sided die. This shape is sometimes known as a quincunx, from which the game gets its name.

The dice thrown by each player are the same as found in Kansil's game Krakatoa. Each player has a pair in their color, and each die has 3 yellow, 4 red, and 5 blue spots.

Out of print for many years, this is reportedly the hardest Joli Kansil/Xanadu Leisure game to find.

name: Escape to Wisconsin Trivia
description: Escape to Wisconsin Trivia is a roll and move trivia game with many similarities to Trivial Pursuit. Players take turns moving their tokens around the board on a track that is shaped like the outline of the state of Wisconsin. Questions are color coded into five categories, each question having to do with some aspect of the history and culture of Wisconsin: Famous People, Sports/Recreation, Geography, History/Government, and Agriculture/Industry. The winner of the game is the player who is the first to collect a scoring piece from each of the five colors. Scoring pieces are obtained by landing on star spaces and correctly answering a question corresponding to the color of the space.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: HitStory
description:
From the box:
Trivia game about knowing music and musical artists. Players have six different categories, like like music history, music hits and so on.
Game comes with a DVD, which helps with audio questions and also pictures, keeps score as well.
Player goal is to collect 3 cards from each six categories.
At the beginning of each turn, players roll the die and choose according question from the card. It is either a question or something from the DVD that card tells.

Be the first player to get 3 tiles from each category to win.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia

name: Red Light Green Light Card Game
description: Red Light Green Light is a children's action and dexterity game. Players take turns flipping light cards to reveal red, yellow, or green lights. When a red light is flipped players rush to pick up a car. They have to be fast though, because there is one fewer cars than players. If you are too slow 3 times you are out.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Beagle-opoly
description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

STURDY, FRIENDLY, CURIOUS, HAPPY-GO-LUCKY... MEET THE BEAGLE!

The sturdy and merry little Beagle is one of the most popular dogs in the United States. A member of the Hound Group, Beagles are scent hounds, developed primarily for tracking game. Since they lived in packs for hundreds of years, they naturally enjoy the company of other dogs and humans. Beagles are intelligent, but as a result of being bred for the long chase are single-minded and determined, which can make them hard to train. Despite this, their happy-go-lucky nature and gentle disposition make them a wonderful family pet.

BEAGLE-OPOLY IS A GAME OF TAIL-WAGGING FUN!
COLLECT YOUR FAVORITE BEAGLES AND PLAY HARD!

Increase your rent by buying Toys for your dogs and upgrading them to Big Bones. Sounds easy enough until you get fleas, have an accident on the carpet, or worse yet, get sent to the kennel!

GRAB YOUR TOKEN AND ADVANCE TO GO BEAGLES!

Who knows! You may soon be Best in Show... or marching in the Dog Parade! Whatever happens, keep your wag on!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Make or Break
description: Make or Break starts with 60 marbles in 4 colors randomly distributed on a grid. On a turn, a player rolls 4 special dice and swaps marbles of any opposing colors rolled with marbles of their color. The object is to create rows of at least 5 marbles of one's own color. Any rows created are scored immediately, and the game continues until someone reaches 1000 points.
publishers: Orda Industries Ltd., Skye Marketing Corporation

name: Maurice Sendak's Little Bear Adventure Game
description:
Little Bear is having a picnic, and each player needs to find Little Bear's friends to bring them to the picnic. Whoever returns with the most friends wins the game. The friends are represented by cards.

Each player moves along a path on the board. When landing on a colored acorn space, you pick up the top card on the draw or discard pile. If it matches the color you are on, you keep the card. If not, you discard the card, face down.

When landing on a Little Bear space, you take a card and keep it, regardless of color. There are also "lose a card" spaces where you lose a card of your choosing to the discard pile.

When all players reach the end (Little Bear's house), the winner is the player with the most cards.
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Color War
description:
Color War is a abstract game for two players. In each turn, a player use a card of his hand, move a pawn of his color, and take a new card from the common pool of cards. The game has only 8 cards, 2 in the hand of each player, and 4 in a common pool.
And that is all. The first player that match her pawns with the spaces of the same color, win. If nobody win in 10 turns, then each player score their pawns, depending of their final position.
A variant called "the isle" have a neutral pawn that the 2 players can move in the turn, using it to block the rival, bau in this case, this turno don´t move his pawn.

name: Hot Wheels Trading Card Game
description:
From the Rules:

"In the Hot Wheels Trading Card Game (TCG), each car is assigned a number for each of 3 Attributes: Speed, Design, and Utility. Players compete using these numbers. When it is your turn, you will select a card from your hand with which you will challenge your opponent. The highest Attribute number on that card is automatically the Attribute players compete with and the highest number wins that Challenge Match."

Game play is similar to Top Trumps and its many variations and offspring (e.g., NBA Adrenalyn XL, NFL Adrenalyn XL,Puck Attax, Match Attax, Slam Attax, Topps Attax, etc.).

Cards from the Hot Wheels Trading Card Game are sold together with cards from the FunTracks Card Game in Hot Wheels Trading Card Fun Packs.

name: FunTracks Card Game
description:
Hot Wheels FunTracks Card Game is a high-octane race game where you create your own racetrack game board and race to the finish!

In FunTracks Card Game players first take turns laying down track cards and creating a race track. Each track begins with the Start Card and ends with the Finish Card. Then each player takes turns rolling a die and moving their car (either one of the Car Cards from Hot Wheels Trading Card Game or a "real" Hot Wheel car. Each Track Card is equal to one space. If a player lands on a Track Card with special game play instructions, that player must do what the Track Card says (e.g., Oil Spill - go back 3 spaces, etc.). Player continues until one player reaches the Finish Track Card.

Cards from the FunTracks Card Game is sold together with cards from the Hot Wheels Trading Card Game in Hot Wheels Trading Card Fun Packs.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Racing

name: Word Shout
description:
You roll all 10 letter dice and the goal is to shout out a word of at least 3 letters that can be made with the dice. You cannot rearrange the dice on the table after they are rolled. When you shout a word, you take the letter dice that make that word and put them in front of you. Play continues until no more words can be made out of the remaining dice. The number of dice in front of you collected from the words you made is your point score for the round. If multiple players shout the same word at the same time, the round ends and the dice are rerolled. The first player to 50 points wins.

It comes with a plastic click case, making it good for travel.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Party Game, Word Game

name: Devil's Advocate
description:
Originally created for a now-defunct contest in December 2010, which required that the game be playable in the iggc sandbox, use conversion capture, and be won by the player with the majority of stones. Though the game can as easily be played with pen and paper, and with variable victory thresholds rather than balancing stones, the rules are presented here as submitted.

Basic rules:
Players alternately place one stone at a time in an empty space on a board with an odd number of hexagonal cells. Normally, Black may only place white stones, while White may place either white or black stones. If the placement of a white stone completes one or more unbroken rows of four or more white stones, all stones in these rows flip to black. When the board is full, the player with more stones of their color on the board wins.

Balancing stones:
On most standard boards, White has a small but definite advantage. It is suggested to give Black a limited number of black stones which may be played at any time during the game in place of their usual white stone. Though a 'pie-rule' arrangement can ensure that both players agree on the appropriate number of such stones, CPU self-play suggests the following setups as fair, and the 9x9x9 is particularly recommended.

6x6x6 Black gets 5 black stones, white gets first move.
7x7x7 Black gets 4 black stones and first move.
8x8x8 Black gets 3 black stones, White gets first move.
9x9x9 Black gets 3 black stones, White gets first move.
10x10x10 Black gets 2 black stones and first move.

Note that once one accounts for the balancing stones, players may mark cells which can no longer be flipped as white, since Black may not play a black stone there, and White should never choose to.

(submitted by designer)
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Vancouver Islandopoly
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μœåνος (alone or single) + polein πωλε·øñν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

A version of Monopoly featuring Vancouver Island.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Bild: Das Quiz
description:
A trivia game with questions taken from a German newspaper's editorial staff. Every player starts as a low ranking trainee and tries to reach the position of chief editor. This is done by answering questions from six different categories. The questions are multiple choice, so even if you don't know the answer, you may have a guess.
The game contains 110 cards with 3.300 questions.
Categories are Entertainment, News, Sport & Travel, Motor & Engineering, Politics & Economy, Life & Knowledge.

name: Colorado Smith et le Sacr√© Temple
description:
Colorado Smith and the Sacred Temple is a tongue-in-cheek boardgame adaptation of popular pulp adventure movies like Indiana Jones. An evil priest wants to sacrifice a virgin priestess of the forces of Light to his deity (some unspeakable horror with tentacles of course). Just like in the movies, the players reach the ceremonial altar just in time to prevent the sacrifice, but each of them has different goals.

The game can be played with three or six players (in which case there are two of each character). The game characters are an adventurer, whose first objective is to steal the jewels embedded in the idols and his second to rescue the princess, an avenger (whose first goal is to kill the priest, then to steal the jewels) and the father of the priestess (whose goal is to save his daughter, then to kill the priest). Each character gains victory points according to his goals, the player with the most victory points win. Each character also has different stats and equipment.

During a game turn, the priest is moved on the board, then players move and fight, then if a player's character or a dead body is in the line of sight of the priest or a cultist, the player roll a die and consult a table indicating what happens (the cultists may move or shoot arrows, the priest may try to possess one of the characters for one more turns).

The game ends when all the characters are either dead or have left the board.

The game was published in Casus Belli magazine issue #23: Casus Belli (Issue 23 - Dec 1984)

name: SHOOT!
description:
SHOOT! is a soccer card game for two players. The game is played with 55 cards. The set consists of 30 soccer player cards, 2 keeper cards, 2 placement cards, 20 action cards and 1 game rules card.
Every player has a team. The team consist of 15 soccer players and a keeper.

In the upper right corner of every soccer player card are one to three soccer balls. This is the value of this soccer player for it's placement line. The value of the keeper is per action determined with a die. The higher total value in a line allows more shot (die rolls) at the goal.

The 20 action cards are used by both players.

name: Skunk
description: Another push-your-luck dice game, like the original Skunk, although in this one the object is to roll skunks, not to avoid rolling them. Each player's turn consists of one roll of from one to five dice, as they choose; every skunk rolled counts as one letter in spelling "skunk". The dice are then passed to the next player. The first player to accumulate exactly five skunks (one for each letter in "skunk") wins, but if any player rolls more skunks than they need, they have to start over again.

name: S'getti Scatter
description: The game includes a large white plastic bowl and lots of colorful plastic pieces of spaghetti that fit around the top rim of the bowl. Three S'getti meatballs are placed on the spaghetti. Children remove the spaghetti pieces one by one without letting the meatballs fall through to the bottom when the bowl upsets and spills the spaghetti and meatballs on the table. The player who causes the meatball to fall in the pot is the loser.

name: Wiener Stadtbahnspiel
description:
Players must travel around the Austrian city of Vienna in a tram, All the points of arrival has facts about the stops along the route. A die is used for movement. Quiz questions need answering at some point and the correct answers are within the rules. The winner is the first player to complete his route and return home.

I only have a reproduction of this game and I have no idea when it was first made. My edition is from the 1980's but the original must be over a hundred years old.
publishers: (Unknown), A. Pichlers Witwe & Sohn, Europ√§ische Spielesammler Gilde e.V.

name: Roll 'n Add
description:
From Publisher Website:

Roll ’n Add is the 2-in-1 fun way to introduce addition to younger children. Plus is a beginning addition game, and Double is an advanced addition game using beginning multiplication strategies. Both games are played with our unique 10-sided dice to enable players to add or double numbers up to 20.

To play both games, simply roll the dice, add or double the numbers, and strategically place the corresponding numbered playing piece on the board. Like tic-tac-toe, players strive for three in a row.

Because Roll ’n Add encourages cooperative play, opponents assist each other in adding the numbers, and the enclosed addition table confirms the answer. Sound easy? It is! But watch out! Your playing piece may be captured and flipped to the opponent’s side! Luck and strategies, not addition ability, win this game - so even the beginning player can compete!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Pass the Pricks
description:
Erotic, party version of Pass the Pigs. Includes special "dirty rules" for couples.

The game comes with a pair of penis shaped dice. The players roll the dice, trying to get the penises to land in different positions. Every position is worth a certain amount of points. The first player to reach a 100 points or the player with the highest score after five rounds is the winner.

The dirty rules for couples turns the game into a striptease/make out game where each dice score equals a certain "act".

Online play: http://www.passthepricks.com

name: Constellation Connect
description:
Did you know the constellations are grouped by astronomers into families - like the Hercules, Heavenly Waters and Ursa Major families - whose members are in the same region of the night sky?

Constellation Connect! is a stellar variation of Go Fish Children explore the stars and collect star points while learning major regions of the night sky. Special cards like Comet Sighting, Northern Lights and Meteor Shower and also a galactic die to change the game play up in lots of spacey ways.throw fun and crazy twists into the game play. An included subject guide teaches about the many multicultural mythologies tied to the constellations.

name: Puzzles in Pictures
description: Party game. 15 pictures (all different) are placed round the room before the party starts. When guests arrive, they are encouraged to look at the pictures at some time during the party. The picture should suggest a well-known item to them. The one who gets the most right answers after an agreed time, wins.

name: Rapuralli
description:
Simple board game for small children. The game is a simple roll and move effort, teaching colours, shapes and basic board game skills.

There are three variants in the rules: game with colours, game with shapes and game with both shapes and colours.

name: Qui veut gagner des millions ? (version voyage)
description:
A French game inspired from the famous TV show "Qui veut gagner des millions" in France.
You play with one, two or three partners and answer questions of knowledge. Indeed, questions which worth 200 € are generally easy, but the one at 1 000 000 € (a billion) is much difficult and specialized.
People who have a large knowledge in many topics (cinema, literature, paintings, and so ones) will spend a great moment playing with this game....as it's only in French, questions are basically easy to understand if you have a little french.

name: Biker Mice From Mars
description:
In this game win the player who manages to defeat the evil Limburger after managing to avoid the enemies encountered on the board, and avoid the dangers encountered on the elevated ramp.
Once you reach Limburger, the player has three chances to be able to hit the figure of the wicked and drop it.
Each player has its own character who will move on the board trying to collect cards that allow access to the elevated road. In this attempt they must defeat the enemies they encounter.
The elevated road contain dangers and traps to be avoided by players to reach the point from which they can shoot with the catapult at Limburger and win the game.

name: Silly Season
description:
You are the newly appointed manager of one of the largest football clubs in the country.The expectations a sky high and the goal is clear: buy new players and build a team for the top.

In the game you move around the board answering questions about players, arenas, championship etc. This gives you money to build your team. Can you afford to use an agent or do you have to make a panic transfer? Using an agent will probably give you players with higher confidence points.

The winner is the player who has gathered the most confidence points.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Splay
description:
Splay is a two player abstract strategy game. The object of the game is to acquire more territory than your opponent. The two players, called "white" and "black", alternately take turns placing their pieces on the playing field, or stacking them on their previously played pieces. Once a piece is played, it is never removed from the board. Splay is a game where the players are constantly battling for territory acquisition. A space which has a player’s piece(s) on it represents a unit of territory which is owned by that player. A "tower" consists of one or more like-colored checkers stacked on top of one another. A tower represents potential for acquiring additional territory. Players who utilize their towers effectively will gain a territorial advantage. Towers can also pose a liability so they must be developed with care.

Splay was inspired by the process by which borders are formed between competing entities.

Please refer to the included "Splay_Rules.pdf" for a complete description of the rules.

Splay placed first in the 2011 rec.games.abstract stacking games contest.

name: Disney Princess Land of Enchantment Game
description:
A delightful trip through the enchanted world of Disney Princesses. Each player chooses their very special princess pieces and guides her back to her home.

The object of the game is to move your princess from her assigned start space around the track and back home, collecting four jewel cards along the way. Movement is determined by rolling a six-sided die. Five sides are colors and represent spaces on the track. The sixth side is the Evil Queen! When the Evil Queen is rolled, the player loses a turn. To counter this, there are four helper spaces on the board: landing on one of these nets the player an extra turn.

The first player to arrive back home with their four jewel cards wins the game.

Includes a bonus checkers game with Cinderella and Aurora Dawn pieces.
For ages 3+
2-4 players
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Indoor Highland Games
description:
One of the truly great sporting events in the world is the Highland Games of Scotland. Played outdoors for centuries, now transported to your living room.
Take part in such modern classics as Tossing the 2HB, Jockionary, Vegetarian Sword Dancing and How High is my Sporran.

Components:
24 cards with activities on them
5 tiddlywinks.

Each turn a player draws one of the cards from the deck. This card explains what the mini game will be for this round. It could be a physical activity or a quiz on Scottish things.
The card explains the rules of the game and how to play it.
Players compete over several rounds to try to amass the most points through competing in these mini, modified 'indoor highland games'.
The winner is the person or team with the most points at the end of 5 rounds.

name: Was ist Was: Junior ‚Äì Piraten
description:
Was ist Was - Junior: Piraten challenges players to find where the green parrot is hiding or spot the pirate with an eye patch. (There's only one?)

The players search for many hidden objects, then simultaneously guess where they think the object is located by choosing and revealing a tip card. Players who are correct advance their ship toward the finish line. First one across the line is a scurvy dog!

name: Tic Tac Row
description:
Tic Tac Row is another game in the Games on a Line Series. The first, which is on Boardgame Geek, is 3 on 3. At least one more game is planned for the Series.
In Tic Tac Row, each player has 4 pieces, which start out alternating on an 8 space line, with the goal to get 3 pieces in a row, by a player moving one of their pieces left or right. Players can a1so win the game, if they have no legal moves at the start of their turn.

name: Denali
description:
Denali is a tile-laying game of wilderness territories. Players occupy territories with their bears, wolves and rabbits. Each player also has a movable hunter as well as a fish.

Over the course of the game, territories combine and result in conflicts among the animals claiming those territories. A player may also use his animals and hunter to attack, potentially emptying a region in order to occupy it on a later turn.

The fish scores based on the regions it borders. Land animals score based on the size of their territory. The hunter is a tactical piece, but does not score.

name: Race to Smurf Village
description:
In the Race to Smurf Village game each player has to select a card, which will tell you what color space to move to next. A Smurf berry or apple card can move you further ahead, However, a Gargamel card will send you back in the game. The winner is the first player to get to Smurf Village.

Includes:
- Gameboard
- Cards
- 4 Smurf themed movers
- 4 Mover stands
- Rule booklet
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: –ú–∏—Å—Å –†—É—Å—Å–∫–∞—è –Ω–æ—á—å
description:
From publisher:

Miss Russian Night (How many women can you seduce in one night?) is a card board game that has been produced under license with the erotic Russian Night TV channel. The players are the guests at a night club who are flirting with 8 different girls. The winner is the player who is able to successfully lure the most women to bed.

Each girl is a real model from the TV channel. They are represented by ten different cards, all varying in their level of intimacy from the proper “one” whom a player can eventually get, to the absolutely naked “ten”. The playing field has three different zones: a stack of cards at the dance floor, the bar table with four open cards and the strip podium. The winner of the game will be the one who can control his desires and use his skills
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Mature / Adult
publishers: Fantasy World, Inc., Hobby World, Igrology

name: Helter-Skelter
description:
A game completely devoid of skill. Players roll a ball down a curling slide (as in a Helter-Skelter ride in a funfair). The ball scores points depending on which hole it settles into, rather like in a Bagatelle-type game).

The box depicts an aged gnome standing on a ladder and about to start a ball rolling whilst two children look on. Not sure why a gnome should be associated with the game!

name: Pocket Quiz: Kultserien
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Cult Television" and the questions are about that topic.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Das Super-Quiz um Millionen
description: 5500 questions and answers in a new edition of the former noris quiz games, a new name and new graphics, the categories are: History & politics, nature and environment, sports & games, art & culture, heaven & earth, fairy tales and folk tales, technology & science, general knowledge. New is the possibility to advance on a money scale for correct answers.

name: Winx Club il Ballo
description:
This is a game based on the TV show Winx Club and is meant for ages 4 and up.

Game has 3 levels: easy, medium and "difficult".

The aim of the game is to be the first to dress, make-up etc. for the Court ball of the evening.

Players roll the dice, enter in a room (i.e. dressing room) and take a card and resolve event, or complete a set of cards in order to dress and prepare her Winx for the Court ball.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: W√ºrfelkrieger
description:
In this small-scale miniatures game, 2 players control one hero and a number of henchmen who try to gain the most points by destroying enemy figures and collecting objectives on the "board".

All miniatures and dice are magnetic, and the playing field is built from flexible cloth "boards" with a wire mesh layer in the center.

name: Pferde-Rallye
description:
Objective: make most of your money manipulating the running-in
- moving by turns -
1 each player draws a hidden card which proposes a different running-in of the 5 (coloured) horses
2 each player rolls 3 coloured dice - colours on top designate the horses to be moved during this turn - 3, 2 and 1 space
by choice of the active player
3 if a die shows a horseshoe - free choice
4 obstacles and/or special positions are going to change/modify results
5 if all horses have crossed the finish line there is a check/comparison how many positions are matching with the running-in proposal on your card
6 after collecting points players will run 2 additional rounds
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wobble Tower
description: A dexterity game in which players roll a die to select a letter then they must add that letter to the accumulating tower of letters on an unstable platform - without knocking down the tower. If you knock down the tower then you get all the letters that were in the tower. The first person to use all of their letters wins.

name: Tabuals
description:
From their web site:

Tabuals is a deck of 43 cards; 36 of which are considered the core deck with each card depicting a pair of dice of varying combinations. In addition to the core deck, there are 6 additional cards called the Starred Doubles. Although the core deck already contains a pair of each double combintation (double 1's, double 2's, etc.), the Starred Doubles is a second set of doubles denoted by a star to the right of their sum (or rank). This extra set is only used in some of our games to change various game mechanics. Finally, the last card in the deck is the JINX card. This card is also only utilized in some of our games.

There are many types of games that can be played with a deck of Tabuals:
‚Ä®
Solitaire Games‚Ä®
Trick-Taking Games‚Ä®
Casino/Betting Games‚Ä®
Building Games‚Ä®
Melding Games

name: Eurotest
description:
A quiz and trivia game about Europe.
Topics are geography, history, art and culture, entertainment, sports and science-technology-services. Proper answers gives predetermined number of chips or question cards.
Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner

name: Gross oder klein?
description: The top card of the deck is turned over, the player guesses on his turn, whether the animal is larger or smaller on the next card. There are a total of nine delightfully drawn animals: mouse, dog, monkey, sheep, tiger, bear, horse, elephant and giraffe, and therefore is in the appearance of giraffe or the mouse does not rate very difficult, but with monkey, tiger and sheep it is not so easy to estimate. For correct answers you get small chips. 5 small chips are worth 1 large chips. Player with the 5 large chips wins the game.

name: Domory
description:
This is a hybrid between Dominoes and Memory. In fact, the material is suitable for both games. The playing pieces are grey plastic units which have one nearly flat colored end with some 3D pattern, and one "diagonal" one.

- In ORY, the players place all the pieces into the box and pull out two of them at a time, hoping to find two in which the patterns fit into each other. Whoever locates most pairs this way is the winner.
- In DO, two random pieces are placed on the table. In his/her turn, a player tries to add a piece that fits the pattern and another one of his/her choice. A player who cannot add pieces has to draw a new one from the box. The goal is to get rid of one's pieces first.

name: Domino 4
description:
Domino 4 is a game of dominoes but each tile is divided by the square diagonally and includes dominoes from 0 / 1 to 4 / 4, fourteen types of dominos in four colors. Add four jokers - the equivalent of 0 / 0 - and you have sixty tiles.

Gilles Monnet devised a simple rule, but interesting. While the classic domino game are done in one dimension, Domino 4 is a game in two dimensions. Tiles can be placed so that all numbers fits with other adjacent tiles but diagonals may be turn in 2 ways.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Maulwurf W√ºrfel Puzzle
description:
Different motives with different background colours are divided into pieces, which are marked with dice symbols. All the pieces are heaped in the middle of the table. Players choose a background colour for their picture and roll the die and take a piece according to the roll. If they already have a piece with that symbol, the may roll a second time. Who has finished his picture first, wins.

Similar to Jumbolino but there is a color die instead of number die and players may re-roll it once if they already have the rolled color.

name: Activity Superthema Heute
description:
Piatnik supplement provides for the lovers of this game an extension to the basic game, the topics are new, diverse, and in this case, they focus on the issue of TODAY.
1320 new terms can be combined with each of the previously released games, which corresponds to the size of the compact edition.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Crisis Dice
description:
Crisis Dice is a cold war dice game with complexity more akin to 'Zombie dice' than 'Twilight Struggle'.

Crisis Dice is a very light, quick-playing, low-complexity game for 1-2 players aged 8 and up.It lasts between 15 to 20 minutes and emulates a tiny portion of the tension and political unrest between the former Soviet Union and the United States of America during the month of October in 1962.

In this game players will try to infiltrate the heart of their opponent’s government and in doing so gain military intelligence that will help prevent political tension, misunderstanding and ultimately a nuclear war. A peaceful victory with propaganda bonuses is the preferred outcome for either side.

Be the first super power to place their Event Marker onto the Victory space at the end of the Event Track before the opposition and before the DEFCON level reaches one.

Rules summary.....

1. Roll for initiative. Both sides roll a single 6 sided dice the highest score wins initiative for that turn.

2. Place Agency Focus Marker. The winner of the initiative roll chooses one of the four Agency Focus Actions at the top of his side of the game board and moves his Agency Focus Marker from its agency home space to the chosen action space. These bonuses are added to the Spy Dice rolls in the next part of the turn where a score of 5 or 6 is deemed successful. The player that lost initiative then chooses his action (he may not duplicate the action chosen by the winner of initiative for that turn) and places his marker.

3. Roll Spy Dice. Both sides roll all of their available coloured Spy Dice. Dice that have been placed within the Kremlin or The White House during previous turns may not be rolled again and remain where they are until the end of that round. On turn one both players will have 3 dice to roll.

4. Agency Focus bonuses are applied. The chosen Agency Focus Bonus is applied to any one of the rolled Spy Dice, starting with the player who won initiative in step one.

5. Spies infiltrate places of power. Successful spies (those dice that scored a roll of 5 or 6 with any bonuses applied) are deemed to have successfully infiltrated their chosen place of power i.e. Kremlin for U.S. spies or The White House for soviet spies and are placed into the appropriate area on the game board.

6. Repeat steps 1 to 5. These steps are repeated 3 times or until either player has placed all 3 of his spies into the appropriate spy placement area. The first player to do this is deemed the winner of that round and moves his Event Marker one place closer to the Victory space. Players must raise DEFCON level by 1 if indicated by text above event track. If both players fail to place all 3 of their spies into their appropriate spy placement areas then an intelligence stalemate is declared and the DEFCON Marker is raised one level.

7. Return Spies and Agency Focus Markers. All 3 Spy Dice are returned to each player and the Agency Focus Markers are returned to their Agency Home Space ready for the next round.

8. Repeat steps 1 to 7 until one side places their Event Marker onto the Victory space and reads the printed outcome or until the DEFCON level reaches one indicating the start of a worldwide thermo nuclear war and both sides lose.
categories: Dice, Modern Warfare, Political, Print & Play

name: ASL Comp: Battle of the Bulge I
description:
From the Publisher:
About 15 years ago Euro Pak II brought ASLers a bevy of Battle of the Bulge scenarios and proved to be one of our best-sellers ever. It's long been out of print ... and deserving of an update. And an update, and then some, is exactly what it has received! Two new geomorphic maps, both depicting rivers, scenarios updated, all known errata input, plus the new layout and art. PLUS some additonal bonus BULGE scenarios AND a FREE copy of the Wingen-sur-Moder counter sheet providing vehicles and AFVs shown on the image above. All in all it comes at you as BULGE PAK I (a hint that, yes, there will be a BULGE PAK II).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Entdecke die Welt
description:
"Discover the World" in English
Trivia game with questions about a nature.
You must answer correctly to advance on the game board and collect all the profit from the first part. A question is read aloud along with three possible answers, the players put in their opinion, the correct prediction chip face down on the table. Who has been right moves on the board in front of a field may turn around the chip and win the corresponding part. For higher income parts players have to move higher by answering further questions, but falls back on the base part with a wrong answer. Who first had all the pieces turned on the colored side wins.

name: Mon premier jeu de Parcours
description:
A dice game for very young children. Player move animals along a path by rolling a colour dice (moving to the next square of the colour the dice is showing). Special dice envents are the butterfly (move to the same colour you are standing on) and the bug (moving backwards). The winning player of a run gets a chip, then the race starts againg. First player with 3 chips is winner.

"Back of the box" desciption: Little animals are walking along a path. The die shows red! The little dog can move onto the next red square... A game that encourages communication between toddlers and their parents.

name: MARCO POLO REISE-SPIEL Frankreich
description:
Objective: collect as many bonus points as possible, but don't miss to be back home on time
- tactical (geographical) quiz - so called on back of box
3 phases - moving by turn - each player starts on his marked/coloured area
I move around collecting cards/images
II answer questions regarding images/cards you hold - if you fail discard card
III get back home (can be difficult) - don't miss the plane/boat
content:
1 board, 60 cards/images, 6 ports/cards, 20 red chips, 4 vehicles with stand-ups, 8 'double-sided' stones to point out directions, 2 rain slides, 1 die, 1 rule
3 similar editions existing for Germany, Italy & US
categories: Card Game, Dice, Educational, Travel, Trivia

name: Soccer Game
description:
Box has comic book style footballers. It doesn't say it is connected to the ultimate British comic book hero Roy of the Rovers, but it does look awfully close.

The board is a soccer pitch and is enclosed within a plastic cover. The pitch has 10 indentations. To move the ball, each player has 10 buttons to press, each numbered to relate to one of the indentations. When a ball settles into an indentation, the first to press the lever, 'passes' the ball, with the intention of sendint it to another position. The cover on the pitch means that the ball cannot leave the board and roll on to the floor. The goalkeepers are worked by slides so that they can be moved sideways to save shots.

name: The Sunset of Waterloo
description:
You must prepare several dice.
This game is sequel game of Sun of Austerlitz in Game Journal#33.
This game covers the battle of Waterloo in 1815, the last battle of Napoleon.
This game uses the same engine as its sequel game. Players must draw a command chit at random to decide which formation will work next.
The rule is longer than usual GJ's games 12 pages.
The game can be played 4 to 6 hours based on its explanation.

198 counters, 1 game map, rulebook

name: Word Twist
description:
Word Twist is a game for two teams. Teams take turns drawing a card from the deck which will display one of five categories, some of which incorporate elements from other well-known word games. The categories are:


Nonsense - players have to answer a question on acronyms, dates, words, people or movies;
Word Bluff - players have to identify the correct definition of a word from three possible choices;
Express Yourself - players give clues to get their teammates to identify a word, but cannot say certain banned words;
Word Twist - both teams compete to make as many smaller words as possible from the letters of a given word;
Memory Time - a short passage is read from the card and questions are then asked to the opposing team.


Teams accrue points in each round and the winner is the team with the most points after a predetermined number of rounds.

From the box front: Word Twist: Every Word Game You've Ever Played - In One!
categories: Memory, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Gitterr√§tsel! Junior
description:
Gitterrätsel! Junior is the kid's version of Gitterr√§tsel!.

Rotating the game board reveals a sequence of images, a word or an image in an open field of the board edge is visible. Whoever first discovers the corect sequence of pictures and letters on the board is the winner. Opponents compete to discover the hidden word first corresponding to the picture and mark it with tiles. However, if another player finds a word that is marked by another opponent's tiles than that opponent looses the word. Whoever has the most at the end pieces on the game board wins! This game promotes playful speed and concentration.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Quizzard Junior
description: Quizzard game for younger audiance where you not only have to be right, you have to be fast. The heart of the game is an electronic buzzer device that records who will answer the question first. Up to 6 players have this buzzer pad in front of them and the first one who hits the button gets to answer. However, you can lose points for incorrect answers so before you hit the button you'd better know the answer.

name: Monopoly: Borussia Dortmund
description: Monopoly with Borussia Dortmund, the famous soccer team from Germany. All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Moonshot The Lunar Power Game
description:
The object of the game is to control the most number of Space Craft at the end of the game.

On your go you roll 2 dice, add them together, and place your Space Craft on the corresponding space on the board, if it is not already occupied. If you roll a 7 you occupy the Moon with your large Moon Base token, this allows you to control the other Space Craft. While occupying the moon you may replace any of your opponent's pieces with a piece of your own colour, provided that you roll the correct number.

When all the areas numbered 2 to 12 are occupied the game ends and the player with the greater number of his colour markers is the winner.

name: Wetten dass..? Junior
description:
Junior version of Wetten Dass ...?

The game offers many simplifications, so just come the youngest in the family and for the course when it comes to the most successful European television show on ZDF.

In five different categories have challenging tasks to be solved to the end to win the game as a competition king.

Players must answer the questions, explain something in 60 seconds with a camera, doing pantomine etc.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing, Paper-and-Pencil, Team-Based Game

name: Monopoly: Sachsen
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μœåνος (alone or single) + polein πωλε·øñν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Sachsen, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: $ Fever
description:
The game includes six dice whose faces are one of the letters of the name of the game in different colors.

The goal is to achieve more winning combinations after 1 or more shots.

There are 10 possible combinations ranging from 50-5000 points.

The first run must include the 6 dice you put aside the combinations you want to keep and raise the other dice. If no any combinations appear, You lose everything!

Each new launch may double the sum if it is succesful.

The winner is the first to total 5000 points.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Star Requiem: Humanity's Last Stand
description:
1,000 years in the future, humanity has traveled well beyond their Sol home to carve out a new empire in a nearby fold of the galaxy. Mankind has all but given up their warlike ways, instead following a destiny of peace, exploration, and discovery.

However, in the year 1044 A.E. (After Exodus), the cyborg race Xyl discovered humanity, and proceeded to systematically begin the process of what they had done to every other species in their quadrant - exterminate them to the last microbe.

It was supposed to be easy, just another species to eradicate in the search for the 'perfect hybrid' race of Xyl.

Pity nobody told the humans...

Your mission as the human supreme commander in this exciting solitaire game is fourfold: First, rebuild and retool the peaceful human economy and set it on a war footing. Second, develop and build mighty starships of war to bring the fight to the Xyl, and to protect your systems from bombing and conquest. Third, develop new technologies that could turn the tide of the war.. or turn out to be worthless dead-ends. And finally, develop, under deeply buried labs that contain humanity's last home, a nanovirus that will destroy the Xyl threat once and for all. Only then can humanity breathe easy... but the Xyl are merciless and though they can be slowed, their species doomsday protocol can never be stopped... until and unless their xenophobic AI is destroyed.

There is no diplomacy. There is no surrender. Humanity must Fight... or Vanish.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Phase Order

name: Tessels
description:
Tessels is a trivia game about homonyms (words with different meanings)
The game consists f 50 cards, each with 3 hints on a homonym.

Players simultaniously try to find the right hymonym. If a player can find the word with only the first hint, he scores 3 points, after the second hint, he gets 2 points and after the 3rd one point.

The first hint is a sentence with the homonym replaced by TESSELS, for example. "While the perents went to a TESSELS, their children played with a TESSELS.

The second hint consists of synonyms for the two meanings (like "orb dance")

And the third hint is a sketch.

name: Quadrigon
description:
Quadrigon is a game of shapes for two or three players. The hexagonal board is marked out as shown in diagram 1. Each player has a sufficiency of coloured triangular shapes of a similar size to those marked on the board. The shapes of each player are of a distinctive colour. The objective is to place these pieces on the board and form quadrilaterals.

In turn, each player places one of his pieces in a triangular space on the board, touching another piece already on the board (excepting of course the first piece laid). They may touch either along adjacent sides or at the points.

Quadrilaterals of many different shapes and sizes can be formed. Some examples are shown in diagram 2. The only quadrilateral which does not count towards a score is one formed by placing two pieces edge to edge (diagram 3). In order for a player to score points for a quadrilateral the following conditions must be satisfied:
1. Exactly half of the counters forming the quadrilateral must be of the colour of the player who has completed it;
2. The perimeter of the quadrilateral must not at any point pass between two counters of the same colour;
3. There must be no empty spaces in the quadrilateral.

When a player completes a legal quadrilateral, he scores one point for each piece within its boundaries regardless of colour. Individual pieces can form part of more than one quadrilateral. The game is completed when all the pieces have been placed on the board.

name: Dukes Chess
description:
A chess variant that provides a larger board (8x9) and adds another piece to the standard chess set: The Duke.

The Duke can move 1, 2 or 3 spaces in any direction but is unable to capture in any adjacent space but can capture in the subsequent 2 or 3 spaces beyond that. The Duke may also jump over pieces to bypass them.

The Duke starts at the King's side, opposite the Queen.

name: San Antonio in-a-box
description:
This is a Monopoly clone from Late from the Sky, a publisher that specializes in themed Monopoly games. All the deeds, spaces on the board and cards feature locations and landmarks from San Antonio.

Players roll dice to determine how far they move. Landing on a space gives the player the option of buying the property. When a player collects all the properties in one color group, the properties can be improved by first building skylines, and then upgrading to keys to the city. When players land on a space owned by another player they must pay rent. Rent is determined by the location of the property and the number of improvements on the space. Some spaces instruct a player to draw a card which can be beneficial or harmful to the player. Players must avoid going bankrupt to stay in the game. The winner is the last player left in the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Kryptos
description:
Kryptos is a trivia card game.

The game consists of 50 cards, each with 3 hints.

Players simultaniously try to find the right solution. If a player can find it with only the first hint, he scores 3 points, after the second hint, he gets 2 points and after the 3rd one point.

The first hint is a sentence of numbers and letters, for example T7WW.

The second hint is a little more precous, like The 7 W of the W)

And the third hint is a sketch, for example a pyramid.

The solutions for this examples would be "The 7 Wonders of the World"

name: Murmeli, pass uf!
description:
Marmots are crazy for flowers. But they must be careful when they walk through the lush meadows and look for their favorite meal. Fox and eagles are in fact crazy for these little animals...

The flowers in 3 colors are distributed on the game board face-up.
In his turn player rolls dice and take the action indicated.
If die shows flower the player moves his marmot the nearest place with the flower with proper color.
If die shows arrow player may move one step with his marmot.
If die shows burrow player may move his marmot to any burrow.
If die shows danger player removes one of the eight burrow-cards from the play so there are now less places to hide.

The game ends when a player has lost both marmots or when all
the flowers of one color were collected. This is when the player with the most flowers that wins the game.

name: Kleiner Eisb√§r Post f√ºr Dich!
description:
A card game for little ones. It is intended foir fans of the books because it assumes you will know all of Kleiner Eisbär's friends.

30 cards, each showing two friends. The first player lays a card from his hand. The friend on the left is sending a letter to the friend on the right. On future turns, he can add to this card, domino fashion, from the right hand side. So, if Eisbär was sending the letter to Greta, he would first have to play a card that matches Eisbär on the right side and another friend on the left. Then a card can be added to the new left sided friend and if ever Greta appears on the lerft hand side, the letter is delivered. Winner is the player who has delivered the most letters after the cards are all used.

name: Meltdown Express
description:
Meltdown Express is a nuclear plant escape game for two players. It uses a die in a non-luck way.

In turns, each player can move one of his three workers to get one of the three hatchways on the other side of the modular board. Each hatchway has different victory points.

You have to run hard and strategic to achieve the objective of not dying and score most points.

This game was made for the II "Imprimir y Jugar" contest of the spanish blog "Jugando en Pareja" and got de second position.
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Wat vindt Nederland?
description:
The boardgame based on the popular Dutch television show "Wat vindt Nederland?" in which two teams compete against each other, trying to find out what the general Dutch opinion is. Teams will get a statement - mostly based on recent events - and have to try and guess what the opinion of the Dutch public is on the statement. Whichever team is closer, wins the round.

Just like the RTL4 show this game is about opinions and how well you think you know them. The game uses a large variety of recent issues on which popular opinion has been polled. Your task is to find out which is the general consensus among the Dutch audience and score points by doing so.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Chase the Mouse
description:
Object: To be the last player left in the game.
Contents: 36 cards

Before you begin, find 3 tokens (buttons, sweets etc.) for each player. These represent his 3 “lives" and when he has lost them he is out of the game. The pack consists of 4 sets of cards numbered from 1 to 9, which have the following order of importance from highest to lowest:
Farmer's Wife, Dog, Cat, Mouse. Therefore, the 3 of "Dog" beats the 3 of “Cat".

The dealer shuffles the pack and deals one card, face down, to each player. During the game you must try to avoid holding the lowest card. The first player to the dealer's left looks at his card.
He can either say "Stick" and keep it or exchange it for the card belonging to the next player on his left in the hope of getting a higher number and/or set. The next player does the same and so on until it is the dealer's turn. He can either “Stick" or exchange his card for the top one of the pack.
Then all players turn their cards face up and whoever holds the lowest one puts one token into the kitty.
If 2 players hold the same lowest number, the lower set loses. All players put their cards onto a discard pile. The next player becomes the dealer. When the pack has been played through once, pick up the discard pile, shuffle it and play on. Play continues until there is only one player left who wins all the tokens from the kitty.

name: Richtig oder Falsch? Das Spiel
description:
Each player has pawn on the game board nad the object is to move it from start to finish.

In his turn player draws a card and chooses between a light, medium or heavy question (or statement) to answer. Then the card is turned over and who answered correctly andvances hi pawn 1 or 2 fields when light or medium question was chosen and as many fields as dice shows if
difficult question was chosen.

Player who reaches at finish first is the winner.

name: None of the Above
description:
In this trivia game, on your turn you will answer your question with 1 to 3 possible answers. The other players then vote using their cards whether the correct answer is #1, #2, #3, or "None of the Above." The active player gets 3-5 points if he's right, more points if he wrote fewer answers. The other players get 2 points if they guess correctly.

If players don't feel they can accurately guess, they can "cheat." They can look at the answer, get only 1 point that round, and must include the correct answer in the three they write on the board.

name: Astro-Nots
description: This is a children's motorized action game. Part of a series of games entitled T.H.I.N.G.S. or Totally Hillarious Incredibly Neat Games of Skill. This is the outer space themed game Astro-Nots. The mission is to rescue the Astro-Nots from the moon surface by lowering the arm of the space ship. A magnet on the end of the space ship lifted the "Nots". The game was started by pulling the alien monster (attached via string) to wind up the game. When the monster was pulled back the game, the round was over. From the box: "Save the Astro-Nots from the Angry Alien!"Ages 5 and up for 1 or more players.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Real-time, Space Exploration

name: Sesame Street Hunt, Chase, Swap and Race!
description:
This is a Sesame Street board game from 1985 made by Milton Bradley. There were 4 collectible game pieces included in the game that were displayed in a clear open window on the game box.

Object: Be first to return to START with three cards belonging to your Sesame Street Characters

Game Pieces: 1 Game board, 4 Sesame Street Playing Pieces, 24 Playing Cards, 1 Die and One Playing Cup (blue)

Collectible Game Pieces include: Big Bird, Cookie Monster, Bert and Ernie
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Qui Croque Quoi?
description:
Card game that features four different games but all are fairly traditional. 36 cards being 17 with an animal, 17 with a food associated with an animal, 1 Wolf card and 1 Red Riding Hood card.

For game 1 use all the cards except Red Riding Hood and her Cake. The Wolf will be the Schwarzer Peter (Old Maid) card. Whoever holds it when all the cards are paired, loses. Note for this and other games, the pairing of two cards are not the same image. You must match a food card with an animal card, i.e. Squirrel and Nuts.

For game 2, use all the cards. The Wolf and Little Red Riding Hood count as a pair. Turn all the cards upside down randomly. Draw two cards and if a pair, take them. When all the pairs are matched up, the one with the most pairs, wins.

Game 3 is a slight variation of Game 2. Take out the Wolf and Little Red Riding Hood. Still matching pairs but the cards are divided into animal cards on the left and food cards on the right. I guess this is seen as a little easier for younger children.

Game 4 is played like a Lotto variant. Each player gets an equal number of animal cards. The Caller has the deck of food cards. He will turn one over and announce it i.e. Thistle. If a player has the donkey card (who eats the thistle) then he can turn over his donkey card. The first player to turn over all their animal cards, wins.

Note that the box is an extending box. This means that it is a regular size but the sleeve inside can be lowered to show a much longer box image. This idea was probably first used by J W Spear in Bavaria but is releatively uncommon. Indeed, this is the first French game I have seen with this feature.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory

name: Hexenkessel
description:
Objective: Gain as many cards (=witches' brew) as possible
- acting by turns -
flip top 'brew' card:
active player chooses one of the ingredients (sticks) out of the witches' vessel; if it matches you may draw another (if needed); wrong? Place stick(s) back into the vessel, next players turn.
If you finished a brew: keep the card.
Drawing a spell? Turn the vessel at 180°
Game ends after all cards are gone.
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: √Ñntligen reklam!
description:
