Swedish quiz game. (english: "Finally, commercials!"

The questions are linked to different tv commercials, municipality slogans etc.

The game is played by one player drawing a card and reading the question. If the players on the other team(s) answer correctly they get to keep the card. The game ends when the draw pile runs out of cards.

name: The Little Game of Food
description:
This food-themed trivia/party game can be played in two teams or with at least two players.
The object of the game is to win as many cards as possible, by answering questions about food and performing tasks from the activity cards. Each card is worth 1 point. The first player to reach the finish space on the board wins the game.

Activity cards come in two types: "Picture Memo" and "Mashed Letters". "Picture Memo" means the active player has to memorize the picture on the card. After 30 seconds, the player on the left makes up a question about the picture, which the active player has to answer. In the "Mashed Letters" activity, there are three words on the card, with their letters jumbled. The active player has to guess the words while the timer is running.
categories: Memory, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Golden Trivia Cards: M*A*S*H Edition
description:
Contains 216 Trivia Cards. These are the same cards as found in Golden Trivia Game: M*A*S*H Edition.

Draw card, roll the dice for question and the first who answer correctly gets the card.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Korean War, Medical, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: UK (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
Another British/Ireland map for Ticket to Ride game made by Wiebke Lüdemann (Illustration) and Stefan Grunhold (Strategy).

The board which is 70 x 80 cm in size, connects United Kingdom with the rest of Europe (e.g. Amsterdam in The Netherlands as well as Bergen and Stavanger in Norway, Helgoland in Germany, etc.).

1. In addition to the original Ticket to Ride Europe this map contains routes which are 7 waggons in length - scoring 18 points.

2. The design and illustration is truly unique and awesome. The ferry routes are multi-colored (instead of having the original's grey color / locomotive symbol on it). Due to the integration of some "overseas"-destinations, a lot of ferries are available. The same is true for tunnels, which are indicated by rounded boxes. Here, I was missing the clearer tunnel borders from the original, but it is not a big disadvantage. The tickets look wonderful - long and short routes are clearly distinguishable. A lot of love, energy and enthusiam has been put into the illustration. Congratulations.

3. The scoring track is a great novelty as it uses railroad tracks in the background which looks really nice.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Holland Express (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description: Ticket to Ride: Holland Express an another fan-produced map of The Netherlands. The map is produced by Sybarite and looks marvelous.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Trains, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Solidarity: El juego de la ayuda humanitaria
description:
Solidarity: El juego de la ayuda humanitaria

Educational game. The players are in the role of ONGD's that try to help with projects around the World to erradicate the poverty and help development in the Third World.

In the process, they also have to answer questions about Geography, international solidarity, discoveries and miscelanea.

Game mechanics: A roll-and-move trivia game. The players roll a die and move around the mapboard, having to answer questions, confront unexpected events and getting the necessary money during the process to do the projects. The first player to complete a determined number of projects wins the game.

name: Logico
description:
Logico is a memory-style game for young children, which helps them learn about the logical sequence of events.

The game consists of sets of 3 illustrated tiles depicting sequences of 3 events. Example: Event 1 is a car starting a race, Event 2 is a car winning a race, and Event 3 is a car getting a trophy for winning the race.

All the Event 1 tiles are distributed among the players. All Event 2 tiles are put face down in one pile, and all Event 3 tiles are put face down in another pile. Players take turns picking tiles and trying to match them to one of the Event tiles they already have. The first player to complete all their sequences is the winner.

name: Rockit Science
description:
Rockit Science is a game with a steam punk meets the energy industry flavor that was commissioned by XTO Energy to hand out as a holiday gift for its employes.

The concept is simple, just draw a card and move accordingly and try to be the first player to reach the end of the path. The game is functionally equivalent to Candy Land.

name: Policajti
description:
Ever wondered how life is at the police station? Definitely do not expect a large bureaucracy, you'd better get ready diaphragm! As a target for criminal bullet as a torture device laughter ...
To play, you will need:
Two six-sided dice
Pencil and paper for counting points
Matches or coins to progress cards and inserted them into action
Try out what it's like to be a true guardian of the law. Learn to use service weapons to fight criminals, starting with hooligans and thieves, through repulsive deviants, to the rough and dangerous mafia assassins. You collect royalty, grant and fulfill orders. And the best is awarded the title police president!

Each player starts with four random cards. Then you prepare pencil and paper which is for tracking current status of policemen level; very level means more cards during turn. At each turn, players have a total of three events. Usually, they will all revolve around playing cards. The most important thing in the entire game cards are interventions and arrest that brings gamers the most points to policemen. To do this you need set of card and support of a partner or have necessary equipment (body armor, torch etc.).
Includes: 108 playing cards, rules, ranks, police summary


Zajímá vás, jak vypadá ≈æivot na policejní stanici? Rozhodnƒõ neƒçekejte velkou ú≈ôedniƒçinu, radƒõji si p≈ôipravte bránice! Jako terƒç pro zloƒçineckou kulku, i jako muƒçící nástroj smíchu...
Ke h≈ôe budete pot≈ôebovat:
Dvƒõ šestistƒõnné kostky
Tu≈æku a papír na poƒçítání bod≈Ø
Zápalky nebo mince na rozpracované karty a do nich vlo≈æené akce


Vyzkoušíte si, jaké to je, být opravdovým strá≈æcem zákona. Nauƒçíte se pou≈æívat slu≈æební zbranƒõ, bojovat s kriminálními ≈æivly, poƒçínaje chuligány a zlodƒõjíƒçky, p≈ôes odpudivé devianty, a≈æ po drsné mafiány a nebezpeƒçné vrahy. Budete sbírat hodnosti, udílet i plnit rozkazy. A ten nejlepší získá titul polecejní prezident!
Obsahuje: 108 herních karet, pravidla, hodnosti, policejní p≈ôehled
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Kannst Du Rechnen?
description:
A game for 3 to 6 year olds, helping them with their counting skills.

There are 24 monkey cards with a maths sum on them and 24 cards with different numbers of bananas on them. Three games are described but all really relate to recognising the correct banana tile to go with the correct sum (E.g. Monkey card says 3 + 2 so the tile with 5 bananas is the correct match.

The games include a Memory game (instead of matching like tiles you match the sum to the correct banana tile, played just like Memory.

name: Chasing Rabbits Card Game
description:
Chasing Rabbits, The Card Game is a trick-taking style card game where the object is to be the first player to 500 points when playing with 3 or more players or with 2 players the highest score after going through the deck once.

the game is played in rounds where the players play positive "Rabbits" or negative "Rabbit hole" point cards and multiplier "Hutch" cards into a communal hand, until a "Chasing Rabbits" card is played to claim the hand. Unless a "Jack Rabbit" trump card is played the player of the "Chasing rabbits" card wins the hand, and then calculates the score. Score is kept on notebook paper (not provided).

Chasing Rabbits is as much fun for adults as kids (ages 7+) and guaranteed to bring out the 'kid' in you.

name: Go For Broke
description:
"Go For Broke" is fast-paced dice game where you can risk it all to get rewards and win! Roll as long as you dare to claim first a 20, then a 50, then a 100 and finally a 200 point card. Pick up "insurance" on the way. But watch out - if you roll Go + For + Broke - you're busted and lose your gains in the current round! All players who earn 200 points face-off in an intense playoff round.

Will you claim victory or will you "Go For Broke?"

name: Hunt and Seek
description:
A "Where's Waldo" type game.

The game comes with several boards, each depicting a scene scattered with various different objects. The objects are hidden within the images so that they mingle with the background, making them hard to spot. One of the boards is chosen for the game.

On each turn, a card is turned face up and players try to spot the object as fast as possible. The first one to do so wins the card. The winner is the player who accumulates the most cards.

name: Les Rois du Ring
description:
"Les Rois du Ring" is a card-driven miniature game with a boxing theme that was dreamed (literally) by french amateur designer "Chien Sauvage", and that he posted about on his blog. It is played on a 5x5 grid, with two miniatures and a deck of normal playing cards, with 1-8 as the main deck, and 16 cards used as hit points (8 each). Player take turn playing cards to move and attack each other on a "ring". They can interrupt each others turn to dodge or parry attacks.

A few variants exist that were released as creative commons
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Grid Movement

name: Das Weinquiz
description: Where is the term "spumante" used? What is included in the "Frankfurter Dreigestirn" ("Frankfurt Triumvirate"]? What does it mean to "destem" grapes? In Das Weinquiz, wine lovers can show their competence and learn even more things worth knowing about wine.

name: Wer kennt Frankfurt?
description:
"Who knows Frankfurt - The Original City Quiz"

Do You know Yor city or region? With over 500 questions about Frankfurt.

The Quizmaster draws a card and asks a question. Plyayers bets correct answer with A/B/C/D-cards face-down or use their joker card. Correct answer scores points and player may continue answering. Wrong answer eliminates player from the session.
Game last until there are no players or the session is over.

Player with the most points is the winner.

name: The New Zealand Investment Game
description:
The New Zealand Investment Game is an exciting strategic board game designed by highly respected investement writer, Frank Newman. It is an invaluable educational tool for both students and serious investors who are keen to flex their business muscles, without actually risking their own money! Invest in the sharemarket, buy property, invest in the money market, trade derivatives, opt into Kiwisaver or build a career. You choose your own strategy.

The unique software that accompanies the game simulates the investment markets, records all transactions, and provides end of game financial reports. All the paperwork is done for you, which frees you up to focus on the serious business of investing.

Real market data and thousands of investment scenarios so no two games are the same
Interactive tips and investment advice from Frank Newman
Online update for the latest game versions and market updates
At the end of the game each player receives a personalised report about their investment decisions.

Contains: game board, playing dice, playing pieces, game CD (includes rules and strategy).

Minimum system requirements: Windows 98/2000/XP/Vista or later, 128MB RAM, 233MHz processor, 50MB disc space, internet connection to obtain access key and download updates.

name: Hexeto
description:
Players place the hexagon-tiles with six colors on the table scoring points for each correct adjacent edge and substracting points for each incorrect edge.
Player with the most points wins if there are no hex-tiles left.
Multiple game-variants available.

name: Kotanook
description: Come discover Kotanook forest during deer migration, when predators and prey take on a gruesome battle to survive. One by one, become each of the wild's most legendary animals, such as a grizzly bear, a wolf or a cougar. The "Kotanook" board game is a unique reproduction of a wild environment, where two opponents take turns combining attacks and evasions. Each player leads a small group of animals, each of them with its own specific qualities (speed, strength and dexterity) in order to collect the highest number of points and become master of their territory. A stimulating board game where chance and strategy meet the instincts of the most ferocious beasts!
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Shark Cards
description:
From the back of the box:
Take a deep breath and dive into fascinating shark-themed card games like Shark's Tooth Rummy, Sink or Swim, and Wild Wobbegong. Want to know which sharks are nocturnal? Which can leap out of the water? Which is known as "white death"? This fact-filled deck turns the world of sharks into games for your brain.

User Summary:
Shark cards are similar to a standard set of playing cards except each of the 4 suits contains 12 cards (rather than 13). Each of the 12 cards contains a picture of a shark and a description.

There are also 12 Challenge Cards that ask players to look for Sharks with particular characteristics.

The game has rules for 5 different games:
Deep Dive (Similar to Go Fish)
Sink or Swim (Similar to Concentration)
Shark's Tooth Rummy (Similar to Gin Rummy)
Wild Wobbegong (Similar to Crazy Eights)
Food Chain (Similar to Solitaire)

name: Bingo Pocket Cards: Spa√ü mit englischer Grammatik
description:
Simple quiz format card game. Distribute the cards amongst the players. Then take turns asking each other questions from the first card. The cards have numerous questions on them, with the answers on the back.

Rules are not clear about how many questions are asked per card. I would suggest just one. If the correct answer is given, the answering player takes the card.

The game proceeds for as long as you want to play or until a pre-set target of correct answers is reached. The player (or team) with the most cards, wins.

The cards all relate to fairly simple English grammar questions.

name: Irrv√§gar
description:
User summary

A tile-laying game for 2 players. The game consists of square tiles with blue and red stripes on them. Players take turns placing the tiles so that they match, and the goal of the game is to get, in your colour, a stripe loof that covers 5 or more tiles.

name: Silent But Deadly
description:
In Silent But Deadly, there are 10 different types of fart cards in four various colors. Each fart card has a description of the fart card, like "Fluffy Poot", "Eggy Stinker", and "Floating Biscuits". Players discard a card in his/her hand by matching a fart type or by matching the color of the card played. The goal of the game is for a player to discard all of his/her cards.

Additional 'special play' cards include, "Light a Match", "Baked Beans", "Cabbage", and "Silent But Deadly". The Light a Match card negates these three specialty cards:
--Cabbage card requires a player to the left to pick up 1 card.
--Baked Beans requires the pick up of 2 cards.
--Silent But Deadly requires picking up 5 cards.

When a player is down to one card, he/she must announce, "low on gas" before the next player discards, else he/she is penalized and must draw 2 cards.

name: Math Dice Powers Practice Edition
description:
In this game layers roll the two 12-sided target
dice and calculate the target number by using the blue die as the base and the red die as the exponent. Then roll the three 6-sided scoring dice and combine their numbers using mathematical operations to match, or come closest to, the target Number.

name: Mini Torpedo Game
description:
Cheap and cheerful game featuring a plastic board with a 'gun' in two corners. Each player takes 3 balls and 2 ships and sets up his ships in the notches for FLAG SHIP and 2nd SHIP as shown on the box. Then each player takes 3 torpedoes (ball-bearings) for his gun.

Each player places a ball inside his torpedo as shown on the box. He moves the torpedo to the right or left to aim the shot in the desired direction and then presses the trigger to release the ball.

Each player, in turn, gets to shoot three times, trying to knock down the ships of his opponent. Knocking over a FLAG SHIP scores 30 points, knocking over the 2nd SHIP scores 10 points. The player with the highest score wins. A perfect score is 40.

name: Nyans
description: Nyans is a game where people are playing in teams. One team member will consider one image out of six that looks nearly the same. Then the other team members will then have to guess which one the other one is thinking on, by him or her with words, gestures and/or pictures describing it, before the one minute timer runs out. If the team answers right they will go forward on the point track. First to the end of the point track is the winner.

name: Tournament Pro Bowling
description:
Statistical game by one of the genre's much acclaimed designer.

Based on a professional ten pin bowling league that was existed at the time in America (maybe it still exists, I don't know).

As usual with these games, dice are thrown and the result cross-checked against various charts and tables. Each match is resolved quickly so a season can be replayed in a relatively short time.

name: Brainwashed
description: Searching for a way to transplant brains we found a new way to have fun. Dare someone to get Brainwashed. Place the Brainwash hat onto your head. Exchange Brain Hand pumps with your opponent, so you are holding the one attached to their hat and they are holding yours. On the count of three start squeezing the Brain Hand Pump using only one hand! Keep pumping the Brain until one of you is Brainwashed! When the brain in fully inflated, this will release the water held in the brain reservoir. The player with the fully inflated brain will be soaked with water. The winner is the first player to fully inflate their opponents brain so that they are Brainwashed!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game, Racing

name: Monopoly: Isle of Man
description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Isle of Man, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Super Six
description:
Card game published as a fund-raiser for a charity that cares for greyhounds after their racing career ends.

This is a game best played with 4 players plus one caller [the caller can be one of the players).
One pack of 52 cards are dealt out with 13 cards to each of the 4 players. The caller also has a deck of cards which is dealt by turning up one card at a time and names the card for all to hear, i.e. Suzie 1, Phoenix 6, Smart Dresser etc.

The player with the card called out places the card from his/her hand face upwards on the table. The caller continues to call out the names of the cards until a player lays down the last card in his/her hand and calls out Super Six.

As the caller calls out the card dealt the card is placed on the table so that a cross-check can be taken for the winning hand.

The cards are a little odd. One would expect only to have greyhound cards but not so, there are Mascot, Trophy, Kennel, and four individual cards that have no category to fit them in. I think the original game must have been more complicated, taking advantage of all these cards but as publication date drew near, the charity probably felt worried about this and cut out all rules except as described above, reducing the game to little more than Lotto.

name: Go Diego Go! Rescue the Animals
description:
Simple card and logic game for kids (4+). Each player receives 6 blue cards at the beginning of the game, placed face-up in front of him. There are 4 animals on each blue card. Every turn, a player draws an orange card from a common deck. There are two animals on each orange card, with or without a big red "X" on them. All players then try to discard blue cards based on the conditions of the orange card.

If the two animals on the orange card are not marked with an X, a player can discard all blue cards featuring both animals. If the two animals on the orange card are marked with an X, a player can discard all blue cards not featuring both animals. If only one of the animals is marked with an X, discarded cards must feature the unmarked animal and exclude the marked animal. If you cannot discard, you must draw another blue card. There are 6 special orange cards that allow only the drawing player to discard.

The first player to get rid of all his blue cards wins, he has saved the animals!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Politics of India
description:
Politics of India' is a strategy based board game with unique but easy to understand game play. 'Politics of India' simulates the Parliament elections of India and gives you a chance to become the best political party in India and make government.

Either you can fight for election on the issues like 'Development', 'Women safety' etc. or you can play dirty politics and use unethical methods such as 'booth capturing', 'bogus voting' or 'bahubali' and try to win maximum number of seats. But when you are using unethical resources, be aware of 'election commission raid' during voting otherwise your candidate will be disqualified.

Game theme -

The game is for 2 to 4 players. As a player, you are one of the national political party of India and this is the election time. Your goal is to win maximum number of seats in India by using any way, be it money, ethical or unethical way and form the government at the center.

Game Play -

Each player gets 1 party card, 15 candidate cards after shuffling, 3 resource cards after shuffling and 15 crore( 150 million) Rupees to each player and start the game. There are two stages of game. In the first stage, there are 15 rounds. In these rounds player has to manage resources and money is a way that they can utilize it maximum and puts most number of candidates. Once the 1st stage is over, voting starts by opening voting cards and playing the dice for each seat of all states.

Finally, the person who wins maximum number of seats, takes the game and form the government.

The game consists of following cards and material -

1. Candidate Cards – There are total 60 candidate cards. Each candidate card consists of the name of the candidate and a numerical value. This numerical value decides the worth of the candidate, the higher the better. Each player gets 15 candidate cards at the beginning of the game.

2. Resource Cards – There are total 50 resources cards. Resources cards contains various issues for which a candidate fight for the election. Each resource card has one of the issue, such as Development, Employment, Free Electricity, Women Safety, River Water issue, Seperate state and more. Along with these issues there are some unethical cards, such as Booth Capturing, Voting list scam, candidate kidnapping and more. These cards, when used, can increase the chances of winning the election, but they can get a candidate withdrawn, if election commission raids on that state or seat.

Along with the issue, each resource card also has a numerical value on it. This numerical value adds up to the candidate value when put together with candidate and increases the chances of winning.

Resource cards are stacked with the candidate with closed face, not visible to any other player. Resource card is opened during the voting, in the second stage.

3. Voting Cards – There are total 12 voting cards. Each voting card has 6 rules written over it, which corresponds to the number a player gets on the dice during the voting. Player has to perform the task it get on the voting card. Voting cards eventually decides the winner on each seat.

4. 6 face Dice - 1
5. Party Name cards – 4

name: Insurgence
description:
Insurgence is an assymetric PnP two-player game that pits brave rebels against an evil empire in a futuristic capital. Or maybe it's a benevolent empire against cruel terrorists - the victor will decide.

The game is played on a 3x3 grid of tiles that make up the districts of the capital. Both players use action cards to move pawns around the districts, but they each have very different goals.

The rebels use hidden rebel cells and their rebel leader to fulfil plots by doing sabotage, making assasinations, and spreading propaganda throughout the districts. If the rebel player fulfils two out of three plots, he/she wins the game. But the rebels also work on causing uprising in the districts. This allows riots to spread from the slums towards the imperial palace. If that happens, the rebels also win.

The empire player, meanwhile, try to either uncover the plots by sorrounding cells with armies and revealing them, or to capture the rebel leader by clever use of both armies and the secret police. If the empire player uncovers all three plots or captures the leader, he/she wins.

In order to win you have to plan carefully while still being able to adapt to an unlucky draw of action cards. But most of all you'll have to both outwit and outbluff your opponent.
categories: Bluffing, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Enclosure, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Terrasauria
description: In this educative game, the objective is to conquer the most continents on the game board by using your collection of dinosaur tiles. The dinosaurs compete using five characteristics: weight, size, agility, ferocity and the period of their appearance on Earth. This game is not only a trivia about 120 dinosaurs, but players also need to demonstrate a keen tactical sense.

name: Shuriken
description:
Shuriken is a board game of ninja combat for 2-5 players. Custom dice, a modular game board, 100 game cards and 250 plastic ninja figures bring fast-paced ninja warfare to the gaming table

Shuriken takes place over the course of ten rounds, each round representing one hour of the night. Each player takes control of a unique ninja Clan and 50 plastic ninja representing unarmed, sword, shuriken, and master ninja. During the game players place, move, and upgrade their ninja forces as they attempt to complete Mission Cards and capture as many enemy ninja as possible.

The game is won by the player with the most victory points at the end of the game. Victory points are earned by capturing enemy ninja, and by completing Mission Cards.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Byzantine Captain's Mistress
description:
This is a game playable on a Byzantine Chessboard (16 round and 4 wide) using Checkers. The game is similar to regular Captain's Mistress (Connect Four), but players control which side of the board pieces enter (and how pieces will follow when entered). In the game, players try to get 4 in a row, vertically, horizontally or diagonally, with a set queuing order for pieces entering a column.

Included is a variant where pieces get recycled, by forming 4 in a row, and winning by preventing their opponent from also doing this.

name: Power Rangers Super Samurai vs. Nighlok
description:
From the publisher:

The Power Rangers work together to defeat Nighloks! Race around the game board collect the Power Disk. When you land on a Sensor Gap, the battle begins. Sometimes you fight alone, other times other Rangers will join in to help you. Roll the battle die and see if you can have the Power Disc that can be used against the Nighlok. The Mooger will try to keep you from winning while Gold Ranger spaces will send you to another location on the game board. Be the Ranger who deals the final blow in Mega Mode to win the game!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gettysburg: The Valley Of Death
description: In celebration of the 150th anniversary of the battle of Gettysburg, Gordon & Hague proudly presents The Valley Of Death board game. This game depicts the 2nd day’s fighting action where Robert E. Lee launches an attack just south town… in an effort to flank the Union Army and take the high ground. The Valley Of Death board game allows players to recreate the strategic and tactical engagement of what many consider to be the most infamous battle of the American Civil War! This game features a massive 3.5' x 4' fully mounted battlefield that was been historically recreated and accurately scaled using period maps and Google Satellite images. Players will enjoy the attention to detail that has been put into this new game launch, as they test their war gaming skills to see if they can change the course of history!

name: Arcane Duels
description:
In Arcane Duels the players are wizards fighting each other using their spells while at the same time they try to complete an arcane ritual.

Each player has 2 actions per turn to gather energy, cast spells and complete one part of the ritual, then the next player takes his turn. The game goes on until all but one wizards are eliminated from the game (by reducing their hitpoints to zero) or until one ritual has been completed (in this case the player who contributed the most to all the rituals in play wins the game).

The catch of this game is that each wizard with all his abilities and spells is represented by a single card which will be rotated after each time that wizards has used a spell, giving him/her new options for his next action(s).
mechanics: Action Points, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Breakthrough
description:
Breakthrough is played on a 5x9 board. Each player has ten pieces which start in the rows nearest them. The object is to get a piece to the row farthest away from you. On a turn a piece can move any distance diagonally as long as it does not pass over any piece or land on an opponent's piece.

The fourth and seventh rows of the board are "wall" rows, and pieces which reach the opposing wall cannot move forward. The only way to get a piece across the wall (necessary to win) is via explosion. Each space has a maximum capacity (depending on which column it is in), and when you get that many of your pieces in a space it explodes, sending the pieces to orthogonally adjacent spaces. Opposing pieces can be captured this way, and chain reactions can occur.

name: Ravensburger Spiele Minis: Dosenwerfen
description:
"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

The game comes with 12 can cards (numbered 1-12) and 2 dice. Each player receives 6 can cards, which they display forming a pyramid. On their turn a player must throw both dice and verify if the other player has that can. If they do they obtain the card. The game will end when one of the pyramids is empty.

name: Yamato 2199 Game: Chapter 6 ‚Äì Sie Kommen
description:
Operational level wargame based on Japanese animation series Space Battleship Yamato 2199.

One player controls Terran's space battleship Yamato and the other player controls the Dommel fleet of Gamilas Empire. The Dommel fleet has various organization at random.

Each turn, players determine initiative. If initiative roll is tied then some event occurs. The initiative players take turn managing movement and combat.

The Gamilas player wins when they sink the Yamato after the capture the Yurisha Iscandar event occurs. The Terran player wins when they prevent the Gamilas player from doing so.

The game includes a rulebook, a game map, and 50 die-cut counters.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: All Hands!
description:
All Hands! ... Nim variant for 2-4 players played with 16 pawns, game board and 'lifeboat'.

Ducosim, the Dutch game association, publishes the game magazine Spel! with 'Spel! enkaarten' (game cards) i.e. games which fit on A5 cards.

All Hands! is Card #0011 and was included with Spel! on 16th March 2013.

The object is, not to be the last tar left on deck as, you will go down with the ship!

Sixteen salty sailors (pawns) are lined up on deck (on the dots on the board) and, in turn, players remove adjacent pawns and place them safe at sea in the lifeboat.

The player to remove the last pawn loses.

name: Spordim√§ng: Mina ‚Äì Sina  ‚Äì Meie
description:
Trivia game about sports, athletics and Olympics.

Roll the custom color dice and choose one of the two color deck to draw a card. Some decks need knowledge, some need co-operation with other players, some need creativity.
Ansqer the question or solve the puzzle and advance with your game-piece.
The player who finishes first is the winner.

name: Knightcap
description:
Knightcap is played by two players (light and dark) on an 8x8 chess-like board with 63 horses of the same color. Both player can use every horse as long as that horse can jump to an empty field in a chess-like manner. The piece jumped over is captured.
The dark player only captures pieces on dark fields, the light player only those on light fields. Multiple captures in a single turn are possible.

A single point is scored for every horse captured over the amount of 30. First player to reach 10 points wins. Several rounds may be played to reach the goal.
publishers: Club TreEmme, Ducosim, √ñsterreichisches Spiele Museum e.V.

name: √çslandss√∂guspili√∞
description:
Íslandssöguspilið is at it's base a roll & move game, with some cards that help you affect other players, by slowing them down or moving their pawns back.

From the back of the box:
An exciting race through Icelandic history. Take part in a race through Icelandic history from the Age of Settlement to the current era. Learn about the persons and events that have shaped the country and it's people.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Noodle Speedoodle
description: Grab a noodle, draw a doodle! Use your noodle to speedily doodle in the quick-draw party game Noodle Speedoodle. You've got 30 seconds to draw a picture and get the other players to guess what it is. The trick is that you've got to include a noodle in your doodle. Spin the spinner to determine the style of play, pick a noodle, pick a card and choose a word to draw, flip the timer and draw! Guess correctly and everyone wins!

name: Abra Palabra
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Divided up into two teams, players in Abra Palabra have to try to guess the right word or concept in as few words as possible. The fewer words it takes to explain the concept, the more points you get for the right answer. The team with the most points wins.

name: Urknall: Supernova
description:
Translated from the German text on the publisher's website:

The expansion contains a rulebook and a single game piece.

The Supernova adds extra uncertainty to the game. If a star becomes a supernova the possession ratios are lost and it is played again.

Counting the supernova: at end of the game every possession marker gets you as many points as elements of the same color are present. It is not about possession ratio. Every possession marker counts.

name: Pioneers
description:
Pioneers is a thematic card game inspired by the old video game Oregon Trail. You play as a pioneer crossing the United States in the 1830's. You gather supplies, play action cards, and encounter events that can help you along, or hinder your travels. The goal is to get to the west coast first by spending resources to travel to cities. You will be collecting supply cards, surviving events, and interacting with other players.

Gameplay: Every player starts the game with a party leader card that grants special abilities along with 3 party members. If all 3 party members die, you lose and the game continues. In the center of the table are destination decks that every player is trying to travel to. To travel to a destination, you spend the required resources shown, acquire the card, and move on to the next destination. The player that gets the set of 2 rivers, and 3 cities, ends the game and wins after a final round if no other players collect all their destinations. Your party size is used as a tiebreaker if needed.
Each player turn consists of drawing cards, playing actions (on themselves or other players), traveling to a destination, and discarding cards.
categories: Adventure, American West, Card Game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Das grosse Autorennspiel
description:
Objective: be the first reaching space 100
- moving by turns/use 2 dice -
Simple 'Roll and Move' game; ending on a marked space follow instructions glued into the lid

Notes:
Due to confusing background advertising game is also listed as
'Das grosse Autorennen': inside the lid you can find a third title: 'Die Kurve'; likely published during 1950's

name: Papegaaien
description:
Papegaaien is a party game where all competitors answer questions simultaneously and get points whenever more than one player gives the same answer.

One round goes as follows:
- a player draws a card containing 7 questions on a subject. These questions usually read: "Name a x that has attribute y"
- the player reads the questions one by one, each time awaiting the other players answers.
- the other players answer the questions out loud. Each time 2 or more players give the same answer at the same moment, those players score a point. The question asking player judges the simultaneous-ness of the answers.

A session exists of 6 rounds, and in each round each player asks questions once. In the end the player with the most points wins.

name: Tangram Duett
description:
Tangram Duett is a competitive game of tangrams, utilizing fifty puzzle cards and up to 4 sets of tans, each including two big triangles, one mid-size triangle, two small triangles, a parallelogram and a small square, all of which can be assembled in a square.

A scoring system is provided based on the difficulty of each puzzle card, to allow for matches or tournaments to be played.

This is not to be confused with Tangoes, which comes in a case of patented design and has a different selection of puzzle cards and rules.

name: WuXing
description:
Players must exhibit their mastery of the five elements in WuXing by trying to match the master in just the right way.

Each player starts with a hand of cards, with each card showing a hand; each finger of the hand shows one of the five elements on the tip. At the start of a round, someone flips over a card to represent the master's power. Each player then searches her hand for a card that matches the master's card on exactly three fingers — that is, elements on exactly two fingers have been swapped. If only one player finds such a card, she scores both her card and the master's; if more than one player has such a card, then you need to find an element on another player's card that's on the same finger on your card, with whoever does this first claiming all of the cards played.

The game ends when someone runs out of cards in hand, then whoever has collected the most cards wins.

name: Qube: 80's ‚Äì Viile√§ 80-luku
description:
Trivia game about the 1980s. Has 500 different questions in 5 categories and is small enough to carry with you when traveling.

Players are dealt a handful of category cards, and on their turn they may play one of them and try to answer a question from that category. If they answer correctly, they may discard that card; otherwise, it's returned to their hand. The first one to get rid of all his cards is the winner.

name: Stormy Weather
description:
Stormy Weather is two player game about two mad scientists competing to win a gardening trophy, using a series of increasingly powerful weather machines. Play takes place on a 3x5 board, where each square has one of five types of weather. Players take on the identity (and abilities) of one of the mad scientists.

Players use their weather machines to move or create weather, with the aim of getting good weather to their side of the board or giving bad weather to their opponents. These can range from the humble remote control cloud to the gargantuan Noahmatic or the planetary realigner. Each machine can normally be used once per round, so the sequencing of play is important. At the end of each turn, sun and rain help gardens to grow, while heatwave and lightning cause them to wither and die.

The final action of the game comes from the play of a 'taunt' card, which contains a special, hidden move and an associated threat to yell at your opponent.

The player with the most flowers at the end of the game will be the winner.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Timeline: 60 ans de t√©l√©vision √† la RTBF
description:
Timeline: 60 ans de télévision à la RTBF is a card game played using 110 cards. Each card depicts an event in the history of the Belgian television, with the year in which that event occurred on only one side. Players take turns placing a card from their hand in a row on the table. After placing the card, the player reveals the date on it. If the card was placed correctly with the date in chronological order with all other cards on the table, the card stays in place; otherwise the card is removed from play and the player takes another card from the deck.

The first player to get rid of all his cards by placing them correctly wins. If multiple players go out in the same round, then everyone else is eliminated from play and each of those players are dealt one more card for another round of play. If only one player has no cards after a bonus round, he wins; otherwise play continues until a single player goes out.

Timeline: 60 ans de télévision à la RTBF can be combined with any other title in the Timeline series.

name: Squabbles
description:
The object of the game is to gain the highest score by the end of the game. Each player forms their own interlocking crossword game on a table surface and works independently. Players may arrange (an re-arrange) the positions of their letter tiles as often as they need to complete words. All ties have a face value which, along with a few other special rules, is what scores at the end of the game.

During the game, when a player has used all their tiles, they yell grab and all players must grab another tile to add to their crossword. If a Bad Boy tile is grabbed, play pauses and the player reveals the top card of the Bad Boy deck and resolves it. It could be gain 10 points, swap places with another player or get rid of the word zoo if you have it.

Play continues in this manner until all tiles have been used. Then the scores on the tiles are added up, all 8 letter words get a bonus 10 points, and any bonus points are scored.

name: Jumble
description:
Based on the popular Jumble: That Scrambled Word Game, found in many daily newspapers and online.

110 letter cards with 3 included game instructions:

Jumble 3-4-5 (2-6 players) to create as many 3,4,5 letter words,
Jumble Word Meld (2-6 players) to score most points creating and stealing words,
Jumble Solitaire (1-2 players) similar to regular solitaire, but with words.


Printed by United States Playing Card Company, Bicycle branded.
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: Wanted
description: In Wanted, you take on the role of an Outlaw or a Sheriff rolling dice to get the best poker hands to buy the items on the table. When the last card is drawn you find out if you are a wanted criminal or promoted to the town sheriff. Once you know who you are you must sell, negotiate, trade, and make favors to get rid of the items you don’t need before the timer runs out and you're stuck on the wrong side of the law.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Pannemann: Das Ruhrgebiets-Schimpfwortspiel
description:
Memory-style game to build Ruhr-area-German swearwords out of pairs. Just for the fun of learning or revisiting Ruhr-area dialect words.

The game plays like memory (unlike memory you don't keep matching pairs - put them back on the table, again). One word is the first half of the full word, one the second (1:1 match). To avoid unclarities, the matching parts have the same color - wrong combinations result in funny new creations, adding to the fun.The cards contain also an explanation what the resulting words actually mean (for those that did not know the word before).

It's mainly a fun party game leading to discussions about local dialects, but the one finding most (new) matching pairs is the winner.

name: Twenty One
description:
A Scrabble-like game and board that uses number counters instead of letter tiles. The object of the game is to score as many rows of figures that add up to 21. Players take turns placing counters from their personal sets, of which they have three in hand.

Scoring does not begin until the fourth round, to allow numbers to build up on the board. During the initial three rounds players may not place a counter if the total in a straight line in any direction would exceed 21.

From the fourth round on, players aim to place counters so that they complete lines adding up to 21. The basic score for a line adding up to 21 is 5 points, but 10 points can be scored by placing the counter on a square that matches the colour of your own pieces, or more by placing the counter on squares marked 15, 20 or 30, scoring that many points respectively.

When a line adding up to 21 is scored, the counter that was last placed is turned face down. No counters may be placed adjacent to such a counter, except for the counter with a star, which counts as 21 in its own right.

The game ends when one player has used all his counters on no player is able to play.

The player with the highest score is the winner.

name: Hungry Dragon: Amazon Edition
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Fight a dragon. Steal treasure. Don’t get eaten. The dragon hunter’s creed.

Heroes have tracked a dragon back to its lair. Now they battle the beast while snatching up treasures. They can steal the good stuff from one another while the fight goes on. All the while the dragon fights back swallowing heroes and treasures that slowly move towards the beast’s fiery stomach.

Hungry Dragon is a 54 card deck fighting/stealing game that includes character, weapon, treasure, and dragon part cards. Players control the dragon or a team of four heroes. The heroes move in close to fight, hang back a little to snatch treasure, or stay safe out of range of the dragon’s claws. Each turn players get a free move and may make one action. Their chance of success is based on how much noise they make. Make a roar and the roll is okay. Brag about how well you do and the chance of succeeding is great. Prepare to make some noise, this is a boisterous game.

Once the dragon is dead (or escapes) the player with the most valuable treasure wins!

The Amazon and Pirate versions of the game add together to form a single bigger game.

name: Neues Post und Reisespiel
description:
Objective: be the first reaching space 100
- moving by turns -
Roll the die and move forward. If you land on one of the special (large) spaces follow instructions printed on the board.

Note:
Likely published early 1910's
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: San Guo Sha: Trial Edition
description:
Like the San Guo Sha: Beginner's Edition, but
- you don't have to cut the cards yourself,
- Lu Bu and Zhang Liao are changed back to the Standard version,, and
- a pair of jokers is included so that you can again play poker games.

Card size shrinks a little to bridge size (88*55 mm) instead of 88*62 mm.


Legends of the Three Kingdoms (a.k.a. San Guo Sha) is a card game based off the Chinese classical novel, Romance of the Three Kingdoms, which shares many rules with Bang!, the differences are as follows:
1. The Monarch (Sheriff) may get an additional skill related to their kingdom allegiance; players routinely have two powers.
2. Weapons may have their own additional powers.
3. A card to let a player borrow a weapon from another.
4. A card to cancel the effect of other cards.
5. Peach (Beer) may be played by any player when someone loses their last life; there is no exemption of using Peach when there are only 2 players left.
6. The game proceeds counter-clockwise.

name: Save the Pie
description:
Tibbar and friends want to surprise their friend Beary wtih his favorite berry pie.
So it's off to the Pie Maker.Will they get there in time? They better hurry if they are going to get the berries to the pie maker before Beary eats them all. Everyone wins when all 5 of Beary's friends get their berries to the Pie Maker!

Roll the die and perform the action shown on the Action Board to move Tibbar and Friends along the game board. Act fast though! Beary's hourglass is always running. Don't let him catch you!

Work together with the other players to get all five characters to the Pie Maker to win the game!

Features

Collaboration
Action- Based Strategy
Fine Motor Skills
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monster Mix-Up
description:
Mix it up or match it up and be the first to build a monster and race to the finish.

Object of the game is to be the first player to return home after building a complete monster (all four monster parts from the same or different monsters).

The youngest player starts the game by rolling the die and moving that number of spaces. Player can move in any direction around the board or use the arrows to guide them. If a player lands on a monster space, she draws a monster card from the draw pile and places it face up in front of her. If a player lands on a Mix-Up space, she can trade one card with another player. If a player land on Home space, she can return to the Monster Mix-up home space in the center of the board. If a player land on a Put 1 Back space, she must return one of her monster cards to the middle of the draw pile. Players continue to move around the board, collecting monster cards to build their monsters. Once a player has a complete monster, she races back to the Monster Mix-Up home space.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Flaskespil
description:
The game is for 2-4 players. Each have 8 bottles and the winner is the one who get rid of his/her bottles fastest.

The game board have eight spaces for each players bottles plus five spaces in the middle.
The players roll the die by turn and do as following:
Roll 1-5 - The player move his/her bottle to the numbered space in the middle.
If there is already a bottle on this space the player takes this into his/her own box.
Roll 6: The player removes the bottle from the game - one down!

For each time you can either place a bottle in the middle or roll a 6 to remove a bottle completly, you can choose to roll again.
Each player have to have at least one roll per turn.

name: Bake the Cake!
description:
In Bake the Cake!, the players both cooperate and compete to bake the best cake. Players score by buying ingredients, preparing parts and baking cakes. Although the cakes belong to specific players, the players may freely use each others' ingredients and parts to bake them. All players participating in a cake will score but only when it is completed and only if the cake wins the final contest.

Bake the Cake! is not about baking your own cake first but rather contribute most to the winning cake. To stop other players, you may take the ingredients they want, use the kitchen tools they need and even eat their ingredients (but not too many or you will get a stomache ache).

The gameplay is quick and intensive as the players fight to get hold of the ingredients and the tools, not unlike what it would be in a real kitchen with too many bakers. Behind the playful theme hides a tactical game where each player must play her cards well to spread her colors to all cakes and at the same get as many other players to them as possible. Please don't try the game recipes at home and don't eat the winning cake!

Game meachanisms include:

Economy: The players use ingredients and tools to accomplish their objective.
Interdependence: The players compete about the same resources but may also earn points for each other.
Take that: Players may interfere each other by blocking tools or eating ingredients.
Balanced victory condition: To win, a player must ensure that other players score as well.
categories: Children's Game, Industry / Manufacturing, Print & Play

name: Setsis
description: A word game, in Catalan, with just 7 syllable dice and 1 numerical die. A player rolls the dice and all players write down the longest word with the syllables shown on the dice (each die can be used just once). After a fixed time all players receive as many points as syllables their respective words while the rolling player receives that many points multiplied by the value of the numerical die. Then the turn passes to the next player. Once all players have rolled one or two times, the player with most points is the winner.

name: Bop It!  Bounce
description:
Bop it! meets the rubber ball/paddle game but with electronic voice commands.

Looks like a funnel with a trampoline over the big opening. You try to bounce a ball in the air off that trampoline to score points.



From the box:Obey the commands! Hit it quick hit it high! Can you keep up? Compete against your friends in a bounce-off & see if YOU can hit the all-time high score!

6 slammin' skill games!

Max Bounce

You only have 30 seconds to bounce your fastest!

Infinite Bounce

Keep it bouncing 'til you can bounce no more!

Hang Time

Catch as much air as you can in 5 bounces!

Right Height

The game calls the shots - hit it high or hit it low!

Little-Middle-Big

Hit it high... hit it low! Then hit it in the middle!

Free Form

Bounce it free style - that's any way you like!

name: Qetchup Card Game
description:
Each player is dealt 8 cards and the remaining card are placed on the desk face-down to form a draw pile.
The first player picks up a card from the draw pile and determines if it helps him in constructing his "meal" with the cards that he has, he then keeps the card and discards one...
A meal is formed with 5 food cards: veggie + fruit + "protein" or meat card + juice or "drink" card + bread or "carb" card.

After a player discards, play moves to the next person going clockwise...

While constructing a meal, the player can substitute one card with the Q card. However, a veggie card can't be substituted as veggies make integral part of a healthy meal :)

Once you've constructed a meal, put the meal on the desk for everyone to see. If you've used a Q card to substitute a food card (let's say your meal doesn't have a Fruit card and you've used a Q card to replace it), another player can insert a Fruit card on your meal as process of gradually discarding his cards...

Aside from this function of substitution, Q card can be used: a) to neutralize a junk card that has been used to destroy a meal.
b) with a Q card you can ask (during your turn) another player (whose turn is after you) to show you a random card from the ones that he is holding (you don't get to see the card before picking it) and you can decide 1) to keep the card for you and put your Q card on the discard pile OR 2) you can decide not to take the card from the other player and keep your Q card.

Junk card: the only function of this card is to destroy a healthy meal. There's nothing healthy about junk food. Players can discard this card by using it to destroy someone else's meal. All you need to do is place a junk card next to a meal...
The only way to neutralize a junk card is to put a put a Q card after it...Ex: if you have 3 cards in hand and you've already created a meal, and someone places a junk card on your meal, you can neutralize that junk card by placing a Q card on it (if you have one or are lucky to draw one)

Unlike most other card games, Qetchup doesn't require you to always draw a card and discard one during your turn. While this is certainly an option for an intuitive game play, you can simply discard a card by using one of it's functions. Ex: by placing a junk card to mess up someone's meal OR using a food card to add to a meal where Q card has been used to substitute it( without having to pick another card from the draw pile).

If you have a Restart card, you can use it to make any other player restart their game from scratch by choosing a fresh set of 8 cards (that even if he's constructed a meal | his entire meal and discard pile are then shuffled back in with the existing draw pile to form a new draw pile from which he gets 8 new cards) Restart card goes back in the discard pile.

name: Math Noodlers
description:
Students solve math problems by choosing Write It, Draw It, Show It and Choose It cards

Concepts covered include addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, fractions, decimals, measurement, graphing, money and time.

Answer questions in four different ways!

Choose it!—Choose your answer from multiple choices.
Show it!—Use Noodle-O manipulatives to show your answer.
Write it!—Write out your answer on scratch paper.
Doodle it!—Draw your answer on scratch paper.


Wacky Cards are scattered throughout each category.
Be prepared to sing, hop, act—in other words—get wacky!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Worldcup
description: Worldcup is a simple game of rolling dice for 2 players with theme football. The game board represents a football-field divided into zones with a black number (in favour of the orange player) and zones with a white number (for the red player). Players have to reach their opponent’s goal by throwing 2 dice at once. Starting from the middle they put the ball forward on the opponent’s half as many places as they have thrown. A player may continue during the same turn until the ball lands on a zone with a number in the opponent’s colour. The ball keeps moving to and from until a goal has been scored (reaching no. 45 exactly). Then the other player starts in the middle again.Some zones are yellow-coloured which represent certain events like free kick, penalty or corner with their respective special actions. The player who scored most goals during playing time of 2x15 minutes wins the game. If both players scored an equal amount of goals it is a draw.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Scommettiamo?
description:
Scommettiamo? is a an old game that copies quiz show hosted by a famous Italian TV star. It's a quiz on general knowledge, ranging from science, TV, sports, culture, history, etc.
The purpose of the game is to win as much money as possible by correctly answering to these questions.

name: Unicum
description:
Unicum is all about unique characteristics. Every object, every number, every form has special defining qualities that distinguish it from other concepts. You must identify these qualities and argue that its card deserves to be entered into the "Circle of UNICUMS". In addition to this common task, you also accumulate individual points by correctly estimating the cards and the other players.

Depending on the number of players a number of cards is placed on the table with the theme you want to use face up. Those cards are the candidates that might be selected to become members of the "Circle of UNICUMS".
Players secretly write down 3 of the candidates they think will enter the circle (one as early as possible, two as late as possible).
Then by turn players may nominate one candidate and advance a reason, why this canditate is unique. Other players my support or object this argument.
A candidate can only enter the circle, if a majority of the players agrees.
After a certain number of rounds, players reveal their notes and score points for all cards on their note that made it into the "Circle of UNICUMS" (depending on their position). The player with the highest score wins.

name: Evolutio!
description:
Evolutio! is a cooperative board game for 2-5 persons aged 10+. It aims to develop cooperation skills, understanding and responsibled decision making. Using European funds, players develop various Polish regions. They decide which accumulated raw materials to transfer, and negotiate with each other to determine which sectors require support. At the same time, they need to work together to deal with the game events.

Successful investment in six economic areas (transport, environment, energy, culture, science and health) supported by the Programme 'Infrastructure and Environment', result in changes throughout the country and affect the level of citizen satisfaction. The key to success is the ability for concerted action, strategic planning and making difficult decisions.

Original Polish description:

Evolutio!to kooperacyjna gra planszowa dla 2-5 osób powy≈ºej 10 roku ≈ºycia. Ma ona na celu rozwijanie umiejƒôtno≈õci wspó≈Çpracy, porozumienia i podejmowania odpowiedzialnych decyzji. Gracze, majƒÖc do dyspozycji Fundusze Europejskie, rozwijajƒÖ poszczególne regiony Polski. DecydujƒÖ na co przekazywaƒá zgromadzone surowce, negocjujƒÖ ze sobƒÖ, które sektory wymagajƒÖ wsparcia, a tak≈ºe starajƒÖ siƒô wypracowaƒá wspólne stanowisko, jak poradziƒá sobie z przygotowanymi przez grƒô wydarzeniami. Pomy≈õlne inwestycje w sze≈õciu obszarach gospodarczych tj. transporcie, ≈õrodowisku, energetyce, kulturze, nauce i zdrowiu wspieranych przez Program Infrastruktura i ≈örodowisko, skutkujƒÖ zmianami w ca≈Çym kraju oraz wp≈ÇywajƒÖ na poziom zadowolenia mieszka≈Ñców. Kluczem do sukcesu sƒÖ umiejƒôtno≈õci zgodnego dzia≈Çania, strategicznego planowania i podejmowania trudnych decyzji.

name: Follow The Letter
description:
From the back of the box:

"The classic parlor game is now a board game!"

"From the backseat to the bar stool, follow the letter has always been a popular word game of using the last letter as the first letter in the next response."

"For example, say the category is 'states'. Player 1 says 'New York', player 2 says 'Kansas' (since New York ends in 'k'), player 3 says 'South Dakota' ... then 'Alabama', 'Arkansas' and so on. 'Follow the Letter' and have the last word to win!"

name: Connect 4: My Little Pony
description: My Little Pony Connect 4 is Fun for Every pony! Ponies go "mane to mane" when players race to drop their custom checkers in the grid to try and make a line upwards, sideways or diagonal. The first player to get 4-in-a-row wins! Check out the fun with 3 ways to play! Players can play original Connect 4 and also play by popping out their opponent's checkers to get 4-in-a-row or start with a grid full of checkers and pop out 10 checkers for the win.

name: Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey: Crops Expansion Deck D
description:
From the publisher:

In the ultimate race to build a bunny society on planet Earth, Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey pits players against each other as they struggle to gain Civilization Points, by building cities and increasing their bunny populations. Players gain points by developing their own civilizations or by using zany weapons and hilarious scenarios to destroy their opponents.

The Green deck has a Crops-based theme which also includes fruits, vegetables and marvelous cards such as Transplanted Troop which allows players to steal bunnies and Reversal Of Order which helps dictate the order of card play!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey: Crops Expansion Deck C
description:
From the publisher:

In the ultimate race to build a bunny society on planet Earth, Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey pits players against each other as they struggle to gain Civilization Points, by building cities and increasing their bunny populations. Players gain points by developing their own civilizations or by using zany weapons and hilarious scenarios to destroy their opponents.

The Green deck has a Crops-based theme which also includes fruits, vegetables and marvelous cards such as Transplanted Troop which allows players to steal bunnies and Reversal Of Order which helps dictate the order of card play!
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey: Land Expansion Deck C
description:
From the publisher:

In the ultimate race to build a bunny society on planet Earth, Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey pits players against each other as they struggle to gain Civilization Points, by building cities and increasing their bunny populations. Players gain points by developing their own civilizations or by using zany weapons and hilarious scenarios to destroy their opponents.

The Yellow deck has a Land based theme which also includes deserts, forests and remarkable cards such as Crossroads which dictates bunny attacks and Urban Plague which can empty your opponent’s cities immediately!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey: Animals Expansion Deck C
description:
From the publisher:

In the ultimate race to build a bunny society on planet Earth, Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey pits players against each other as they struggle to gain Civilization Points, by building cities and increasing their bunny populations. Players gain points by developing their own civilizations or by using zany weapons and hilarious scenarios to destroy their opponents.

The Orange deck has an Animals based theme which also includes mammals, marsupials and incredible cards such as We Are The World which gives maximum Civ Point rewards for city building and Cruel Mule which can deflect an attack!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey: Energy Expansion Deck C
description:
From the publisher:

In the ultimate race to build a bunny society on planet Earth, Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey pits players against each other as they struggle to gain Civilization Points, by building cities and increasing their bunny populations. Players gain points by developing their own civilizations or by using zany weapons and hilarious scenarios to destroy their opponents.

The Red deck has an Energy based theme which also includes power, invisible forces, and extraordinary cards such as Gone In Twelve Seconds which can destroy a city and Death Delay which allows your bunny to live past its time!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey: Elementals Expansion Deck C
description:
From the publisher:

In the ultimate race to build a bunny society on planet Earth, Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey pits players against each other as they struggle to gain Civilization Points, by building cities and increasing their bunny populations. Players gain points by developing their own civilizations or by using zany weapons and hilarious scenarios to destroy their opponents.

The Violet deck has an Elemental based theme which also includes metals, jewels and amazing cards such as Slow Smelting which causes players to lose their turn and Maybe, Maybe Not which can eliminate an opponent’s attack!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Le Sultan du Feu
description:
Le Sultan du Feu is a solitaire game simulating the campaign of the Egyptian expedition from July 1798 to September 1801 Directoire required by the Directoire and led by General Bonaparte.

In this game, a map in two parts (2xA3) is the historical area of this campaign: the Upper and Lower Egypt, Palestine and Syria, from the Mediterranean to the Red Sea. 1 cm is about 25km and 1 round of game three months in real time.

A game is played in 10 rounds, the time you have to conquer Egypt and face your enemies, Mamelukes, Turks and English who oppose you vehemently.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Geen Paniek! Turbo
description:
Do you dare to battle with your opponents?

Take a card and secretly choose a question to challenge the other players. How many answers will they find? Will they choose 1, 2 or 3 tokens? Is he sure or is he bluffing?

You have 3 seconds to answer. The other players can use their black cat to make it even more challenging and forcing you to find more answers!

name: Panic: War of the Khan Succession
description:
In fighting off the Western Xia, Genghis Khan died a sudden illness. The golden head of the family had not time to establish a successor to the empire. Now each surviving prince ranked himself heir to the empire. When word of the Khan's death spread throughout Eurasia, the princes went to war to establish their worthiness.

Play Introduction:
1. Place the map on the center of the table.
2. Separate the 4 different region cards and shuffle the each stack, then place each stack on the corresponding position on the map.
3. Mix troops in their draw bag.
4. Prepare an discard area.
5. Each player takes a corresponding color screen and 10 tokens, and then randomly takes six troops card from the bag, and places behind their screen as the starting Standby Force

The game takes place over several battles. The first player to win a battle to earns the first player token (the Scarecrow).
In order, the players choose cards from the four regions where the battle will take place. Each battle takes place in player sequence, and takes place in 3 stages. After the 3rd stage of the battle is complete, a new region card is turned over, and play continues until a victor is declared.

Victory conditions:
In a 4-player game, if a player occupies 3 areas the game is over immediately, and the player wins the game; in a 2-3 player game, if a player occupies the four areas the game is over immediately, the player wins the game

name: Family Trip
description:
Vacation (noun) - a period of time that a person spends away from home, school, or business usually in order to relax.
Trip (noun) - a journey to a place.
They say that once you have kids, you no longer get to take vacations, you just take trips. Going from point A to point B. But year after year we try to prove them wrong.

Object of the game
Players compete in several areas (Photos, distance travelled, and memories) to have the best trip possible. They have to balance this against fulfilling their kids needs, and trying not to fall asleep from exhaustion!

Last Christmas I designed a game for a gift exchange with my wife's family about how "fun" vacations turn into "trips" once you add children.

This is the game, and now I'm releasing it as a print and play for you guys to enjoy!

Go here to download it!
http://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/111273/family-trip

name: Quickstep
description:
Quick Step is a smart amusement game full of surprises for 2 or 4 people. Luck is not determining because it depends very much on where to best move your stone. Each game of QUICK STEP is exciting and full of new contingencies to which you must respond tactically smart and clever.

Quick Step is, as the name implies, a fast, quick lively game that invites to play several games in a row to determine the overall winner.

Setup Quick Step:
With 2 players, each player gets four double-sided pieces (green/red) and builds a tower with it. One player puts all the green sides face up and the other player puts all the red sides up. The towers are then placed in the big starting circle marked with red and green.
With 4 players, the blue/yellow pieces are used also. Setup is the same, but blue and yellow start at the other big circle, playing then in the other direction.

Playing Quick Step:
Roll the Dice. Move one piece that shows your color. If you land on an empty space, turn your piece face down (now the color of your opponent is visible!). If you land on any other piece(s), don't turn your pice face down. All pieces under your piece are now blocked and cannot move until you move your piece away. If you roll a "6", don't turn your piece face dawn, even if you land on an empty space.
It may happen that your color is not visible when it is your turn. Then you just skip your turn. The situation on the board may change and then you can play again.
To reach the end of the track, you have to roll exactly the needed number and you don't turn your piece face down then.

The winner is the person who moves one piece directly into the ending circle.

—description from the back of the box (translated)

The players start at the starting position of their color. Movement is determined by a die. The first player to get one of his playing tokens to the end of the track wins the game. At the roll of a 1,2,3,4 or 5, if a token lands on a free space, it is turned over to it's other color and belongs to the opposite player. If a token lands on an occupied space, it is put onto the first token without being flipped over. Only the upper token in a stack may move. If a token reaches the finish, it is not flipped over.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cards for the Masses
description: Cards for the Masses is a hilarious, thought provoking, and creative game of questions and wacky mixed up answers. Choose and call out a question, select from your hand of 3 cards, an answer you think will be the most popular.

name: Fantastic Four
description:
Publisher's Description:

Find the Fantastic Four! You want the Fantastic Four team--Mr. Fantastic, Human Torch, Invisible Woman, and The Thing--to go on an exploration mission with you. You must reach them all before you can fly away with them. But Dr. Doom, Mole Man, and Annihilus are out there to prevent you from carrying out your plan. However, you can count on Silver Surfer to give you a helping hand.

Fantastic Four was published as part of the Marvel Comics Super Heroes Game Book, and the board is a double-page spread of the book which is laid flat to play.

Each player starts with four markers and rolls two dice (or in this case presses the "electronic die" twice), multiplying the numbers. They then place a marker on a space that displays the resulting number. If another marker is already on the space, the marker must be placed on another matching space. If the square has instructions, the player follows those instructions. If the player lands on a space with a villain, their marker is stuck there until all other markers are placed. A Silver Surfer space allows the player to move the marker to any space. The first player to place one marker on each member of the Fantastic Four wins.

name: Memory Game at the Friendly Farm
description:
A new king of memory game, educational and more fun to play than conventional games, sure to please the youngest to the oldest players! Two ways to play for twice as much fun: combine identical pairs of picture discs or trios of discs identified with pictograms.

With this two-for-one game, children will learn about the Friendly Farmer's daily activities and develop their visual memory while establishing a foundation for reading and learning a second language.

Note: Discs illustrating activities contain no text, giving children free rein to their imagination and creativity.

From the back of the box:

Jeu de mémoire.

Un jeu de mémoire nouveau genre, plus amusant et éducatif que les jeux traditionnels, qui plaira aux tout-petits et aux plus grands! Deux façons de jouer pour deux fois plus de plaisir: en jumelant des paires de pastilles identiques ou en associant des trios identifiés par des pictogrammes.

name: PBL ROBOTS: Gold Base Robot
description: A kickstarter exklusive golden base robot. Was sent too all backers months before the game was published.

name: 101 Dalmatians: The game based on the film
description:
Cruella, the cruel fashion designer holds many little Dalamatian puppies hostage in Hell Hall to make their pretty coats into elegants furs. She did not, however, reckon with Pongo, Perdy, Fogey and Sergeant Tips. These four are on their way to release the puppies. Teh player who can release the most puppies from Hell Hall and bring them home has won the game.

Three routes are going to Hell Hall, where you can find the puppies. Choose the short one, and test your luck. Cruella may hide here often and takes the puppies away. On the long one, your odds are better and you may find a soot chip to mask your puppies. The last route goes over the river and you face the chance to hit the water, losing your puppies to Cruella again!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Give the Dog a Bone
description:
Short print run dexterity and dice game from Waddingtons. Players pull back and release Barney the dog to propel him around a track looking to uncover a number of bones buried at points along the track by the players as determined by a die roll.

Play continues until all 40 bones have been uncovered, the player with the most wins.

name: Monopoly: Kinder √úberraschung
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μœåνος (alone or single) + polein πωλε·øñν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Kinder Überraschung, a brand from Ferrero.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Winning Moves Germany, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: VIVA!„Ç≥„Ç≥„Éé„ÉÉ„ÉÑ (Viva! Coconots)
description:
The monkey players in Viva! Coconots want to grab coconuts from the field, with those coconuts ideally lying in a straight line.

To set up the game, place the "Las-nut" card in the center of a 3x3 grid, then shuffle the other coconut cards and lay eight of them in the surrounding spaces of the grid, removing any unused cards from the game. The coconut cards have powers on them that come into effect when that card is active during the game.

The game lasts nine rounds.
