Each player has a deck of monkey cards numbered 1-10, and to start play, they each shuffle their deck, lay two cards at random face down in the front of them (looking at them whenever they like), then take a hand of three cards. In a round, the players look at the coconut card for this round (as indicated on the Las-nut card), choose a monkey card in hand, then reveal them simultaneously. If two or more players lay down the same card, they're out for the round. After taking into account the coconut's power, whoever played the highest card wins the round and places a token on the card.

The Las-nut card is claimed in the final round, with whoever has the highest total in the two cards set aside claiming it. (These cards can possibly be swapped during play.)

If a player has ever placed three tokens in a line on the grid, that player wins immediately. If this doesn't happen, whoever has placed the most tokens (with the Las-nut counting as two) wins.

name: Rolltennis
description:
Objective: gain penalties - as little as possible - by flipping a rotor through a gate

Build up a gate on a table - flanked by a skittle and a backstop on each side. Use a curved needle to flip the rotor through the gate to opponent's side - avoid to hit a skittle/backstop; otherwise collect a penalty and try again. First player gaining 20 penalties has lost the game.

Note:
This game was invented in Germany before the Second World War. Based on the tools/materials used, one of the possible German publishers before WWII could be Edwin Mieg oPH (Mieg).

name: Loco Lingo Building Site
description: The popular learning game in a small format. This game from our "Loco Lingo" series is all about building sites. There is a story, a riddle, a poem, and this time there is also a little dice game! For 1-6 players and a reader. Please note: This game can be played without the other games in the Ratz Fatz series. For ages 3-12.

name: Pics & Circumstance
description:
Pics & Circumstance©
Tom & Pete Games

Once, long ago, there was a glorious leader who faced many challenging circumstances. Fortunately, the glorious leader had a council of wise and creative advisers who would help him to understand various things about these circumstances. Some advisers would provide examples of the circumstances; other advisers would explain the cause of the circumstances, and others still would offer solutions to the different circumstances. Prepare yourself for such trials and tribulations, for you will have to be creative and clever if you wish to be declared the best adviser ever!

Game Contents
170 picture cards
30 circumstance cards

Objective:
Each round, one player will judge the advice offered by the other players and decide whose advice was the best. The player whose advice is chosen the most by the end of the game is the winner.

Game Setup
1. First decide which game you will be using (i.e. game A, B, or C).
2. Divide the cards into one stack of circumstance cards and one or more stack(s) of picture cards.
3. Each player draws 10 picture cards to form his or her playing hand. Players are allowed to look through their hand, but should keep their cards hidden from the prying eyes of the other advisers.
4. The player who is closest to the age of 18 becomes the first judge.

Turn Sequence
1. The judge flips over a circumstance card and reads aloud the circumstance for the appropriate game (e.g. “Our Glorious Leader demands that his laundry be softer.”)
2. Each of the other advisers plays one picture card from his or her hand and explains how it relates to the circumstance. (e.g. “We shall use this mighty chainsaw to inspire the imperial clothes washers into improving their job performance.”)
3. The judge selects the card/explanation that he or she likes the best.
4. The winning adviser keeps that circumstance card as a victory point.
5. The picture cards that were just played are discarded and players draw back up to a hand of 10 picture cards (Note: circumstance cards do count against the hand limit and do not need to be held.) If the deck of picture cards runs out, discarded cards can be reshuffled to form a new deck.
6. The adviser to the left of the judge becomes the new judge, draws a new circumstance card, reads it aloud, and so on and so forth.
7. The game ends after the last circumstance is resolved. The player with the most victory points is declared the best adviser ever! (All of the loser advisors should then sing a song commemorating the greatness of the winning advisor.)

Game Play Variations
Suggestion Box: Players place their cards face down in front of the judge. After all players have done so, the Judge shuffles them, reveals them, and decides which of them is the winner without any further input from the advisers. This style prevents people from playing favorites.

Bards against Humanity: Incorporate the picture cards into your other party style games to allow for more flexibility in play.

Become Famous: Post your own variants on the Pics & Circumstance website under the Officially Unofficial Variants section.

For More Information
Please visit us at Facebook.com/PicsAndCircumstance
© Copyright 2015 Tom & Pete Games, LLC all rights reserved.

name: Tiny Robots
description:
Competition at robot building factory begins! But the pieces are all around, and you need to find the best parts before anyone else does. Will you be the best builder and figure out a way to win, and get the title of Robot Builder Master?

Tiny Robots is a memory- and puzzle game, where players take turns building their robots from pieces available. All pieces represents different robotic parts available for building. Pieces are arranged to gaming area with circuit side up. This way all players can see pieces available, and look for their next piece to take. On the hidden side are robotic parts. Parts include heads, legs, wheels, arms, canisters, cameras etc. But parts also have different colors and Technical points added to them. When building a robot, players try to arrange their circuit sides into as whole circuitry as possible.

Players can do 4 things during their turn, in any order they want:

Pick a piece from the table and add it to their pile.
Turn 3 pieces around from the table
Remove one piece from their pile.
Declare your robot as ready.


Players can look at the robotic side from their own pieces at any times. After players are done with their turn, player order goes clockwise. After players have at least 3 pieces arranged the way they want, they can declare their robot completed. When a robot is completed, it is then given points. Points are calculated from amount of pieces used, unified colors of robotic parts, complexity points and deduction of points from any mistakes on circuitry side.

Game consists of 125 gaming pieces, and players can choose game length with 25, 50, 75, 100 or full amount of 125 pieces. Regular game lasts until either all the pieces are taken or players don't want any piece. Goal of the game is to get more points than other players when the game ends.
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Bots Battleground
description:
A cards war game featuring the innovative Boogie Dice, in which players gang up to attack a single defender.

Each turn, a player claps their hand. The Boogie Dice, which is sound activated, either remains still, or starts bouncing around. If it does - you must defend against the other players.

Each players has a hand of cards, and each card is a bot with different attributes, so you must strategize well in order to be the ultimate winner of the battleground!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Dice, Electronic, Fighting, Negotiation, Real-time, Science Fiction
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Brunost, langrenn og lusekofte
description:
An entertaining game on how to behave like a "typical Norwegian".


When you are abroad do you boast of Norwegian pop groups that you really do not like?
Do you think a stranger must be crazy for asking to sit beside you when there are other vacant seats on the bus?
Have you ever turned over to Swedish television when Norway beats Sweden in cross country skiing, just to hear the Swedish television commentators?


If you answer "yes" to any of these questions, you have very good chances succeeding in this game.

Brunost, Langrenn and Lusekofte (Brown cheese, cross country and "cardigan") is a wonderful entertaining game, where you get or lose points depending on how typically Norwegian you behave (for better or worse...) The game is a perfect gift and a festive way to get to know both yourself and your friends. Perfect for a party, a dinner party or a barbecue evening. Enjoy!

name: Wertvolle Sch√§tze
description: Wertvolle Schätze (Precious Treasures) is a tile laying game, presenting 20 treasures named in the Bible. Numbered tiles are drawn from a bag. On your turn, you place one tile or change one for a new one from the bag. To make a discovery, place the L-shaped tiles around a treasure, matching the numbers and placing black and white numbers alternating. The player who places the fourth, last tile around a treasure gets it. Whoever gets five treasures first, wins.

name: Winds of Fortune
description:
Two players command ingenious fleets, bold captains, & fantastic monsters in an attempt to outmaneuver their opponent and destroy their flagship!

Winds of Fortune is an epic adventure of naval strategy for 2 players! Games generally last between 45-60 minutes. Players each take control of powerful fleets of awesome ships and vicious monsters in an attempt to outmaneuver their opponents’ fleet and destroy their flagship to secure victory. The game comes with 2 prebuilt faction decks as well as enough extra cards to build your own custom decks.

My goal in designing Winds of Fortune was to create a card game that really felt like you were commanding a fleet of ships on the high seas. By creating a maneuverability mechanic unlike any other card game, positioning your cards properly is of the utmost importance just like real naval battles. With the added ability to create your own decks and customize your own flagship, you can also take full advantage of infinite strategies.

--from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Hello Kitty Fia-spel
description:
Be the first player to move all your four pieces around the board and into the middle, where the Ferris wheel is. This game uses the basic ludo rules but with some graphical modifications. For example, instead of a die this game uses a spinner.

You are allowed to move out one of your pieces onto the board if you get a sun when you spin the spinner. If you land on the same square as an opponent, that player's piece is moved back to its starting position.

name: Scandalous: The Naughty Drawing Game
description:
From the publisher:

If Cards Against Humanity and Pictionary had a baby it would be Scandalous. This is basically a drawing game where you have a card with a word on it - like Whisker Biscuit. The defitition for Whisker Biscuit is written underneath, and you need to get your team to say "Whisker Biscuit." That's it- it's very simple, and very funny. Cards are assigned a point value of 1-3 based on how difficult we've judged it to draw, and game ends at 20 points.

name: Masters of the Heist
description:
The year is 1919. America is in its golden age of grift. Clever thievery has moved from shell games and three-card monte to a more mature art form: the heist.

In this head-to-head match, you must compete to hire a team of professional criminals, plan heists on unsuspecting marks, and muscle out your opponent to earn money. It's all about return on investment and knowing your opponent. The player with the most money at the end wins.

The game plays in a series of 5-7 rounds, each round with three phases: The Purchase, The Plan, and The Heist.

THE PURCHASE: Spend Wisely.
Hire crew members to pull your heists. We've got Grifters, Partners, Insiders, Thieves, Muscle, Getaway Cars, and Cops on the Payroll. Spend wisely.

THE PLAN: Choose Carefully.
Plan your heists by by secretly sorting your crew cards in your hand. Place your crew face-down when ready. Choose wisely.

THE HEIST: Plans unfold.
Plans are put in motion that cannot be changed! You attempt your planned heists, but if you run into your opponent you must rely on your best muscle to save you.

-- publisher website --
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Publish or Perish
description:
Set up you own sub-particle laboratory! Experiment with the most fundamental particles! Make sure you are one step ahead the other scientists! Publish your research to secure your findings! Perishing is not an option if you aim to write your name alongside the best scientists in history!

Publish or Perish is a deduction game for young scientists in which you want to find out the secret properties of each particle, collect the data, and accumulate your knowledge. But be sure to publish it before any of the other competitors do, or you might just miss the chance of winning.

Thanks to the app (and your mobile device) all secrets stay secret, and handling crucial information is both easy and intuitive. Not to mention the holograms in your hands! The augmented reality enhanced app allows you to see and enjoy experiments to the fullest!

Note: We worked hard to make sure that the science behind the game is accurate. We cooperated with scientists and consulted on all of the content.

name: Wissens-Quiz f√ºr Kinder
description: Quiz game for children from 6 to 10 years. The Players try to answer questions in each of the 8 categories. The catagory is choosen by a simplified Trivial Pursuit game board.

name: Word Shuffle
description: Word Shuffle is a spelling game, but one that can be played in English, French and Spanish. Words are scored based on letter value and the use of wild cards, and words from all three languages can be played simultaneously.

name: Monster High: Share or Scare Game
description:
From the box cover:

Grab your ghoul-friends for a fang-tastic game of truth or dare! On your turn, spin the spinner to see your fate...Spin Share and you'll reveal your spookiest secrets, monstrous crushes, and all the stuff that makes you eerily unique...try to guess each others' answers to score! Spin Scare and beware! You'll do one of a hundred challenges so fierce and funny they'll have you in stitches! It's a spook-a-rific race to get 13 points to win the game! Monster High Share or Scare-so fun, it's scary!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Polite Murder
description:
You count yourself amongst the best murderers in Victorian England. You must dispatch of your opponents one-by-one using various methods of villainy and vileness, but, be careful, for your fellow compatriots of evil deeds also want you dead and The All Seeing Eye of the Law diligently looks into the ominous shadows of the night.

During game play, players play action cards from their hand in which they may either do the action on the card or sometimes attempt murder on their fellow players by rolling the die.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: The Award Winning Game
description:
The Award Winning Game plunges you into the hellish underbelly of the advertising industry… where clients have horns, deadlines are always an hour away and showing a little cleavage wins you accounts.

From humble beginnings, you and your friends will run your own ad agencies, working (and sabotaging) your way up to hiring the world’s most pretentious creatives, and winning accounts from famous brands… only to throw them away for the shot at winning awards.

Because, y’know, who needs clients when you’ve got prestige?

name: Randomonium
description: The game of random thinking! What crazy ideas fly out of your mouth when you're trying to make connections under pressure? Whatever they are. Randomonium will keep you and your friends laughing. Try to make as many connection between tiles as you can before the timer runs out. On your turn you have 20 seconds to link the words on your tiles to the tiles already played. You can be creative as you like, but your fellow players will decide if you play counts or not. Fast-paced and perfect for a crowd, Randomonium will put a smile on your face. Free association has never been so much fun!

name: Egypt (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.


This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the "cities", each with a value to be earned by visiting that "city". These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, though there are limited selective options for these.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: X-Mas 2004 (fan expansion for Ophidian 2350)
description:
Ophidian 2350 CCG X-Mas (2004) was the second print and play expansion set for Ophidian 2350 CCG and the first fully created using fan submissions.

The expansion consists in 9 Ophidian Christmas based cards:

1 Level 1-2 Brand New Gladiator Card
1 Level 3-4 Brand New Gladiator Card
5 Brand new Minions Cards
1 Quick-Hit Card
1 Pump Card
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck Construction, Player Elimination

name: Black Stories: Promostory "Gruseliges Casting"
description:
This is a promotional Game: Black Stories given out for free at the publisher's booth at SPIEL Essen 2015. It will be contained in the upcoming Black Stories Scary Music Edition.

Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddle stories. The players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident, piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.

The promo story can be played on its own, without any actual Black Stories edition.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: The Story Telling Game
description: Once upon a time there was someone who loved telling stories... well if you know that someone, then they'll be a winner at playing The Story Telling Game! Whether they tell tall, short, fairy or scary stories, this fast-paced game will be a best-seller for children aged six upwards who have a vivid imagination, a competitive streak and are quick thinking. The Story Telling Game is a great birthday and Christmas gift and it not only encourages creativity, but it will keep children entertained on rainy days and school holidays. Created for budding Jackanorys, The Story Telling Game sees each player start with five words on their cards and when the clock starts, the first players starts telling a story using one of their words. Then it's the turn of the next player who has to incorporate one of their words into the former player's story... and so it goes on with each player adding to the story with one of their words at a time until the buzzer declares that it's 'The End' for the player who's talking when the buzzer sounds. When this happens, the player has to pick up all the cards used by the other players and begin a new story, this time with the opening 'Twice upon a time'. The story doesn't have to win awards or be a work of literary genius - it can be about anything but has to include one of the words on each of their cards. The Smiley Trump card adds a twist to the game as it can be used as any word and if a player is caught out by the buzzer, the Smiley Trump means they get off scot-free and the next player has to collect all the cards.

name: Peer Review
description:
Peer Review is a science simulation. The active players draw cards with subjects and hold a short lecture on their research of that subject. The other players are the peers and have to criticize the lecture on the grounds of desiderata cards. If a majority of other players rejects the research, it's the next player's turn; if the research is commendable, the lecturer receives new merit and desiderata cards.

The goal of the game is to hold most merit cards after a predetermined time - prizes, scholarships, tenures, etc.

The game contains German and English cards, but is aimed at players who master both. Additional use of Greek or at least Latin is recommended.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Humor, Negotiation, Party Game

name: Mana War
description:
Mana War is an original card game created with the spirit of simplicity, inclusion, and creativity in mind. There are 50 cards in the game (5 suits: Sun, Water, Fire, Rock, and Leaf; 10 of each). There are no numbers or values to the cards, no text to read or instructions to follow on the cards themselves. In fact, the games are so simple, the rules for the 4 included games each fit on a single card.

Winning one of the Mana War games ranges from completing a grid of cards with unique rows and columns by yourself to a team effort of wit and luck to bluffing your way to be the sole winner in a cut-throat battle of memory and strategy.

The main goal of Mana War was to create games which are so simple to learn, a small child or a drunk person could pick it up easily. This was achieved by having incredibly simple game components and designing game rules which challenge players to think logically while only needing to remember basic colors/shapes.

name: Healthy Helpings
description:
From the publisher:
Be the first to fill your plate with a balanced meal! Follow the USDA’s MyPlate guidelines. Food cards have real-life photos and are self-checking (the back of the photo matches the food group it belongs in)

Includes:

50 food cards
4 placemats
1 spinner
Activity guide


Learning Style: Visual

Skill development:
Self-Help- Provides a visual tool to help students understand portion control according to the five food groups when filling their plate at meal time.

Social & Behavioral- Real-life photo cards help students learn to make nutritional choices when having a snack or making a meal based on the five food groups.

Basic Concepts- Promotes identification of the 5 food groups- fruits, vegetables, grains, protein and dairy. By learning the food groups, students are creating building blocks for maintaining a healthy diet.

How to play:

Spin the spinner to select a food group.
Pick a food card that matches the group.
The first player with a complete, balanced MyPlate wins!

name: BattleBo
description:
A game based off the Roshambo (rock, paper, scissors) game, whereby two opponents compete to capture each others base piece.

Each turn, the players compete using rock-paper-scissors, with the winner being allowed to make a move - placing or upgrading a piece, or attacking with a piece. The player that captures his opponent's castle wins the game.

name: Speedy Race: Disney Cars
description:
It's a fast-paced race with Lightning McQueen and his friends. Bring your favorite heroes at the finish line first and win the thrilling race!
But be careful, several obstacles are awaiting you during the route, before the winner can roll to the finish.

Each player chooses a pawn and places it in square one.
In your turn, place Lightning McQueen at the center of the action platform and press it flat. Look
as it turns, and in what hole he randomly ends.
Each of the 9 holes has a different action\power that you have to perform.
The first player to cross the finish line wins.

name: Super Dungeon Explore: Crown Guard
description:
The Crown Guard warband represents the doughty men and women who join their local village militias, town watches, or regional military. Devoted to combined arms and defense, the Crown Guard can protect weaker monsters around them, shielding them from attacks. Occasionally, the Crown Guard are even forced to maintain the peace against rambunctious Heroes, or—in more dire situations—turn to the service of the Dark Consul. While orcs are ferocious, they are not unintelligent, and the Crook-Eye Tracker has recognized the threat of the Dark Consul, lending his considerable survival and hunting skills to the good of the land.

CONTENTS:
Crook-Eye Tracker Hero Model
Royal Knight Mini-Boss Model
14 Crown Guard Monster Models: 2 Watchtower Spawning Points, 2 Sergeant-at-Arms, 4 Longbowmen, 4 Swordsmen, 4 Pikemen
Game Cards: Hero, Classic Monsters, Arcade Monsters, Treasure Card
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Castle Assault: Sir Mitchell Greencastle Promo Card
description:
Promo Card for Castle Assault.

Epic Neutral Unit
Cost: 3
Stats: 2, 4, 0, 1
Ranged Linear (1-6)
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Monopoly: Florida Edition
description: A variation on the classic monopoly board. The pieces are all the same as classic Monopoly, however the names of the properties are places and businesses around the Sunshine State - Florida.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Minoqaur
description:
An Adventure Puzzle Game for QR Codes. This is a single-player game that uses a set of rules built around movement within QR codes. You are an adventurer in a maze and must escape with the treasure while avoiding the minoqaur.

You enter the maze at the open spaces next to the corner-squares on the QR code. A sword, a key, and a cloak are drawn in each of those corner squares. A treasure is placed in the smaller square on the lower-right. The minoquar starts in the exact center.

Your goal is to get to the treasure and then escape (either via one of the entrances, or using the key) without encountering the minoquar. In each turn, you will move or tunnel, then the minoquar will move or tunnel towards you. Movement is tracked by drawing straight lines through the white corridors of the QR code maze. Walls are represented as black lines and must be avoided or tunneled through.

name: Best of Music
description:
Compete with your family or friends to see who has the biggest musical culture of yesterday and today.

Nostalgia and laughter guaranteed ! Young and old have their chance with nearly 1600 questions. Answer the questions of the cards and try to recognize visual album covers, complete an unforgettable words or recognize who owns accessories from famous ...

And without realizing it, you will sing on tubes that have marked you.

2-6 players or teams of players.

name: Star Wars: Battle Matching
description: Licensed Star Wars movie game that contains 32 picture tiles, 4 battle coins and instructions. It is a matching memory game that when you make a match you can launch an attack by flipping your token to determine the winner. Collect the most matching pairs to win.

name: Het wijnspel
description:
Trivia game with 280 questions about wine. Contents:
56 quizcards
4 winecards
1 die

The goal of the game is collecting 8 grapes for the winecard by correctly answering wine-themed questions. A small element of chance is added by the die: On a roll of 1-2 the player gets a multiple choice question (which rewards 1 grape), on 3-5 an open question (which rewards 2 grapes). The player's turn is lost on a roll of 6 or a wrong answer.

name: SJUFT
description:
This game has a subtitle :"Everyone's friend, is nobody's friend" and that is very appropriate and descriptive !

SJUFT is a classic board game where players have a number of pieces, that they have to try to bring from their base and into the center of the board.

To reach the targets and thus have the chance to win the game , you however have to work together with the other players. If you do not help, or receive help from the others in the game - You are not going anywhere in this game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game

name: UNO: Cinderella
description: Cinderella themed version of standard UNO. One Exclusive Glass Slipper card.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Vip Vap
description: Small dexterity game for children available (among other small toy prices) to loyal customers at GuldBageren - a Danish chain of bakeries. The game consists of a small cloth pouch containing: a wooden hemisphere (5.5 cm in diameter); a d6 die with sides in six different colors; six small painted wooden blocks of different shape, size, and color. The colors of the small blocks correspond to the sides of the die. Rules are printed on the pouch. On turn, a player rolls the die and then has to place the small block of the corresponding color on the wooden hemisphere. If the increasingly loaded hemisphere tilts such that the small blocks drop off, the player lose the game.

name: A Curious Deck for Extraordinary Liars
description:
This is the first of a series of games based on some simple rules... Here's the description from the back of the box:

A Curious Deck for Extraordinary Liars contains 56 peculiar cards depicting surreal and unintentionally hilarious Victorian art from ads and postcards dated 1880-1910.

Instructions for play:
The first player takes a card from the deck. The card holder may choose to describe what they see on the card or lie about what is on the card. It's up to the other players to determine whether the card holder is lying or telling the truth. Players are permitted to ask questions.

When all players have guessed Lie or Truth, the card holder announces the correct answer and reveals the card.

The player to the left then takes a new card from the deck and continues the game.

Players who guess correctly get 1 point.

The first player to 10 points wins.

name: N√©cropole
description:
Nécropole is a boardgame designed for 2 to 6 players, and can be played in several mode (teams, competitive or versus a game master).

Each player take control of up to 3 undead heroes. They can be vampires, necromancers or ghosts.
Each hero is chosen amongst three classes: sorcerer ‚òÖ, warrior ‚åΩ or assassin ‚òæ.

Classes will have great impact within attack phases during fights. They will give your heroes dedicated abilities (all unique).

‚åΩ Warriors master "talent" to dominate the battlefield.
‚òÖ Sorcerers are spell casters, specialized in control and area effect damages.
‚òæ Assassins use their skills to make surgical strikes against their preys.

Abilities and legendary artifacts are won by exploring the various Necropole's districts and accomplishing epic quests.
You can also attack your opponents and go into the slummy areas to trade souls for gear.

Possibilities are endless to fulfill your objectives and win the game.

As each card is unique, each game is unique too.

Now is your turn to master the Necropole, city of the dead.

Necropole is an epic game of exploration and skirmish fights.
Players will battle against other undeads (controlled by theor opponents or the game master), using cards in their hands and rolling dice.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Fish & Chips
description: Preschool game featuring a fishbowl full of plastic fish, with cardboard chips scattered all around it. On your turn, flip over a chip to see whether you take a new fish from the bowl, steal a fish, or trade fish with another player. The first player to get a fish of each color wins. But when you take a new fish from the bowl you might get the stinky fish -- and have to put one of your own fish back in.

name: Mitt f√∏rste butikkspill
description: Turn the tiles and find the goods on your shopping list. Pay with cash and make sure that you get the right amount of money back. If you can't pay, you have to roll the die to get more money out of the bank. The first player who has bought all the goods on their shopping list, wins the game. The game contains: 12 shopping lists, 36 goods, 33 coins, a die and rules.

name: Splash
description:
Be a fan of one of the colored contestants on the game board! You can also guess who will be the first to swim across the pool first!

On your turn, roll the color die and move the swimmer with the same color one step further. If one of the contestants acrosses the pool the game ends. Who guesses the winner wins also the game.

name: The Grand Duchy of Luxembourg (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of Tourist cardsor the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. You may 'buy' advantage cards. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, though there are limited selective options for these.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: complete 2 tracks in one turn: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: „ÅÇ„Çã„ÅøÁº∂ (AL-Mican)
description:
User summary
„ÅÇ„Çã„ÅøÁº∂ (Arumi Kan) in English would be called Al-Mican. In Japanese, arumikan has two meanings. Arumi Kan means "aluminum can", and Aru Mikan means "oranges there". This game is packed in a metal can. (The game design and artwork was produced by the publisher as a group).

Arumi Kan is a memory game. No further explanation needed. Each turn, you flip two cards, each of which depicts an orange of almost the same shape. You score a point if these two are identical, but it's extremely hard to tell. You will laugh out loud when you find their subtle differences.

When you teach the game to new players, don't explain too much, and enjoy watching how they are surprised. Even children can play this game, and it's a good ice breaker.

This game was featured in a domestic TV program in Japan.

Publisher's summary

name: Tark Laps Taskus
description:
Tark Laps Taskus means "Smart kid in the pocket".
Like in Tark Mees Taskus there is letter in one side of the card but picture on another side of the card instead of category.

Turn around top card and be the first to say something that is on the picture and starting the letter from another card and You get the card as a point. If nobody can´t say anything or there is a tie the card is kept for the next round.
If the deck runs out the player with the most points is the winner.

Other variants included.

name: Tom Turbo: Jagd auf Fritz Fantom
description:
Together with the help of Tom Turbo, the fantastic bike, the players have to prevent 3 capers of Fritz Fantom, greatest opponent of Tom Turbo.
In your turn you may use a Tom Turbo Trick, then you move Fritz one step and, depending on the color of the spot he reached, turn up a purple or green card and implement it. Then you move Tom Turbo to an Agent Chip, reveal it and place it on the other free agent spot. An agent helps to clear a trick spot or to deflect a small crime. When Fritz Fantom reaches the Major Crime spot and you can hinder him, all win together in this cooperative memory game.

name: Saukram
description: Players collect cards by correctly identifying pairs that appear during play. The illustrations on the cards are very similar so spotting the matching cards is not too easy. The winner is the player with the most 'Pork' (cards) at the end.

name: A Game for Good Christians: The Blessings of God ‚Äì A Kinder, Gentler Expansion Deck!
description:
This expansion deck is comprised of Biblical blessings (and curses on other people which, let’s be honest, are blessings). It includes promises such as

The grace of God offering salvation to all people. (Titus 2:11)
God holding your enemies’ heads under the water until the bubbles stop. (Exodus 15:1-12;19), and
All the sex! (Genesis 1:28)
This expansion comes with 54 Cards: 12 Creed & 42 Canon.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Religious

name: Cyprus (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - but there are spanner cards to collect which may help or hinder you.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn extra points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Quiz Casino
description:
A trivia game, where up to 6 players discuss possible answers to trivia questions and place bets on answers (yours and/or others), based on bluffing, strategy, tactics, and one of 4 card modifiers (bet, bluff, double bet, pass). The player with the most chips wins.

Content:
Board
134 question cards (804 questions, 3200 possible answers)
Answer Sheet
6 sets of 4 modifier cards
100 betting chips
2 dice
Instructions
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Strawberry Shortcake Pick-A-Berry Card Game
description:
Here's a delicious game that you can play all by yourself.
In it, you try to match and stack cards with yummy looking berries printed on them.
To win, just match and stack all the cards into one great pile.

Solitaire game of matching berries, numbers of berries and Strawberry Shortcake characters until you either create one pile of (35) cards, and win or can't make any more matches.

name: DEADCERT: London ‚Äì Expansion Pack F
description:
Expansion Pack F contains 60 cards that detail an extra Victim (Gary Young), a new Crime Scene (Empire Cinema) and an additional Time of Death (Monday 11 May 2015).

The Expansion Pack is to be used in conjunction with the main DEADCERT: London - Game Set
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery

name: DEADCERT: London ‚Äì Expansion Pack G
description:
Expansion Pack G contains 60 cards that detail an extra Victim (Vernon Gilmore), a new Crime Scene (Pall Mall Address) and an additional Time of Death (Wednesday 21 January 2015).

The Expansion Pack is to be used in conjunction with the main DEADCERT: London - Game Set
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery

name: DEADCERT: London ‚Äì Expansion Pack H
description:
Expansion Pack H contains 60 cards that detail an extra Victim (Yasmin Owen), a new Crime Scene (Gaucho Restaurant) and an additional Time of Death (Friday 2 January 2015).

The Expansion Pack is to be used in conjunction with the main DEADCERT: London - Game Set
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery

name: The Prince of Pies
description:
A micro-card game played in your hand. You take the role of the Jack, who is out to steal as many pies as he can before the Kings can catch him. Played with a unique deck of 17 cards, you have to use the abilities of your Jack to steal pies and avoid the Kings. If there are ever two Kings in a row, you have been caught! At the end of the game, tally up how many pies you managed to steal.

This game is based on the old poem "The Queen of Hearts".

name: Family Guy: Quagmire Card Pack
description:
Description from the publisher:

Family Guy: Stewie’s Sexy Party Game is in full swing, but there’s still one more guest to invite – Quagmire! Add everyone’s favorite deviant to the game with the Quagmire Card Pack. This 80 card pack adds new, inappropriate word cards to fool around with including some of Quagmire’s favorite people, places, things and phrases.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: HeroClix: The LoneRanger Mini-Game
description:
Bring the fast-paced Western action of The Lone Ranger to your HeroClix collection! This easy mini-game combines Disney’s new film with the most popular pre-painted miniatures tabletop game for exciting gameplay.

Includes everything new and established players need to get started: Lone Ranger and Tonto HeroClix figures, an exclusive fold-out game board, quick-start rule sheet, scenario sheet, 32 bystander tokens, and dice.
categories: Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Frechdachs
description:
The funny games of the Badgers is played two different ways:

Come Let Us Build A Cave!

All players try to build a cave together. If they manage to surround themselves on all sides with bushes, they have won. If the Frechdachs, however, takes 11 shrub game pieces during the game - the badgers cannot build a cave any more - so he is the winner.

The Search For The Pine Cones.

And again the game begins against the Frechdachs. But this time, every badger has to play for himself and try to collect as many pine cones as possible. Whoever has found most pine cones is the winner. You only know this when all the pieces are taken out of the game, and the number of the depicted pine cones is counted on the flipped side. Did you win now? Or was it the Frechdachs again?

This game was a promotional item for the foundation "Wald in Not" (Forest in Need), protecting the remaining forests of West Germany. The back of the box has an endorsement from the foundation president Dr. Bernhard Vogel, and two deutschmarks out of every copy sold was donated to the cause.

name: Paradox Girl: Game Time!
description:
Paradox Girl is a fast-paced and dynamic card game based on the quirky, time-traveling comic book heroine of the same name. With its balanced blend of theme and abstract tactical play, Paradox Girl makes a great "gateway game" for 2 or 4 players, playable in about 20 minutes.

You don't have to know anything about the comic books or their storyline to enjoy or play the game. Paradox Girl combines mechanics like those you might find in Chrononauts, Carcassonne, and Reversi to create a kind of battle-of-wits on an ever-changing board, which offers lots of chess-like tactical thinking in a more social atmosphere. Paradox Girl is streamlined enough to be welcoming and accessible to new gamers and all general audiences, but thought provoking and dynamic enough to engage more experienced and calculating gamers.

The game is played on a 4×4 grid of cards representing possible events along a timeline/continuum. Players represent different manifestations of the same character (since the gag is that Paradox Girl frequently crosses her own timeline and interacts/fights with herself). The object of the game is to score points for yourself or to deny points to your opponents by claiming and locking down event cards on the timeline with your pawns. Unlocked events and their point values are subject to be changed every turn when players "change the future" (deal new cards). Control of individual spaces/cards can be contested through a very light combat mechanic called a "paradox brawl." Players can also accumulate secret bonus points by snagging Waffos (tokens), Paradox Girl's favorite brand of toaster-waffles.
The game is based on characters created by Cayti Bourquin and appearing in "Paradox Girl" by Hanako Games/Hana Comics. Artwork by Yishan Li.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: 13 Survivors
description:
Do you have what it takes to make it out alive?

When an elite group of people boards a spaceship and leaves a doomed earth. The deadly virus they escaped from tags along and threatens the last few of the human race. Your goal is to survive the infection and become the individual with the best prospect for humanity's second chance.

13 Survivors is a micro card game with a constant state of flux. Each card can flip the outcome of the game on its head at any moment. Playing the right card at the right time is crucial for your survival.

The object of the game is finish each round with the best possible card (either high or lowest numbered card). A random card is removed every round, which varies the game-play and makes the outcome harder to predict. It is a game of tactics, mind-reading your opponents and a bit of luck.

The game is played in either 3 rounds (short game) or 7 rounds (long game). On the very first round, the oldest player goes first. On subsequent rounds, the previous round’s winner goes first. On his turn, a player MUST play a card and do its action (unless it's his last and only card, in which case, he passes automatically), after a card’s action is complete, it's discarded to a face-down DISCARD pile. Then it’s the next player’s turn clockwise. The highest-numbered card is normally the best, unless this rule is reversed when the Mathematician card is played.

When all players have only one card left each, they all reveal their cards simultaneously. All and any players with INFECTED cards gain NO points. SURVIVORS win points according to the numbers they end up with, and whether it’s the highest or lowest number that wins the current round (see Mathematician card). Best-result player wins 3 points. Second best-result (if any) wins 2 points. Third best-result (if any) wins 1 point. Fourth survivor (if applicable) wins nothing. After the final round, the player with the most total points wins the game! In case of a tie for the first place, play an additional round.

name: The Vampire, the Elf & the Cthulhu: Edgar Allan Poe
description:
B. - The novel is almost ready, missing only the finale.
J. - Right, it could take place in front of the gates of the Black Land.
H. - Black Land, John? We are in New England!
J. - You are killing the epic poetry Howard, Black Land and a horde of orcs.
B. - I got it! We can set the Novel in Transylvania, it's a classic! And a lot of garlic, everywhere.
H. - We already chose the United States.
B. - Romania or nothing!
J. - Middl ...
DLIN DLON!!
E. - I'm Poe, I solve problems!

This card is kept on the Idea Area and is available to players like other cards, but it can only be activated, not gathered. When a player activates the card, Discussion action starts: the player must propose a new card to substitute a Novel card. All players can join the decision assigning their strength to change it or not.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: South Korea (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.

There are also spanners along some tracks which may help or hinder you. The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - but there are some options in the spanner pack.

Mountain railway excursions and 9 bonuses give you extra points.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn double points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Sunk!
description: Sunk! is a skill and action game in which the task is to add water — one drop at a time — to the cup floating in the water-filled tank without causing it to sink. You're not simply pouring water, though, as the game involves challenge cards as well. Can you pour with only one eye open? What about when you're hopping on one foot?

name: Dazzleship Battleships
description:
Description from the publisher:

This game is based on one of the most unconventional ideas ever to have come out of international warfare – dazzle ships! Inspired by the shock and awe of Cubism and Vorticism, the dazzle ships of the First World War used a striking form of bold camouflage to confuse enemy attackers.

Use this wonderfully oddball idea to confuse your opponent and evade attacks on your fleet with this new version of the ever-popular battleships game. Includes two 64-page map-and-grid books for playing the game and a 16-page booklet explaining the history of the dazzle ships and the artistic inspiration behind them.

name: Odious Blocks
description:
Description from the publisher:

This one is pretty simple… try to keep up.
Stack the blocks up three by three to build a tower.
A player starts by removing a block from the tower and choosing to either answer the truth or do the dare on the block.
After answering the truth/doing the dare, the player stacks the block on the top of the tower. Then the next player goes.
If a player refuses to do the truth or the dare on the block, that’s ok, they can put that one on top of the stack and pick another (note: you can choose to set a limit to the number of times a player may skip before starting the game).
BEFORE STARTING THE GAME you need to decide what the punishment will be for the person who knocks over the tower. We tend to go with spanks.

NOTE: There’s a good chance that a block will get pulled twice in the same game (because you put the blocks back on top after pulling them, genius). When this happens, whoever pulls the block the second time must choose the truth/dare that wasn’t done the first time the block was pulled. Once a block is pulled twice in one game, don’t stack it back on top, just take it out and don’t use it for the rest of the party.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Print & Play, Puzzle

name: Dust Tactics: Steel Guard Tesla Squad ‚Äì "Steel Lightning"
description: The Tesla Squad of the Steel Guard is one of the most feared combat unit on the planet. Nobody ever faced them that wasn’t unchanged after this experience. In combat it uses some of the most powerful infantry weapons known to man and is equipped with the new version of the Steel Guard armor. The squad is presented here in desert colors, as used in the Middle-East, circa 1947.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Dust Tactics: Steel Guard Anti-Tank Squad ‚Äì "Steel Thunderbolt"
description: The Anti-Tank Squad of the Steel Guard is one of the most feared combat unit on the planet. Nobody ever faced them that wasn’t unchanged after this experience. In combat it uses some of the most powerful infantry weapons known to man and is equipped with the new version of the Steel Guard armor. The squad is presented here in desert colors, as used in the Middle-East, circa 1947.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Basher Science Card Game
description:
GAME SYSTEM



This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages.




From the publisher:
"Based on the delightful Basher Science Book Series, Basher Science toys and games show kids that science is fascinating and fun! The Basher Science Card Game is 2 games in 1 — play battle or match with fun science facts! The base game includes 22 colorful cards that teach kids about various topics such as liquid, pollen, and sandstone, from different branches of science, plus a mini-figure and 2 tokens for game play. Basher Science Card Games are available in these science subjects: Rocks & Minerals, Biology, Astronomy, and Chemistry. Collect Basher Science Mini-Figure singles and 3-packs for exclusive game cards with special powers! For ages 6 and up
Features:
• Learning about science is big fun with Basher Science!
• The Basher Science Card Game is 2 games in 1—play battle or match with fun science facts!
• Each character card teaches facts about an aspect of science (such as atom, virus, and supernova) and includes a special power for use during game play
• When you purchase the Basher Science mini-figures, look for exclusive cards that can also be used in the game
• Pack includes 24 colorful cards that teach kids about topics from different branches of science. Also includes a mini-figure and 2 tokens for game play
• Collect the game for each science branch and have a blast as you learn!"

Further details:
The base game is a small box of 22 cards (2 copies of 11 different cards) and a single Shopkins-like figure. There are four base boxes: Biology, Chemistry, Astronomy and Rocks & Minerals. Additionally, there are 3-packs and 1-packs. These come with three or 1 Shopkin-like figures and 2 copies of their associated cards. Each pack is also themed Biology, Chemistry, Astronomy and Rocks & Minerals.

Battle Game:
Before the game starts, each player builds an 8-card deck. Each card has a value between 1 and 8, a name, a small fact, and a game-play ability. Cards from different themes can be mixed. Players draw a hand of three cards from their decks. They then simultaneously choose one and reveal it. The higher number wins the round. Special powers will break rules and make things interesting. The player who first wins 4 rounds (short game) or 6 rounds (long game) wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Game System
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Memory, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Supremacy 2020: Fortuna 2020
description:
From the publisher's site:

This expansion brings the Minor Powers to life. Minors will now trade on the market, build on their own, seize your factories and even invade their neighbors!

Deadly Virus Outbreaks will also appear. Don’t ignore them too long or they may spread into a world wide pandemic that destroys the planet.

Requires Supremacy 2020, and BRIC Minor Powers expansion.

name: Misohitosaji („Éü„ÇΩ„Éí„Éà„Çµ„Ç∏)
description:
User summary
„Éü„ÇΩ„Éí„Éà„Çµ„Ç∏ (Misohitosaji) is a Japanese poetry game, for Tanka poems. Tanka is a short Japanese poem consisting of 5 lines with a structure of 5-7-5-7-7 syllables.

The first edition was given a restaurant theme. The cook is a bear named Goro („Ç¥„É≠„ÉºÔºâ and the waiter is a rabbit named Nanako Ôºà„Éä„Éä„Ç≥Ôºâ. They appear in the second edition, also styled Áü≠Ê≠å„Ç´„Éº„Éâ„Ç≤„Éº„É†„ÄÄ„Éü„ÇΩ„Éí„Éà„Çµ„Ç∏„ÄàÂÆöÈ£ü„Äâ ÔºàTanka card game MISOHITOSAJI „ÄàTeishoku„ÄâÔºâ, where Teishoku means “set meal”. The second edition enables solitaire play, whereas as the first edition rules are for 2-8 players.

This game enables you to easily craft Japanese Tanka poems. The game consists of cards with 5 syllable and 7 syllable words in Japanese. Mix and match the cards to create a Tanka poem following the 5-7-5-7-7 syllable structure.

There are six different ways to play, including “Utaichimonme" and "ku-meeting". In “Utaichimonme", players exchange cards in a manner similar to Poker in order to craft their poems. In “ku-meeting”, players collaborate to create a single Tanka poem.

In addition, the set contains 40 blank cards which you can use to write your own words to customize your game play. Because of the depth of Japanese text in the game, it would be unplayable without being able to read Japanese.

name: Animals Party
description: Animals matching game for toddlers. This matching game is a basic game for young children. Roll the color die and the animal die and search for the animal block that matches both in that combination, then place it on your board (if you have that animal space available). First player to fill their animal board wins!

name: Ashram
description: A quiz game by Michael Szymanski. 10,000 questions.

name: Quiz o Europie: mini
description:
Description from the publisher (translated):
"Quiz about Europe - mini" - fascinating game and great fun, during which participants answer questions about Europe. Players can answer 180 questions with 45 cards, and they have 540 answers to choose from. Topics for questions and answers are: history, geography and nature, science and technology and the art and culture of Europe. "Quiz about Europe - mini" is an exciting and exciting entertainment for the whole family, and its participants can expand their knowledge of Europe while playing.

Description from the publisher:
"Quiz o Europie - mini" - fascynujƒÖca gra i ≈õwietna zabawa, w trakcie której uczestnicy odpowiadajƒÖ na pytania o Europie. Gracze mogƒÖ odpowiadaƒá na 180 pyta≈Ñ z 45 kart, a do wyboru majƒÖ 540 odpowiedzi. Tematami pyta≈Ñ i odpowiedzi sƒÖ: historia, geografia i przyroda, nauka i technika oraz kultura i sztuka Europy. "Quiz o Europie - mini" to atrakcyjna i emocjonujƒÖca rozrywka dla ca≈Çej rodziny, a jej uczestnicy mogƒÖ w czasie zabawy poszerzyƒá swojƒÖ wiedzƒô o Europie.

name: Blue Falcon
description: A fast paced, friendship bruising player-elimination card game designed to identify who amongst the group (Military or other wise) is the ultimate Blue Falcon (Military slang for a buddy F---r). Players strive to draw as many cards as possible, while limiting the hand draws of their friends/enemies. The goal is to gain the Blue Falcon card and strike when your friend can't defend themselves and are eliminated from the game. The last person standing is the ultimate Blue Falcon and champion of the now friendless masses.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: The Game of Little Jack Horner
description:
The game of Little Jack Horner consists of 32 cards. Four ‘Jack Horner and His Big Pie’ cards with numbers 2, 4, 5, and 7 displayed in the top left corner. The other 28 cards are 7 each, of 4 different variety of plums; the Lombard, the Crugers Scarlet, the Dominee Dull, and the Green Cage Plum. These cards display the numbers 1 to 7 in their top left corner.

To begin, the four Jack Horner pie cards are placed in a square. All other cards are dealt to the players and placed faced down in a pile. Taking turns, players flip over their top card, and attempt to add plum cards to the pies. Once the number 1 plum card is placed on a pie, all other plum cards in ascending order must be of the same plum.

If a player turns over a card from his pile and he can’t place it in the center pie cards, then he sets it in front of him face up, creating a discard pile. He can only place a plum card if it can go in order of 1 to 7, and on the correct pie. Once a pie is complete, the player who completes it, takes it.

A player may be able to play his top faced up card on his discard pile during his next turn. He may also draw another card from his pile and play that too, if able. After the draw cards are all used, players shuffle the discard piles and begin again until all cards have been used to create pies.

Score is as follows:

three points is awarded to the first player who goes out of cards
two points for each pie taken

The winner is the player with the most points, or the most points after three rounds.

name: Thor Skirmish
description:
A board and card abstract skirmish level combat game for 2 players depicting the battle between Asgardians and either Frost Giants, Dark Elves or Marauders.

Play is conducted on an 8x8 board using chits, figures or miniatures to represent units. Dependant on scenario several spaces on the board will be marked as impassable, representing pits, walls, and other obstacles.

Units are described in a series of tables but have a hit point value of between 1 and 9, have specific capabilities and characteristics, and may have associated special cards.

Players share a common deck. Cards are of varying types: Move, Ranged Attack, Hand to Hand Attack, Defence, Combo and Special. Move and Attack cards have an associated range.

The units used are dependent on scenario (four are provided). Each player places one unit on each square of his back two rows. Units may not stack.

Players take turns with each turn comprising 3 phases:

1. Fate Phase
- Draw 3 cards. Max hand size = 5 cards. Discard excess cards.

2. Move Phase
- Play (discard) a Move card to move one of your units. The move card has a number. This is the number of spaces the unit moves. Moves can be diagonal or orthogonal. “Knight” type move cards allow a unit to move like a knight in chess. Instead of moving just one unit in any direction, you have the option of moving 2 or 3 units forward the indicated number of spaces using a single move card. Units cannot move through other units.

3. Fight Phase
- Play (discard) an Attack card to have a unit attack. The attack card has a number. This is the range of the attack. Attacks can be diagonal or orthogonal. “Knight” type attack cards produce an attack with a range like a knight in chess. Units cannot attack through other units.
- Every attack does a base of 1 damage (target loses 1 hit). Use chits or coins to record damage. A unit reduced to 0 hits is killed or incapacitated and removed from the board.
- Your opponent may play defence cards to negate your attack.
- A unit is knocked back in the direction of the attack. If a unit is blocked by another unit the other unit is also knocked back (like a row of dominoes). If a unit is knocked into an impassable space or off the board it is destroyed.

Victory conditions are scenario specific. After 15 turns, if there is no victory, one side retreats and the battle is a draw.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Speedy Bees Game
description:
It's a busy day in Honeybee Valley. The bees need to collect pollen from as many flowers as possible to make honey... but to get the correct flavour they have to visit the flowers in the right order.

In this fast paced matching game, spin the spinner which points to the colour sequence in which to visit the flowers. Now race the press your bee onto the flower shapes, stacking them in the correct colour order.

name: Tank Girl Skirmish
description:
A board & card skirmish level combat game for 2 players representing a battle between Tank Girl and friends vs Water and Power.

Play is conducted on an 8x8 grid using chits, figures or miniatures to represent units. Terrain types (sand dunes, road, rough, impassable, destructible), which affect play, are added to the board at the players’ discretion. Units start on the back two rows of the player’s side of the board. Units have a designated hit value, certain skills/characteristics and may gain specific benefits from special cards.

Players share a common deck. Cards types are move, attack, defence and special. Move and attack cards have an associated range. Special cards have differing effects dependent on which unit they are applied to.

Players take turns with each turn comprising 3 phases:


Fate Phase
Draw 3 cards. Max hand size = 5 cards. Discard excess cards.

Move Phase
Play (discard) a move card to move one of your units. The move card has a number indicating the number of spaces the unit moves. Moves can be diagonal or orthogonal.
Instead of moving just one unit in any direction, you have the option of moving 2 or 3 units forward the indicated number of spaces using a single move card.
Units cannot move through other units.

Fight Phase
Play (discard) an attack card to have a unit attack. The attack card has a number indicating the range of the attack. Attacks can be diagonal or orthogonal.
Every attack does a base of 1 damage (target loses 1 hit). A unit reduced to 0 hits is killed or incapacitated and removed from the board.
Your opponent may play Defence cards to negate your attack.
Units cannot attack through other units.



The first player to knock out the opposing player’s leaders is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Duck Dance
description:
Game of speed and strategie.
The ducks dance as you put the cards on the table, but when the "stop" card switches off the music, you have to find a rubber ring to sit on, and fast!
The player left without a rubber ring has to take all the cards, and the music starts again...

name: Marvel Civil War Skirmish
description:
A miniatures and card game style war game played on an 8 x 8 board representing a fight between Superhero teams of the Marvel Universe. One team plays Team IRON (Iron Man, Iron Patriot, Black Widow, Spiderman, Vision and Black Panther); the other Team CAP (Captain America, Bucky, Falcon, Scarlet Witch, Hawkeye and Ant Man). Heroes start on the player’s back row of the board. Team IRON goes first

A regular 52 card playing deck is used as an action deck. Each Hero has his own action table which describes 10 numbered actions that Hero can take – these correspond to the 1 (ace) – 10 cards in the deck. Action are of 4 types: Attack, Defence, Movement or Special. A King card can be used to have a friendly Hero attack an adjacent enemy Hero. A Queen card can be used to move a friendly Hero 1 or 2 spaces. Black Jack cards can be used for Witty Repartee: A Friendly Hero and an enemy Hero within 2 spaces of each other may neither move nor attack the rest of this turn. Red Jack cards can be used to Taunt: A Friendly Hero causes an enemy Hero within 2 spaces to want to attack him or her. That Hero can attack no other Heroes the rest of this or next turn.

First, each player fills their hand to 6 cards. Players then take turns playing 1 card at a time to cause their heroes to: Move, Attack, and Defend. Attack values indicate the range of the attack emanating from that Hero. Movement values indicate how far the Hero will move. A Defence Action will negate an attack just made by an enemy Hero against this hero. Played cards are discarded.
If a player has no cards left, or nothing he wants to do, he may pass. A player who passes may play no other cards this turn except Defence cards. When both players have passed the turn ends.
Heroes may not end their turns in the same space as another hero however, they may move or attack through (past) other Heroes.
Each hero has 5 Hit Points (HP). Every time a hero gets attacked and does not defend, it loses 1 HP. If a Hero is reduced to zero HP that Hero is knocked out and removed from play

At the end of turn 12 if both Cap and Bucky are still in play, team CAP wins, otherwise team IRON Wins.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Lipless!
description:
User summary:

Another party game with dental mouth openers.

Players wearing a mouth opener, must get your teammate to understand phrases without using your lips! to score a card.
Team with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Level 8: Das Kartenspiel ‚Äì Happy Meal Edition
description: "Level 8: Das Kartenspiel - Happy Meal Edition" is the a Happy Meal version of the original "Level 8: Das Kartenspiel". This edition is the promo copy of Level Up, consisting of 60 small cards (1-12 in 5 colors). This game was distributed as part of the McDondald's Happy Meals Menu.

name: Orange Quest: Cap (Boomstarter promo)
description:
Equipment.

You instead of the leader distribute the reward for the victory over the boss

name: Humiliated
description:
Welcome everyone to humiliated the game where you will laugh, cry, and be humiliated. The first person draws a duel card and go against someone and they play(rock paper scissors, flex off to a macho song or head bang to a rock song.) The winner gets a point and the loser has to draw a humiliated card which is where the real fun starts. Having to pick a humiliated could be something that is not that bad or it could be something awful (someone throws a hot dog at your face, draw a 70s porno mustache on your face with a marker, or the bukake party) Win the most duels and you're the winner . The stories you will have after you play will be unforgettable. Grab this game, get some laughs, and tell your friends.

—description from the publisher

name: Dirty Diction
description:
Dirty Diction is the new Adult Party Game! Have fun! Laugh at your friends! Dirty Diction is the new, hilarious, and slightly educational, party game of idioms, phrases and slang! There are eight different play challenges to get your team to be the first to five points! Act it out! Draw it! Vote on which player is most likely associated with it! Set players up like human mannequins! Do whatever it takes to beat the competition! Watch out though! ‘All In’ challenges could put you ahead or take away your lead! Liven up your game night with Dirty Diction!

—description from the publisher

name: The Appalachian Trail Game: The ME-GA Expansion Set
description:
We are excited to announce NEW cards that expand the game play of both the Backpacking and the Special Edition of The Appalachian Trail Game. The ME-GA Expansion Set includes two distinct decks -- The Thru-Hiker Deck and the A.T. Communities Deck. These two decks combine for 25O new cards and mirror the dual backpacking experience of spending time in the backcountry and in A.T. Communities along the way.

To play with the ME-GA Expansion Set...


Replace your old Challenge Cards with NEW Challenge cards from the ME-GA Expansion Set
Shuffle the NEW Chance cards in with your existing Chance cards
Get your GA-ME on!


—description from the publisher

name: Alphabet Island: A Letters and Sounds Game
description:
This is an educational game for children learning to match lowercase and uppercase letters or learning letter sounds. There are two levels of play, level one using the matching letters and level two using the sounds.

The theme is alphabet island and the game includes a hungry shark, ready to eat all the letters.

To play you take turns flipping over a card and revealing a capital letter. Then all players race to find the disc with the correspondent lower case letter, or picture/word stating with the sound of that letter. The first person to find it gets to keep that disc and the person with the most discs at the end wins.

To enhance the game play there are starfish, crabs and the shark. If you find a disc that uncovers a starfish you must give one of your discs to another player. If you find a crab you get to take one from someone else, and if you flip over a shark card you must feed a disk to the hungry shark. (There are four shark cards in the deck.) The shark is a 3D plastic toy with a lever on the back that allows the shark to actually eat the disks.

The instructions come in English, French, Spanish and German and you could play level one in any of those languages, but to play level 2 you have to play in English.

name: Buzz Around
description:
In Buzz Around the players control a swarm of insects and try to get through a field of flowers, surviving the hazards that threaten them! In addition to the basic roll and move system the game adds interesting decision points with clever card play and choosing the optimal route through the ever rotating flowers.

The player who first gets his or hers swarm safely through the field wins the game!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: IsBut Cooking
description:
Aim of the game: Collect the most number of the IsBut's and Cut Spaghetti recipes.

Flow of the game: Players either use function cards, play recipe cards, or pass and draw cards.

End of the game: When the deck runs out, the player with most recipe cards wins.

name: Alveol: Das Zellenspiel
description:
Every player takes one box with square plates and one roll with rings of the same color. The 1st player places a square plate vertically into any slit of the board. Then the 2nd player places one into any slit he likes and so on. If there is a square with 3 walls the player whose turn it is to play, must shut it by placing the 4th wall. If the square which he has shut, has no number, the next player continues to play. Otherwise the same player has another turn. In shutting one square the respective player puts one of his rings into it. The squares without number count 1, those with a number count as many points as are indicated by the number.

When all squares are shut, the points are counted and the player who has the most, is the winner.

name: Gack, Gack!
description:
This fun and exciting game will delight children.
When it is your turn, roll the dice and press it on the chicken's breast as many times as the number of dice rolls. If nothing happens, it is the next player's turn. When the chicken coop opens and the chicken cackles and lays its egg, the player picks it up, opens it and drops the egg slab from the inside to the table. If it lands so that the egg is visible, the player has bad luck: he wins nothing in this round. If it lands so that the chicken is visible - Congratulations!
The player with the most chickens wins.

name: The Dwarf (fan expansion for Dragon's Hoard)
description:
The Dwarf is an action card who aloud you to steal one treasure already in game from another player.

The dwarf is interesting only by gems and gold so they don't steal wishing tree or prince/princess (treasure 7-8).

A treasure in a lair is protected from Dwarf.

A Dwarf can be stop by a dragon card.

A Dwarf with a Wizard is unstoppable.

The unicorn protect from the dwarf.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion

name: Box Quiz: Julekalendere
description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Advent Calendars'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about advent calendars. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

name: RONE: The Aftermath
description:
Discover the RONE universe in this new epic exploring dice game that use unique dice that you can craft during the game.

This game is driven by scenarios and players take role of group of people who wants to survive the apocalypse. But remember, they are not the only one who wants to survive and the danger lurks at every corner.

Explore the map, build your players deck, improve your dice and be prepared for unpredictable.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Tiny Swords
description:
Tiny Swords is a cute, casual card game about fast fun duels with customizable swords that can fit in your wallet. Each themed set comes with its own unique cards, including a charm card that can dramatically change how the game is played.

A complete game for two players can be made by printing out just one sheet of 8.5x11 paper, but the extra expansions add all kinds of fun new card themes to play with!

Included is a Tiny Swords instruction manual you can either read as a PDF or print out as a minizine!

—description from the designer

The print-and-play game is distributed as an instruction manual and several print-and-play card packs, including:


Wave I - Spooky, Sweet, Mermaid, Moon
Wave II - Puppy, Kitty, Cafe, Forest
Wave III - Circus, Clockwork, Dino, Lucky


"Spooky/Sweet" and "Mermaid/Moon" are considered the traditional "starter" packs.

The game was released as a free "beta" version in 2016; following a successful Kickstarter a commercial "print and play" version was released in 2017.

Game play involves hand management of custom cards that represent a player's "tiny sword" - a "parry" card, a "slice" card, and a "thrust" card. Each card type beats one other card type but in turn is beaten by the other card type in a traditional "rock-paper-scissors" paradigm. Players alternate turns attacking an opponent of their choice; selected card pairs are simultaneously revealed and resolved by card swapping and possible card elimination. In addition, some cards have special powers that may be activated during resolution. In the case of "ties", resolution may require succeeding card plays. Players who have all their sword cards eliminated are themselves eliminated from the game. Play continues with fewer players until only one player remains holding one or more sword cards.

—user summary
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Ragnar√∂k: Destiny of the Gods
description:
Ragnarok - Destiny of the Gods is an exciting card game for adults and children alike. The sixty-five cards each show one of the beings found in Norse mythology: gods, trolls, giants, animals, and more. For each, the card describes the being, their strengths and weaknesses, and their story. With the information on the card, you can play six fun and educational games. You can even play out Ragnarok!
—description from the back of the box
