Ragnarök – Destiny of the Gods. This is a unique intellectual work of Reynir A. Óskarson made from original sources. The deck of card is designed as an edutainment deck of cards and a souvenir
about Norse mythology, where the 65 cards describe all the main characters of the Norse mythology. In the deck, all the characters get points, showing their locations, influence, and power according to the original sources, and these points give people insight in how Nordic people saw the world in the age of the Vikings. It's even possible to play out the events of Ragnarök as they appear in the ancient texts of Völuspá and Gylfaginning!
—description from the publisher (English)

Ragnarök - Destiny of the Gods. Hér er um er að ræða einstakt hugverk Reynis A. Óskarssonar sem er í heild unnið upp úr frumheimildum. Spilið er hannað sem skemmtimenntunar (e. edutainment) spil og minjagripur um Norræna goðafræði, þar sem 65 spil fara yfir allar helstu kynjaverur goðafræðinnar. Í spilinu fá allar verurnar stig sem sýna staðsetningu þeirra og áhrifamátt samkvæmt upprunalegu heimildunum og gefur fólki innsýn í það hvernig norrænt fólk á víkingatímum sá heiminn. Það er meira að segja hægt að spila út Ragnarök eins og þau birtast í Völuspá og Gylfaginningu!
—description from the publisher (Icelandic)

name: The Song of Salt
description:
A mysterious real history
A civilized opera 2000 years ago
A magical industrial history
A fascinating history of struggle
A group of people with special positions who are emerging, flourishing and finally extinct in the vast ocean of history
- The Song of Salt

In distant oriental continent, there is a position to maintain the stability of the country, i.e. salt administrator.
What is salt administrator?
Long time ago, salt played an important role in the social economy. In that era and background, salt administrator, as the highest leader in the salt production process, was formally appointed by the court of Northern Song Dynasty, ranking sixth in political circle and in charge of a salt field.
On the other hand, the salt manufacturing is always dependent on fate from ancient times to date. Regardless of raw material collection or obtaining salt by drying bittern, they all are dependent on the generous gifts of nature. Now, as the new salt administrators appointed by the court, you have to complete the salt manufacturing task assigned by the court in the shortest possible time. You will face challenges from both competitors and nature, every choice you made may change the fate of the salt field. You will experience this piece of magical history in this game and master this ancient technology, salt manufacturing.

The most important thing is that you will meet constant new challenges, and you should maintain a calm judgment on using which way for salt manufacturing. After hard works, there will be a mysterious final test.
Today, you are about to take office. In the next years of cooking bittern from the sea, the new salt administrators, please bring yourselves back to the ancient ages, and please achieve your ideal with fair decisions and rational minds, so as taste the difficulty in the ancient salt manufacturing process.

—description from the publisher

name: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation DVD Game
description:
CSI DVD Screen Show Game lets you experience the intense drama of the popular CSI TV series with your friends and family; investigate evidence, interview suspects, and solve the case--all on your TV screen.

A casino lounge...a Las Vegas hotel...an autopsy room...

Enter the real world of CSI and uncover the powerful plots and terrific twists in this interactive, multi-player DVD game.

Remember to listen up, take notes and look carefully, because any clue could help you solve the murder mystery.

—description from the publisher
categories: Deduction, Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery

name: Now goes me a light up
description: "Now goes me a light up" is a card game about common phrases. If you translate German idioms into the English language you don't get the correct English equivalent, but rather a funny English sentence. Then it's not English, it's Denglish ("D" for Deutsch = German). So one by one the players draw a card and have to translate the Denglish sentences into German and then also have to find the correct English forms. Only if a player can translate the Denglish phrase into German and then correctly into English they can keep the card. The more cards the players collect the more points they earn. Whoever earns most points wins.

name: Banquet
description:
On the face of it, it is a golden age; King Arthur and Queen Guinevere are married and ruling with wisdom and impartiality, the Kingdom is stable and prosperous and Evil seems to have been driven from the land.

All is not well however; ambitious Lords constantly scheme at the Royal banquets to get in with those in good standing with the Royal couple. The illicit relationship of the young lovers, Tristan and Isolde, threatens to start a war with their neighbours and then there’s the rumours about Queen Guinevere and Lancelot...

Players play as ambitious Lords in the time of King Arthur, all vying to be seen sat next to the most influential people in court at King Arthur’s latest banquet at Camelot.

Gameplay involves playing a Scheme card from you hand that will allow your character card to move in various ways, or allows you to move the other members (King's Knights, Guests or VIPs) of the banquet. Moving one character, however, may cause the character it displaces to also need to move in a specific way, and moves may chain beyond your control! For example, moving a Knight may require that knight to automatically move straight to the Royal Row, which may then displace a VIP such as Isolde who must move to be next to Tristan, who may then displace another Knight, etc.

You have until the end of the final banquet course (or "round", which varies depending on chosen game length) to manoeuvre yourself into the best position to gain points from adjacent guests AND to hopefully complete your secret quest for bonus points. The player with the most influence points wins (and becomes the most influential Lord of the land)!

Each game also has a random or specifically chosen common quest that changes the rules of the game slightly, which all players are affected by.

When playing with less than 4 players, AI players called "Rogue Nobles" operate the "missing" players, moving around automatically and likely screwing up your well laid plans!
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Pattern Building

name: Treasure Temple
description:
Treasure Temple is a treasure-grabbing, back-stabbing adventure card game for 2-4 players. Players each take on the role of daring explorers from across the globe seeking lost treasures hidden deep within the Treasure Temple.

Collect treasure points by scoring treasure cards into your trove. But beware, other explorers will trick you, trip you up and even steal your well earned loot if you're not prepared! Use adventure cards to create pitfalls for your rivals, send them the wrong way deep into the jungle or have your army of maniacal monkeys steal their treasure for you. The first player to collect 20 treasure points wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Exodo: Guerra de Dioses
description:
In Exodus: War of Gods you will assume the identity and power of one of the great gods. Fight to recover your followers and destroy your enemies in the battle to become the greatest and most powerful divinity of all time.

We started the game with 2 action cards in hand and 2 Villagers, 1 Fanatic and 1 Prophet as devotees, each with a value of 1, 2 and 3 devotional points respectively.

At the beginning of the turn we will draw a card from the common stock deck: if we draw a devotee we will be obliged to put it among our devotees and pass the turn; if it is an action card we can choose between playing one of the action cards of the hand or the ability of the god we represent.

Whoever gets to 15 points of devotion will win, who will be the last god with devotees, or who has more points of devotion at the end of the deck of actions

name: Mountains (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
The Mountains series of expansions introduces Mountains as a new landscape feature. Mountains are not scored like the normal landscape feature, but are instead scored when the tile is played. All the other expansions in the series require that the Mountains expansion be played with.

Approved by carcassonnecentral and carcassonne-forum
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Elements Realities
description:
Introduction

The game is a cooperative, 1 to 6 players, settled in the Elements Realities universe, a concept by Giortech GmbH.

In the game, the players are Temporal Agents, in a Time Agency set in the near future, that jump in time for dangerous missions in the past, in the ancient Greece.
The agents must protect the Timeline and preserve the Reality from the attacks of a mysterious force only known as... Darklings! All the wonderful discoveries of the ancient Greece, the democracy, the philosophy, the arts, the sciences, are at risk. The Agents jump in the middle of the most important key events of the mankind to protect the Reality.

Produced at LudoFact, this made in Germany game is presented in German Version. English Version is coming shortly.

The Game mechanics of Elements Realities

The game is cooperative as all the agents have to fulfill dangerous missions in the past to protect our Reality from the attacks of the treacherous and mysterious Darklings.
Each player chooses an Agent with specific unique skills. Then, each agent chooses a mission card among the currently available in the Agency, and starts the jump procedures: First a briefing card is executed, and then the jump is done on the Time Jump Track with a dice roll, based on the time distance in epoch to jump back. If the jump is missed, then a roll is made on the Jump Failure Track, where the Agent can influence the result by spending his own Reality Chits (the "coins" of the game). When an Agent manages to jump successfully into the past, the Mission story is built. The mechanism of building the mission is so that it is almost impossible to build the same mission twice. Every mission card has objectives on the bottom, and a sequence of Events cards is extracted, each containing one or more objectives symbols, until all the missions goals are paid off. A certain number of Reality Chits are positioned on the Mission card, as final reward. The Agent then each turn faces one Event card that can be passed by successfully rolling against some of the personal skills. Every Event passed shall make gain or lose Reality Chits on the Mission card. If at any moment the number of Chits should go less than zero, the Mission is lost and the Agent is transferred back to the Agency, where can start a new Mission. Every lost Mission reduces by 1 the level of our Reality. Every successful Mission increases the level by 1. Goal of the game is to reach level 10. When all Agents have moved in a round, before the next, there come the Darklings. An Agent per turn possesses the Destiny in his hands, a special white wooden Chit. Whoever owns the Destiny faces the Darklings in that round. A Time Epoch is moved forward, a Reality Chit is given to the Agency from the bank, and a Darklings card is extracted and positioned on the board. If the Darklings card has the same symbol of the current Epoch (circle, triangle or square) then the card comes into effect, and the negative effects are executed. Before that, the owner of the Destiny can decide to roll against the Darklings cards as many dices as many Reality Chits of the Agency is willing to pay. The roll is made against the current Reality Level, so if the Agents are losing the game it will become increasingly more difficult, and if they are winning it will become easier. For every successful roll, a Darklings card of choice can be removed and the positive effect on it is executed. Then a new round starts.

One of the most interesting aspects of the game is its configurability. The difficulty level is based on the starting level chosen for our Reality and the Darklings Reality. This amounts to almost 100 difficulty levels to choose from, in a 2D space of difficulties. Elements Realities will never become obsolete! Then the Game is unique in that an Agent can join the game in every moment, and can leave in any moment. No more uh-uh moments when a friend knocks at the door and you are already in a one hour game. Just offer a chair and an Agent card. The same if someone has to leave or pause the participation during a game. This *is* freedom!

The Game of Elements Realities has many facets: family game, strategy choices, roll of dices, collaboration between players, deep immersive story. The presence of Special Missions that build exciting Side Stories that span for multiple Mission cards, give the game an uncommon depth. The Agents, the Stories, the entire World of Elements Realities, are depicted in the Science Fiction Novels that are regularly published. An entire Universe comes to life. Giortech shall also produce a first pilot episode of a series.

A final note from the Author

I want to make a special note, at the end of this presentation of Elements Realities, to put under light the fact that the Missions presented in the game, and the surrounding stories, happen in the real Greek history. By playing the game, you will learn important events that forged the world in which we live, and the dates in which these events happened. So the Edutainment aspect is great and unique.
Last, but not least, I leave you with a thought. There is a deep analogy between our lives and the Universe of Elements Realities. As the Agents jump in Time to protect the great discoveries of the ancient Greece, the Philosophy, the Arts, the Democracy, so everyone of us, in our today time, must not take for granted once and for all terms like Culture, Arts, Democracy, but we have to nurture them every day a little.

Each of us is a Time Agent, in our time.

—description from the publisher

name: Honestly?
description:
Honestly? is a bluffing game. Players win by lying to friends about whether or not they are actually a liar.

Each player is dealt a single card stating whether or not they are a liar. Clockwise, they state if they are a liar or not, of course not having to tell the truth. After the statement, the next player either states "I believe you" or "I have concerns".

If concerns are expressed, the active player has 10 seconds to make their case that they are telling the truth. Then the accusing player must either respond with "I believe you" or "honestly?"

If the accusing player says "honestly?" then the active player must reveal their card. If the active player was telling the truth, the accusing player is eliminated from the game. If the active player was lying, they are eliminated.

Play continues until all players have been the active player or until only one player remains. If all players have been active and multiple players are in the game at the end of the round, then all players must reveal their cards. If any player(s) successfully lied, they win. If no players lied about their cards, everyone loses.

name: Tight Cowboy
description: There are some robbers, sergeants and villagers from everywhere crowd at the bar in a little desert town. At the bar, you should identify other's capacity agilely and choose one of these action to do with them like taking out your gun, robbing some coins or making your opponent drunk. The player who gain more coins in a muddle would be a winner.

name: Sesamstraat: Boodschappen doen
description:
In this game you must do your own groceries! You must see which things you need, and which things you don't. Players will learn that some things are more expensive than others.

Player must roll a die and move their Sesame Street character the rolled amount of steps towards any direction. When the players lands on a coin, they receive one Sesame coin. If they land on a store, they get the chance to buy one item of their shopping list using their collected Sesame coins.

The player who has crossed off all the items of their shopping list wins the game!
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Kwirky
description:
Kwirky is a fast-moving, quick-thinking, question-and-answer, bluff-and-banter game for family and friends., and in this game you decide the answers!

Answer against the clock, even if you don't know, by convincing others you do! Beware because players may call your bluff! Younger players compete on equal terms since quick wit and cheeky confidence are what you need in this game where all the answers are up for grabs.

name: 11 Soccer
description:
11 Soccer is a funny micro game about soccer.
Become the new Neymar !!!!
It contains 17 cards.
It's a Love Letter like.
You need to have deduction, memory and tactical skills to win the round
Every player has one card into his hand. At his turn, the player takes a new card and play one card. Action on this card is applied.

At the end, each player who still one card in his hand compare values. The winner of the round is the player with the most valuable card.

—description from the designer

name: Spy Code: Safe Breaker
description:
Mission #2: Safe Breaker | Crack the Code

Your mission is to break into the safe. Use your spy skills to scan, solve and crack the code. Safe Breaker is a game that combines skills, memory, and a little bit of luck. Collect the most treasures to win!

To start the mission, players pick a card and turn the safe combination to the corresponding number shown. Next, listen to the secret hint using your Spy Stethoscope as you gently press the fingerprint scanner to test the number. If the light is green, the safe will release some coins. If the light is red, you will get a clue. The spy who collects the five golden coins or two diamond coins first, wins the game!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Puzzle, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Captain Underpants and the Rip-Roaring Race to Remain Rainless Game
description:
It's up to you to save the day with George, Harold, and Captain Underpants! Players work together to get through the toilet paper obstacle course. Keep Captain Underpants from getting wet and changing into Principal Krupp! Watch out for Professor Poopypants, Turbo Toilet 2000, and other twists and turns! This game uses good old fashioned tap water to add to the fun!
—description from the publisher

The game involves each player moving according to a spinner. Within the track, there are spaces which require the player who lands on them to transfer water from one cup (which starts full) to a smaller cup (which starts empty). If the water spills from the smaller container, all players lose. If all players make it to the end before the smaller cup fills up, the game is a victory for the players. Graphics ties the gameplay to the cartoon characters.
—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: LFG Storytime with Dick
description:
Ever sit around the campfire to tell stories with your friends when everything suddenly goes wrong? A friend gets murdered, everything you love is destroyed, and the call is coming from inside the campfire! That's what separates your average storytime from LFG Storytime with Dick!

LFG Storytime with Dick is a competitive storytelling dice game. Players take turns rolling the dice and trying to tell a story by matching the story element symbols they rolled to one of the cards in their hand. However, after every roll, one of the players -the Dick of that round- gets to mess with the story. Do you accept the fiery wake Dick leaves behind or push your luck and try to salvage your story with another roll of the dice?

LFG Storytime with Dick contains:
• 9 custom Storytelling dice that can also be used as regular 6-sided dice;
• 42 Plot cards with references to your favourite moments from the Looking For Group webcomic;
• 1 Dick Role card, so everyone knows who the Dick at the table is;
• 8 Cheat Sheets, because rules are hard and drinking might be happening.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Storytelling

name: You've Got Dirty Problems
description:
You've got DIRTY problems is an expansion to You've got problems that will give you all kinds of new horrible perks and problems. Would you rather have your the President tweet a picture of you naked every day, or have your eyes on your genitals? These choices are going to be disgusting and terrifying. If that’s the kind of thing you’re into, this is the expansion pack for you.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Secret Benalla
description:
In the year 2018, France finds itself, under the pretext of progressivism, on the verge of turning to authoritarian rule.
A handful of parliament members opposed to the neo-liberal regime seek to counter the corrupt presidency by denouncing its abuses of power and blocking the passage of oppressive laws.
Meanwhile, the government has begun to create a private militia to obey its orders, thanks to the help of a shadowy figure: Alexandre Benalla.

Secret Benalla is a game of deception, lies and betrayal. The players are either opponents of Emmanuel the 1st who win by uncovering the corruption and unmasking Alexandre Benalla, Macronists who win by passing the oppressive laws of the authoritarian regime, or Opportunists who each have unique win conditions that are sometimes ... hard to decipher !

Be careful - even your allies may betray you. Keen observation, scrutiny, and logical reasoning will lead players to triumph, but maybe not a triumph for democracy.

Secret Benalla is a re-implementation of Secret Hitler based on a 2018 French political scandal.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Humor, Party Game, Political, Print & Play

name: Blindsight
description:
Blindsight is a party game in which you can only see and play the cards that are in your opponents' hands. The main objective is to get rid of your own cards.

Blindsight is easy to learn as the basics are all about playing adjacent numbers and alternating the colours. You have to continue playing until there are no more cards to play, unless you can find a way to end your turn early. Which helps as you are trying to empty your own hand. When playing Blindsight in a group you will immediately notice there are always an extra pairs of eyes monitoring your every move, this give the game a cooperative feel.

There are four types of special cards in the game; they all have their own unique and usually quite surprising effect on the game. Cards that might help you the first time; can turn against you the next time you play them.

With the regular game play there are three additional variations to play. You can increase the difficulty by bringing the symbols found on the cards into play. Or you can play a last man standing variation in which you are trying to get rid of the opponents' cards instead of your own. Or combine both variations.

—description from the designer

name: Cthulhu Kids: Cosmic Catastrophe
description: Cthulhu Kids: Cosmic Catastrophe is a battle card game inspired by the Cthulhu mythos. Use attacks by characters from the HP Lovecraft's Cthulhu mythos, augment them with dice rolls, and play extra power cards to alter the course of an attack. The first to win 3 attacks wins the game.

name: Story Game Lost & Found
description:
Move around the fun fair by spinning the spinner and try to fill your collection board with lost things! A sunny spell lets you go anywhere you like, while cloudy skies send you back to your start space. The first player to find all three of their things wins!


Promotes simple decision-making skills and strategic thinking.
The spinner adds excitement to the game!
The detective theme makes the game exciting and extra fun to play!


—description by publisher

name: Monopoly Cash Grab
description:
Monopoly Cash Grab is a mad dash to get the cash! To play, load the money into the money blaster (a.k.a., the bank), then spin the spinner to blast loads of cash and Chance cards into the air. Rush to grab as much cash as you can to win the game — but don't stop there! Collect Chance cards to add more strategy to the game, such as swapping money stacks with another player, taking half of any one player's money stack, or making all players pass their money stack to the left. Once the blaster is empty, the player with the most cash wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Mage Knight: Coconut Halves & Stick Horse Promo
description:
COCONUT HALVES & STICK HORSE RELIC CARD SET

These relics are based on Monty Python and the Holy Grail and were only available by attending Wizkids conventions in 2004.
• Card Numbers: R-109, R-110
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures

name: Pitch and Yaw
description:
Pitch and Yaw is a tabletop miniatures skirmish game, requiring around 6-16 models representing a high seas boarding action in the golden age of piracy. It is a free to download PDF with an extended edition available on our website.
The game is highly asymmetrical with each player taking turns playing as attacker and defender. The attacker must search the ship before the defender can take too much toll on their forces. Unlike many pirate based skirmish games Pitch and Yaw features a highly dynamic environment representing the difficulty of fighting on a constantly shifting deck. After each round of activating models to move and attack the ship and all unsecured objects will shift.

name: UniQuest
description:
A game for unicorn lovers. A magical game of unicorns that is simple and fun for all. Get the most unicards by matching mane color, hoof color, and horn color to the unicard you wish.

Players have a hand of 5 cards. Most cards have a unicorn on them with a colored mane, hooves, or horn in one of the 7 colors of the rainbow. Cards are also marked with a shape to help differentiate colors and for help with the colorblind.

During a turn, a player draws a card from the top of the deck or the discard pile. Once a player has three matching color unicorn cards of all three types (hooves, horn, and mane) they may discard all three and claim that color Unicard.

Unicards are separate from the cards used in the deck and player hands. There are 7 Unicards, one for each of the colors of the rainbow, and the first player to claim 4 Unicards wins the game. But be careful, because other players can steal your UniCards by also matching the same colors.

Also included are rainbow unicorns that can be used as any color and the dark horse which prevents you from winning.

—user summary

name: Seiryuu no Kanmuri
description:
ÊòüÁ´ú„ÅÆÂÜ† (Seiryuu no Kanmuri, "Crown of the Star Dragon") is the third game from Polygonotes. You play adventurers chasing after the precious scales of the Star Dragon; the game is semi-cooperative, with a pure coop mode for 2-3 players and a more competitive mode with the potential for betrayal for 3-4 players.

Each turn has three phases. In the preparation phase, you can spend Stars to buy items or heal, and you choose an item to use in the combat phase. In the combat phase, you flip a card from the Star Dragon deck and resolve its attack. Only the players with the highest attack or defense rating take part in combat. If things go well you can earn Stars here, but if they poorly some players will take damage. Some Dragon cards also have special effects like doing damage to players with too many Stars. Finally, in the Spoils phase the Stars earned in combat are split evenly among all participants. The game ends after ten turns, when the Dragon's Crown is revealed.

Because Stars are used to heal damage as well as to buy the items you attack with every turn, you'll have to balance offense and defence in order to survive the dragon's attacks. If you're playing to win you can play it safe in a round by trying to avoid combat... but since you won't get a share of the spoils that's risky too. You'll need balance in how you deal with the Dragon as well as your allies to come out ahead.

—user summary

name: The Noticeboard
description:
Overview:

A side-questing tabletop RPG with components that can be used as props or tools for your d20 system (fantasy setting). The game allows you to use your own characters from your system of choice and play mini-adventures.
In this game, everyone gets the opportunity to play, and everyone gets the opportunity to GM. It's a rule-lite game that builds player confidence with d20 RPG systems and encourages skills and experience with GMing.

The Game-play:

Players: 2-6 (but can stretch to 8 depending on the mode)
Playtime: 30-180min (dependant on how much players like to roleplay)

The game is formed primarily of:
Quest cards, hunt cards, location cards, a set of meeples, and a set of dice. The quest/hunt cards have plot-hooks written on the front and GM notes on the back. The location cards are drawn when the players are resting in the town after a hard day adventuring; the cards contain a mixture of bonuses and setbacks.

The game has three primary modes of play, head-to-head, co-operative, and classic.
In head-to-head, 1-4 players build a party of four adventurers and compete with each other to become the most successful/famous party in the land. Players move from town-to-town, completing quests and trying to earn: coin, renown, and experience points.
In co-operative mode, 3-6 players choose a character and join forces to form a party. The players head to a local town and aim to clear the board of quests within 5 days.
In classic mode, 2-6 players choose characters to form a party and compete with a GMs rival party of adventurers.

Applications as a tool:
The game was originally designed to be used as a prop during DND. The game can be used to manage downtime or as a way to introduce the party during session zero. It can also be used to generate plot-hooks or side-quests during the game.
The game itself is a great way to pass the time while you are waiting for other players to show up or as an alternative when players unexpectedly cancel.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Storytelling, Worker Placement

name: Ja Nein Rammstein
description:
Nobody can fool you when it comes to Rammstein music, live concerts, videos and other interesting details and facts about the band?! With this quiz game you can prove your Rammstein knowledge and literally compete with your friends.

The quiz game contains 400 questions about Rammstein in German and English for 2-6 players aged 16 and over.

Spiel mit mir!

—description from the publisher

name: Doomsday
description:
In Doomsday, players take on the roles of the last inhabitants of the island kingdom of Atlantis. Earthquakes are ravaging the island and large chunks of it keep falling into the sea! You have to keep moving each round, trying to find the safest space on the island. Those who choose unwisely will fall into the sea and be lost forever!

All is not lost, however. Boreas, the wind god, has taken pity on the doomed Atlanteans and has pledged to save the most worthy of you. Whoever can survive to the end will be swept up by Boreas and carried to safety. Do you have what it takes to outsmart your opponents and live to tell the tale?

Doomsday is a card game that integrates with a mobile app to create a fun, light-hearted party game. It is a social-deduction game of bluffing, persuasion, back stabbing and reading your opponents. Each round, players simultaneously select a location card from their hand to travel to. If too many people travel to the same location, the mobile app will eliminate some of them.

Location cards have special abilities that may modify the usual flow of the game, but play will continue until there are two players left who face off in a showdown. Depending on their choices, there may be one winner, two winners, or they may both lose! Games are quick and designed to be played multiple times in succession.

—description from the publisher

name: Pour Taste: The spin it, mix 'em, drink up game!
description:
In the hilarious Pour Taste game, players choose 6 ingredients (ingredients not included) and fill each cup with one of them. Then, each player takes a turn spinning the spinner. The spin will tell the player which ingredients to mix up -- or whether to choose another player to drink, steal chips, or go bankrupt. Will the drink taste ok or totally gross? It's up to the player to decide whether or not they will drink up. Every time a player drinks from a cup, they earn a chip. If they decide not to drink the concoction, they lose a chip. The first player to get 4 chips wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Infection Express: Secondary Infection
description:
Infection Express: Secondary Infection is the second edition of Infection Exress. It is a cooperative 1-6 player dice game inspired by Pandemic.

All that's needed to play are 5 6-sided dice with colored faces, 1 ordinary 6 sided die, 56 4-6mm cubes (14 each of 4 colours), player pawns and a print out of player mats, role cards and game board.
—description from the designer

GAMEPLAY:
On their turn, players move their pawns about, to cure diseases. They then cast dice to research a cure, and to determine where new diseases appear.
The players win the game, once all diseases have been removed from the map, and a cure has been researched for each type of disease. Players cooperate to achieve this goal, but at the end may compare their scores who saved the world the most.

Should there be to many outbreaks, or the infections become too severe, the game is lost.
—user summary
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Buchstaben: Domino
description:
There's always something happening in Buchstaben: Domino: First, Dragon Dave is making his rounds on the domino cards, and then there's word chaos in Dragonland and the domino cards must be put in the right order. You will be able to expand your spelling and vocabulary, which will help you win the Dragon Race or ABC Dominoes games.

—description from the publisher

name: Norges Saga
description:
The game consists of six boards with nine pictures of events from Norwegian history (with the year of the event printed on them), 54 cards with the same pictures, and a list of descriptions of the factual events. The players get one or more boards each (depending on the numbers of players) and draw cards. If they can correctly identify the historical events depicted, they get to keep the card. The goal is to fill you board.

—user summary

name: Mr Benn Grab!
description:
Mr Benn Grab! is a card game that's laugh-out-loud fun for all the family. The game is based on the iconic Mr Benn animated cartoon series, but you don't need to be a fan of the show to play: the game is easy to learn and quick to play.

Mr Benn Grab! is a frantic race to see which player can collect the most of Mr Benn's exciting adventures - but watch out for the shopkeepers who will try to steal them before you can grab the souvenir cards to keep them safe.

Players score 1 point for every souvenir card grabbed, and the first player to get rid of all their adventure cards scores 3 points. The first to 10 points wins.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Das gro√üe Maulwurfrennen
description:
All Moles are trying to get the golden shovel to become Mega Mole of the Year. To defy all dangers, they first try to find their way into the vegetable garden of gardener Teitze.

It starts in the mole building, where all players place their mole. The tunnel has eleven event fields whose meaning should read aloud.

At the beginning the player rolls the dice and tries to roll a 4. On the cube it is the highest number, in addition there is a rock and a pic. So who dices the 4 may dig and is then right again at the turn.

If you roll a boulder, it means that there is a rockfall. Then you take a boulder and put it right in front of your field. You only pass the rock by rolling a pic. Even if the next moles arrive and might even pass by with their litter, they have to wait in front of the boulder.

So if one of the moles manages to roll a pimple, the rock is knocked out and the player is allowed to roll the dice again.

The event fields have different meanings. They can be to the advantage, but also to the detriment. Most of the events are negative and slow the mole down a bit. The events are really very sweet written and lovingly illustrated.

The winner is the first to reach the finish with the exact number of points.

—user summary

name: Monopoly: Unite Students Edition
description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

From the rear of the box:
Welcome to the Unite Students edition of Monopoly. This game commemorates the first anniversary of the launch of Home for Success.
At Unite Students we want to create a home for our students, somehwere they feel comfortable to be themselves and have a sense of belonging, in an environment that helps then achieve success - whatever this might mean for them. And we also want to create this for our employees as well.
We're really proud of where we've come from and this game celebrates the different properties we've opened over the years, our people and our processes. Caring, uniting leading and ultimately deliversing is what has made us successful - ad will continue to do so in the future. And an important part of this is having the opportunity to interact with each other and have fun - something we hope this game will help enable.
Tour Unite Students for the hottest properties: sites, values and offices are all up for grabs.
Invest in flats and blocks, then watch the rent come pouring in!
make deals with other players and look out for bargains at auction, there are many ways to get what you want.
Stay sharp - because there's only room at the top for one. For everyone else, there's bankruptcy.
Trade your way to success - you can own it all!

PROPERTIES
BROWN
Jennens Court, Birmingham 2014 / Callice Court, Coventry 2007
LIGHT BLUE
Moonraker Point, London 2012 / Kendrick Hall, Reading 2011 / Greetham St. Portsmouth 2016
PINK
Riverside Point, Nottingham 2006 / The Holt, Loughbrough 2004 / Filbert Village, Leicester 2007
ORANGE
Parkway Gate, Manchester 2008 / Grand Central, Liverpool 2003 / Saw Mill, Huddersfield 2014
RED
The Forge, Sheffield 2005 / Sky Plaza, Leeds 2009 / Manor Back, Newcastle 2010
YELLOW
Exeter Trust House, Exeter 2009 / Central Point, Plymouth 2002 / Purebeck House, Bournemouth 2005
GREEN
The Old Fire Station, Aberdeen 2001 / Kelvin Court, Glasgow 2012 / Chalmers St., Edinburgh 2009
DARK BLUE
Unite House, Bristol 2001 / Waterside Court, Bath 2004
STATIONS
We Care / we Lead / We Unite / We Deliver
UTILITIES
The Core / Swan House
TAXES
Property Tax / Student Loan
COMMUNITY CHEST / CHANCE
Community Chest / Chance
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Popeye: Schlagkr√§ftig!
description:
Striking! A small golf ball and a wide distant target .. No problem for Popeye. Brutus will do everything to stop him and Olivia will stand by her Popeye. Anything is possible at this golf tournament!

A entertaining quick game with coasters. Fun for everyone!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Game play: If there is no own Popeye on the board, one is placed on the tee-off field. The active player rolls with both dice. Each rolled double (2x equal number) now causes the checkered flag to be moved. The rolled number shows where (new target field).

The active player always rolls again after a double. Both rolled results can be used for the movement of figures. At least 1 movement has to be done on a player’s turn. A figure movement takes place with your own Popeye, Olivia, or Brutus.

The rolled numbers 1 to 6 show the possible range of movement on the board. The player will always have 3 possible results after rolling both dice.

Popeye (-balls) are immediately holed when 1 Popeye moves to the checkered flag field with the last step of his current movement (the target field of a movement).

Oliva helps / Repositions Popeye: The coaster on which the Oliva token is currently lying is relevant here. Land a Popeye as the target field of a movement on a free field of this coaster (no matter where, 1 out of 9 possible fields), the player can reposition this Popeye on any field of this coaster.

Brutus prevents / Blocking Popeye(s): The coaster on which the Brutus token is currently lying or being moved is relevant here. All the Popeyes lying there or those, which should be moved on this coaster, cannot move until Brutus is moved down from this coaster again.

Once a player has holed his 3 Popeyes at the end of a full round, that player wins the game.

-description from designer




Schlagkraftig! Ein kleiner Golfball und ein weit entferntes Ziel .. Kein Problem fur Popeye. Brutus wird alles tun, um ihn
aufzuhalten und Olivia wird ihrem Popeye zur Seite stehen. Bei diesem Golfturnier ist alles moglich!

Ein kurzweiliges schnelles Spiel mit Spieldeckeln. Spaß für jedermann!

—description from the publisher (German)

Spielablauf: Befindet sich kein eigener Popeye auf dem Plan, wird einer auf das Abschlagsfeld platziert. Der aktive Spieler würfelt mit beiden Würfeln.
Jeder jetzt erwürfelte Pasch (2x gleiche Zahl) führt dazu, dass die Zielflagge wandert. Die erwürfelte Zahl zeigt wohin (neues Zielfeld). Der aktive Spieler würfelt nach einem Pasch immer erneut.
Beide erwürfelte Ergebnisse können für die Bewegung von Figuren genutzt werden. Mindestens 1 Bewegung muss pro Runde vom Spieler ausgeführt werden. Eine Figuren-Bewegung erfolgt mit dem eigenen Popeye, Oliva oder Brutus. Die erwürfelten Zahlen 1 bis 6 zeigen dabei die möglichen Bewegungsweiten auf dem Spielplan. Dem Spieler stehen nach dem Würfeln beider Würfel immer 3 mögliche Ergebnisse zur Verfügung.
Popeye (-Bälle) werden sofort eingelocht (kommen dann aus dem Spiel), wenn 1 Popeye als Zielfeld einer Bewegung auf das Feld mit der Zielflagge kommt.
Oliva hilft / Neu-Positionierung von Popeye: Der Deckel, auf dem der Oliva-Marker gerade liegt, ist hier relevant. Landet ein Popeye als Zielfeld einer Bewegung auf ein freies Feld dieses Deckels (egal wo, 1 von 9 möglichen Feldern), kann der Spieler diesen Popeye auf ein beliebiges Feld dieses Deckels neu positionieren.
Brutus behindert / Blockieren von Popeye(s): Der Deckel, auf dem der Brutus-Marker gerade liegt oder gezogen wird, ist hier relevant. Alle dort liegenden Popeyes oder welche, die auf diesen Deckel gezogen werden sollen, können sich nicht bewegen, bis Brutus von diesem Deckel wieder runtergezogen wird.
Sobald ein Spieler am Ende einer kompletten Runde seine 3 Popeyes eingelocht hat, gewinnt dieser Spieler das Spiel.

name: Fr√•gekort: Sport & Lek
description:
300 questions & answers and simple rules. The questions are about sport and games. Get 6 right answers before the end, and you've won!

—description from the publisher

name: Trivial Pursuit: Passione Azzurra
description:
This is a custom version of the Trivial Pursuit board game made by the the IP oil company.
All questions are related on the Italian national football team.

—user summary
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Animal Act
description:
Each player starts with an empty game card. Players move their pieces around the board, then draw a playing card with a word on it and follow the instructions for the place they land on. The player acts, sings, or mimes to get the other players to guess the word. If the word is guessed correctly, the player fills the appropriate spot on their game card. A player wins when their game card is filled.

—user summary

name: Bamse: Gympaspel
description:
In Bamses fitness game, you can collect cards by doing different moves together with Bamse and his friends. Playing games and moving around at the same time is good for both your muscles and your mind!
—description from the rulebook (translated)

Players try to collect one card in each of 5 different colours. Roll the coloured die, and if a card in the matching colour is available, do the movement shown to win the card.

Movements are things like:

walk on your toes
walk backwards
lie on your stomach and fly like an aeroplane
run around your friends
hop like a bunny
wriggle forwards like an eel
stand on one leg and pinch your nose
do a jumping jack


—user summary

I Bamses gympaspel ska du samla på kort genom att göra olika roliga gymparörelser med Bamse och hans vänner. Att spela spel och röra på sig samtidigt är bra både för kroppen och knoppen!
—description from the rulebook
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Sports

name: Doom Squad: Three Hundred Years of Special Forces Warfare ‚Äì Solo Wargame Rules
description:
Written by Steve Danes a nerve-shredding game of special forces action that ranges across three hundred years of history. From the time of Napoleon through to the trenches of World War One and right up to special forces operations in the early 21st century. A small team dropped in against the odds. Doom Squad is meant to be played as a solo game system pitting your team against the game engine. You can also opt for a multi-player game of 'co-operation' of two or several players going up against the game.

Your troops will be equipped with the latest high-tech weapons and equipment from their historical or current era; which can mean muskets, rifled carbines or assault carbines with red-dot sights. It all depends on which period you pick. Rules are very simple and easy to use and are based around the use of one or more six sided dice to test for firing and close combat. Players will control one or more special forces squads and will be faced with an enemy that can be tough, disciplined, confused, resolute, unsteady and always unpredictable.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Napoleonic, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War I, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: UNO: High School Musical 3
description:
Celebrate senior year with the students of East High in this special edition of UNO.



Make the underclassmen jealous with the special Graduation card and rule!



And get ready to toss your cap in the air and yell "UNO!" when you are about to make the grade!


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music

name: Stray Cats
description:
Stray Cats is a quick, fun, easy-to-learn card game to bring a home sweet home for cats. Depending on the current active Paw Law, the players may place the right cat in the going home pile. The first player with no more cards on hand is the winner. But not so fast, there are home cards and a few special cards that change the Paw Law and prevent you from entering your cat cards. Plus all the special effect cards are not allowed to play as the Last Card. The game fits for ages 12+ and 2-6 or 2-8 players depending on deck versions.

—description from the designer

name: Battle for Blastoff
description:
Navigate the streets of Earth and be the first to escape! A street smart safety game developed by the Government of Alberta as a tool for teacher's to help students stay safe on the streets.

A tile laying game where you need to move your aliens (safely) around a city, crossing streets, in order for them to reach their mothership and escape home.

—user summary

name: Stock the Gathering
description:
Players are speculators in the stock market.
At the end of the game, the player with the most assets wins.
In the stock market, various events, such as moving the marker or playing event cards, will change the asset value of stocks.
Can you predict the next event and trade to increase the asset value of your stock?
—user summary

„Éó„É¨„Ç§„É§„Éº„ÅØ„ÄÅÊ†™ÂºèÂ∏ÇÂ†¥„ÅÆÂèÇÂä†ËÄÖ„Å®„Åó„Å¶„ÄÅ„Ç≤„Éº„É†„ÇíË°å„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ
„Ç≤„Éº„É†ÁµÇ‰∫ÜÊôÇ„Å´„ÄÅÊúÄÂ§ß„ÅÆË≥áÁî£„Çí‰øùÊúâ„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„Éó„É¨„Ç§„É§„Éº„ÅÆÂãùÂà©„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ
Ê†™ÂºèÂ∏ÇÂ†¥„Åß„ÅØ„ÄÅÊßò„ÄÖ„Å™„Ç§„Éô„É≥„Éà„Å´„Çà„ÇäÊ†™Âºè„ÅÆË≥áÁî£‰æ°ÂÄ§„ÅåÂ§âÂåñ„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åç„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ
Ê¨°„Å´Áô∫Áîü„Åô„Çã„Ç§„Éô„É≥„Éà„Çí‰∫àÊ∏¨„Åó„Å¶„ÄÅËá™ÂàÜ„ÅÆÊ†™Âºè„ÅÆË≥áÁî£‰æ°ÂÄ§„Åå‰∏ä„Åå„Çã„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´ÂèñÂºï„ÇíË°å„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åó„Çá„ÅÜ„ÄÇ
—description from the publisher
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Point to Point Movement, Stock Holding

name: 1968: TET
description:
A few months [before June 2021,] we announced that we would be discontinuing both 1968 & 1987.

These games were designed when I first started the company and frankly, I was in a rush to put out a catalog. Unfortunately I don't think either of these games are up to the quality I want to maintain with CSL so both will no longer be available on our catalog.

If you purchased 1968 and/or 1987, I will provide you with a 20$ discount toward your next purchase.

Finally, I apologize that these games ended up being broken.

—description from the publisher

The 4th title in the Procedural Combat Series (PCS) allows players to recreate the infamous Vietnamese Tet Offensive across Vietnam. PCS is uniquely suited to simulate the conflict given the variable combat strength system being an elegant way of representing asymmetric and conventional warfare on a number of levels.

1968 is arguably the first game in the series to give a player a significant chance of winning through an Automatic Victory. The Vietnamese player is incentivized to string a series of rope-a-dope attacks together forcing the American player to constantly react or recover instead of operating offensively. The American player while having advanced weaponry, fantastic air power, and well-trained units, they lack strategic objectivity making it more difficult to turn success into political consequences/VP.

Random events can play a key role in changing the pacing of the game; like ending a turn prematurely, allowing several spent units to refresh or even exchange combat chits. The Vietnamese player receives material support through the USSR and nuances regarding supply/logistics allow the Vietnamese player a level of strategic and operational flexibility unavailable to the American units, at the exchange of raw power.

WEIGHT: 7/10
SOLITAIRE: 9/10
PLAYERS: 1-2

—description from the designer
categories: Civil War, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Maktkampen
description:
Maktkampen (The Powerstruggle) is a light card game where you and your friends collects points through playful challenges.

But below the surface another game is hiding, where all players secretly tries to influence the behaviour of their opponents using psychological tricks.

Maktkampen is a game that doesn't end when the cards are back in the box. Will you win by keeping your head cool and manage to manipulate your friends, or will you loose yourself when reality and game mixes together?

Be prepared for a laugh inducing, shattering and occasionally shocking experience, signed by Henrik Fexeus - Swedens most famous mentalist and psychological manipulator.

Rules in short:


At the beginning of the game every player gets three cards numbered 1, 2 and 3 (these are used for different challenges), and five red mission cards of which three is kept and two is discarded.
The player whose turn it is takes a blue challenge card and challenges an opponent. If the player succeeds with the challenge the card is placed face down in front of him/her as a point marker. If the player did not succeed the card is placed at the bottom of the blue deck.
Anytime during the game a player can follow the instructions on his/her red mission cards. The card is not revealed until the player succeeds with the mission and is then placed on the table as a point marker. Then the player draws a new mission card.
Blue cards are worth 1 point and red cards 2 points. The first to get 7 points wins the game.


—user summary

name: Emix
description:
Strategic character development card game.

Players act as Emonites, spirits, which infiltrate human's world, feeding by emotions and affecting people's feelings, thoughts and actions.

The goal of the game is to get the most points. Points tracker divided into 2 parts: red and blue, the final score for the player is a difference between them.

During the game players will play cards with various abilities, red cards affect red score, blue cards affect blue score. The difference defines, which track the player will be advancing on.

The game ends after 10 rounds, or if any of the players reaches 100 on either of the tracks.

—user summary

name: The Game of True or False
description: In total, your food travels about 9.1 metres through your digestive system. Is it true or false? Hurry up; you only have a split second to decide in this adrenaline pumping trivia game. Suitable for ages 14+ with three or more players, this true or false game needs fast fingers and a cool head to come out on top. By the way, it’s true that food travels about 9.1 metres in your body. If you knew the answer, did you ring the bell of truth in time?
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Trivia
publishers: Ginger Fox Games, Ginger Fox Ltd., Marks & Spencer

name: Firefly
description:
On warm summer evenings, you, the dancing fireflies light up and appear as sparking lights or long trails. Looking for lustrous stones as the love token to attract your special someone and share together your ephemeral life.

Components
Bush tiles(hexagonal):
• Male firefly tiles x4
• Lustrous stone tiles x8 (1 stonex6 and 2 stonesx2)
• Lantern with one handle tiles x4
• Lantern with two handle tiles x3
• Assigned lantern tiles x4
Player tiles (hexagonal in the 4 player colors)
• Female firefly tiles x4
• Player's lustrous stone tiles x8
• Sparking tiles x4
• Danger marker tiles x4
• Player marker tiles x4
• Points and Special tiles (round)
• Round sparking tiles x4
• Round lustrous stone tiles x24 (1 stone x11 and 3 stones x13)

name: Siste man ut
description:
The game involves skill and luck picking up game pieces from the game board. The player who succeeds in taking the last winner.

On a game board with holes in a 5x5 large grid, the players take turns to place out the colored game pieces in random order.

On a player's turn they can remove one, two or three game pieces. If more than one game piece is removed, everyone must be in the same row, they must sit next to each other and no one must be of the same color.

—user summary

name: I Moustache You A Question
description:
The ultimate facial hair face- off trivia game!

Put on a pair of plastic 'stache specs and grow the longest moustache by correctly answering trivia questions of all shapes and sizes. Choose to answer the adults or kids questions depending on your age!

Will you have stubble trouble or a close shave in this fun family game? Watch out for forfeits! You could end up yodelling, performing dance moves or doing animal impressions.

Whoever has the longest 'stache at the end of the game is hailed the Handlebar Hero!

—description from the publisher

name: Toc! Toc Toc!
description: We need to organize the better party. Children have to pay attention on cards and when they see exactly three Toc! symbols of the same color have to say: "Who is it?" The first, can take a card with an animal who join the party. First reach seven animal will win. Be careful because also the wolf is present in the cards. If you get it, if there are less then two animals you will lose all animals, else nothing happens.

name: Corri Pulcino
description:
It is a game very similar to Uno for children. The card represents poults. Instead numbers and colors they have different postures, different disguises and make different faces. You can discard cards only if one of these characteristics match. There are also some special cards with special effects. First who remains without cards will win.

—user summary

name: Outsider
description:
A quiz game where four items are given, and one of the options does not fit in.

If the players answer correctly before the common factor is revealed, they get 2 points. If they answer correctly after the reveal, they get 1 point.

First player to 15 points wins.

—user summary

name: Tic Tac Tongue
description:
Tic Tac Tongue is a battle of skill and speed between quick-licking chameleons. Numbered insect cards are placed in standees and set in a row between the players. Players don chameleon masks which feature contractible tongues which the play can activate (party blowers). Play starts when a card is flipped over from the deck to reveal a number that corresponds to the insect cards. Chameleon players face off to knock down the correct card. The chameleon that knocks down the most insects the fastest wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Baa Baa Bubbles
description:
In the middle of the green meadow stands Baa Baa Bubbles, the cute little sheep and despite abundant feed supply does not know what to eat! The sheep must be helped, so the players in turn offer him different delicacies from the pasture. Try is about studying! The problem is, the Baa Baa Bubbles sheep has developed a peculiar hayfever, and every time it does something wrong, it sneezes bubbles! Weh that, which was then just with feeding off!

The food tiles lie like a meadow around the sheep, whose back is rubbed with a soapy water before the game starts. Each tile shows a food and a number that indicates how often the lever below the feeding trough must be operated. The mechanics of the lever foams the soap into small blubber bubbles, which gradually collect like a fur around the sheep's body. If the sheep can tolerate the offered food without sneezing bubbles, the player may keep the food tile. If not, bubbles will blow in all directions and the tile will have to be returned. Who has collected the most tiles in the end, wins!

name: Der Herr der Wichtel
description:
In Der Herr der Wichtel, the leprechauns in the deep forest no longer have a ruler, so 2-5 candidates have stepped up to try to become the new Lord of the Leprechauns. To do this, they gather a following of up to four leprechauns around them whose job it is to increase their prestige. They hire Leprechauns from the village square, exchange henchmen with their competitors, and call completely new friends from the drawing stack.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Brainbox: People at Work
description: BrainBox People at Work has 53 cards with interesting facts on people at work and the jobs they do. Each round takes 10 seconds so all players are involved. A game lasts as long as you want it to, 10 minutes is the norm, but playing for 5 minutes is also great fun. BrainBox is educational and is perfect for families and groups of friends to play, wherever they are, on a level-playing field. The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a dice. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept, and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.
publishers: GoKids Áé©Ê®ÇÂ∞èÂ≠ê, Green Board Game Co., KENSHO Kft.

name: Temptation Island: The board game
description:
The moment is finally there, ‘the’ ultimate relationship test starts again and you and your friends are allowed to cause chaos on the island as seducers. You have a clear goal, but are you funny, sexy or intelligent enough to seduce that person. Use every trick you got to surpass your fellow players and ensure an extreme result during a campfire. Are you capable of winning this crazy love game and can you conquer ... Temptation Island?

Temptation Island is a fun party/card game that contains cards, a dice and a game board. The game can be played with up to 6 players. The goal of the game is to collect a certain number of cards. The cards can be obtained by seducing other players with a clever text. Players take turns playing a card that misses a piece of text. Depending on the time of the day, all the other players try to be the funniest, sexiest or smartest player to complete the sentence on the card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Judge, Set Collection

name: Manchukuo: Leaders of Xinjing
description:
Every good master knows it's best to lead from the front! With the Leaders of Xƒ´njƒ´ng expansion, you can join your students out in the field, giving a more direct hand in the action.

Leaders of Xinjing introduces asymmetrical player powers, which come in the form of your leader cards. Choose one of the eight leaders as your master, and assign your school's special leader meeple to tasks alongside your students. While your leader does not contribute its own labor value to the task, it does lend a special ability or quality to your action, and their influence can give you a significant advantage when it comes to recruiting new students!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Manchukuo: Rise of the Resistance
description:
Southern China faces its own troubles. The League of Nations is paralyzed by inaction. It seems that the people of Manchukuo must stand for themselves if they are to survive the occupation.

By adding the Rise of the Resistance content, you and your fellow masters can contribute directly to the efforts of the resistance fighters. Sending supplies and able hands can reward you with great prominence at the risk of garnering further suspicion. The more you and your peers contribute, the better the Resistance will fare, which can turn the tide of the entire conflict!

—description from the publisher

name: Think Words! Spin
description:
Think Words! Spin is the fun, fast-paced game which is simple to play – spin it, name it, take it!
How to Play
There are 7 ways to play Think Words Spin, here’s one of them…

Spin…the spinner until it stops.
Match…the colour to select the category and letter.
Shout…out the answer first to win the card!


—description from the publisher

name: Orchards
description:
In Orchards, each player is trying to produce the best crop of fruit to sell at the market. They will need to plant, grow, harvest and sell at the right time to earn the most victory points.

Players begin the process by planting trees, which may grant them ownership of some of the orchard. Owners earn money whenever someone uses one of their spaces. Each turn the active player chooses a row and column of the orchard and all the trees on these spaces grow fruit. Eventually they will harvest this fruit in order to fulfill orders at the market. The changing seasons modify the value and viability of each fruit, and players may need to collaborate to fulfill an order and sell at the best price. Each order fulfilled earns the players involved victory points and coins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Market, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: AARGH!
description:
AARGH! It is a competitive card game based on the live role-playing events of Survival Zombie, where each player controls a group of survivors whose only mission is simple: get the seals that will make their group escape from the zombie apocalypse. However, the different groups must face zombies, test and incidents using their skills while meeting different characters.

The game consists of 200 cards and markers and offers 3 different types of games:

Survival: Game of 2 to 8 players, initially they will give each player 3 survivor cards and one of modifier. Get 2 stamps to win the game, make it difficult for opponents because only one team will escape the apocalypse. Maximum of 6 cards in hand.

Cooperative: Game of up to 8 players per team, initially 2 players of survivors and a modifier card are given to each player. It consists of playing in the same way as the Survival game, the teams will always be alternate at the game table and the objective will be to get 3 stamps per team. The modifying cards are still secret to the rest of the players, among teammates you can only ask if they have cards of a certain type but not how much they reward or penalize. Maximum 5 cards in hand.

Sudden Death: A game of up to 16 players, initially 1 survivor card and a modifier card will be delivered to each player. Special survivors' cards and encounter cards must be removed from the event deck, as getting stamps is not essential but to survive. Alliances are prohibited, so you cannot help a rival unless you get a benefit from it. Maximum 3 cards in the hand.

—description from the publisher

name: Potu: Underground Adventures
description:
The recently discovered underground continent of Potu is swarming with adventurers after its treasure and secrets, and you're one of them.

The continent of Potu is made of up location cards in offset rows. Each round characters simply choose whether they'll go up or down when going into the next row of cards. If you end up in a location by yourself you're sure to get it, but if you land on the same card as other adventurer's you'll have to fight to see who gets the treasure. You'll need to avoid fruitless battles and use your skills to your advantage to get the most treasure.

Of course each character has something that makes them different, whether that's the Robot who can plan ahead for battles, the Black Cat who can go not just up or down but anywhere, the Professor who gets an extra boost in discoveries, or any of the other characters.

Will you come back with the riches of Potu?

—description from the publisher

name: Money Match Caf√©
description: Match the coin cards to your meals and deliver them to the correct table. Serve all of your meals first to win.

name: Zeus on a Moose
description:
The rhyming charades game with the strange sounding name.

Inside the box you'll come across loads of weird and wonderful rhyming charades. Your job is to describe a rhyme, with your team trying to guess as many as they can in 30 seconds.

name: GUAU!
description:
GUAU! is a fun game for boys from 3-4 years.

In turn, each participant must place a token, and whoever comes first to the spoon will win. Do not forget to shout GUAU!

The game has 80 chips with different categories that will allow players to move forward, backward or find obstacles on their way to the spoon. Whoever comes first will win.


GUAU! es un divertido juego para chicos a partir de los 3-4 años.

Por turnos, cada participante deberá colocar una ficha, y quien llegue primero a la cucha, ganará. No te olvides de gritar GUAU!

El juego tiene 80 fichas con distintas categorias que les permitirá a los jugadores avanzar, retroceder o encontrar obstáculos en su camino hacia la cucha. Quien llegue primero, ganará.

name: Entromancy: Hacker Battles
description:
Entromancy: Hacker Battles is a cyberpunk fantasy tabletop card game for 2 players. In Entromancy: Hacker Battles, you and your friends will take the roles of hackers and engage in fast-paced, strategic card battles to deploy devastating programs and attempt to overcome each other’s security protocols.


Competitive Card Game Mechanics. Draw cards to build and unleash devastating programs upon your


opponents while gaining bit points to overcome their security protocols.

Customizable Gameplay. Choose from five distinct specializations and multiple objective cards for a new experience every time you play.
Expandable Up to 4 Players. Engage in fast-paced 2-player card battles where strategy is paramount to victory, and add extra decks to play with up to 4 players.
TCG Gameplay, Reimagined. Experience strategic card battle mechanics without having to collect extra cards to succeed.


—description from the designer

Set in the Entromancy universe.

name: Speed Charades
description:
Speed Charades is a fun twist on a family favorite. It’s a fast-past, fiercely fun party game that will keep everyone involved and interacting with each other. Team compete head-to-head in a race to act out the words on their cards. The first team to guess 4 of the 5 clues on their card wins the round and scores a point. The team with the most points after ten rounds wins!

It’s ideal for groups because it allows everyone regardless of age to participate. Divide into teams – guys vs girls, adults vs teens, blondes vs brunettes, family vs family, etc. – and let the fun begin.

—description from the designer

name: Èè°„ÅÆËø∑ÂÆÆ„ÅÆ„Éâ„É©„Ç¥„É≥ (Dragon in the Mirror Labyrinth)
description:
This is an asymmetric cooperative game in which two adventurers who have lost their way into the Mirror's Labyrinth, where the dragon lives, and one wizard who tries to trap them in the labyrinth.

‚óÜ ‚óÜ Victory conditions ‚óÜ ‚óÜ

Adventurers win the magic sword and shield hidden in the mirror world and reach the dragon. The wizard wins if 4 wizards appear or change all labyrinths into a mirror world. Compete which is faster.

‚óÜ ‚óÜ The appeal of the game ‚óÜ ‚óÜ

Adventurers can either move or flip the labyrinth tile. The number of actions is determined by the dice, but there is little difference. However, if the numbers are biased continuously, it can make a big difference. Enjoy your luck!

The game system on the adventurer's side is a mix of whack-a-mole, which defeats so many wizards, and treasure hunt looking for weapons. I want to search for weapons quickly, but I can't get used to it because there are so many wizards.

The wizard will win if 4 witches appear, trap the adventurers in the mirror labyrinth! But wizards are so weak that an adventurer can be killed just by passing. Get up again and again!

Adventurers can flip the labyrinth tiles upside down like a mirror. Adventurers can make a path by flipping the labyrinth tiles, even if the road you want to go is blocked. Ofcourse you can flip the labyrinth tiles to keep the dragon away. The wizard will win if all the labyrinth tiles change the mirror world, so let's turn it over.

Dragons that are a threat to adventurers and wizards move randomly according to the cards. The plan can be ruined by the dragon. However, adventurers can restart from the magic square even if they are attacked by dragons, so don't give up until the end!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: KinderPerfect: Naughty
description:
For edgy parents who can laugh at darker kid-centric experiences.

Add these hilarious cards to the main KinderPerfect game for more laughter! 25 Red Question Cards and 75 White Answer Cards. All cards crowdsourced from real parents just like you.

name: Common Threads
description:
Common Threads is the family card game that lets you play four different games with the same deck! Featuring cool characters and colorful graphics, each card in the deck matches in one way. It's up to you to spot the matching elements, play your cards quickly and outsmart your opponents. Cards feature quirky characters -- like a unicorn, robot, dinosaur and more -- dressed in colorful outfits and accessories. Do two different cards show the same character? That's a match. Are two different characters wearing the same color shirt? That's a match. Are two different characters each holding a skateboard? That's a match! But act quickly, because each game is based on how fast you can spot the matching elements. This fast-paced family card game is lots of fun for 7 year olds and up.

-from the publisher's website

name: Qui mange quoi?
description:
The game is set on a farm with eight animals on a board (goat, rabbit, goose, pony, donkey, duck, pig and hen) connected by a path and various food tokens (corn, grain, bread, apple...).

The player goal is feed as much animals with a correct food as possible.

Each player has it's own bucket to carry available food tokens. A roulette is used to choose between movement and feeding actions and "money tokens" are used to count fed animals.

This main game is for two or three players. There are also two more sub-games described in the rule book. One sub-game for 2-4 players consist just of describing randomly drawn tokens. A player who correctly named/described more tokens wins. The second sub-game is a solo game variant of the main game with a target to feed all animals / use all food.

—user summary
mechanics: Action Points, Different Dice Movement, Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Resource to Move, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Stick Six
description:
"Pop Pop Pop Pop Pop Pop! Stick this suction cups to the translucent honeycomb board and try to get six in a row before your opponent!

Start with a giant clear playing board, then start strategizing. You’ll be sticking here and sticking there as you lay out a few options to Stick Six of your own, all while blocking the other players. Whether it’s in a circle, a straight line, or a diagonal – the first player to stick six in a row wins!"

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: „Çø„Ç§„É†„Ç´„Éó„Çª„É´ (Time Capsule)
description:
In „Çø„Ç§„É†„Ç´„Éó„Çª„É´ (Time Capsule), players participate in a number of auctions over several rounds, with 5 nostalgic childhood items being auctioned in each round, one at a time.

In each round, players are given 50-Yen to spend, and may only purchase items up to the maximum satisfaction allowed by their "Satisfaction Gauge".

A few cards have special affects. The player with the most points will win, and points are obtained from winning certain cards, as well as having the most cards of each type of card, such as candy.

name: Zombie Pile-Up
description:
A fast-paced 1 vs 1 Card Game where the first player to match the ammo type to the zombie type wins the point.

This game is best played with 3 people, 2 players and a dealer.

Playthroughs are very fast and 100% skill-based, the winner will be the fasted player who can stay focused for the duration, this is actually very challenging and super fun, especially with more cards.

For each playthrough, you will need 2 players and a dealer. The dealer plays an enemy card and Player 1 & Player 2 must match the symbol on the enemy card with their player card, the first card placed wins the point.

Each player's decks are colour coded and numbered for easy scoring at the end of the game. Player 1 has red backs, player 2 has blue backs.

The dealer plays 1 card at a time from the zombies decks and players must match the symbol on the zombie card with a card from their deck, and do so before the other player.

When all cards are played, the dealer sorts through the pile to score, all the zombie cards Player 1 got to first are handed to player 1, and all the cards player 2 got to first are handed to player 2, players will have a card taken from them for any wrongfully laid cards, and the scores are calculated.

—description from the publisher

name: Salo Helenica Juego de Mesa Mitos y Leyendas
description:
Board game adaptation of the entire classic Helenica set of Mitos y Leyendas (Myths and Legends CCG)

This limited edition game has all necessary accessories (playmats, coin, hourglass) to have a 2, 3 or 4 player game based on the 20 year old strategy collectible card game. This version has all 340 cards from the Helenica era.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology

name: The Collector
description:
When someone doesn’t pay their mini storage bill, the unit is eventually auctioned off to the highest bidder. Retired detective Arthur Dukes just purchased one of these mini storage units in hopes of reselling the contents for a profit. Art was hoping for a big score, but was disappointed to find that he’d won a virtually empty storage unit aside from a single box. However, after opening the box and seeing some of the contents his heart began to race and his palms became sweaty. Instantly, memories from his career with the Valley Falls Police Department flashed before his eyes and he was taken back to the times of tracking down some of the city’s most notorious serial killers. It now appears that a new evil has awoken in Valley Falls.

Difficulty Level: 9/10

name: Random Equal: Matemaattinen seurapeli
description:
Random Equal is a mathematical game for families. Each player is dealt five number cards, and they have to form an equation that holds true. Easier rules are for smaller children, 3 cards, and around 10 year old, 4 cards. Older than that means that all numbers must be used in equations. Operators (+, -, *, /) and parentheses are freely available for all players.

—user summary

name: Dwarf Invasion
description:
A 9-Card microgame from Button Shy games for 1-3 players.

In a reversal of roles, the aliens are the ones being invaded! In Dwarf Invasion you will try to destroy the alien hive that was simply minding its own business, until you came along to rob them of their precious minerals. Watch out, as they will fight back!

Players will need to supply up to 12 6-sided dice.

name: Super Dungeon: Masterclass ‚Äì Formless Hanzo
description:
Hanzo has been called many things over his long and storied life: master, teacher, monster. His team won the Moonlight Tournament twenty-two years ago through legendary speed and infamous cunning. He displayed all these qualities in the Sun Empire, but added another—treachery—for the first and only time, a Kagejima shinobi decided to stay with the Sun Court.

CONTENTS:

1x Formless Hanzo Masterclass Miniature
1x Formless Hanzo Hero Card
1x 25mm Black Base

Take your Super Dungeon hobby to the next level with Super Dungeon: Masterclass! This premium line of resin models is specifically designed for hobby enthusiasts and gamers alike! Featuring Heroes and monsters from throughout the realms of Crystalia, these finely detailed miniatures bring the world of Super Dungeon to life as never before. Each Masterclass miniature includes cards that allow it to be used in your games of Super Dungeon!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Age of the Wolf
description:
A strategy game in which you must lead and grow your wolfpack to be the strongest. Defend your territories and conquer new ones, attacking with your wolves and using other predators to weaken your rivals.

—description from the box
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That
publishers: WOW! (What a World of Entertainment AB)

name: Vespula: Das turbulente Wespenspiel!
description:
Recognize and win the wasp species with speed and skill, just like in flight.
