Are you the fastest wasp of them all? Win your races with speed. But watch out, otherwise you will fly wrong.

Playfully discover the fascinating variety of wasps. It's about fun, speed, a close look and learning wasp species.

Contents: 88 playing cards, 9 "Who are you?" Cards, and game instructions with information on the individual types.

Goal of the game:
All players are workers in a wasp colony. But who is the most hardworking and gets rid of their cards first?
You need to pay attention to all the details and distinguish all the kinds of wasp species as fast as possible.

Put a makeshift "cocoon" into the middle of the game (e.g. a piece of wood) and distribute all cards as drawpiles to the players.

One after the other, each player uncovers the top card of their draw pile and puts it onto their personal discard pile.

If two cards with the same motive are visible at the same time, the two players who own these two cards, need to touch the "cocoon" as quickly as possible.

The player who touches the cocoon first, gives all their uncovered cards to the slower player. This player needs to put all own uncovered cards, as well as the other player's cards back onto their draw pile.

If both players touch the cocoon at the same time, the player who can identify the wasp species first, wins.

Once a player's draw pile is empty, the player skips the uncovering of cards. But they still need to get rid off all open cards on the discard pile.

The game ends when one player got rid of all cards.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Memory, Real-time
publishers: Nieders√§chsischer Landesbetrieb f√ºr Wasserwirtschaft, K√ºsten- und Naturschutz

name: Reel Them In
description:
You are the leader of a small fishing village on the main land of the Trifecta Islands. The fishing season has just begun and the waters are splashing around with the local breeds of fish known as the three most exotic and rarest commodities in the world.

With a small crew of worker boats and your newly acquired captain ship, you must hoist your anchors and set sail so you can; cast out bait, control the fishing areas, improve your catching abilities, influence the market, expand your fleet, fulfill contracts, create profit and earn your way to the top against rival villages when you try and Reel Them In.

Reel Them In is a highly player interactive fishing game where players compete to be the best fishing village once the fishing season ends. The game brings new innovative mechanisms and Board layouts that has never been done before. Everything fits in thematically in a streamlined and moderate strategic manner. New strategies can develop each time you play and with team play variants a whole new level of competition can be discovered.

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Grid Movement, Market, Pick-up and Deliver, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Plumber Pants
description:
Oh no…the plumber is fixing a clog under the sink and he's getting pranked! His pants just might fall down…and that means everyone gets sprayed with water! In this plumber pants game, players take turns raiding his toolbox and loading The tools onto his belt. Be careful! If the plumber's pants fall down on a player's turn, water will spray from the sink, and that player will be out. The only player not to make his pants fall down wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Mickey Mouse Pop-Up Game
description:
One of the four Whitman Pop-Up games. A simple spin and move children's game featuring Mickey Mouse and friends. The board depicts a pop-up rendition of the Magic Kingdom Castle and some hedgerows before the main gate. Use the first spinner to determine your pawn's movement and the second spinner to determine if your horse can jump this turn allowing you to use one of the shortcuts if you are lucky enough to come by one.

—user summary

name: Kinder-Quiz
description: The quizmaster draws a random card, names the theme and the current player chooses a difficulty (1-4). If they answer right, they get points equal to the difficulty. Otherwise, they lose the points. The first player to reach 21 or higher wins.

name: PJ MASKS: Pyjamahelden auf Gangsterjagd
description:
In this cooperative children‘s game, the three heroes need help to drive the villains Luna Girl, Romeo, Night Ninja and his Ninjalinos from the city.

To win the game the three heroes Owlette, Catboy, Gecko need to reach the headquarter of the PJ Masks before one of the villains does.

Each round one die determines which villain needs to be moved and how many pips are available to move one of the heroes.If a hero reaches a field with a villain, all shout „PJ MASKS!“ and bang their fists together. Depending on the hero, there follows a small dexterity element of moving around the table without dropping the standee of the villain from your head (Owlette), back (Catboy) or palm (Gecko).
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dragon Ball: Il gioco in scatola
description:
Roll dice, move on the board in a Monopoly fashion, pick-up a dragon ball when you step on the corresponding square on the board. Encounter NPCs and train them to get rewards, attack other players when your movements end on a square which is currently occupied by them. If you win, you gain the balls they have hoarded so far.
The first player who collects all of the 7 balls wins.

name: Antwerpen
description:
You play this new game on the plan of a real town. Entrepreneurs try to get their corporations off the ground. But look out! The competition is deadly. Everybody wants to build his or her empire in the downtown center. Space is at a premium, the battle for the best lot is fierce. Who's going to make the fewest concessions and become the most successful business operator around town? Accept this challenge and test your business feeling now. GOOD LUCK!

—description from the back of the box (translated)

name: Super Yaniv
description:
This is a game for 2-4 players played over several rounds. The aim of the game is to be the player with the smallest sum in hand by the end of the round. Platers are eliminated if their total reaches over 200 points. Once all other players have been eliminated, the remaining player is the winner. It is a derivative/reimplimentation of Yaniv.

Players begin the game with a hand of 5 cards. On their turn, a player first discards one or more cards from the hand (sets of same cards or runs) and then takes a card from the deck or a previous discard. The main difference from the original Yaniv is the inclusion of tactic cards.

name: Mythic Americas: Aztec & Tribal Nations Starter Set
description:
The Mythic Americas version of Warlords of Erehwon still keeps at its heart a singular objective in mind – to allow for fast-paced and exciting miniature battles upon a standard-sized table between rival forces known as Warbands.
A Warband represents your own band of warriors – courageous humans, blood-thirsty monsters, legendary heroes, and mythological entities from the depths of the darkest myths.

Mythic Americas: Warlords of Erehwon provides a new multi-level, scenario-driven approach to your games.
This approach offers plenty of opportunities to reward tactical play, but at the same time keeps things manageable in terms of the size of forces and space required.
The game still uses ten-sided and Order dice, making for a game with mechanical depth and considerable adaptability.
The Order dice test system, at the mechanical core of Mythic Americas, and an extremely balanced rules set offers Warband leaders great tactical freedom, but the game still offers lots of opportunity for fate and chance to have a say in the outcome of your battles.
But, every experienced general throughout the ages knows that fate and chance will test even the most ingenious battle plan!

This is The Way.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Little Puzzle
description:
A PUZZLE AND COLOUR MATCHING GAME
OBJECT: for a successful fishing trip, you need to catch some whole fish! Who can catch 4 the fastest?
At the start of the game, all 24 half-fish are placed face-up in the middle of the table. Players all play at the same time, and must try to put 4 whole fish together as quickly as they can to win the game. Careful – for the fish to count, you need to find 2 matching halves with the same coloured spot!

+++ An introduction to observation games for toddlers.

—description from the publisher

name: Einkaufen macht Spass!
description:
In this game, the children playfully learn the first quantities and numbers related to shopping.

Each player gets a list which things to shop in a supermarket.
On your turn, you roll the dice and advance as many steps in the supermarket. If you end in front of a shelf in which you find one of the things from your shopping list, you have to name the shelf and the number of things on your list. For example: "I'm standing in front of the fruit shelf and I'm taking three bananas." If you named everything correctly, you're allowed to put the corresponding token on your shopping list.

The player who completes his or her shopping list first, wins.

name: Pro Cycling The Board Game
description:
Pro Cycling The Board Game is 2020’s latest cycling board game, a fun and tactical game from the world of pro series. In the game you have to control a professional cycling team and get the most points by the end of the game. The following game items are available for this.

1. Team organization: From the five-person frame, assemble a four-person team according to the conditions of the race track – for the flat sections SPRINTER, for the mountain sections CLIMBER, and a LEADER who leads the team.
2. PELOTON: The field that is uniquely part of the competition.
3. Track knowledge: Mapping the race track and getting to know the most important action points.
- The colorful lines on both sides of the racing track indicate the difficulty level of the
road and the level of steepness.
- PART SPRINT: You can also earn valuable points during the race.
- REFRESHING POINT: Additional action cards can be drawn.
- BIG FALL, TECHNICAL ERROR: Various disadvantages can be obtained.
4. Game dice and action die: The player makes the moves using the two dice.
5. Action Cards: Action cards can be used to launch actions.
- BREAKAWAY CARD: This card can be used to break away from the peloton.
- ATTACK CARD: It gives the player an opportunity for a quick attack.
- PELOTON CARD: Used to increase the pace of the field.
6. In addition to action cards, other special actions can be used, such as a sprint, helping each other, helping the leader.

The board game is not only for bike fans, but also offers fun for the whole family. The number of players: 2-4 people. The duration of a game is 40-60 minutes depending on the number of players. The rulebook is available in the following languages: Hungarian, English, German, French, Italian, Spanish.

name: Tower Of Pancakes!!
description:
Tower Of Pancakes!! („Çø„ÉØ„Éº„Éª„Ç™„Éñ„Éª„Éë„É≥„Ç±„Éº„ÇØ„Çπ‚Äº) is a trick-taking card game from Japan.

Cute cats love pancakes! Bake pancakes well, serve them, and aim to become the best-selling pancake maker!

There are 4 cats (A to D) waiting to be served pancakes. If they get more than 8 pancakes in a stack, the surplus becomes negative points. Except cat D, who is a glutton, and just makes more stacks of pancakes.

The players have chips of batter which are turned into cooked pancakes. The game follows standard trick-taking rules. The 1st & 2nd winners of the trick supply pancakes to the cats. The loser of the trick cooks their batter into pancakes according to the card they played.

When the tricks are played out, a final score is calculated based upon where players placed their cooked pancakes, minus penalties for over-supply.

The game has two variants in the rules; one for a different style of hand management, and one for an extreme supply of pancakes.
user summary

name: ≈ölƒÖscy Potentaci
description: Card and resource management game about industrialization in XIXth century Upper Silesia. You are taking the role of one of the major Silesian aristocratic houses ( Ballestrem, Giesche, Henckel von Donnesmarck, Hochberg, Schaffgotsch). In-game you have to make 2 actions out of five: Influence, extraction, research, building,exchange. Influence is needed to build more advanced buildings. Research gives cards from the technology deck. These cards are advancement cards or event cards. In the game, you are collecting resources by drawing cards from the extraction deck. You are also expanding your house by raising buildings in different fields. These buildings are giving bonuses to area resources. They are also giving victory points needed to win the game. Exchange lets you trade resources with bank in proportions 1:3 (or 1:2 with the special building). The game ends when any player earns 27 victory points. There are optional variants: with constructing every building, or a faster variant with 21 victory points needed to end the game.

name: Upper Hand
description:
A 9-card game about stacking hands on a baseball bat.


Remember that game where you stack your hands on a bat?!

Players will stack hands, left then right, forming a baseball bat until they reach the end card, and no additional hand can fit under the tip. At that point, final scores are tallied and the player with the most points win.

—description from the publisher


COMPONENTS
1 End of Bat card
6 Player cards
2 Flippable L-R cards with faces on both sides

SETUP
1) Separate the deck into 3 parts:

Place the two double sided cards onto the table with the two hands on the bottom (L-R) and the single hand on top (L). Each card's bottom edge must touch the line on the previous card.
Place the bat end on the other end of the table.
Deal the remaining cards to players as equally as possible.


TURN
On your turn you will do ONE of the below actions:

Place a card from your hand onto the top of the bat (order must always be L then R)
Score the points in the baseball icon on the card that you placed, then take any card from the pile EXCEPT the top card, and all cards below that one.

-OR-

Move a card that is already on the bat, to the top of the bat (order must always be L then R)
Score the points in the baseball icon on the card that you moved, the take all cards from the pile that were below the card that you took.

If you cannot place or move a card, you must pass your turn.

The 2 double sided cardswith the flip icon can be flipped over before they are placed, in order to change the hand.

END OF THE GAME
The game ends when all players cannot fit a card under the end of the bat, and pass their turns.

The last card to fit under the end of the bat line, gets 1 bonus point.

Cards in hand are worth negative points based on the number in the bottom corner. The player with the highest score wins.


Released in the October 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

name: Dupa biskupa
description:
The party game known as Dupa biskupa can be played with any set of cards and any number of players, over any number of rounds. There is one general rule; the more players there are, the more cards are required.

The game starts with cards being dealt so that each player receives the same amount. Starting from the first, players lay down cards in such a way that everyone can see the card. Having laid the card, the player has to perform a certain action established before starting the game, and corresponding to the suit and rank of the card. Some suits or ranks require that the player perform no action.

Player who perform the wrong action, or fail to perform one when required, is obliged to take the pile of cards.

The winner of each round attributes a way of acting to other cards in the next round, but the actions for queens, kings and aces remains the same.

The first player to empty their hand wins the game.

name: World Business
description: A Monopoly clone.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: Order-Up: Burger Edition
description: Order-Up: Burger Edition is a fast, fun, burger-matching card game that is perfect for the whole family. Race against your fellow cooks to complete five orders, but don't forget to yell "Order-Up!"

name: Balance the Baker
description: Take turns piling on the pastries but don't let the baker drop it all or you lose. 1+ players. Includes wooden baker, 6 pie pieces, 4 cake pieces, and 3 croissant pieces.

name: „Ç¨„Éñ„É´ „É¨„É¢„Éç„Éº„ÉâÔºàGaburu Lemonade)
description: Gaburu: Lemonade is a competitive two-player card game in which players use their cards to vie for food markers. A battle occurs when both players have placed three cards in the same row. Players total the values of their cards in that row, and the player with the highest total claims that row's food marker. The player who claims the most food markers, or who manages to break their opponent's egg, wins the game.

name: #Maradj Otthon!
description:
#Maradj otthon! ("Stay Home") is a simple and fast-paced party game that is great fun for all ages. The original game was created by Ms. Lenhardt Kwaysser Fatime, winner of the 2020 Super Teacher Award, during her quarantine for her own class, and was later further developed with the help of the Blue Game. The year 2020 has left us with a lot of bad feelings and memories, but it is important that we can laugh despite the difficulties.

The goal of the game, which can be played by 2-6 people, is to preserve our cold blood and overcome the obstacles in front of us in the constantly changing conditions. Collect all 19 points! During the game, they could step on a special game board that could change at any moment, creating a whole new situation for the players. When collecting points, don't forget about the mask and hand sanitizer! Funny quarantine cards will help or hinder us during our mission.

If we come together from time to time to defeat the virus together, we can also play with the semi-cooperative game mode: here too we collect points for ourselves, but in the meantime we also have to pay close attention to the threatening virus so that it does not outgrow us! We can only defeat it by working together together if we are willing to make sacrifices and give up the points we have already earned. In the game, we tried to smuggle a lot of humor in addition to the current problems, to solve the limitations and annoyances of everyday life.

Masks produced, have fun!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Gridball
description:
Gridball is a 2 player game, based on a futuristic fantasy sport. The game is played on an isometric grid, you control a team of 4 players, positioned on the gridline intersections. During a game turn, your team has an allocation of 3 actions, with these action you can choose to Move a player, Check an opponent player, Load the ball or Fire the ball.

The objective of the game is to Fire the ball into your opponent's goal zone. Points are awarded once this happens. The team with the most points at the end of the 30 minute game period are declared the winners.

-description from publisher

name: Great Retreat
description: An wargame on the First Battle of the Marne in 1914 during World War I.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Liar's Clue
description:
Liar's Clue is played using six number and six court cards from a standard deck and a reference sheet for each player. Six hands each consisting of one number and one court card are dealt: one to each player, one face-down on the table, and one face-up on the table. The object of the game is to deduce the cards in the face-down table hand.

On a turn a player asks an opponent any question about their hand that they want, as long as it can be answered with "yes" or "no." However, the player being questioned does not necessarily tell the truth - the reference sheet tells them whether to tell the truth or to lie, based on which number card they have and which player is asking the question.

name: N√§hd√§√§n T√§l Pual Jokke
description:
Trivia game about one of Finland's major cities, Turku. The game has 936 questions and is suitable for everyone who wants to learn more about Finland's former capital, Turku.

The name of the game refers to the old saying in the Turku dialect meaning "This side of the river" (as opposed to "The other side of the river") and refers to the river Aura which splits the city in two, into "old" and "new" parts. "This side of the river" is the old part with the cathedral, old city halls and market square etc., while the actual city center is now in the new part "on the other side".

The game is basically the Turku edition of N√§hd√§√§n kellon alla!, the original version set in Helsinki.

name: Escape game: Winter is Coming
description:
During a strategic and diplomatic meeting between the delegations of each opposing power in Westeros (the King in the North and the Mother of Dragons), the castle is attacked by the White Walkers. Your time is running out as the ice boulder blocking the room entrance is is gradually melting.

A secret passage out of the room is hidden somewhere, will you find it in time? Will you put your political disagreements aside and work with your enemies in order to have better chances at survival? Live the moment as if it were your last, because if you can't fend off the White Walkers in 1 hour, you may well become one ...

This escape game can be played in two teams or as one collaborative group. One player needs to be Game Master and hide riddles and clues in two IRL rooms.

Contents:

1 organizer booklet containing explanations of setting up the game, pledges and answers

2 "mission" sheets with the summary of the rules of the game

41 puzzle cards and tips

10 special "Characters", "Bonus" and "Malus" cards

24 envelopes to hide
categories: Deduction, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Puzzle, Real-time

name: Il Gioco della Fattoria
description:
How does a farm work? How is organic honey produced? Who knows what are the ripening times of the tomato or how the vine is grown? Learning the rhythms and mechanisms of agriculture, the good one, and discovering the healthiest and quality foods by playing.

The players are called to face the tests of the game in four different categories: Vegetable Garden and Orchard, Olive Grove and Vineyard, Organic Agriculture and Farm Animals. Each category corresponds to a test, which will lead players to have to answer questions, mimic or draw, or play memory or misspelled words.

The farm game can be played individually or in teams and the winner will be whoever has obtained at least three points in each of the four categories.

—user summary
mechanics: Acting, Line Drawing, Memory, Paper-and-Pencil, Spelling

name: Visual
description:
Who is the fastest to find a pair of identical figures, rotated, reflected or of the same color?
An addicting action game that trains the alertness and visual-spatial skills of young and old!

The deck of cards is shuffled and one half is taken, which is placed in the center of the table, with the side of the figures covered (played with half a deck). One of the players deals one card each. Each player looks at the card and reveals it, placing it straight (not oblique) in front of him (attention: once positioned it must not be moved until the end of the game). The player whose turn it is then takes the top card of the deck and places it face down in the center of the table: this is the bank card. He then reads the quiz on the new top card of the deck and turns over the dealer card. The goal of each competitor is to conquer the bank card just discovered, solving the quiz indicated on the top card of the deck before the others. The quizzes are expressed in such a way that each player must find a correspondence between a figure on his card and a figure on the bank card (see example). The first to find the right figures takes the dealer card (you have to be quick!) and shows the correct match. A competitor may take the dealer card even if he believes that between his card and the dealer card there is no correspondence required by the quiz card. In this case he declares: "None!" We then proceed to check: if the player has made the right observation, he wins the bank card; otherwise he leaves the game and cannot re-enter until the end of the game. The game continues in the same way, changing the dealer every turn.

Whoever has the most cards when the deck runs out wins. Attention: the player who leaves the game keeps the cards won, which are counted in his final score.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game
mechanics: Matching, Memory, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Super Dungeon: Masterclass ‚Äì Krampus
description:
With a strength of 3B 2G and a will of 2R 2G, Krampus is well-equipped to destroy any Hero. It has a lower armor than most dungeon bosses, but this is compensated for with its abilities.

You’ve Been Naughty shapeshifts any Hero that scores a critical against him into a Naughtie, turning his low armor into a potential asset as Heroes are more likely to score criticals. Once some Heroes have been transformed, Nom Nom Nom! allows the Krampus to heal whenever he destroys a Naughtie.

The first action available to Krampus is Into The Bag. This devastating attack renders the target Immobile and Hexed, making its next activation difficult as it struggles to move or attack (it’s hard to move when you’re stuck in a sac, after all).

The next action is the Grabbing Stick, which allows Krampus to move the target with compel, potentially setting it up to perform an attack for the Consul because with the final action, Make Mischief, the Krampus can force the Heroes to attack each other if they have been turned into Naughties!

The Krampus's Boss Fight card help's ensure that at least one Hero will always suffer the fate of being transformed into a Naughtie thanks to Caught Red Handed. This ability also provides a fun interaction with Kringle's own Nice List ability. Run Free, Children turns the Heroes upon themselves, allowing the Consul to use Naughties to attack the party.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Roll Business
description:
Roll Business is a write and roll game for 1-8 players. Play is simultaneous so there is no downtime between players. Roll Business is video conference friendly too. All that is required is a printout of the game sheet and 5 six sided dice per player. If you don’t have that many dice you can use a dice rolling app or even free random number generators. You will mark the game sheet with pencil or you can laminate the sheet and use a dry erase marker.

You will compete over several rounds in the game. At the end of each round you will see how well your movie does at the box office and if you win any awards. The winner will be the player with the most prestigious career.

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Re-rolling and Locking, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Burning Bakery
description:
Marcelo, our town’s baker, has lost his 5 senses and can’t go on making bread. Shall we help Marcelo to recover his....

Sight, so the bread doesn’t burn?
Touch, to knead the bread and make it spongey?
Smell, so the bread’s aroma can tell him that it’s ready?
Taste, so the bread is neither very salty nor very sweet?
Hearing, so he can hear the oven’s bell on time?


It's a cooperation game where all the players should help Marcelo to recover their senses, for that, the players should take from the bag some of the wooden pieces with the different senses and then match with one of the cards which you can perceive with the sense you took from the bag, if it match, you win the sense, if not, you put the sense on the bag again. But if you take from the bag the flame, then the bread start to burn in the oven, if you take the flame 5 times before you recover the 5 senses, then all the players lose, otherwise win.

—description from the publisher

name: Blitz Champz
description:
Blitz Champz is a competitive card game that aims to teach and test football knowledge and strategy.

The game is played using a deck containing offensive, defensive, and continuation cards. Players take turns. On each turn, they first draw a card, then play a card. An offensive card can be played to score points. A defensive card can be used to cancel the points just scored by the previous player. Continuation cards can be played to draw new cards, or to trigger a special effect - reversing the play order, or forcing the next player to skip their turn.

The first player that reaches 21 or more points without the next player bringing their score down again, wins the game.

—user summary

name: EXIT Adventskalender Kids: Dschungel-Abenteuer
description:
To find the right door for the following day, the puzzle of the day must be solved. This can be found on each of the detailed illustrated cards in the tray. Find the solution and thus the symbol of the following door. In this exciting Advent calendar, children from the age of 6 can immerse themselves in the Exit world full of puzzles and secrets. A total of 24 entertaining tasks lead through an exciting and unforgettable adventure into the depths of the jungle. Only those who crack the picture puzzle of the day and find the symbol for the following door will get closer to the secret of the jungle.

This is the mission: the world-famous naturalist Professor Humbelhopf travels into the jungle in search of very special species of monkeys. At his side you will meet numerous animals and have to face exciting challenges. Every day there is a new task to pass. The adventure is considered successfully completed when the entire band of monkeys has been collected. Who dares the eventful journey of exploration into the wild jungle?

name: Cat-Astrophe
description:
Have stacks of fun with purrrfect kitties to stack as high as you can. Will you be able to balance them all or will the game end in cat-astrophe?

Challenge yourself or take it in turns with friends to stack those kitties. Make sure to stay pawsitive and keep a steady hand. Be warned, if you make the stack tumble, you're meeeeowt!

name: Trapped: The Zoo
description:
Escape Room Game Pack
Series 1, Room 5
Difficulty level: EASY

TRAPPED turns any room into a family-friendly escape-room adventure... Each game is loads of fun as you move around the room actively solving puzzles and decoding clues. Every pack is different and contains everything you need to create your very own escape room experience. Packed with loads of content including clues to solve and puzzles to crack, all you need to add is family or friends to play and the cunning to escape/live the dream!

The Zoo: Find the Meerkats! In The Zoo, it’s the day you’ve been waiting for: your annual trip to the zoo! Excited, you upgrade your ticket to include a Personal Meerkat Experience. Under strict instructions to stay in the enclosure, the zookeeper leaves you to play with the meerkats. But wait! You do need to get your camera...A few seconds outside won’t hurt, surely? When you come back: disaster! The gate is ajar, and all eight meerkats are running into the distance! Now your team has a mission: work together, solve the puzzles and catch the meerkats! The future of the zoo is in your hands.

name: Crash & Grab
description:
You are the captain of a flying saucer who has crash landed on Earth You must gather enough crewmembers to operate your ship, abduct the leader of Earth, and escape before your opponents can do the same. It supports 2-6 players and takes less than 45 minutes.

Your ship will require an Engineer, Scientist, Doctor, and Pilot to be fully operational. You will have to locate them and then pick them up using pre-planned movement. Getting your original crewmembers will be ideal, but anyone will do.

Each round, all players simultaneously choose a movement card from their hand to play on their turn that round. You will also place accelerator and decelerator tokens on the board to either help your own saucer maneuver or or to mess with your opponents' plans. By the time you actually execute your movement card, the board may have changed, which leads to hilarious mistaken movements and collisions.

You will also gain energy throughout the game, which will power up ship upgrades, giving you unique powers as the game progresses, which will likely influence the best strategy for you to use in the middle and end game.

Will you be the first to grab the leader of Earth and escape the planet?!
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Movement, Modular Board, Programmed Movement, Race, Set Collection, Square Grid, Take That, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Set-up

name: Bible Match It Link It
description:
Bible Match It Link It is played with 57 unique octagonal tiles. Each tile has eight images, one on each edge of the octagon. On any 2 Bible Match It Link It tiles, there is always 1 (and only 1) matching image. The 4 exciting ways to play Bible Match It Link It are all super easy learn: Match It like “Snap!” then Link It like “Dominoes”.

Game 1: Lightning Links
Match It to win tiles and Link It to your own tiles. The player with the most linked tiles wins the game!

Game 2: Frenzy
In the first round, all players begin with 3 tiles. The first player to match and link all of their tiles wins that round and gets 1 token. Players who have won tokens must start subsequent rounds with more tiles. The player with the most tokens at the end of the game wins.

Game 3: The Big Picture
In this cooperative game, everyone works together to match and link all 57 tiles.

Game 4: Four in a Row
Tiles are arranged faceup in a 5×5 or 6×6 grid. To win, players must connect 4 of their colored tokens in a straight line, either horizontally, vertically, or diagonally.

name: Shut Up!
description:
The goal of Shut Up! is to crush the morons you so generously call your ‘friends’ in a glorious battle of wits.
What you’ll need: Just the cards and a minimum of two hapless fools for you to dominate (meaning 3 or more players).

Shut Up! is played in a series of short matches, and each match is broken into two rounds. Think of it like a series of short boxing matches, but with less punching. Usually."

Players are dealt the cards per the Set-up. One player designated as a judge flips over a blue care with a "Judgement" on it. Players then play green cards as fast as possible as only the first two played are accepted by the judge. Players then argue their card choices to the judge who may then ask for a red "Modifier" card to be played by the chosen players. The judge makes a final ruling on whose cards best describe the blue card played. The winner is awarded the blue card. The role of "Judge" for the next round is awarded to the winner. After a predetermined number of rounds by the players, the player with the most blue cards is the winner.

name: Word Stax
description:
In Word Stax, players build stacks of cards, trying to find words that fit an increasing number of conditions. Each card in hand gives players 2 choices of conditions to add to the conditions on the word stax in play. The more conditions, the more the stax are worth. If they can think of a word or phrase that fits all the conditions, they can claim the stack and all its points…for now! Players are aided by special cards which allow them to manipulate the stax and claim them for their own!

GAMEPLAY

5 cards are laid on the table representing the intitial stax (7 for a 3 or 4 player game), and each player holds 3 cards and 5 cubes in their hands. On a turn, a player places a card such that one additional condition is added to the stack. The player says a word that fits all the conditions of the stack and claims it for their own by placing a cube on the stack, then draws a new card. Claimed stacks can be claimed by other players if they can add a card to the stack. Special cards allow players to perform other actions such as swap, remove, or rotate cards. If a player cannot play on a stack, they discard a card from their hand and lose a cube permanently. When all players have either run out of cubes or cards to play, the game ends and each player recieves points for their claimed stax.

Word Stax was an entry in the 2021 54-Card Game Contest, where it placed 4th for best solitaire game, and 6th overall.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Word Game

name: Dungeon Ball Legend
description:
Take your team to the championship and become the best quarterback in the league along the way. This solitaire game is a mashup of the Dungeon Ball theme and the Hunted system.

Dungeon Ball Legend can be played in two modes: Exhibition (one game) or Season (six games). In each game, you’ll attempt to guide your team to victory by scoring more points than your opponent, and you’ll try to rack up as many highlights as possible to gain votes in the race to win the Hegzug Trophy (it’s kind of like the Heisman…).

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Print & Play, Sports
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Erforsche den K√∂rper
description:
The box contains 2 cooperative games and a memory game that use an ingeniously simple scanning method to illuminate the human body. The "scanning device" is slid between a black background and one of 4 differently printed foils. The "scanning device" consists of a handle and a white square that brightly highlights parts of the foil. These highlighted parts are now to be associated with individual plates that show exactly the same parts.

The winner of the memory game is the person who collects the most tiles.

The other two cooperative games are won together when all the tiles have been distributed.
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: The Alphabet Game
description:
Player go around the table saying a word that matches the theme that also starts with the next letter of the alphabet! If you mess up, you'll have to take a trick card that makes your next round harder.

Once all players have taken a trick card or you get to Z, a new round begins. When all of the trick cards have been taken, the player with the fewest trick cards wins the game!

name: Things on a Hamburger
description: This game contains a deck of cards with various categories to guess, like "parts of a bicycle" or "superheroes," and a single short rules card. Play is in teams, whether one-with-one or bigger, and a timer is suggested but not required. Whoever gets the most correct answer, wins.

name: Svenska spr√•ket
description: A educational quiz game about the Swedish language.

name: Oganika: KIDS
description:
A 36 card pack with a themed developmental thread to lead the puzzler through a variety of puzzles revealing principles and developing understanding of the Oganika tile set.

It challenges children to create animals and funny faces.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement
publishers: Blood Moon Games Ltd, NewRoads Gaming

name: The Santa Claus Game
description: They race around Santa's Workshop trying to load their sleigh with 5 toys. Once a Santa has 5 toys, they fly off to the town to deliver the toys. Along the way, Santas encounter fun activities like belting out their best "HO HO HO" or Singing their favorite Christmas carol. The first Santa to deliver all their toys wins the game.
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: 5 sekund junior
description: Special Edition is another installment of the crazy and fun family game 5 Seconds Junior. In this version of the game, the questions were created by kids and parents with little and big players in mind!

name: Na jagody: moja pierwsza gra
description:
The heroes of the Baby Boomers and Teddy Bear series set off on a forest adventure, picking delicious berries along the way. How many berries will they be able to collect before they reach Teddy's hut? Simple rules, spacious game board and large wooden elements make the game perfect for beginning the adventure with board games. Great fun in the company of characters loved by the youngest.

Colorful board, large pieces and spacious house make the game more attractive for children. Instead of pawns, wooden characters move around the board, so children can impersonate their favorite fairy tale characters. A standard die with dots is replaced here by a multicolored wooden dice, so even toddlers who can't count yet can play their first board game.
The manual also encourages players to play the cooperative variant, in which all players collect berries to a common basket. This way, rivalry will be eliminated from the game and the little player can focus on having fun, enjoying the time spent together and teaching cooperation.

—description from the publisher

name: Astralis
description:
Astralis is an abstract, space odyssey, area-control strategy game for two players, played on a hex-hex 8 gameboard. Each player starts with one colony ship pawn and 30 planets stones. Players share 169 double-sided control tiles and 60 contested tiles.

On a turn, a player must move his or her ship pawn one or more hexes, in any one of the six standard directions, to any hex not containing any stone or the opponent's pawn. Pawns may pass over any hexes not containing an opponent's stone or pawn. Pawns can pass over owned stones. Control tiles never impede movement and simply indicate ownership of a hex.

When a pawn reaches its destination hex, the player may place a control tile and an owned stone on top in any one of the empty hexes adjacent to the pawn that is not adjacent to any other stone.

For each hex adjacent to a placed stone, if the hex is not adjacent to any opponent stone, place a control tile own-side up in the hex; and if the hex has one or more adjacent opponent stones, replace the opponent’s control tile with a contested tile.

The game ends when all hexes contain a control or contested tile. To determine the winner, players count the number of control tiles they have on the board. The second player adds a komi of 3.5 points to his total. The player with the highest total wins.

—description from the designer

name: Audimat
description:
Choose one of four location (yacht, loft, villa, deserted island).
Each player chooses one of eight clothing and accessory card.

The show is about to start.
You play as TV show contestants, in a Big Brother style show:
The Production manages everything, you can't leave the set and cameras are rolling day and night.

Read the few rule cards: Big Brother is setting up the boundaries.
Then take turn reading and answering question cards. This is Big Brother summoning you in isolation to answer private questions.
The story will grow, one card, one answer at a time. Before you know it, an exciting story will unfold, filled with plots, backstories, partnership and betrayals.

You'll need to vote your rivals out but beware: the eliminated contestants still participate in votes (representing the viewers' vote).
Can you be the last one standing?
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation, Party Game

name: Dragonball Z: Lo Scontro Finale
description:
Iconic characters from the Dragon Ball saga begin their search of power in various places (i.e. picking up power-up tokens from locations across the board), each trying to boost their own martial skill.

When a player reachs the total of 27 points between all his character's stats, he can announce a tournament!
The others then fight in duels amongst them, trying to eliminate each other, following a matching rank based on their respective character's stats: fourth fights against third, the winner fights against second, winner gains the right to challenge the first. He who can prevail in the tournament's final, is the most powerful warrior!

From the back of the box:
"Un percorso appassionante alla conquista delle sette Sfere del Drago"
("An epic journey conquering the seven Dragon Balls")
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Back To The Future: Time Travelling Board Game
description:
Travel through the saga timeline. Roll the dice to decide your travels to the past or back to the future!

Similar game play to Snakes & Ladders. Roll the dice and follow the actions required by any cards or events on the board spaces. The first one to the end of the path wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Action/Event, Events, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pie Y'all
description:
Try not to get pied in this game of Pie Y'all from Ridley's Games!

In this fun-filled, family-friendly twist on the classic game of Sh*thead, don't be the one left with pie on your face!

On your turn, try to play a card of equal or higher value if you can, and if not you need to pick up the entire discard pile.

The object of the game is to not be the last person to be rid of all your cards, so you'll want to try to give away as much pie as possible!

Be sure to keep a pie out for several upper crust cards like the Key Lime Pie-rate and the Lemon Buff Pastry!

Perfect for pie enthusiasts, families, and groups of friends, it comes in a sweet pie illustrated tin and is suitable for ages 8+, 2-5 players, and has an average 15 minute gameplay.

—description from the publisher

name: Splito: Goodie 42
description:
The back of this card is an additional common objective, added at the start of the game alongside the other two.

When at the end of a round the sum of the Splito cards of an area reaches exactly 42, this objective is placed in the area in question.
It is definitively validated and the area can receive other Splito cards.

If several areas reach this amount at the same time, this objective is discarded.
mechanics: Alliances, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Bake It Happen
description:
In Bake it Happen, play as a baker collecting and trading ingredients to cook recipes while trying to prevent other bakers from doing the same. To win, have the highest score when the Time's Up card is flipped.

On your turn, make trades with other players and complete recipes. Then end your turn by drawing more ingredients from the deck. You can also play special ingredients for their action instead of using them in a recipe. When the Time's Up card is drawn, the game is over and whoever has the most recipe points wins!

—description from the designer

name: Grandpa's Great Escape Board Game
description:
The World of David Walliams brings you The Twilight Towers Amazing Break-out Board Game! This beautifully designed 3D game brings to life the best-selling book by David Walliams. Is it the end of days for Jack’s rather confused grandpa or can you help him ESCAPE the evil clutches of the Twilight Towers! It’s a race to save the old folk from the evil clutches of Miss Swine, the hideous matron that will happily zip you with her cattle prod! Climb the overhanging willow tree, take a wide berth to miss the ‘not so lovely’ nurses, then take to the skies aboard a World War Two RAF Spitfire whilst being chased down by the deadly German Messerschmitt! Be the first player to bring home Jack and the old folk in this fast, exciting cat-and-mouse style game for two to four players, based on the best-selling book from David Walliams. This fantastic, easy play, 3D family board game and is perfect for 2-4 players age 7 years and over.

—description from the publisher

name: Monopoly: DPR Construction 25th Anniversary Edition
description:
In 25 short years, DPR Construction has grown into one of the nation's top technical builders with offices around the country building great things for some of the most progressive and admired companies in the world. In celebration of this milestone anniversary, the MONOPOLY brand is proud to present the MONOPOLY: DPR Construction 25th Anniversary Edition of the world's most famous board game! Increase work without competition on DPR projects while you build structures from site work to completion. Draw "Culture" and "Critical Success Factors" Cards along the way as you negotiate to dominate the market and won it all. Grab your favorite DPR-themed token and advance to GO!

Tokens include: Wine Bottle, Safety Cone, Key, Construction Hat, Boots and DPR Truck.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: Linehauler
description:
The ultimate transport game putting you behind the wheel.

Like many drivers in real life your Linehauler career starts with a Rigid Truck. You'll draw Manifest Cards as you play, which show your destination, cargo and the amount you’ll make. Sometimes special instructions will apply and you will need a Pilot or an Escort, you might also draw the Wide Load or Dangerous Goods Loads, which will require a permit. The Pay Day and Fifth Wheel Cards will also test your luck with bonuses and penalties.

This game is not just pick-up and drop-off, along the journey you’ll get to own the services that support the road transport industry. These income-producing properties include Fuel, Mechanical, Pilot Services, Seaports and even Airports.This game is not without challenges, with stoppages and detours, fire, floods and restrictive tunnels and bridges occupying the board and sometimes forcing heavily-laden drivers around alternate routes.

Race your competitors around Australia to become the first person to own a Road Train and return to the nearest Capital City, and be crowned Linehauler Champion!
mechanics: Events, Ownership, Pick-up and Deliver, Race, Track Movement

name: Tin Man
description:
A race game for 1-4 players, included as part of the press kit for the Sci-Fi Channel's miniseries "Tin Man" (a dystopian reimagining of "The Wizard of Oz"). Players can play as the main characters D.G., Glitch, Wyatt, or Raw, each of whom is depicted with a solid metal figurine, as they search for the Emerald of the Eclipse.

The game is composed of a folding 19.5 inch board, four pewter figurines, one six-sided die, a rule sheet, and a stack of 20 full-color cards.

name: Lands of Oz
description:
The wicked witches are dead and the lands of Oz are free from tyranny! Surely there’s no place like home, but in the meantime, maybe Dorothy would like to visit Winkie Country? Collect the right tokens and play your cards right, and maybe Tin Man will join you in Quadling Country.

In this family friendly game, each player represents one of the lands of Oz. Each round, players will draw a card and play one from their hand. Depending on which card is played, they will gather tokens of various types. If they collect the most tokens of a given type, they will attract heroes to their lands and score points. After the entire deck of cards has been played and all players have had an equal number of turns, they will score points and declare a winner!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Set Collection

name: Bart Simpson Kartenspiel
description:
An easier variant of Rummy played with 110 "The Simpsons"-themed cards.

The game has the groups of cards: number-cards from 1-5, family-cards (Homer, Marge, Bart, Lisa, Maggie) and non-family-cards (Gramps, Otto, Krusty) in 4 different colors. In addition there are 6 jokers.

Even though the general game flow is similar to Rummy - with the exception, that the whole discard deck needs to be taken instead of the top cards - the allowed combinations differ:

Laying out cards allows any combination of all-different cards out of two of the three groups mentioned above. Having all in the same or all in different colors gives extra-points.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: –¶–∏–≤–∏–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è. –í–∏–∫–∏–Ω–≥–∏. –ü–µ—Ä–≤–æ–æ—Ç–∫—Ä—ã–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª–∏ (Civilization. Vikings. Discoverers)
description:
The Viking attack was like a natural disaster. They appeared suddenly, rapidly attacked villages and towns, seizing property and land. But the inexhaustible desire of the Vikings to get land, wealth and fame across the sea drove them to explore unknown seas, discover and settle lands again and again...

The participants of the game are Vikings who sail the seas, fish, hunt whale and walrus, extract sable and bear, sell dried fish, sable skins, walrus tusk, amber and other goods.

They attack settlements, take tribute from them, discover new, unexplored seas and lands, and each of them dreams of building a fleet of seven ships and becoming a powerful Viking leader - king.

The game presents four variants of the rules, which become more complicated as you master the gameplay, with visual diagrams and tips for players. Feel like ancient Vikings, feel the romance of the sea and the passion of exploring new lands.
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Take That

name: Das Geheimnis von San Marco
description:
Das Geheimnis von San Marco ("The Secret of San Marco") is an escape game full of riddles and puzzles that consists only of cards.

A stranger has called the players into the state library of Venice to entrust them with an ancient legacy. A mysterious manuscript is hidden somewhere in San Marco. Can the players solve all the riddles and puzzles to reveal the hiding place and thus prove themselves as worthy heirs?

How to play:
The players' adventure takes place in the library. All 77 playing cards contain a riddle to be solved. As soon as the players have solved all the riddles on the cards, they have to face one last challenge: where is the secret manuscript hidden?

By the way: The game material remains intact and can therefore be used again and again.

name: Mikey Wonder Land
description:
In Mikey Wonder Land, the players are running a theme park and need to make sure that the park's mascots do not appear in more than one area at once, or it will ruin the children's dreams that the characters are real!

The game begins at level 1, and there are 2 characters the children are looking for. Each player simultaneously reveals a character from their hand. If more than one player reveals one of the target characters, they receive failure chips. This process of revealing and checking for failure is repeated until the players are out of cards.

At the end of a round, if one player has at least 4 failure chips, the game is over and the player with the least failure chips wins.

Otherwise, increase the level and play another round. If the players make it to the end of level 6, they all win.

name: –û—Ö–æ—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–∏
description:
–û—Ö–æ—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–∏ (Hunters) is a family board game, where each player need to trace a prey on prehistoric hunt. When a player turns a tile, he compares the power of animal and hunter. It's a world of saber-toothed tigers, woolly rhinos and a tribe of hungry hunters.

The game hase three modes: competitive, cooperative and command. All the tiles are placed on the table, this is a hunting field. A player makes following actions:

1. Turns over 2 tiles on the hunting field.
2. Evaluates the results of hunt. If it's possible, make additional actions.
3. Take the tiles, if the hunt was successful (matched), or turn back the tiles, if the hunt was unsuccessful.

A player wins in competitive mode if he has more hunted tiles or has the highest values of tiles. In cooperative mode, players need to collect a certain number of tiles in 30 rounds.

name: Monstre Toi
description:
OBSERVATION GAME
A group of monsters has just arrived. Please help them
get into their dormitories by matching them up 5 by 5
based on their distinctive marking. Enjoy your stay!

Each player in turn will try to find the common characteristic of the 5 visible monsters. The yellow arm? 4 pink legs? a scar? The first player to find the common element wins the round. The first player to win 3 rounds wins the game.

-description from publisher

name: Gold Crush: All that is Gold is all Yours!
description:
Gold Crush is a 2-4 player adventure board game. The first player to reach the treasure at the center of the board wins. On your wild west adventure, collect Power cards to help you win, Defense cards to defend yourself, and Resource tokens to make more Power and Defense cards. Not to miss: watch out for Traps, Landmines and Opponents who are ready to attack you

Players move through the board by rolling the dice. On the journey as they step on power, defense and resource tiles the players collect power cards, defense cards and resource tokens respectively.

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Champions ‚Äì Death Campaign Deck
description:
Campaign decks allow those new to the Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Champions universe to quickly field an army and get straight into the action. There are 4 Campaign decks available each with their own individual playstyles.

As one by one the Mortal Realms fell to the grip of Chaos one of the Grand Alliances grew ever stronger. For the armies of Death, there is no relief. These lost souls remain forever in servitude to their dark masters. Mordants, Vargheists, Spirits and Skeletons fill the ranks of an army that will never know death.

name: DOG: Harry Potter
description:
The wizard students are traveling around Hogwarts; from the dormitories of the four houses, they make their way to the Great Hall — but Hogwarts wouldn't be Hogwarts if the up-and-coming magicians didn't turn almost every challenge into a competition to test who has the most successful house. Whether Gryffindor, Hufflepuff, Ravenclaw or Slytherin, everyone tries to make it to the Great Hall as quickly as possible, outplaying the others and sending them back to the dormitory. Only caretaker Argus Filch makes life equally difficult for everyone.

DOG: Harry Potter adapts DOG to the wizarding world, and round after round, players try to use their action cards to move the figures in their own house from the dormitory to the Great Hall, where they are safe. On the way there, other classmates not only want to overtake them, but prefer to throw them out. With magical tricks such as walking backwards, conjured up jokers, or lucky number witchcraft, they, like the patrolling caretaker, become a real threat to progress. After all, who likes going back to bed when the goal seems so close?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Movement Points, Take That, Team-Based Game, Track Movement

name: Operaci√≥n dinamita
description:
Operacion Dinamita is a game where you, in turns, reveal a pair of cards. Each card usually has a number, and if you are able to get one number from the other using one of the operator cards in your hand, you get they three (scoring three points). For example, a "4" card and a "8" card can be obtained using a "x2" operator card.

Bonus operator cards like the dynamite stick, matches or chronometer make a tweak in the game with special rules.

name: Questions de Merde: Sp√©cial Geek
description:
In this game, everyone chooses a question among the three proposed on a card and reads it aloud.

From left to right, each of the other players responds.

After each answer, the players land in a dark or bright space.

At the end of the round, it is the last player to have answered, which designates the winning space.
categories: Humor, Party Game, Trivia, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Finale Ending, Ladder Climbing, Player Judge, Questions and Answers, Real-Time, Voting
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Le Droit de Perdre

name: Lightyear Blast-Off Blitz
description:
Discover Disney Pixar's Lightyear. Stranded on an uncharted planet, Buzz Lightyear and his crewmates will battle hostile plants, giant bugs and the ultimate threat, Zurg, to complete their mission and return home. This exciting skill and action game is inspired by the movie. Two teams of 1 to 4 players ages 8 years and up face off in a puck-flicking battle to launch Buzz's spaceship, the XL-15. The game board, fuel cells, pucks, and giant bugs all play a part, and the rocket really launches! Get ready for cosmic action as Team Star Command and Team Zurg collide head-to-head and puck-to-puck in a race to collect fuel cells. For each fuel cell collected, players can take one shot to launch the XL-15. If the special Hyperfuel Puck hits the launch pad on target, the starship will blast off. Score the most launches to win!

-description from publisher's website
categories: Action / Dexterity, Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Science Fiction

name: Penny Drop
description: A push your luck party game with the goal of being the first player to get rid of all your pennies. Played with a box with 6 penny-sized numbered slots, roll the dice to fill each slot with a penny. Pass to the next player before you roll a number that's already filled with a penny to avoid taking all the pennies in the slots.

name: Burguerre
description:
In Burguerre each player must create the best burger and ruin those of others.

In his turn, a player can add food to anyone's burger! he can give himself a good steak, or put disgusting food on his enemies' burgers (rats, fingers, etc.) The aliments gives or substract point to the burger.

The intrigue of the game is the fact that the foods given cover the old, so you have to memorize what you all receive.

This game also have actions cards and counter cards to make the game more interesting, like swap two burgers !

At the end we count the number of points for each burger, the winner is the one with the most.

name: SharkMagedon („Çµ„É°„Éû„Ç≤„Éâ„É≥Ôºâ
description:
A card game in which you create the strongest shark and fight against land, sea, and air enemies. A partially-blind bluffing game. Players want to build up the best sharks to attack either land, sea, or air enemies, never fully knowing which locations the enemy cards belong to played by your opponents.

On your turn, you can either call for “Sharkmageddon” or decide to draw cards. Card draws help the player boost their sharks by adding body parts, or hurt players by adding enemy “human” cards facedown.

Sharks are divided into land, sea, and air depending on the color of their heads. The sharks battle the enemy cards of that same type. Any player can begin "Sharkmageddon" at the beginning of their turn, but only the shark with the highest combat power can challenge the enemy and earn points for that location. When “Sharkmageddon” begins, player compare attack power of their sharks by location. An “air” shark has no relation to a “sea” shark and do not cancel each other.

From here, all enemy cards played are revealed and placed in their different locations. The feeding frenzy begins, the strongest shark for each location attacks the enemies. If the fighting power is greater than the enemies` collective power, the player collects the cards and earns those points. If the strongest shark is weaker than the enemies, the shark is wasted! All sharks used for that “Sharkmagedon” attack are discarded.

When the deck runs out, the player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Critical Hits and Failures, Set Collection

name: Escalation: Nuclear War in Europe
description:
Escalation: Nuclear War in Europe is a comic-book-styled game of espionage, warfare, and nuclear exchange. It is a game for 1-2 players, which begins its story at the height of the Cold War. You take the role of NATO or Warsaw Pact commander-in-chief.

Each turn, you start with a set of action cards, which you use to perform actions and trigger events. Your successes bring you closer to victory but escalate the crisis at the same time. The initial Cold War stage allows you to use agents to perform intelligence operations. But when the game escalates to the next (Conventional War) stage, the full force of the army and airforce is brought to bear.

Now you conduct military offensives by advancing your armies across the enemy land, supported by your bombers and agents. If you gain a lot of ground quickly, the enemy falls apart, and you are victorious. But if you fail to sustain the advance, another escalation becomes imminent, crossing the threshold into a nuclear war.

The game comes with a Tutorial designed to teach you the game quickly and easily. You can play the full or the short version of the game, giving 2-4 hours of average gameplay time. It also features a Solo Bot system specially developed for this game. This is the first in a series of games that are quick to learn, easy to play, and exciting to experience. Special attention has been given to the system's user-friendliness and visual style.

—description from the designer
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Modern Warfare, Political, Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: –ù–µ –∑–∞–∫–æ—Ä–æ—Ç–∏ –¶–µ–ø—å! –ü–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–∞—è –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—è (Do Not Short Circuit! Series story)
description:
The goal of the players is to repair the electrical circuit of the robot's communication panel by installing token modules with electronic components and laying closed electrical circuits from plus to minus power, trying to light up as many bulbs and LEDs as possible.

In this case, short circuits, high current supply to the LEDs and improper installation of electronic components must be avoided. Whoever scores the most points at the end is the best electronics!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Powerhouse
description:
Pieces drawn randomly from a bag react to others you’ve saved as you seek to build a set.

Included in Pyramid Arcade, and also as a PDF on the publisher's website.

name: Mish Mash: Sweet Treats Edition
description:
Shuffle the cards and place them in the center of the table face down.
First player to unscramble the word(s) correctly wins the card.
The first player who gets 5 cards wins the game.

Includes 36 cards and instructions.

name: GHOUL Battledeck
description:
At the far end of the Glug nebula, third star system on the left, you’ll find a cube-shaped planet called Ghoul.

It may look like an idyllic utopia, but zoom in and you’ll find it overrun by dim-witted monsters pulling ridiculous faces.

For an age, tribes have formed volatile alliances and battled for control of Ghoul.

You, the hero, have formed a shabby band of monsters to settle the score once and for all, but there’s one small problem...

Your friends stand in the way.

Battledeck pits you and your horde against your friends as you fight to determine the one true ruler of planet Ghoul.

Each player receives 3 Ghoul cards face down, a HP card, and a Counter Gem. Players reveal their first Ghoul and the battle begins.

Dice rolls determine damage and healing, but also trigger special abilities unique to each Ghoul: slow death by wet nibble; shower of crusty monkey biscuits; and bounding embrace of boneless fists to name a few.

Using the HP card to track a Ghoul's health, Counter Gems may fall on Yellow Hearts – triggering Chance Card with ridiculous demands, or fall on a Purple Heart triggering Mayhem, upping the stakes of the game.

Players choose who to attack on their turn – beat the strongest player down to size? Or deal revenge on the Ghoul that gave them the Curse of Creeping Toe Fungus?

GHOUL Battledeck is a hoot and suited to the whole family. Its weighting makes it perfect for ages 8 and up.

-description from designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Hissa: Historian tietopeli
description:
("Hissa" is Finnish slang for history, especially as a school subject.)

Trivia board game with six categories of questions with three levels of difficulty.

The Board is a colorful circled labyrinth were you advance with correct answer to the question about history. First player to get in the middle circle with the correct answer from freely chosen category is the winner.

Game has six categories of questions:
I: From ice age to space age (blue)
II: War and peace (red)
III: Science and art (green)
IV: King and peasant (yellow)
Silver: Hard questions from all fields
Gold: Very hard questions from all fields

If you answer correctly to the question from four basic categories, then you will move one space forward. Silver category is worth two moves and gold gives you three moves forward. You can always choose to answer silver or gold question, otherwise the colour of your current space determines the category of the question. With the correct answer you'll go on until you fail to answer correctly, then it's next players turn.

Ending of the game is triggered, when somebody answers correctly to chosen question in the middle circle. Current round is then finished, so that everybody has same amount of turns. If several players are tied, then extra questions are made until winner is decided.

name: Grand Finale
description:
You’re in charge of putting together the best fireworks show. But no matter what you do you have to get the Grand Finale right. Can you use all the firework cards and end the night with the perfect Grand Finale?

Grand Finale is an 18 card solo only game where you play cards within an 3x3 grid in an attempt to finish the night with a pre-determined display. But be careful, you'll need to play cards so that no two adjacent fireworks are the same size or color. Move played cards up higher in the sky to help fulfill your goal but just make sure your last card played completes your Grand Finale!
mechanics: Layering, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Ridley's Game Room: Movie Buff Trivia
description:
A fun and fast-paced quiz for film fanatics of all ages. Featuring questions from old classics to modern-day blockbusters. Lights, Camera, Action!

Teams go head to head to be crowned trivia champions in this fun quiz game.
Divide into two teams or 2 opposing players and shuffle the deck. Take it in turns to ask the opposing team a question:
DIFFICULT: Ask the question only.
MEDIUM: Ask the question with all 4 multiple choice options.
EASY: Ask the question with just the 50:50 choices.

Teams earn 1 point for each correct answer. Keep score as you go. The first team to gain 29 points (or the team with the highest score) wins!
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Dune: House Secrets ‚Äì Bonus Pack
description:
This Dune: House Secrets bonus pack contains component upgrades and bonuses.


3 new chapters - envelopes 1 to 3
5 wooden consequence tokens
black cloth bag for consequence tokens
4 character cards: Arya Khoras, Daniel Arias, Javed Dhar, Gora Mallick
5 large-format postcards in B5 format (176 × 250 mm): Tel Gezer, Tel Gezer: Owl Market, Ter Gezer: Ornitopter Airport, Tel Gezer: Morgan's Tavern, Tel Gezer: Sorc's Mansion
large-format map of the northern polar region of Arrakis, A3 format (297 × 420 mm)


Pre-order English edition originally limited to 1500 copies.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling
publishers: GaGa Games, Portal Games, TLAMA games

name: Small Deadly Space
description:
The philosophy behind the rules is the primacy of human actions as opposed to the cumulative material effects of ballistic combat. In the chaos of battle, humans begin to ignore the increasing material flotsam around them and fall back on their training. Small Deadly Space portrays this reality by reducing the pages of material modifiers, which we think, erroneously, are the main factors in determining human behavior, and increases the role of psychology in battle as influenced by training, drill and unit elan.

—description from the rulebook

name: Monopoly: Flip Edition ‚Äì Fortnite
description:
FORTNITE-INSPIRED MONOPOLY GAME: Flip. Outsmart. Survive. In this Monopoly Flip Edition: Fortnite board game, it's not about what players own—it's about how long they can survive

FLIP TILES TO CHANGE BOARD: The dynamic gameboard includes 8 island tiles that flip to change the board and reveal well-known Fortnite locations, hazards, and more. Watch out for a damage trap!

BE LAST PLAYER STANDING: In this battle royale, players earn and lose Health Point (HP) chips instead of Monopoly money. Players who lose their last HP are out! Be the last player with HP to win

BUILD A LOADOUT: Each player chooses a Loadout card with a Permanent Item on it that lends them an advantage over other players. Store Loot Chest items there and use them to attack or heal

ACTIVATE SPECIAL ACTIONS: Roll the action die to boost Health Points, target opponents, and draw Game Mode cards that unleash the Storm

COOL GIFT FOR FORTNITE FANS: Looking for gifts for Fortnite fans? This Fortnite-themed Monopoly game is a great choice, and it's an exciting family board game for teens and adults

—description from the publisher

name: –ó–≤–µ—Ä—è—Ç–∞ (Catch&splash)
description:
Little animals play on the beach. But how to separate them so that some swim and others sunbathe? Take multi-colored fences
and place them in such a way as to separate some animals from others!

How to play?

Look at the task cards
Pick a fence for this round
Find and capture the right animals!


—description from the publisher

name: Conspicuous Cultists
description:
Conspicuous Cultists is a Lovecraft inspired, pocket sized, solitaire game of resource management, cult building, and Eldritch secret seeking.
You'll shuffle up a deck of randomly selected event cards that will be slightly different every time you play. Will you uncover dark secrets and hidden knowledge, or will your dark obsession get the best of you!

To set up a game of Conspicuous Cultists you'll make a semi-random deck of 14 cards from the 43 present in the game box. You'll pick a starting resource pool, and then you can begin. The resources are divided into 5 types: Relics, Money, Cultists, Persons of Interest, and Suspicion. You then will reveal cards from the top of the deck and pick one of the two to three options available on the card. This will cause you to do things like pay or gather resources, remove the card from your deck, add new cards to your deck, or roll a dice to see what might happen.
Some of the cards will lead you through a chain of events (by adding new cards to your deck) that will ultimately allow you to unlock a dark secret, such as a pact with the Deep Ones.

When you get all the way through your deck, you'll shuffle it and keep going. This means that part of the challenge of the game is remembering which trials and obstacles are in your deck that you haven't come across yet, so you can try to save your resources for them. Or alternatively gambling that you'll be able to replenish your resources before you encounter those trials. You may remember the cards in your deck, but you'll never know what order they'll come up.

You'll also have to balance your resource income and expenditures. Too many resources and the gods may curse you for your gluttony. Too much suspicion and law enforcement may raid your cult. But too little of anything, and you won't be prepared for what comes next. As bad as a curse of greed or a law enforcement raid may be, the wrath that the Old Ones pour out upon those who approach their secrets unprepared can be far worse!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Horror, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Globules
description:
An abstract game given away by the Ducosim game club, Game card #0032, given away to attendees of their conventions.

Try to create the largest globule of your color by placing markets given to you by your opponent.

Game is a single thick paper sheet with pieces that must be cut out from the card.
mechanics: I Cut, You Choose, Pattern Building

name: No Honor Among Thieves!
description:
In the high stakes world of art thievery it takes cunning to make a name for yourself. As you work to amass the greatest collection of pilfered valuables you must outrun the law, while watching your back from your fellow thieves. As your collection grows so too will the temptation of your fellow thieves to take what you rightfully stole. As the saying goes... There is no honor among thieves.

On a player's turn, they will have the opportunity to draw a card either from the deck or another player's hand. The card drawn may be an event that has impact on the current player or the table itself. Once a card is drawn, all players will have the opportunity to play cards from their hands which may help or disrupt the current player. Finally, the current player can "stash" a loot card from their hand or from another player's stash to collect victory point. However, keep an eye out for forgeries which might have consequences.

The game continues until the last card is drawn.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Take That

name: MAD TEA PARTY
description:
MAD TEA PARTY is a three player only trick-taking card game from Japan. Themed on Alice In Wonderland, the players are split between one Challenger and two Disrupters working together. The cards have key symbols on them, and the Challenger must win more than half the keys to win the game.

The Challenger can declare Trump, but there are also 4 Cheshire Cat cards in the 32 card deck, which are always Trump. These are labelled A, AA, X, XX, with the first two being strongest Trump and the latter being weakest trump but have keys.
user summary

name: (Nie)Powiniene≈õ 3
description:
(Nie)Powiniene≈õ 3 is a card game for awful adults (18+) who like to laugh. It comes with two decks of cards. It is similar to Cards Against Humanity or and can be explained in two minutes. All players (from 3 to 15 people) draw 10 cards from orange deck at the start and then first main player draws one card from black deck.

Main player read black cards with some funny phrase and other participants have to choose on of their orange cards with other funny phrases that in their opinion are a best match for the phrase in the drawn black card. Cards are given to the main player in secret, whom then reads them aloud and chooses the best one and owner of this card scores the point.

After that all players that used orange cards draws new ones (so they have 10 again) and the next player become the main player and the cycle continues. After one of the decks become empty players stop the game, they count their score (1 black cards = 1 point) and the winner is a player with the higher score.

All cards have phrases printed in english and polish language both.

Decks from (Nie)Powiniene≈õ 3 can be merged with ones from (Nie)Powiniene≈õ and (Nie)Powiniene≈õ 2.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Kings League Infojobs: El Juego de Cartas
description:
Goals worth 2? Super saves? A field that changes size? Prepare the plays with your team and activate your President with the button to enhance the attacks. Keep an eye on the dice and, above all... Be careful with Piqué's cards!
