Before starting the game, pick a trainer card, a special power, and a set of random cards. Each turn, both players play face down a team member and check which wins to move the ball card into the next areas with the aim of scoring. First to five points, wins.

name: Space FTR
description:
Space FTR is the second print at home game from Moonbound Games, following the success of Skull Searchers. You are quested to gather as many Auras as possible (the primary source item that earth now desires).

You start with a fixed Energy amount and must survive from Mission 1 all the way to Mission 8. Missions have levels that you must get through without falling to 0 HP. There are explosions, hazards, traps, enemies, and bosses to fight BUT don't worry as you can collect energy to gain HP scattered throughout along with auras and rockets. As you journey through your missions you will gain experience (XP) that will allow you to learn skills and add more power & speed to your character. There is a Final Score at the end of the campaign where you can calculate your score. Replay again or compare with friends to see who can get the highest score.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Final Boss
description:
Each character comes with it own character game sheet, with each own unique skills to learn, and attributes to be filled with numbers and dice.
Each turn, players roll 2 d6 dice, one dice for own character as an action for this round, another dice resul will go to opponnent. Actions have unique numbers assigned to them.So each turn, both players perform 2 action at the same time.
Players will be expanding and learning skills, adding various dice and numbers into 4 attributes.
After 7 turns, characters are ready for final battle.


PnP, one page, roll&write, dice drafting, action selection, character building and dueling game for 1-2 players with solo mode and Variable Player Powers.

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Drafting, Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Player Powers

name: Mein lieber Scholli
description:
Mein lieber Scholli is a cool ice fun game where penguins waddle over floes, dive and slide down an ice slide.
Players control the action with two dice. With one of them, the penguins push and shove themselves across ice fields and dive from floe to floe. The other die drives schools of fish towards them, but also allows the penguin friend Walli Walfisch to appear. This causes pieces to come loose from the floes every now and then, and a penguin goes swimming. A slide leads out of the icy water and back onto the ice, ending in two landing areas: In one of them, fish can be collected here, but in the other one, some fish can also slip out of the fins and then lie ready for penguins to slide in later.
Whoever collects the most fish in this cheerful Antarctic adventure wins.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Dice

name: Sounds Sus
description:
Enter a game of many suspicions & one truth with Sounds Sus. Don’t be suspicious!

Players take turns as the active player and show the others a question and the answer. One of the answering players will write the correct answer while all of the other players try to "not be sus" by writing an incorrect answer to try to trick the active player.

Includes 200 questions cards, 9 whiteboard sus cards, 60 point tokens, 3 dry erase markers
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Communication Limits, Hidden Roles, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Logi
description: Players attempt to play all the letter cards from their hand by spelling words starting with the last letter of the previous player's word. Some letters have special instructions with the letter, such as skipping or making the next player draw two cards.

name: Waterworld
description:
Waterworld the boardgame is based the movie Waterworld.

The object is to be the first player to discover dry land. This can be accomplished by collecting all four resource cards (enola, guns, rope, and trimaran supplies). Then the player must destroy the Deez to gain control of the compass. The compass will lead the player to location of the dry land. The first one to discover dry land with the four resources is the winner. Of course there are many ways for other players to get in your way and steal your resources or the location of the dry land.
categories: Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Nautical
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Last One Laughing: Das Spiel
description:
Your challenge in Last One Laughing: Das Spiel is clear from the game title: Be the last one to laugh. More specifically, be the last one to laugh twice since the second laugh eliminates you from play.

Once the round starts, if you get someone else to laugh, whether by using the suggestions on the 170 included cards or by doing anything else, you can hit the buzzer and win a point for their lack of restraint.

Whoever remains in the game the longest or who scores the most points wins.

name: 8 Out Of 10 Cats
description:
In 8 Out Of 10 Cats, players or teams take turns answering questions on opinion polls, surveys and statistics.

There are five different categories of questions, including "Poll with a Hole", "And the Winner Is ...", and "Pick of the Polls". Players roll a die in order to determine which kind of question they have to answer. Once a player or team has correctly answered ten questions, they have to successfully answer an "8 Out Of 10 Stats" card to win (and end) the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Do You Sudoku? Game
description:
From the box:
Now Sudoku can be played in teams. Players race to see who can complete their Sudoku puzzle first.

More than 100 different puzzles designed at three different levels. Teams can choose their level or roll the dice and meet the challenge.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement

name: Ich sehe was ...
description: On her turn, a player takes a color card and a picture card. The other players then take turns rolling the dice and asking whether the color and/or picture shown on the dice matches the selected item. Whoever first guesses the correct item gets a bear card, and the first player to collect three bear cards wins.

name: Candy Land DVD Game
description:
The Candy Land DVD game brings new excitement to the classic board game, with music, animation, and several classic characters brought to the TV screen. This game is for 2-4 players of Ages 3 - 6 - it includes one DVD, 20 gingerbread tokens and 24 floor mats.

There are three separate games and some music videos. "King Candy’s Adventure Game" is a color-matching game with movement similar to the board game; "Mr. Mint Says" is a game of following directions (like Simon Says); and the Grandma Nut game is a themed version of musical chairs. Youngsters will get up and move around as they try to perform the various tasks and collect gingerbread tokens.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Fantasy, Music

name: Junior Trivia
description:
This children's game was released at the height of the Trivial Pursuit craze, and is suitable as a stand alone game, or as an addition to other trivia games.

There are 2,592 questions, which are broken down into the following categories:
1. Entertainment/Famous People
2. Sports/Games
3. Science/Computers
4. Literature/Art/Words
5. Geography/Space
6. History/Traditions

The questions are further divided into two skill levels: Level 1 (Ages 5 - 9) and Level 2 (Ages 10 - 13)

This is an excellent game for young trivia buffs.

name: Huhuuh
description:
In this cooperative game, the players try to help the ghosts get back to their castles before the sun rises. Each player controls at least one ghost of each color, depending on the number of players. A roll of the die will indicate what the current player must do. Red, green, or blue indicates that the same color of ghost may go home. White allows the player to select the ghost to send home. Black requires the player to take a ghost out of a castle. Yellow adds a ray to the sun, progressing toward the end of the game.

Game setup is scaled for the number of players.

Ages 4+

name: Cassette Juego: La Oca
description:
Cassette Juego was a very popular late 80´s spin and move series of portatile boardgames that were created in spain by CASA CHICO, but later was very popular in Venezuela and Peru,among other southamerican countries.(produced by Loklinka and Maxi S.A.)

The game itself was portable with shape of a 80´s old audio cassette, that come with it cassette box.The cassette was displayed in three sections. One is located in what was the function of the die, which was replaced by a rotating wheel with various numbers printed on it. The other two panels formed the board cassette. It was made ‚Äã‚Äãof metal, for small magnetic chips (usually four, but this varied depending on the game) could adhere securely and not dropped or lost. When not being used, the chips were placed in a small metal plate located on the upper right of the board.

LA OCA (the goose game) is a classic spanish boardgame, adapted to the Cassette Juego Format were each player spin the wheel and advance the number of square acording to the result, having some squares that let you advance more by saying "De oca en oca tiro porque me toca" meaning that you roll again because you get the chance. The winner is the first player pawn to get to the end of the OCA game.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Se vad jag kan
description:
Simple game to run a frog from one end at the game board to the other by tossing dice and move.
Additional moves will be awarded when providing the correct answer to questions.
All in Swedish.

name: Relative Insanity: See What I Mean?
description:
Everyone has at least one crazy family member. If you don’t think you do, then that means it’s YOU!

In Relative Insanity, everyone looks at a hilarious photo that could have come out of a crazy family photo album, like a young man taking a bathroom selfie while wearing a granny nightie.

Then the Judge rolls the die to tell you what category of caption you're looking at on your cards. Everyone else chooses one of their caption cards to finish the phrase, like: "Millennials continue to amaze" or "It’s ugly but it’s mine," etc.

In between laughter, the reader picks the funniest one and awards that player as "Mom's Favorite", worth two points! Second best gets one point as "Middle Child" and the Judge can declare someone the Black Sheep, just for fun, if they played a really bad caption!

Play the number of rounds as decided upon at the start of the game, then add up all the points and whoever has the most is the winner.

It’s a different hilarious game each time you play!

Features the humor of Jeff Foxworthy.

-description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Player Judge

name: Data finans
description: Swedish finance game similar to "Nya finans", except that parts of the gameplay is controlled by a small "computer". Earn as much money as possible through building houses and investing money in stocks etc. A Monopoly variant with a mini computer instead of dice.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Letter Dice
description:
Letter Dice by HABA is a word dice game similar to Letter Dice by Fun and Games and Ad-Lib Crossword Cubes, where players make words to score points.

HABA's version is for 1-6 players. It has several play modes:

1. Crosswords: One player rolls all 13 dice and forms words in a crossword puzzle shape. Players agree on the length of the round (between 2-5 minutes) and the number of rounds before the start of the game. Letters used score their point value. Letters used in two words score for both words. Letters not used are subtracted from the score.

When a player finishes making words, players can try to make a funny sentence with the words.

2. Letter Yatzi: The first player rolls all 13 dice and tries to form the longest word. Letters which don't fit are rolled again. At least one letter must be put aside each time. Play continues until all letters are used or set aside. Points are scored for the letters used. Unused letters are not counted.

If a player uses all 13 letters, the score for the word is doubled.

3. Vocabulary: All players together make one word, with all 13 dice if possible. One player is chosen as the secretary. Players try to make words with the letters of the first word, and the secretary keeps track of them. The winner is the player who can find the last intelligible word.

name: Contrabando: Vale do C√¥a
description:
Contrabando: Vale do Côa is an adventure game based on ethnographic research about smuggling on the eastern border of Northern Portugal, during Salazar’s dictatorship.

Each player controls both smugglers and border officers, on one hand trying to guide his own smugglers to Spain and on another trying to catch the other players smugglers. On each of the six nights of the game, each player guides two groups, but every group has a different number of members and cargo value, as well as different points of departure and arrival. So movement must be planned and sometimes a group must be sacrifice in order to save other. The length of each group's journey, the value of its cargo and the phase of the moon influences the strategy as for example, on a full moon, the officers can better see and thus control the territory. Also there are different terrains like forests, unpredictable and dangerous lookout points, mounts and a canyon river (the Douro, famous for the Port wine) influence the movement and hiding capacities of the smugglers. The action cards add different dynamics to the game allowing to momentarily break the rules and get a flavor of the tactics of both smugglers and officers.

"Night is falling. Amidst the silence and shadows of the villages, men and women leave their homes with suspicious bags. Walking for hours and hours, they cross mounts and valleys, smuggling merchandise to Spain. But the portuguese border force officers know the paths and are always on the lookout for the nightly adventurers. This game, based on the heritage of Territórios do Côa relives the smuggling stories from the period of the portuguese dictatorship. Can you get to Spain?”

name: The Beer Game
description:
Components:

Folding Board, Playing Pieces, Question Cards, Dice, Instructions.

Publisher's Description:

"You will travel around the board, in and out of the Irish bar, the village pub, the club and the tavern having a drink and collecting bottles along the way. You may have to arm wrestle someone, perform some bar or magic tricks and do unimaginable feats in varied and interesting ways. You could take a booze cruise or a serious bar crawl. You might just end up in the gutter, fall asleep with your clothes on or land in jail - or you may just have to drink lots of beer!"

Brief Notes:

Non-drinking friends with a sense of humor can still enjoy this game by substituting a beverage of choice for beer. Enough fun and interaction to be a decent party game for any group of reasonable adults.
mechanics: Acting, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing, Storytelling

name: 24: Wer zuletzt sticht, sticht am besten!
description:
Each player starts with 24 points and tries to be the first to lose them. You reduce your score by taking tricks. The value of the trick does not matter. But beware: it is possible to change the play order and the trump color - even during a running round! And possibly, voilà, you get more points instead of losing them...

This is one of several card games released by KOSMOS after Nürnberg 2008.

name: Arschbombe
description:
In Arschbombe – German for "cannonball" – players make cards "dive" from their hand into a swimming pool comprised of cards.

To start the game, players create a swimming pool via a ring of scoring cards, with more cards in the ring for more players. Each player has six swimmer cards, three "rascals" who want to cannonball other swimmers and three divers. The pool is seeded with one swimmer during set-up.

On a turn, a player chooses one swimmer card and decides whether to take a normal jump or a special jump. For the normal jump, the player stands, holds the card at eye level, then drops it onto the playing area. A diver scores points if it touches no other swimmer cards, with more points being awarded if the diver jumps later in the game. A rascal must try to "splash" a swimmer identified by the player's left-hand neighbor. If the rascal doesn't touch this card, the player scores no points; if it does, the player scores 1-3 points depending on how successful the splash is.

For a special jump, the player must hold the card over the head (for a diver) or toss the card while sitting (for a rascal). If a swimmer card touches the edge of the pool or falls completely outside the pool, the player loses 1-2 points.

The player with the most points after everyone's had a turn in the pool wins.

name: Home You Go
description:
"A very simple yet exciting family game for 2 OR 4 players Ages 6 and up"

Yes , very simple rules. Each player has 5 men of the same color. These men have to be moved to the other side of the board to win. Movement is by dice and only straight forward (no change of direction allowed).

When players land in other player pieces that second piece goes back to the start : HOME YOU GO!!

The fun is when 4 people play, as "attackers" will come from all the 3 sides!!! as the board becomes more and more busy.

It has some simple strategy. Children and adults will like it.
publishers: Rocket Toys and Games, Spear's Games

name: Big Business
description: Every player is a "Big Businessman" in this popular game and has a chance to develop large business ventures across the U.S. Players compete for state patent rights to develop industry in different states, such as lumber in Washington or dairy products in Wisconsin.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Delfino
description:
The game has 25 large tiles showing a dolphin leaping from the water. The dolphin's beak and tail occupy two corners, the dorsal fin a third. A grid is laid out 5x5 (or smaller depending on players), and players have a half sphere token and a die to show their points score. The players roll a larger die and move their marker about the tiles, rotating the one they laid on clockwise. When 4 tiles are made to point together, the player scores a point and 5 points wins. Players can also move tiles into stacks.

Nice components and an interesting game, but it may lock up.

name: The Weider Game
description:
"The Weider Game - it's more than a game!"
An educational fitness game based on dice, trivia, and physical challenges. Game play is divided into two parts.

Events
The game begins with players trying to win medals in a series of events based mainly on dice rolls.

Weight Lifting - up to 3 dice rolls to gain the most points
Walking - dice roll race with some values given special meanings
Long Jump - simultaneous distance choice, identical numbers are canceled
High Jump - dice rolls for numbers higher than an incremental value
Sprint - dice roll race in turns



Weider Marathon
In the Weider Marathon players roll dice and move along the path. On trivia squares, players answer educational questions about nutrition, anatomy, and sports. Surprise squares often have the player trying to complete some physical task; some easy, some not. Medals are used to fulfill a difficult question or challenge. A player who retains a medal to the end does not have to finish with an exact dice roll.

name: Trial by Pylon
description:
Welcome to the world of the Great Pylon, a world of Sorcery and Witchcraft, a world of Combat and Chivalry, a world of Monsters and Danger. Jovima the Mage is master of this mystical land. His many wonderful Treasures lie waiting throughout his realm, each guarded by a perilous adversary of unique powers. Jovima challenges each wayfarer to dare the Trial by Pylon, a trial in which you risk your very life to attain some of his wealth and powers.

Whether you are a Novice, a Warrior, or a Sorcerer, the elements of chance are always testing your skills. A simple treasure hunt can easily become a fight for survival. Up to six players may confront Jovima in their quest for fortune.

—publisher description

An independently produced hack-and-slash fantasy card game. Per the rulebook, the first edition was limited to 5000 numbered copies. Some or all of these first edition copies were signed by the designer and artists. It does not appear any subsequent editions were published.

Three "levels" of play are available: Novice, Warrior, and Sorcerer. The Novice level is a solitaire game that allows a player to become familiarized with the Location, Weapon, Treasure, and Peril (monster) cards. Warrior level challenges the players to be the one who escapes the realm with the greatest amount of treasure. To win at the Sorcerer level, a player must exit the realm with Jovima's four most precious treasures, thereby becoming an Adept at the Trial by Pylon.

The game includes six characters, each of which has a special points advantage in regards to some or all of the "Perils" that will be encountered in the realm. Players switch to a different character if the one the player started with is killed off.

Character, Weapon, Location, and Peril cards are randomly distributed at start, and during the game by drawing from the respective decks. Players use their character's special advantage, along with weapons possessed by the character, to overcome the peril found at a location in order to win the treasure being guarded by the peril. Combat is a straight comparison of the Power number for the weapon used by the character, plus any character bonuses, against the Strength value of the Peril card, adjusted for the Location when applicable (classes of monsters are stronger when in certain locations, or sometimes weaker). The Weapon card is discarded after use.

Treasures can be used to buy weapons, and sometimes to bribe a peril. Escape cards allow a player to successfully avoid a peril, or perhaps end the Trial by Pylon - but beware the appearance of Jovima, who can bring your quest to a sudden conclusion!

Trial by Pylon is not solely a dungeon-crawling adventure. The locations depicted on the cards range from wilderness venues, to rooms that might be found in a palace or castle, to elements of a cavern or dungeon complex - making the journey a varied, abstracted, and somewhat random one!

—user summary
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Events, Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Market, Move Through Deck, Race, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Sudden Death Ending, Trading, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Mystery
description:
Mystery is a easy to play Party-Game for up to 12 players.

In Mystery two teams try to guess the words by asking the right questions. The questions can be answered with yes, no or unimportant. If one team guesses the word right, it gets points.

name: Streets of Shadows: Resistance and Collaboration in Occupied Paris
description:
During the occupation of France by Nazi Germany, many brave men and women risked everything they had to continue fighting against fascism. Today, we know that the Resistance and the Allies would be victorious, but at that time - living moment-to-moment - it was far from inevitable. They are celebrated not because they won, but because they stood firm when the outcome was uncertain and dangerous.

There were others - often the wealthy and powerful - who stood for nothing, who risked nothing. The sorts of people who only do the right thing when it is safe and profitable for them to do so, who don't care what side they're on, so long as they're not on the losing side. Throughout the occupation, they attempted a delicate balancing act, collaborating with the Germans while also helping the Resistance, allowing them to hedge their bets until the last possible moment, switching to the winning side so as to escape its wrath.

These are the sorts of people that players are asked to play in Streets of Shadows. Not the brave heroes of the Resistance, nor even the scared everyday people just trying to get by, but the sorts of people who see the occupation as an opportunity for advancement - as a way to pursue economic, social, and political influence. The game does not ask you to empathize with these unsavory people, but does seek to demonstrate how they enable oppressive power structures to remain in place. Even today, even on the other side of an ocean, there are still those who risk everything to fight for a better world, and others who remain silent, safe, comfortable, and complicit.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Travel Sorry!
description: Travel Sorry! is the travel version of the old Sorry game. Instead of cards, a spinner is used to determine your movement, and you have two pieces instead of four.

name: Die sieben Weltwunder
description: Seven games that can be played independently or as campaign to determine a winner by points. All modules deal with the seven wonders of the ancient world and challenge capacity for remembering, logic thinking, pantomime abilities and combinator skill.

name: Divide and Conquer
description:
Divide and Conquer is a game of dots and lines played in two phases. One player is black, the other white. Players take turn drawing white or black dots, according to their color. They then take turns drawing lines between dots, without regard to color. Points are scored when a triangle is formed which cannot be further subdivided. The player who completed the triangle scores one point for each of their own dots in the completed triangle. The game ends when no further triangles can be formed and the player with the most points is the winner.

Divide and Conquer was invented on a dry-erase board with colored magnetic dots in 1996 and was published in the Origins preregistration book with the title Triangulous. It is included in Chief Herman's Holiday Fun Pack.

name: Kickoff the game
description:
The new football card game.

Easy to learn - easy to play!

If you can play football you can play Kickoff!

Players each choose a formation card (4-4-2, 4-3-3, etc) and draw a hand of 10 cards from three categories, Defense, Midfield, Attack based on their formation, Use Midfield cards to move the ball forward on the pitch board, use Attack cards to shoot and defend cards to Save shots. Tackle cards, Foul Cards and a Red Card are mixed in to add "realism" to the game.

Players replenish their hand back up to 10 cards whenever they lose possesion. Score more goals than your opponent before the draw deck runs out.

name: Clown Face
description:
Red leg, blue hair, yellow hand! 1, 2, 3...go!

The Chief Clown in shows three cards with different images to confuse the other clowns. After the third card is shown, all other clowns use the three cards to determine where to put their hands. The first clown placing their hand on the right combination gets all cards.

Score as many cards as you can to win Clown Face. Are you quick enough to become the new Chief Clown, or are you the clown everybody laughs at?
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: 20th Century √•rhundredets spil
description:
This is a trivia game with questions divided in 4 groups (sport, world, Denmark and entertainment) on the 20th century. The board is the years from 1900 to 1999 and whoever reaches 1999 first wins. The question and the number of spaces you may move is decided by spinning an arrow.

Awards

1999 √Örets Voksenspil, Adult Game of the Year Denmark

name: Colorino
description:
With Colorino, your child learns to identify and combine the basic colors. The pieces have been specially created for children 2 years and up, and are easy to use!

The game is to complete the drawings with corresponding buttons -- fixing them in the right place on the support. It allows your child to enjoy the primary and secondary colors. A fun way to develop his abilities association, handling, creativity and memorization!

How to play:

Choose an illustrated board -- either the color side, or black and white.
Place the chosen design underneath the transparent support.
Complete the colored image with the corresponding color buttons, fixing them in the right place on the support
Complete the black and white images with the color buttons of your choice, or try to memorize the color-side.


Contents: 1 transparent support, 6 image sheets (color on the front, black and white on the back), 40 color button pieces: red, blue, yellow, green, purple and orange.

name: Spy Alley: Dice Game
description:
Publisher Blurb:

In Spy Alley Dice, each player becomes a spy for their given country. Players roll the dice for a chance to guess their opponents identities. If a player rolls 3 of a kind, they may take a guess of any player as the spy that is on the three dice. If a player rolls five of a kind, they may either guess a player as any spy, or they may take a big chance and try to accomplish their mission. To accomplish their mission, the player that rolled the 5 of a kind must ask each player in a clockwise manner if they want to guess him as the spy identity on the dice. If no player is willing to make a guess and the player is the spy on the dice, that player has accomplished his mission and wins the game. Otherwise, the last player remaining in the game is the winner.

name: The Risk Factor
description:
The game consists of 9 dice which show "E" on two sides, "N" on two sides, "T" on one side and "O" on the last side. The active player rolls all the dice and forms the words "ten" and "one" from the results. For each "ten", s/he may put aside a "T" (counting 10 points), for each "one", s/he may put aside an "O" (counting one point). The remaining dice may be re-rolled as many times as desired, but when a player can form neither form a "ten" nor a "one", s/he loses all the points from the current turn.
The first player to reach 200 points is the winner.

name: Friend or Faux: A Game of Ridiculously Revealing Questions
description:
Description from the publisher:

Players earn points by correctly answering five rounds of increasingly revealing questions. The twist? Players have to answer the questions about each other, ultimately determining whether you are Friend or Faux. Light-Hearted, often surprising and at times risqué, Friend or Faux uses the funny but all-too-real moments of your own life. Players will get personal, recall memories, share stories and will have you laughing until it hurts.
publishers: Easily Amused Productions, Games Adults Play

name: Poker d'Enfer
description:
The game is not a variant of poker but a game on his own.
Bet with your tokens or with one of your cards representing various goods: a whisky bottle, act of property, alliance,...
But these will have effects on the game.

name: Popeye
description: Popeye the board game plays the same as the video game "Popeye", where Brutus chases Popeye around, while Popeye must collect items, such as hearts that Olive Oil blows to him. Eat the spinach, and then you can go after Brutus and save Olive!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme

name: Ice Cream Scoops of Fun
description:
The object of the game is to be the player with the most ice cream in their bowl when the game is over. Players have Ice Cream Sunday cups with 3 flavors of ice cream and various toppings in front of them with a group of ice cream cards in the middle. In turn, the players pull an ice cream card and click the included scoop which will show either chocolate, vanilla, or strawberry. Whichever player has the Ice Cream Sunday cup with the flavor just spun and the topping matching the ice cream card gets the ice cream card in his bowl. Keep doing this until all of the ice cream cards are taken.

Basically, this a game where you are trying to match patterns. The ice cream scoop randomizer is one of the more interesting randomizer methods in a game.

name: Grand National Steeplechase Game
description: This is a simple roll and move horse racing game, with the added dimension that the horses need to clear the steeples. The first version I know of is a 1901 edition, but I've only seen a postcard advertising it and not the actual game. There have been a wood version circa 1930 and a paper version date unknown. This list of versions, however, is by no means definitive.
publishers: (Public Domain), (Unknown), Canada Games Company Lmt., Chad Valley Co Ltd., Comansi, Harlesden Games, Jos. Scholz, Mulder, National Game Company, Spear's Games, White Horse, Wild Horse

name: Dice: The Evolution
description:
From the game's rules:

This is a game designed to be fun. You have dice, you’re going to play with them anyway.
Now you have a goal.

Make dice towers, roll high numbers, spin dice, and evolve.

Players start out with the d4, and fight their way up through the evolutionary chain of dice; d4 -> d6 -> d8 -> d10 -> d12 -> d20

The game is made up of two different sections in each evolution; the quests, and the challenge.

Quests are undertaken in order to obtain bonuses to rolls which can be used in any of the upcoming challenges.
Challenges are undertaken when the player feels they have enough bonuses to defeat the next die in the evolutionary chain of dice.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Math, Print & Play

name: ŒöœÖŒ≤œåŒªŒµŒæŒø
description:
A word game with a timer. Players roll 20 dice with letters and according values on them, in order to form words with the highest values.

Œàνα παιχνŒØδι ευστροφŒØας, αντŒØληψης και… ταχœçτητας!
ŒÜδειασε τα 20 κυβŒ¨κια με τα γρŒ¨μματα στο τραπŒ≠ζι, γœçρισε την κλεψœçδρα και γρŒÆγορα, πριν τελειœéσει ο χρœåνος, σχημŒ¨τισε œåσες πιο πολλŒ≠ς ελληνικŒ≠ς λŒ≠ξεις μπορεŒØς! ΣημεŒØωσε τη βαθμολογŒØα σου στο μπλοκ και… δες αν εŒØσαι εσœç ο μεγŒ¨λος νικητŒÆς!

name: C'est pour ma Pomme
description: Each player uses action cards to catch caterpillars thanks to the birds. The player succeeds each time the color of his bird matches that of the caterpillar. The winner is the player who will catch the most caterpillars, but be careful as soon as 3 caterpillars reach the apple, the caterpillars win and all the players lose.
publishers: MJ Games, Muduko, Trefl Joker Line

name: Solar Circuit Racing
description:
In the abandoned and uncharted spaces of the solar system a small group of daredevil pilots fly their spacecraft through dangerous race courses known as Circuits. Set up in advance by a shadowy group of scouts and bookies, each Circuit is unique. Some wind through planetary canyons, others through old mining tunnels bored through asteroids or through the swirling rocks of planetary rings. Racers must dodge obstacles as well as the weapons fire of their opponents to cross the finish line first to win fame and fortune!

Solar Circuit Racing is a sci-fi racing game for 2-6 players. The game is played on a modular, customizable course made out of map tiles. Moving into a tile with an obstacle requires a piloting roll. Failing the piloting roll results in something bad happening, like smashing into an asteroid or scraping a wing along a canyon wall. Damage reduces the capabilities of your ship. Once you pass the roll, you can advance into the space and move on.

Each turn, you will have to manage your limited engine power, and make decisions about how to spend it. Engine power can be used to advance through the course, to evade enemy weapons, and to make maneuvering through obstacles easier. Spend too much power on maneuvering and your opponents will jump into the lead, too much on advancing and you'll splatter against the obstacles. The first player to complete the decided on number of laps wins.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Simulation

name: Make Fake News Great Again
description:
You know the truth? Nothing but the truth? You want the world to share your news? Then spill it and come up with the most fantastic stories. But beware – all players are involved in the news and everybody contributes his content. Each player throws one card into the ring, but it is only you who makes the news. Use the information from the other players. But be careful: At least one piece of information has no place in your story, and you decide which one it is. Blow the cover of the card, which gives another player minus points. The player who tells the best fake news earns the respect of the others and, as a perk, gets one of his opponents into trouble.

—description from the publisher

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers Board Game
description:
From the box:
This fast-moving and exciting family board game follows faithfully 'The Two Towers', the second part of the blockbuster motion picture trilogy by New Line Cinema.

An original and easy to learn gameplay full of twists and turns, allows you to experience all the adventures of the remaining members of The Fellowship as they continue their treacherous journey, battling with Mordor in their quest to save Middle-earth.

Alternatively you could choose to play Mordor itself as it seeks to destroy The Fellowship and gain possession of The One Ring.

With Frodo and Sam (accompanied by Gollum) heading for Mordor, Merry and Pippin held captive by the Uruk-hai and Orcs, with Legolas, Gimli and Aragorn in hot pursuit, The Fellowship are no longer in one group. Will Gandalf's reappearance at Fangorn help in their epic struggle and, even if The Fellowship and its allies repel the attack of the Warg Riders on the Plains of Rohan and then successfully destroy Isengard, will the huge battle at Helm’s Deep prove too much? The resolve and determination of Mordor remains undiminished as it struggles to regain the ultimate power and it will stop at nothing in its quest to defeat The Fellowship.

Skill, strategy and luck will play their part in your success or failure and, whether you choose to play good or evil, there will be no respite and no place to hide – The One Ring must be destroyed if Middle-earth is to survive.

name: Medieval Puzzles & Enigmas
description:
From the back of the box:

Welcome, gallant knights! Time to take part in the greatest tournament organized in honor of King Arthur and his queen, Guinevere. No physical courage or high morals required. Patience, cleverness, and cunning are all you need in these quick-witted, brain jousting games. The object of the game: to be the smartest and most cunning of the knights assembled at the Round Table.

Includes:

156 cards divided into six puzzle categories: Logic, Observation, Numbers, Riddles, Pictograms, and Move it, Solve It
Book containing the rules of the game and the solutions to the puzzles
Score book to fill in during the fiendish challenges of the tournament
Sand timer


(This is a trivia/puzzle-solving game where the objective is to be the first to correctly answer puzzles of varying difficulty from 4 of the 6 available categories.)

name: Tugie
description: Players take turns rolling the die to see which color piece to take from the Tugie Tower. Players keep any pieces that fall when they tug and the pieces count as points against the player. Whoever has the least number of pieces at the end of the game wins.

name: Monsterjagd
description: In Monsterjagd, or Monster Hunt, each player receives a set of five monster-catching devices, which are laid out in a row in front of the player, the order memorized and the cards turned face down. Each turn, two monster cards are simultaneously revealed - one showing dark-colored versions of the monsters and one showing light-colored versions. Certain combinations of monster sets may only be captured using specific monster-catching devices. As quickly as possible, players check their reference cards to determine which monster-catching device will work for the monster pair currently on display and place the appropriate card in the center of the table. The fastest players are rewarded while the slowest players or those selecting the wrong monster-catching apparatus are penalized.

name: Intime Conviction n¬∞3: L'Affaire du bouchon de Li√®ge
description:
Sick prank or well-orchestrated vengeance? The gala just started and was going so well…

Jurors, will you make the right decision? Slip into the shoes of a juror, judge a criminal case and deliver your verdict. Play with friends for an evening by recreating the atmosphere of a closed session! Or make the fun last by revealing only a few items a day!

"Intime Conviction n°3: L’Affaire du bouchon de Liège is the third installment of the series of murder solving game by Editions Fika Intime conviction is a craft object entirely designed, made and assembled by hand and in Belgium. The format of the game is unusual as well: the whole game fits in an envelope.

- In group: Play with friends at a party by recreating the closed door ambiance (about 2h game)
- 2 player game: Make it last by revealing only a few new elements every day.

Place the crime scene in the middle of the table and give each player a Juror card.
Inspect the crime scene, then read the defendant's deposition. Reveal the Juror cards one by one.
When the Jury is ready to vote, the final vote takes place. If a majority isn't reached, the debate continues until someone switches sides.

The verdict is announced, a final revelation is unveiled (brand new information is discovered).
You win if you settled on the right decision. You lose if the verdict was inadequate.

—description of a distributor.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling, Voting
publishers: Blackrock Games, Editions Fika, Gen-X Games, Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, Nosolorol Ediciones

name: Yu-Gi-Oh! Hexors Collectible Battle Tile Game
description:
Hexors are a new collectible battle-tile game that features 75 pieces to collect and battle. The starter set includes 10 Hexors, a Game Mat, Instruction Booklet, 6 Glass Beads, Chains and Dice. Collect an army of monsters to clash in the Arena! Collide with enemy Hexors to battle and corner your opponent as you unleash monsters and magic to win!
Uses a very basic gameplay mechanism utilizing elementary math. Involves elements of strategy and luck.

name: Incredible Hulk Smash-Up Action Game
description:
From the rules:

While doing research, Dr. Banner became the victim of radiation gone wild. Now, in times of stress, he becomes transformed into the rampaging Incredible Hulk. He must build a lab to "cure" his terrible problem. Each player tries to build one for him. But watch out - the players must sometimes rev up and unlease The Hulk who could, in his rage, "smash up" the Labs that are being built! Players must rebuild and survive the Hulk's attacks to win. POW!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Bing-Oh!
description:
This is the CRAZIEST bingo game you'll ever play!

Choose your Bing-Oh!™ card at random. Each one is different.

Take turns rolling the Bing-Oh!™ dice. Place your chips on the corresponding space and let the MADNESS begin!

Depending on the square your chip lands on, you may get to steal chips from your opponent, add extra chips to your card, lose a turn, roll again, swap cards with an opponent, set up a “Road Block”, or one of many other devious events.

Get six in a row to win, but be careful! Your opponent might foil your victory by removing chips from your board! Or worse yet, you might run out of chips!

There is no telling what’s gonna happen next in Bing-Oh!™

name: Guerras Gato
description:
Theme: From ancient Egypt to the apocalyptic times of the zombie invasions, going through the Middle Ages and the present age, cats have always sought the supremacy of their counterparts.

In this game each player represents a cat leader who tries to drive away the inhabitants of the regions controlled by their enemies, attacking them ... with cats!

A simple but at the same time very exciting card game that you can use in those moments in which you need to activate your mind.

Goal: To be the last cat leader in the game after having won two of three rounds.

Gameplay: After shuffling the deck of cards, five cards are taken and the player closest to his birthday starts the round.
At each turn a player may use a card to either attack, defend or change sides. If a player can not use a card, he simply passes the turn and waits for the result of the round.

At the end of the round if there are active attack cards, each player will receive a damage card for each attack card on the table, except the last player to play a card.

The player who scores nine points with damage cards loses the round and is eliminated from the game, the last player standing wins the game.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Winnie the Pooh
description: A children's game with a color based movement system similar to Candyland. The players draw colored discs from a paper bag and move to the next free space of that color. Certain spaces allow you to move further ahead or require you to go back.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Racing
publishers: Alga, Jumbo, Paletti, Parker Brothers, Walt Disney Productions (Disney)

name: Time is Money
description: Players must move their pawns in order to get certain cities in time to acquire state-of-the-art technologies.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: Wales-Cymru
description:
A Monopoly edition based on Wales with rule books in both English and Cymraeg.

From the Back of the Box

Monopoly, the greatest property trading board game finds its home in Wales. You can now play the classic game with the street names, landmarks and locations which give the country its distinct identity.

Wales is a land of unspoilt natural beauty, where the mountains meet the sea and the hills reach across the land like waves which lap at its 750 mile coastline.

It has a rich cultural heritage, evident in the lyrical language and the explosive arts scene, as one of Europe's oldest nations advances with new optimism and confidence.

This is repeated in Welsh.
"Daw Monopoly, y gem fasnachu eiddo enwog i gartrefu yng Nghymru. Gallwch chwarae'r clasur o gem ..."
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Whac-A-Mole Card Game
description:
The game contains 30 cards with a mole in the hole, 30 cards with no mole, and a small plastic mallet.

There are four games included. Two of them, "Mole-No Mole" and "Mole-A-Round" are pure luck, just with different methods of randomly distributing victory points among 2-4 players. Of the other two games, one is an action game and one is a memory game.

"Whac-Wild" is an action game for 2 players where all of the cards are shuffled together and dealt face down to a pile for each player. The mallet is placed between them. Each player then takes turns flipping the top card of his/her pile. If the card has no mole the other player takes a turn. If it has a mole the first player to grab the mallet and whack the card puts it in his/her score pile. The player with the most mole cards after all cards have been flipped wins.

In "Mole Pairs" the entire deck is shuffled and dealt out to the 2-4 players. A certain number (depending on the number of players) of cards is set face down in front of each player. They then take turns whacking two of the cards, either in their own area or that of another player. the cards are flipped up. If they match (either mole/mole or no mole/no mole) they go into the whacking player's score pile and new cards are put in their place by any player other than the scoring player. The scoring player then gets another turn. When a player whacks a mole/no mole mismatch, the turn is over and the cards are turned back face down. When all pairs have been claimed the game is over and the player with the most pairs wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Memory, Video Game Theme

name: Marvel Superhero Showdown!
description:
Part game, part action figures, Showdown! allows Marvel heroes/villains to go head to head in a contest of strength, poseability and strategy.

Each figure has a power base, attack poses, projectiles, trading cards and battle tiles. Starter sets are packed with two character dedicated power bases, two projectile shooters, six character cards, two six sided dice, 12 Battle tiles and two figures.

Figures are 4" in size.

Marvel Super Hero Showdown Starter Sets
Hulk & Wolverine
Spider-Man & Thing

Marvel Super Hero Showdown Battle Pack Series 1
Black Costumer Spider-Man
Dock Ock
Ghostrider
Punisher
Berserker Wolverine
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Team-Based Game

name: Take a Train
description:
36 of the 39 tiles show different parts of locomotives, passenger and freight carriages, and the other three are Conductor cards. The cards are of thick cardboard and are taller than they are wide. All tiles are shuffled together and placed face down. Players draw a hand of 5 cards in the 2-player game, or 3 cards in the 3 or 4-player version.
Players take it in turns to draw one card, and then must either lay one from their hand, or discard one to a discard pile. Train pieces must match together, but can be started from the middle of the carriage or engine. New locomotives or carriages can be started against a completed one, to form a longer train.

The game ends once a player has completed a locomotive and one or more carriages, and also has one of the conductor cards in their hand. Points are then awarded for completed locomotives and carriages, and conductors in the hand. Highest score wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection
publishers: Fisher Price, Otto Maier Verlag, Ravensburger

name: The World of Beer
description:
From the back of the box:

"Two games in one"

"Barflies
The first game is a pub game featuring 300 questions on beer and brewing that will leave you in stitches! What the hell is an Inferno Pod Ale? Does Chicken Killer Barley Wine really kill chickens? And where do they brew a beer called Vergina? Find out in Barflies - that's if you can drink fast enough to catch up with your mates!"

"Beer Geeks
The second game is one of a kind - the world's first quality knowledge quiz for die-hard beer geeks featuring 600 individual questions on the history and art of brewing, from Belgian classics and Brittish real ale to US and Australian craft brew. If you're still a learner (or just plain blond), easy-level multiple choice questions allow you to catch up with master brewers and hop-head experts. Join the Beer Geeks and discover The World of Beer!"

"Questions for The World of Beer have been devised by true beer geeks - British artist Kim Wyon in association with Anders Evald representing the Danish Beer Consumers' Association."

name: Log Jam
description: Log Jam is a game of placing pieces in a hand crafted tower of wood. If the log you place sticks over the top, you or your team gets a point. Every round, a new layer is added to the tower. When the tower is complete, the player or team with the fewest points wins!

name: Sexyonary
description:
Very similar to Pictionary but with a sex theme.
Players take a card and then draw the concept of the category that matches the one on the board. When someone guesses the correct answer they roll a dice and move to another spot.
The game ends when one teams reaches the final spot and wins.
mechanics: Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Etapa Nueva S.A., Van De Wyngard

name: Highlights Which Way USA? Game
description:
From the box:
Based on the Highlights puzzle-book series, the Which Way USA? game is an exciting new board game created for children who are fascinated by United States geography and trivia. Each player is the leader of a crew of colorful Which Way characters. Players crisscross the nation and use their expanding knowledge of facts about the United States to identify the states. Players must name a state correctly to pick up a Which Way crew member. The first player to collect an entire crew and guide them safely home is the winner.

The Which Way USA Game combines skill, luck and strategy with geography knowledge in a way that appeals to players of different ages and abilities. In addition to the colorful game board of the United States, there are enough vehicles, crews and cards for up to Five players. An added bonus is the Which Way USA? fact book, a full-color reference book with hundreds of facts about the United States.

CONTENTS:
1 game board
5 Which Way vehicles
25 Which Way crew tokens
5 Which Way home-State tokens
5 Which Way crew boards
50 Which Way state cards
1 color spinner
1 6 sided die
1 Which way USA? Fact Book.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Memory, Travel, Trivia

name: LEAP FROG Bingo
description:
Six ways to play! Learn shapes, colors, animals, beginning letter sounds, counting and addition!

Object: Be the first player to shout "BINGO" by getting 4-in-a-row.

Game One: Color/Shape Match
Use the spinner, and cards with shapes on them. The youngest player begins by spinning the spinner and calling out the shape and color to which the arrow points. For example, "Blue Star!". Then all players search their cards for that color and shape. If they have a match, they cover it with a Tad bingo chip. Play continues clockwise with each player taking a turn spinning and calling. For shorter games, just match colors or just match shapes.

Game Two: Number Match
Use the spinner, and cards with numbers on them. The youngest player begins by spinning the spinner and calling out the number to which the arrow points. For example, "number 9!". Then all players search their cards for that number. If they have a match, they cover it with a Tad bingo chip. Play continues clockwise with each player taking a turn spinning and calling.

Game Three: Animal Match
Use the spinner, and cards with animals on them. The youngest player begins by spinning the spinner and calling out the animal and color to which the arrow points. For example, "Purple Lion!". Then all players search their cards for that color and animal. If they have a match, they cover it with a Tad bingo chip. Play continues clockwise with each player taking a turn spinning and calling. For shorter games, just match animals. Or for a beginning letter challenge, instead of announcing the animal the caller says "the animal that begins with M". Players then place Tad bingo chips on ALL animals on their cards that begin with M.

Game Four: Add-Up and Match
Use the spinner with the addition equations, and cards with numbers on them. The youngest player begins by spinning the spinner and solves the equation to which the arrow points and calls out the answer. For example, if the spinner points to 9+1, then the player solves it and calls out 10. Then all players search for 10 and cover it with a Tad bingo chip. Play continues clockwise with each player taking a turn spinning and calling.

Winning:
A player wins when they get 4 Tad bingo chips in a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal row and they shout out "bingo".
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Number, Word Game

name: Moomery
description: Challenge the other players in a test of speed and memory in Moomery. Remember all the cards in the stack in front of you and be the first to strike when you are sure two identical cards are in the pack. Watch out for the tricky cow!
publishers: Captain Macaque, Rebel Sp. z o.o.

name: Trump Cards
description:
This game puts politics aside and simply tests your skills at weeding out fake news from real news. Two to ten players take turns reading out cards. Think the president really said it? Play the “Approved” card. Think it’s made up? Use the “Fake News” card.

One point is granted to each player for correct responses, but if no player is correct, the reader gets one point.

Win the game by being the first player to reach 5 points.

All “real” Trump quotes are properly sourced to prevent arguments.

name: Suomirokkia trivia
description: A trivia game about Finnish rock music from the 70's to 00's. The game includes a four-piece game board, 180 question cards and a dvd together with about 1000 questions. The dvd contains video and music samples. There are two different playing options: you can either play a quick game or a regular game. The publisher is a Finnish record company.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Transport
description:
Choose your route and the cargo you will transport! Your performance depends essentially on your decisions. A good logistic operator never forgets that time is money!
The object this game is become the world's best logistic operator, completing your objectives before the other players and accumulating at least $360.000.

Contents:
- 6 pawns
- 1 dice
- 1 gameboard
- 12 object cards
- 49 country cards
- 11 DHL joker cards
- 400 $$ bills
- 1 notepad loans chart
- 1 notepad control chart

Sponsored by DHL
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Famous Monarchs of England Card Game
description:
The theme of this game is the kings and queens of England (and Oliver Cromwell), and is intended to be a more fun way to learn the names and dates of reign.

The goal is to collect sets of Monarchs in sequence, either in "date order" of reign or in "name & number order" (e.g., Henry 4, Henry 5, Henry 6) per the 2008 version rules.

The game play is very like ‘Rummy’ in style, using a card hand to build straight sequence sets.

1991 version contents:
57 portrait cards
4 reference cards
3 rules cards

2008 version contents are listed on contents card in image section below, and contains a few more player aid cards.
publishers: Heritage Games, Inc., Heritage Toy & Game Co. Ltd., Trioview Ltd.

name: Crazy Like a Fox
description:
"The dice game for the cunning and sly".

Each player rolls a secret "hand" of five D12 dice which they reveal simultaneously one by one, with the highest value winning that round. Points for a round are determined by rolling a D8 before players reveal their chosen die. Playing high and low dice at the right time will maximize the number of rounds and/or points won. Trying to win higher point rounds while sacrificing lower point rounds is key to maximizing points. But beware points from previous rounds can be swapped/stolen when presenting a die roll of one. The player with the most points after 10 rounds wins.

name: Superiority: A Game of the Invasion of Europe in the Near Future
description:
An abstract game representing "modern" warfare between Soviet and American forces. Both players set up their forces on the bottom of two hidden 15x14 grid maps which are identical. The goal is to advance as many units as possible to the top of the map in 8 turns. Each turn consists of players alternating launching missiles at map locations on the opposing board (E10, H13, etc) and after all missiles are launched and destroyed units removed both players move all surviving units. Players never see the opposing map, and are only informed if their missile strikes "hit" or "miss".

A Yaquinto Album Game.

name: Battlechrome
description:
1996 card game of futuristic mecha battles in the 21st century. Anime-style art credited to "Dolphin Meat", "Hunger", "Bud", Scott Roberts and "Sledgehammer".

Contents: 2 9"x11", double-sided, loose pages. (The first has the rules. The second has appendices containing a list of all Frames and Systems, pre-designed Frames, sample missions, and templates for use designing new Frame cards.) 108 rectangular (non-rounded edge, non-laminated) cards, divided into 12 double-sided Frame cards, 36 System cards, 12 Terrain cards, and 48 Action cards.

Gameplay: Player take on the roles of mecha pilots and divide themselves into two teams. They design their mecha with Frame and System cards, and then arrange terrain cards in a line to form the field of battle. Each turn, players exchange movement and fire until the designated end-game is reached. Different scenarios have different victory conditions, from destroying the opposing frames to devastating the Terrain cards.

Expansions were promised, but to my knowledge were never released.
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game

name: Walt Disney Productions' Robin Hood
description: A roll and move game based on the Disney movie "Robin Hood".
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Alga, Brohm-Parker-Spiele, Clementoni, Damm / Egmont, John Sands Pty Ltd, Oy Fenno-Alga Ab, Parker Brothers

name: H√§uptling Wackelnix
description:
From the Ravensburger catalog:
Rotate, stretch, balance - who provides most actions while the egg in his hand? Indeed, it is no ordinary egg! A little bird is asleep and snoring inside. Children make fun exercises with it. They try not to wiggle too much to not wake up the birdies. For each exercise you do correct and not wake up the bird, you can keep the card.
First to collect 5 cards wins the game.

name: 24 godziny
description:
You are detectives and have 24 turns (every turn is one hour from the title) to found all clues and witness to stop the villains. Every turn you will take a SMS card that will do something with game. Sometimes it could help you - you can have extra steps to go in this round. Sometimes it can force you to find some clue again or to go to some specific place to recover something. You win if you will find all 16 clues/witness, before the ending of last turn.

Co-operative and very random game. Good to play with kids.
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Safari Yum
description:
A simple and fun dice game for young children! Players roll five dice with animal pictures (lion, monkey, giraffe, crocodile, elephant and hippo) on each side, and try to collect sets of matching animals. The "Lion" picture is "wild". After the first roll, players are allowed to re-roll the dice of their choice up to two times. Players then place the equivalent number of matching animal tokens on their playing board. This process is repeated for each player five times. The winner is the player with the most monkey, giraffe, crocodile, elephant and hippo tokens on their playing board! Suitable for children age 4 and older.

Contents:

4 play boards
100 chips
5 dice
1 dice cup
1 sticker sheet
instructions

name: UNO: High School Musical
description:
The usual Uno (including themed editions without new cards) rules - Players race to empty their hands and catch opposing players with cards left in theirs, which score points. In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color or number to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw cards from the draw pile until they are able to place a card. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit. Additionally, when playing their penultimate card from their hand, players must shout 'UNO' or face a forfeit of drawing two further cards.

Based on the Disney Channel Movie High School Musical.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: 'Duet Card' There are 4 pairs of characters in th "High School Musical." When you play the Duet card, all other players must discard one of the pairs from their hand (2 cards). If a player cannot discard a pair, they must draw 2 cards from the DRAW pile and add those cards to their hand.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music

name: Naje≈∫d≈∫cy
description:
Simple strategy game based on negotiations. Game flow includes taxes, army creation, movement and battling, basic infrastructure building and constant negotiations.

Fantasy world of Elves, Goblins, Hummits, Dwarves, Dark Elves and Trolls. You are owner and manager of one of six lands. You have only one goal: to conquer all other lands, no matter how.

name: Hammer iT
description: The game is a trivia game which also includes a large block of wood, a hammer and some nails. The active player rolls a die to determine a category of question (skip the trivia part on a roll of 6). When the player can answer the question asked, he or she can hit his or her nail (which is in the block of wood) with the hammer once. The first player whose nail is completely inside the wood is the winner.

name: Build a Bike
description:
From the box:

A fast & fun family card game where each player races to build a fleet of Schwinn bikes.

Players collect cards by drawing, picking blind from other players' hands and by looking through the discard pile after playing a "Go To Bike shop card".
Wheels + Frame + Seat + Handlebars + a Helmet = 1 bike = 16 points.
Bonus cards can add to the score.

Most points wins the game.

name: Asteroid Field
description:
Asteroid Field is a chaotic solitaire card game in which you are the computer of the autonomous miner spaceship A-438 that works in the asteroid belt. Your mission is transport the mineral from the base asteroid to the artificial storage planetoid with the minimum cost.

The players form a board of 5 x 4 cards as the asteroid field. The game goal is to cross the asteroid field without being destroyed while using the smallest quantity of fuel. If the ship is destroyed or the fuel runs out, the player loses. The player can try to improve his marks crossing the field spending less fuel units.

The player uses a token as spaceship to cross the field, he can change the ship's speed and direction. In each turn, asteroids disposition in the field changes chaotically according the rules. There are cards to control speed and fuel consumption.

The only randomness in Asteroid Field is the card order. This game is chaotic because despite having all the data it will be hard to predict the result of the game.

-description from designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Monopoly: Disney Frozen II
description:
Similarly to the base game players journey round the board, buying properties (which in this case are scenes from the first and second films), charging rent and making deals.

The stations of the original game have been replaced by elements which allow players to teleport around the board. The utilities are “snowflake” spaces, which give the opportunity to tell a heart warming memory to gain the snowflake token, which then doubles the rent on one property.

—user summary

name: Charge Large
description:
Enjoy Great Credit, Without the Crunch!

In today’s economy, getting and keeping good credit isn’t easy. But now you can take the crunch out of credit with CHARGE LARGE, the game that makes buying, building and even borrowing pay of big!

Travel around the board using cash and your gold credit card to scoop up prime properties. Buy strategically, borrow wisely, and pay back quickly to earn a platinum card. (It also helps to hit the lottery and collect rent!) If you’re the first to have cash, a zero credit balance, and the coveted black credit card, you’ve beaten the credit card blues, and won the game!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Gobbos' Banquet
description: Games Workshop's return to simple boardgames (together with Lost Patrol) concerns a group of goblins preparing dinner from whatever they find skulking around (bats, spiders, rats, and other goblins). Goblins walk around a smallish dungeons, pushing and jabbing whatever they meet in an attempt to steer it towards their own cauldron. Miniatures used to represent all the creatures are clearly recycled from other GW products, and are not very easy to fit on the rather small squares of the board.

name: Word Blind
description:
Word Blind is a game where you place down tiles to create a board (or path) that you move your piece along. The tiles have different instructions on them. To be able to move your piece your are giving the first letter of the word you need to guess and one of the first of four definitions of the word. If you guess the word on the first meaning you get to move 4 spaces, with each additional definition you need you get to move one less space. If your piece runs out of spaces to move on, you place down additional tiles to continue the path.

The player the lands on the last tile wins the game.

name: Route 66: The Great American Road Trip Game
description:
This game simulates a cross-country trip from New York to Los Angeles, along I-80 to Chicago and US 66 from Chicago to LA. As you take the trip, you land on challenges, which could include performances, fill in the blanks, trivia, true/false questions, roadside assistance, drawing pictures, quick list making, speed answering, or geographical. You might also get sent to a Tourist Trap, where you might have to tell a story, answer a geographical question, or do some performance.

Game includes board, 4 tokens, 320 "postcards" with challenges, 80 side trip cards, 1d3, 12 police tickets, 4 wind power cards, 1 answer revealer, and rules.

The game is also adaptable to team play.

name: Scaredy Cat
description:
"Piece together the scarecrow, collect and count the birds but watch out for the scaredy cat."

Scaredy Cat is a children's game for two to six players Ages 5 - 10. The object of the game is to collect cards with birds on them. the winner is the player who has the most birds when the game ends.

To set up the game, all the cards are shuffled together and placed face down on the table. Players take it in turns to draw a card

There are three types of cards in the deck:

Most of the cards in the deck are Bird cards which have a picture of one to six birds on them. When a Bird card is drawn, the player puts it on the table in front of them.

Scaredy Cat cards have a picture of a cat on them. When one of the three scaredy cat cards are drawn, the player who drew it loses all of their bird cards. The bird cards are shuffled back into the deck along with the scaredy cat card.

The six Scarecrow cards each have a different part of a picture of a scarecrow on them. When one is drawn, it is placed in the middle of the table. When all six pieces are on the table, and the scarecrow is complete, the game ends and the birds are counted.

At the end of the game the birds on all the bird cards on the table are counted, the player with the most birds wins.

We have found that the game works best with three or more players. Two player games tend to go on for a long time with much frustration.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Ramses: Wettlauf um die Reicht√ºmer √Ñgyptens
description: The latest release from Isensee Verlag at Essen 2007. Players compete to assemble the greatest collection of Egyptian artifacts for museum exhibitions. Each possible exhibition is made from collecting the right set of cards. Some are made with three cards, some with four, and one with six. Once collected, the exhibition must be placed into the exhibition area and this is where one of the game's main strategies evolves: the exhibition space is fixed and size and there must be room for yours! The game is highly interactive by involving significant trading, passing of cards, and placement strategy to lock others out.

name: Spin the Bottle
description:
Players sit around the vinyl play mat on which rests a spinner in the shape of a bottle. Spinning the bottle determines who will be the active player's partner. A card is then taken from the Stunt Deck and the active player and partner must complete the stunt in under 2 minutes. If they do so, each earn a number of points as indicated on their stunt card.

Some example stunts are:

With your and your partner back to back, cross arms and hold hands. Turn to face each other without letting go of their hands.

Perform a dramatic reading of the phone book for two minutes.

And of course a good number of stunts involve kissing.

name: Silhouette Cards
description:
Silhouette Cards is played with a deck of cards with silhouette images.

Two cards are drawn from the deck. The first player to come up with a word that matches both cards keeps them both, and two new cards are drawn. When the deck is exhausted the player with the most cards wins.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Round the World with Nellie Bly
description:
Game based upon the legendary, 72-day trip around the world accomplished by 25-year-old Elizabeth Cochrane (aka Nellie Bly) in 1889/90, a feminist reporter for the New York World. Her feat, inspired by the fictional trip in Jules Verne's Around the World in 80 Days, created a media sensation, and many considered her to be the most famous woman in the world. Her trip also brought new interest to the Verne's novel.

Players spin a spinner, which dictates the number of spaces forward (around the world) they must move. Landing on certain spaces might cause them to move forward or backward, speeding them along or hindering them in their journey.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nellie_Bly

name: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation ‚Äì The Crime Game
description:
From the back of the box:

The evidence never lies! CSI: The Crime Game is a fun, interactive, intriguing game that simulates the most popular television show on earth and allows players to experience the excitement of solving a crime. These four new captivating stories can be played with your CSI: Crime Scene Investigation Board Game or on their own with the "Custom CSI Die" included in this game. In either case, players collect three levels of evidence cards from the CSI Characters in seven Crime Lab Divisions.

Game Play:

Two to four players or teams of players can participate. The object of the game is to be the first player to collect enough evidence from the CSI Characters in their various Crime Lab Divisions to arrest one of three suspects by proving their means, motive and opportunity to commit the crime. Test yourself, friends, and family while learning about cutting-edge scientific methods and old-fashioned investigative police work as you try to build your case.

Game Contents:

- 4 Crime Stories (27 Cards per Story)
- 13 Disclosure Cards
- CSI Handbook that Includes: Crime Scene Photos, Crime Scene Descriptions, Crime Solutions, Rules, and Glossaries
- 1 Arrest Warrant Pad
- 1 Custom CSI 12-Sided Die

Includes 4 new crime stories:

- Sticks and Stones
- Heat of the Moment
- Current Events
- The Clean Up

name: The Game of Law School
description:
The "Game of Law School" challenges players on their knowledge of law in everyday life.

The main component of this game is the question cards, each containing 6 questions. Similar to other trivia games, each card has a question from each one of the different categories, with answers on the reverse side. These questions test one's knowledge on either constitutional, tort, judicial, criminal, business and property law. There are a variety of styles of questions including true or false, multiple choice and fill-in-the-blank.

A board helps to enhance the game as players progress from the "First Day of Law School" onwards to "Graduation". Moving through the squares that line the edges of the board, the players may gain advantages or disadvantages in their quest for commencement. Some of these spaces allow extra turns while others may put you on "probation" or cause you to restart the game!

The goal of the game is to be the first person to Graduate and receive a graduation certificate (which is included in the game).

Of particular note is the die which allows a maximum roll of 3.

name: Star Trek Starfleet Game
description: This was a small promotional game which was distributed by fast-food chain McDonald's. The game is based on the first Star Trek movie. The winner is the first player whose starship reaches the V'GER space at the end of the map. The game pieces are attached to the perforated cardstock map. Once detached, these fold into four stand-up starships and a hexagonal shaped tube which serves as the die. Portions of the map also fold up to give decorative parts of the map a 3-D look.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing, Science Fiction
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Warlocks & Warriors
description:
"Introductory" fantasy board game in which players choose to be either a warlock or a warrior, start off on the board's movement track, cast spells at each other (which consist only of "move an opponent a certain number of spaces"), and try to be the first to conduct the princess to her castle at the end of the track despite the numerous perils along the way. (The fairy tales don't talk about would-be rescuers having bloody fights over who gets to take the princess back to her castle, but oh well.)

Playing time is a guess.

For 2 to 6 players Ages 8 and up.

name: Kalle K√§ngu
description:
In this game for young children, Kangaroos hop from the playground to the ice cream truck.

A track of tiles is laid out between start and finish. Each player is assigned a kangaroo, but all four kangaroos are in play, even with less than four players. Players take turns rolling a die. If they roll a color, that kangaroo moves forward one field. There are also arrow faces on the die. If a forward arrow is rolled, the last kangaroo moves forward (hopping over others if the path is blocked). With a backward arrow, the first kangaroo hops backward. The first player to reach the ice cream truck with their kangaroo is the winner.

name: Lady Luck
description: A classic game of skill and chance! Lady Luck sets up players to race around the board trying to turn a $100,000 ante into a 'million dollar' fortune of cash and assets. The first player to complete the five game circuits and survive the trip down 'tax lane' is the winner. Players collect, barter, and trade assets in real estate, transportation and, luxury items. Do you feel lucky?
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading
publishers: Northern Games Co. Ltd., Silver Bear Marketing Ltd.

name: Intercity
description:
Every player gets two trains. One rides from noth to south, and the other from south to north. The players draw a start-card. There are two city names on a start-card. Each player puts his/her passengers on the start locations. Then the destination-cards are drawn. There are two city names on a destination cards. A stopover and the destination.

On a player's turn, he/she moves all the train one space forward. Next the player throws the dice and moves the trains of which he/she has thrown the colors. If a train passes a station, a passenger can get in the train or change between trains. When a passenger arrives at the stopover or at his destination, the player receives a station-card as prove he/she stopped at the station.

The first player which brought his/her both passengers to the right stations wins the game.

name: Monopoly: Dallas Edition
description:
