"They say everything is bigger in Texas. But Dallasites know bigger is better in Big D. So what could be better than the first ever authorized Dallas Edition of Parker Brothers' famous Monopoly game?" (Back of box)

This is an authorized edition of Monopoly based on famous Dallas (area) landmarks: Love Field, Texas Stadium, Southwest Airlines, Dallas Cowboys, etc. It features eight different metal tokens in the classic style (boot, iron, battleship, top hat, thimble, race car, terrier, and the cannon. There are two additional tokens including a cowboy on horseback and a wheel barrel.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: A Question of Sport
description:
"A Question of Sport" is the trivia board game version of the amazingly popular UK BBC television series of the same name.

The original version of the game, featuring the TV game show hosts Bill Beaumont, David Coleman and the late lamented Emlyn Hughes on the box cover was released in 1986 and included 1200 question and answer cards, 2 scoreboards, 2 picture boards, 2 dice and 2 shakers.

It remains ever popular and has been re-released many times and in several formats since including junior and sports themed expansion versions. Later versions of the game also included a "Mystery Guest Video Cassette."
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: BBC Enterprises, The Games Team Ltd.

name: The Simpsons: Bart's Trivia Game
description:
The Simpsons: Bart's Trivia Game

Greetings, everyone. Lisa Simpson here! Everyone knows my underachieving brother Bart, right? But do you know which of our neighbors gave Bart a well-deserved spanking? Or what Bart's silly middle name is? No? Well, don't fret. Not everyone can be an A+ student like me! (the answers are below!) inside this box are lots more questions about America's favorite bad boy, Bart Simpson.

You can compete with your friends or even other Simpson trivia experts! See how "Bart-smart" you are! You'll have lots of fun and you just might learn something. Believe it or not, it's more fun than a trip to the library!

And guess what? The game comes with a Springfield Elementary chalkboard pad, so you can write sayings, just like Bart does each week.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Dragons' Derby
description:
Five dragons race around a track. Players bet on three of the dragons. Play cards to move your dragons forward and hope that other players also want your dragons to win.

Illustrations by Marino Degano. Ages 14+. In the L-Series of games.

name: MindTrap: The Revised Edition
description:
From the box:

Classic MindTrap challenged the way you think.

MindTrap II captured your imagination with dazzling new brainteasers.

In MindTrap - The Revised Edition we have laterally combined the best of both in the classic mystery scenario style - riddled with both clues and red herrings!

Whether you've played before or are new to MindTrap we know you will love MindTrap - The Revised Edition!

All the questions are written in humorous prose with a delightful twist that will make you laugh at the surprisingly simple solutions.

name: Silly Socks
description:
Collect pairs of socks, but don't pick up the underpants!

Each player gets three silly socks to start. On your turn take an item from the washing machine. If it's a sock that matches one of your three, put the pair in your laundry basket. But be careful. If you pull out a pair of pants you'll lose one turn until you can try for silly socks again. The first player to collect three matching pairs wins. For 2 to 4 players, ages 3 to 5.

name: Str8 Eight
description:
This is a math based card game. The object of the game is to play eight cards, each with a larger number, in a sequence. There are eight different sequences each starting from a number between one and eight. The sequence is basically the multiplication table. For example, the second number in the sequence that starts with 5 is 10 and the third number in that sequence is 15. You do not have to stay in the same sequence. If you have played a 10, you can proceed with a 12 or 15. The cards helpfully show which cards they can be played on and which cards can be played on them.

Each of up to four players is dealt three cards. On each turn they can draw a card from the draw pile or the discard pile. They then either place a card in their sequence or discard. There are eight cards when played cause player to exchange hands.

Scoring is done by adding up all the points played by the player who completes his sequence of eight cards. All the other players add up their cards played and subtract the points for cards still held in their hand.

name: Go!Short
description:
Unlike most conventional board and dice games where you aim (or hope desperately) to roll high so to be crowned ultimate champion, in Go!Short you’re going to be the winner if you continuously roll low.

So easy to pick up, great fun and perfect for killing some spare time, Go!Short is a new and fast paced game that challenges the regular table-top format by being played out over a series of six ever moving tiles — or what some would technically call, beer mats.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Beard Ball
description:
The game of skill, style and sticky whiskers! There have always been countless reasons why having a beard is better than not having a beard - the beard gives you a strange power that will improve your life, your thoughts will look deeper and more developed with a beard, a beard can make a hipster’s nerdy shirt look cool. Now there’s one more for the list – Beards make the perfect backdrop for a fun party game!

The game centers around completing stunts with three different fake beards. On a turn, two players (either as a team or two cooperating competitors) will try to complete one of the many stunts represented on the cards in the game. Each card provides details about the challenge, the number of attempts allowed, and how many points the stunt is worth.

One player puts on a fake beard with a set of glasses, while the other grabs the plastic balls that are covered in Velcro. The team then follows the instructions given on the card, often trying to get the ball caught on the beard. If they succeed in the designated number of attempts, then both players (or the team) score the points!

Play continues until one player (or team) reaches 11, and he/she/they are the winners!

Contents include - 50 beard ball stunt cards, 5 beard balls, 3 stylish beards of varying difficulty levels, 1 pair of glasses, 1 Bearded die, 1 game board, and instructions

name: Bata-Miaou
description:
A GAME OF BATTLE
OBJECT: get all the cards by winning the hands.
All cards are dealt among the players. Everyone takes their cards and puts them in piles face-down in front of them. The players turn over the first one at the same time. The card with the biggest animal wins the hand. If several animals are the same size, there is a “meow battle”! Each of the players in the battle places a new card face-down on top of their card and then another one face-up. The player with the highest card wins all the cards on the table. When one player has won all the cards, they win the game.

+++ There’s no need to know how to count – just compare the size of the cats!

—description from the publisher

name: More or Less
description:
More or Less is a quiz game in which players have to answer (numerical) questions. The player whose guess come closest to the actual answers gains a point. But there is a catch! For each question, it is determined whether only guesses that are higher than the actual answer will count (more), or only guesses that are lower (less).

The first player to gain five points wins the game.

name: Buchstabensuppe
description:
There's a plastic soup dish in which there are a lot of plastic pearls. There are letters and jokers printed on the pearls.The aim of the game is to create as many words as possible with 2 spoons of letters, within a fixed amount of time.

Players use a plastic spoon to fetch letter-pearls from the soup dish. An hour-glass times your efforts to construct words, using the letter-pearls (you can stick the letter-pearls together to form a pearl-chain). The game is played over 5 rounds and the winner is the player with the most points. Points are gained for each used letter, for each syllable and a bonus for players who have used all their letters. Points are lost for unused letters.

The box contains 144 letters, 1 spoon, 1 soup bowl and scoring sheets.
publishers: Dujardin, Schmidt Spiele, Selecta Spel en Hobby

name: Jigsaw Mystery Pack
description:
From the publisher:

Play the detective card game to put the Jigsaw together -- and then have a picture mystery case to solve. Each case has 40 clues and is 8 x 14 inches. The sealed envelope contains the Solutions, and a secret coded message for crime fighters everywhere. Lots of play value!

Rules included for a group co-op game for 12 to 36 players, using all four cases together.

Contents:
36 action cards
4 jigsaw mystery cases
solutions
rules

name: Cheyenne
description:
Each player is a cowboy who rides the trail across the game board from Cheyenne's Corral to the Pony Express Station.

A spinner is used for movement. When a player reaches a space with a gun on it he must stop and "shoot" the adjacent Obstacle (cattle rustlers, rattle snakes etc.) To do this he takes the cardboard obstacle marker that matches the corresponding picture on the game board and faces it towards the orange "shoot" circle in the corner of the board. He then takes his plastic "gun" and places it over the edge of a "bullet" (a plastic disk.) By pulling the gun back he "shoots" the bullet across the board like a Tiddledy Wink. If he hits or knocks down the target he may continue down the trail.

The first player to reach the Pony Express Station wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, American West, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: CON!
description:
CON! is a fast paced card game where players compete to the be most popular attendee at a generic convention. Character cards are bid on as they come into play. Each character has a set point value and changes the effects of the bids that are used to win the characters. After each player has a chance to put a character into play, the hands refresh and new characters are dealt into play.

The bids consist of four suits: Stuff, Hobbies, Freakness and Tales. Certain characters have different effects on the suits that maybe played. Other cards Stops and Trumps allow to to eliminate rival player's cards or even knock them from the bidding entirely. Hand management comes into play as your cards do no refresh until everyone has put a character into play.

Game takes approximately 10 minutes to play and is scalable, so the game takes the same amount of time regardless the number of players. It is pure beer and pretzels and will have future expansions featuring more stereotypical con goers. The game is best described as 1/3 luck, 1/3 strategy and 1/3 spite.

name: Crossfire Bingo
description:
Crossfire Bingo - alternative to Bingo but make your own luck.
Each player has there own crossfire board and about 25 counters for covering the spaces.
Players take turns to roll the dice and cover a space or spaces on the board according to the numbers showing.
Example a a three and a five are showing
Options 1 cover the space 8 (by adding the dice together
2) Cover 3 and 5
3) Cover space 35
4) Cover space 53
To win the game you must have two rows of seven numbered spaces covered (D spaces included) with one row running vertically and the other row horizontally.

name: Beer College
description: The game is to drink to graduate. Progress through a four year academic environment consuming a beverage of your choice as course work. Choose from a host of characters with different beer ranks to represent how aggressive you like to play the game. There are specific amount you will need to consume moving along the game path, however, you are given some latitude to drink at your own pace. The last guy that passes each final is assigned the amount in the communal glass. Interact with other players through playing cards that assign drinks, move players back and forth or perform other activities. Use the excuse cards to defend against drink assignments from others, either rejecting them or passing them to someone else.

name: Fast Sundaes
description:
From Publisher:

"I Scream, You Scream, We All Scream for . . . Wait a minute. What's all the screaming about? It's about Fast Sundaes, the delicious new game the whole family will quickly devour! Here's the scoop: Each player takes turns dishing out cards, all the while watching for special combinations of ice cream, toppings, sauces, or complete sundaes. If you spot something yummy, be the first to slap the cards and you 'scoop' the pile. Get all the cards, and you win! But watch out for Blooper Scoopers or the dreaded Brain Freeze 'cause they'll knock you out faster than you can say 'hot fudge.' So come on, if you've got an appetite for gun, get Fast Sundaes! It's a scream!"

name: Big Fish Lil' Fish Shark Shooter
description:
From box back.

Avoid the Shark!
Play your Cards!
Watch Out!

Play your cards as quick as you can, but don't get caught in the cross-hairs of the Shark Shooter! In this twist on the classic fast paced, feeding frenzy card game Big Fish Lil' Fish, you'll try to eat lil' fish with big fish while avoiding the card-shooting shark. If someone points the shark at you, move fast, or you could get stuck with all the fish it shoots out!

Includes:
2 Decks of Big Fish Lil' Fish cards
1 Shark Attack Card-Shooter (Requires 3 C sized batteries)
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Electronic, Real-time

name: Window
description:
Window is a Decktet solitaire game.

Object of the game: To merge all of the cards into a single pile.

Setup: Deal out nine cards face down, in a three by three grid. Deal nine more cards face down on top of those. Do it again, so that you have nine stacks of three cards each. Finally, deal one card face up onto each of the stacks.

Play: Move the cards around in certain ways to get all the cards into 2 pile to win.

Game Rules:
Window at the Decktet website

name: Jungle Bungle!
description:
from the back of the box

All hell is breaking loose in the jungle! Somebody has stolen the monkeys' treasure - and you have to find it! Help the monkeys and find your way trough the jungle with the magnetic treasure detector. If you hear a "clack!", you have found the treasure. The player who finds the most gems and brings them to the king of the monkeys wins the game!


Help the apes find the stolen treasure!

Players roll the banana dice to move the magnetic treasure hunter on the board, trying to find the missing gems located under the board. When the treasure hunter moves on top a gem, it attaches to the magnet. The players then try retrieve the gem by moving the hunter to the hole in the middle of the board. Gems are scored based on their colors.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Exploration, Memory
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hellapoliisi korttipeli
description:
Hellapoliisi is a delicious game of cards, which is based on the super-popular Finnish police cooker recipe site. The raw materials generated by the blog writer? In this delicious game of card players, the task is to combine the right material with the right recipe. Challenge other players, no doubt their knowledge of food and recipe cards to steal from their hands! The player who collects the most cards in a recipe, wins the game! Enjoy a delicious dinner with your friends!

Game play:

Game has large cards (foods) and small cards (components). Each large card back has a recipe. On each turn, players draws 8 cards cards and takes one food card from the below of the deck. Then the hourglass is turned and players now has to place all components that fit to that food. Trick is that even a 1 wrong one will nullify a score, so be careful. Each correct one with no wrong cards lets you keep the food with cards. At the end of the game you read all the cards you have placed on top of your foods. You get 10 extra points when you have places all components named at the back of the card.
Winner is the game with the most points.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia Board Game
description:
Step into Paddy’s Pub with Mac, Dennis, Charlie, Dee and Frank.

All friends working in harmony for a common cause: themselves!

As a member of The Gang, you’re trying to purchase the most shares in Paddy’s Pub. You need to collect beers (tokens), make your way to a pub to convert them to empties, trade your empties for Paddy’s Pub Dollars at a beer store, and make your way to Paddy’s Pub Headquarters to purchase some shares.

Along your quest, don’t forget to ‘Bang the Waitress’ and backstab other members of The Gang with some Charlie Work!

Components:

•Game Board
•70 Episode cards
•64 Sunny cards
•42 Paddy's Pub Dollars cards
•24 Charlie Work cards
•20 Paddy's Pub Shares
•130 Beer tokens (26 of each 5 different types of beer/character)
•5 Game tokens (characters)
•5 Bang the Waitress tokens (also characters)
•1 six sided die
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Vaasan tori: Vasa torg 1930-1950
description:
The marketplace ("tori" in Finnish, "torg" in Swedish) of Vaasa ("Vasa" in Swedish) was a vivid trade center in the 1930's, to which people from the surrounding countryside came to sell their goods. Townsfolk frequented the marketplace and various goods traded owners.

The war had its impact on the nation in the 1940's and there was shortage in food as well as other products, which lead to that the range of goods was reduced in stores as well as in the marketplace. Trade in the black market became usual especially when the ration cards were taken into use. The nation recovered in the 1950's and the belief in the future got the trade started once again.

In the game the players try to accomplish various tasks and bring goods from the market stands to the stores located around the marketplace at the same time as they are looking for the missing whistle of the marketplace guard.

During the game the players receive rewards for accomplished tasks, such as new skills, which allow them to move on to more difficult tasks. However, the life at the markeplace is not that easy. Good and bad crop years, the rising population, the war, economical success, the belief in the future and different events in the society have their impact on the prices and the players' possibilities to carry out tasks.

This is an exciting and educating game for 2-4 players, in which local history and the memories of the elderly townsfolk of Vaasa are interwoven into an innovative boardgame.

The board has two sides, one easier and one harder. The game is suitable for both young and more mature players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Trading

name: Troika
description:
With magical pyramids Tic-tac-toe changes into a three-dimensional challenge. The situation on the board is moving fast and simple rule forces the starting player to activity.

Playrs place their pyramids on 3x3 grid board to form a Troika.

TROIKA is any combination of your own pyramids in which the two basic parameters (color and size) occur either in the ratio 3:0:0 or 1:1:1 (either all the same or all different).

Draw is not possible.

Full Rules:

Preparation of the game

You will need one trio each of white, yellow, red, blue, green and black pyramids.
Players divide pyramids. One of the players has all nine pyramids of lighter colors (white, yellow, red), the second has all nine pyramids of darker colors (green, blue, black).
Start of the Game

The younger player rolls the die. The player with the color on the die starts. Players consecutively place one of their pyramids on the board.

Placing of Pyramids

You have to place one pyramid per turn. Once laid pyramids can not be moved during the rest of the game.

Pyramids can be placed on free fields, yours or your opponent's pyramids.

Attention! Pyramids can not be placed on pyramids of the same size nor on pyramids two size bigger/smaller.

When laying pyramids may therefore occur following four options. You can lay down:
any pyramid on a free field
small pyramid on any middle pyramid
middle pyramid on any small or large pyramid
large pyramid on any middle pyramid

Only top pyramid counts for the goal!

The goal

Players try to create a TROIKA of pyramids lying in one row or one column, or the two main diagonals on the 3x3 board.

TROIKA

TROIKA is any combination of your own pyramids in which the two basic parameters (color and size) occur either in the ratio 3:0:0 or 1:1:1 (either all the same or all different).

Examples:

Large red, medium red and small red do form a TROIKA, because their color scheme is 3:0:0 (three red, no white, no yellow) and size scheme is 1:1:1 (one large, one medium and one small pyramid).
Medium blue, medium green and medium black do form a TROIKA, because their color scheme is 1:1:1 (one blue, one green, one black) and size structure is 3:0:0 (three medium, no large and no small pyramid).
Large blue, medium blue and small green do not form a TROIKA, because their color scheme is 2:1:0 (two blue, one green and no black pyramid)

Troika Training

To explain the rules it always helps when you form several TROIKAS, especially if you play with school children. Take any two pyramids and challenge players to find the third pyramid required to form a Troika. Practice this several times.
End Game

The game ends when the first player creates TROIKA in a row or column or one of two main diagonals on the board. This player is the winner.

If a player has at least one of his pyramids, but cannot place any of them, he loses the game.
If both players run out of all their pyramids and no player created TROIKA, the player who did NOT start the game, wins.

(For this reason it is good to keep the die next to the game board.)

Rules of 5 games: http://www.mwe.cz/images/gettingstartedwithpyramids.pdf
To buy: http://mwe.cz/cart/index.php?route=product/product&;product_id=73

name: Absolutely English
description:
A game for foreign learners of the English language.

The game contains more than 1.000 questions in 5 different levels, from beginner to advanced. There are also 5 different categories: vocabulary, grammar, phrases, general knowledge, and miscellaneous.

A die determines which category a question is asked from. It shows five colours or a star (let's the player decide if he/she wants a grammar or vocabulary question). If the player answers the question correctly, he/she wins the card. Cards are collected until one player is ready for the grand finale: The player who is first to answer correctly here wins the game.

The game can also be played in teams.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Trivia, Word Game

name: SOLOmino
description:
SOLOmino is a Mau Mau variant that replaces the standard numbered and colored cards with domino-style cards that feature a colored number on each half of them — although some cards also feature action symbols that put twists on gameplay.

To start, each person takes a hand of eight cards. On a turn, a player either draws a card from the deck and adds it to her hand, or she plays one card from her hand onto one or two cards already in play. When you cover a card already in play, the half of your card doing the covering must match the covered card in either number or color. If the card you play features an action symbol, that action takes effect immediately, skipping the next player's turn, changing the order of play, forcing the next player to draw cards, swapping hands with other players, and so on. As soon as a player's hand is empty, she wins.

SOLOmino includes a variant that allows a player to play out of turn if she can play a card that matches a card in both color and number. When this happens, the player lays down the card as if it were her turn, then the next player in clockwise order takes the next turn.

name: Call of Cthulhu: Terror Paths
description:
Horrors arise. Your Investigators are the people on the spot. If you can’t stop the Menace now, the city, or even the world, may be doomed. You are the only hope, if you can withstand the terrors and stress of the frights that await you.

Terror Paths is a tabletop cooperative experience for several players. All players take on the role of Investigators, who work together as a team. The game comes with two maps, each with wildly different scenarios. While you can just play a one-off scenario, you can also play the game as a campaign. Keep an eye out for more Terror Paths maps, scenarios, and campaigns.

All the investigators can move and take actions simultaneously, while they puzzle out arcane mysteries, gain insight, and find the tools they need to stave off the Menace. As the adventure begins, you don’t know how to defeat your opposition or even what that opposition consists of!

After the investigators take their turn, the Menace advances. Threat increases, Doom rises, and terrible events occur. Keep in mind that the game has a time limit–if you delay too much, you are ruined. Draw back the veil and embark upon the Terror Path!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Puzzle
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stat Check Resolution, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: QUIZscape: Probe-Spiel
description:
A demo case for the QUIZscape series, published by moses Verlag. This demo contains a very small time travel story that demonstrates the mechanisms of the QUIZscape games. The players have to travel through time to rescue a missing team.

Each card contains a riddle that has to be solved to continue in the story.

name: Die Pyramide des Krimsutep
description:
In this game the players take over the roles of archeologists who are exploring a pyramid. Their goal is to find canopic jars and, ultimately, treasures. The first player to find and secure his treasure wins the game.

The pyramid, which is about to be explored, is built with the help of cards. All of these cards are placed face down in a 6x6 grid. Around half of the grid is built by light cards which cannot hide jars or treasures, the other half consists of darker tiles and are placed deeper inside the pyramid. Every player can spend 5 movement points. It costs 2 movement points to move through an undiscovered tile, but only one movement point to walk across a discovered tile. Players are not allowed to move diagonally and must always show their opponents the way they wish to take. Although moving through discovered tiles is faster, it can also be less handy and dangerous as you might not only discover a simple corridor but also a trap. Cards are used to move, look at undiscovered tiles or attack your opponents.

As soon as the first player discovers a canopic jar, the mummy awakes and starts to wander the pyramid. The mummy is moved by the different players and can be used to prevent an archaelogist from leaving the pyramid with a valuable artefact. When the mummy attacks, all items the attacked player has in his backpack are lost and returned to the pyramid.

If a player successfully leaves the pyramid with a jar, the card is taken out of the game and cannot be taken away from the player again. To prevent players from securing their treasures, other players can steal items or attack opponents to make them lose an object.

From the back of the game box:
You are on the verge of meeting the greatest challenge an archaelogists could ever be faced with:
Krimsutep's Pyramid
Legendary treasures are said to be hidden inside the pyramid, but be careful. Legends speak of a curse that will be put on anybody who dares to enter the pyramid and tries to reveal its secrets. Not only does the structure of the pyramid pose a problem to eager archaelogists, but also the pharao himself does not wish to be disturbed.
Who will be the first to find the legendary treasures of Krimsutep and get them to safety?

name: 19th Hole Golf
description:
19th Hole Golf is the original, championship golf-dice game; selected as a tournament golf-favorite: at the PGA Seniors, the Ryder Cup, the Dinah Shore LPGA, the Johnny Miller Classic, and many other major tour events.

19th Hole Golf is an authentic game of golf played with dice. Each roll of the dice plays a hole. All of the dice are rolled at once. You can play medal play (the player with the fewest total number of strokes at the end of play) or match play contests (the player who wins the most holes).

You can play team against team, with a point scored for the low ball and 1 point for the team with low total. Any number of players can play 19th Hole Golf.

name: Darkest Dungeon: The Board Game ‚Äì The Weald
description: The Weald expansion brings two heroes and completes the roster that can be found in the videogame, and of course the board game adaptation.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Video Game Theme

name: Saved by the Bell Game
description:
Description from publisher:

RING! Class is back in session at Bayside High School! You’ll be reaching “squad goals” with Zack, Jessie, Kelly, Slater, Lisa, and Screech as you hit the school hallways or visit The Max, your favorite café hangout. In the official Saved by the Bell Game, you’ll relive the classic 90’s sitcom and the unforgettable episodes.

Whether you identified as a trouble maker like Zack, a jock like Slater, a nerd like Screech, a beauty queen like Kelly, a fashionista like Lisa or a straight-A student like Jessie – there’s something for everyone to channel their high school self! To begin, select your favorite player to travel throughout this retro-90s game board visiting various locations such as homeroom, Zach’s room, and more.

Your homework assignment: Be the first player to collect one of each Character Card, or 3 Character Cards of the same player. Once you spin “View a Scene,” you’ll have a few seconds to glance at snapshots of classic scenes from the show. Be prepared to answer random questions. So, study up and don’t flunk this memory test to win a Character Card!
If you spin a number, you must move your character that number of spaces on the board. You can land on “Time Out” and steal from your fellow players. You’ll even receive your own Yearbook to collect your Character Cards, but don’t doodle on Zack – you must be focused to get an A+!

Once you’ve collected one card of each Character or three cards of a single Character, you’ve won the game and you’ve been… Saved by the Bell!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Rules of the Road
description:
"Players have fun using rules of the road and skillful driving to win!
Drive through this small city following actual traffic signs and observing all common rules of the road.
Children and non-drivers learn bicycle and pedestrian safety by knowing the rules of the road."

name: Miami Vice: The Game
description:
For the player who acts as the Miami Vice Team, the object of the game is for him to apprehend the criminals forces (cars) and/or to get to the target drop before the criminal does.

For the player who acts as the criminals team, the object of the game is to get to the target drop before the Miami Vice team does and if possible, to eliminate the Miami Vice forces (cars).

name: Grand Prix
description:
Published a good many years after their Formula One game. One in which the play mechanics went back to dice based movement.

For 2 to 6 players, the game comes with a large race board, 6 Grand Prix cars with sponsorship decals on them, 6 Dashboards, flip-a-dice unit and dice, 8 counters and rules.

name: Reach For The Summit
description:
The aim of the game, is to get to the summit of the mountain in the center of the board and return to base camp. Sounds easy.. but its not just you, since you're roped together with your support team.

Each player has three climbers roped together as a support team and another two roped together as an assault team. The support team has to be moved to a supply base first, after which the assault team can start up, but they have to link up with the support team before they reach the summit. The first player to summit and then return to their base camp wins.

The different colored spaces require different number of movement points to traverse. The movement points available are determined by a spinner.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Movement Points, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Art Linkletter's House Party Game
description:
Players complete against one another and the timer, similar to the popular television show.

Game Contents:

Gameboard
Money
Spinner
4 Playing Pieces
2 Miniature Decks of 45 Cards
1 Regular Deck of 45 Cards
1 30-Second Sand Timer
1 Plastic House
1 Win $100 Pop-Up Timer
1 Plastic Card Holder
16 Cue Cards
1 Special Games Booklet
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Monopoly: New York Mets
description:
The MONOPOLY game joins Major League Baseball® to bring you the ultimate dream - owning the Mets greatest assets. The best of the Mets are up for grabs, and it’s every fan for him or herself!

Now fans can experience Mets excitement in and out of the ballpark in this New York Mets Collector’s Edition of the MONOPOLY game. Buy, sell and trade legendary stars Tom Seaver, Gil Hodges, Keith Hernandez and current stars Mike Piazza, Pedro Martinez and Carlos Beltran in a quest to own all the Mets greatest assets. Home to some of the most skillful players in Major League Baseball, the Mets continue to make for exciting play in this classic game of risk taking and deal making. Includes six collectible pewter tokens for the true baseball fan - Mets baseball cap, hotdog, batter, pitcher, ball in glove and catcher’s mask.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Twister Hopscotch
description:
In Twister Hopscotch kids play classic hopscotch in new ways. After spinning the spinner players are challenged to hop through the Twister Hopscotch path without touching the color indicated on the spinner.

The game comes with 13 colored plastic rings in blue, red, yellow, and green which can be connected in any number of floor patterns with 16 supplied ring connectors. Also provided with the game is a large spinner. The game can be played on any flat surface indoors or outdoors.

Players have four choices of game play:
-Avoid hopping on the color indicated on the spinner
-Only hop on the color indicated on the spinner
-Avoid hopping on the color indicated on the spinner, but touch the spot with your hand
-Perform "action" item for the color indicated. There are four potential action items; Dance, Sign, Clap, or Wiggle.

Rules are provided for 1,2, and 3 or more players. Ages 6 and up.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game
publishers: Hasbro, MB Jeux, MB Juegos, MB Spellen, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley

name: In Order to Win
description:
A quiz-like game that uses a DVD to present the questions and solutions randomly, whilst players place a list of items in order by writing on a dedicated scorepad.

E.g.
Which Alice in Wonderland character appeared first?

A: White Rabbit
B: Dormouse
C: Cheshire Cat

(The correct answer is A,C,B)

Each game lasts 12 questions over 5 rounds. Each round changes the scoring slightly but the basic mechanics remain unaltered throughout.

name: Schuhbidu
description:
In what is perhaps the most painfully titled game of 2011 – Schuhbidu from designers Christian Barnikel and Heike Rosskopf – players are tasked with the challenge of outwitting a shoe goblin and reassembling four pairs of shoes.

At the start of the game, each player secretly draws four of the 48 shoes from the bag. Then all players simulatenously release their shoes on the table. Spot a matching pair? Place a finger on each shoe. If you did find a pair, you get to place the shoes on your shelf. Be the first player to collect four pairs of shoes, and you win the game.

name: Spy Alley Junior
description: Players are spies, blindly choosing a nationality that will be hidden from others. Taking turns, players roll a die or use movement cards to circle the board. When a player lands on a colored "guess" space, they may guess the hidden identity of any other player who is currently located on the same colored guess space located anywhere on the board. If a player's identity is revealed, they are out of the game. The last player remaining is the winner.

name: D√©fifoo Classic
description:
In each round, two teams compete and the third is the referee! Then the roles change. Mime, design, action, speed, memory, address: 150 simple and fun challenges in every genre: Find 10 objects of specific color in the room as soon as possible! Make more sports guessing mimicking! and many more.

Quickest team scores. Team who has most points and the end of the game is the winner.

Contents:

One bag,
cards 150,
hourglass,
two notepad,
2 pencils,
1 die,


rules of the game

name: Penguin opoly
description:
This is a Monopoly clone from Late from the Sky, a publisher that specializes in themed Monopoly games. All the deeds, spaces on the board and cards are penguin themed and some have penguin facts on them.

Players roll dice to determine how far they move. Landing on a space gives the player the option of buying the property. When a player collects all the properties in one color group, the properties can be improved by building. When players land on a space owned by another player they must pay rent. Rent is determined by the location of the property and the number of improvements on the space. Some spaces instruct a player to draw a card which can be beneficial or harmful to the player. Players must avoid going bankrupt to stay in the game. The winner is the last player left in the game.
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Horrible Histories: Awful Egyptians
description: Based on the popular TV show "Horrible Histories", Awful Egyptians is set in ancient Egypt. The players are "rotten robbers" who try to steal the treasures of the dead Pharaoh hidden in the Pyramid in order to sell them to the rich men in the villages and the unlawful priests in the temples.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Trading

name: Zingo! Time-telling
description: Zingo! Time-telling works like other Zingo! titles from ThinkFun in that it has a chunky plastic device that spits out two tiles at a time for players to use. In this game, players try to find hour tiles and minute tiles to match the analog clocks depicted on their individual player boards. If the clock shows, for example, "7:20", then you must find the "7 hour" tile and "20 minutes" tile in order to complete it. The first player to complete her board wins!

name: Guess Who? Super Hero Squad
description: Guess which super hero or villain the other player selected. Narrow down the options by asking yes or no questions.

name: Star Wars: Box Busters ‚Äì Endor Attack
description:
From the packaging:

"Two Players face off in an epic battle of planetary conquest in the Star Wars universe. Roll the dice, blast through your opponent's defenses and capture their command center to win"

Each player needs their own Battle Cube, which is a small diorama. Each has a unique combination of abilities.
categories: Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Llama Line-Up
description:
Roll the dice to see what attributes your llama needs to have (color of llama, color of scarf, and pattern of blanket).

Be the first to grab the matching llama with a suction cup and you get a point.

First to five points wins.

—user summary

Get your llama game on with Llama Line Up, a fun - packed fast - paced family game that gets players competing to pick out the right llama quickest!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Dice
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Speed Matching

name: ŒõœåŒ≥ŒπŒ± ŒªŒØŒ≥Œ± Œ∫Œ±Œπ œÉŒøœÜŒ¨
description:
A game about Greek proverbs.

Info from the publisher's website:
Game is in Greek. A challenging game with 580 proverbs, sayings and mottos. By playing it the players enrich their vocabulary, learn the meaning and the proper use of proverbs while having fun. They understand when "A miss is as good as a mile" why "Adversity makes a strange bedfellow" and why "A friend to all is a friend to none".

Info from the publisher's website in Greek:
Ανταγωνιστικœå παιχνŒØδι με 580 παροιμŒØες, εκφρŒ¨σεις, ρητŒ¨ και λαœäκŒ¨ γνωμικŒ¨. ΠαŒØζοντας, οι παŒØκτες εμπλουτŒØζουν το λεξιλœåγιœå τους, διδŒ¨σκονται την Œ≠ννοια και τη χρηστικœåτητα των παροιμιœéν, ενœé παρŒ¨λληλα ψυχαγωγοœçνται. Κατανοοœçν πœåτε Œ≠ζωσαν κŒ¨ποιον τα φŒØδια, σε ποια περŒØπτωση πŒ≠ταξε το πουλŒ¨κι, τι σημαŒØνει του Œ≠δωσε τα παποœçτσια στο χŒ≠ρι, σε ποιον ταιριŒ¨ζει ο νοœéν νοεŒØτω, για ποιον λŒ≠με ο πνιγμŒ≠νος απ’ τα μαλλιŒ¨ του πιŒ¨νεται...

name: Valentina: The Game ‚Äì Tutto Crepax Vol. 1
description:
Valentina: The Game – Tutto Crepax Vol. 1 includes 96 color tiles and 16 subject cards featuring the art of Guido Crepax with two memory-style games included in the rules:

• In "Crazy Valentina" all players simultaneously try to find the six color tiles comprising their subject card in the pile of face-down tiles placed in a 12x8 grid. The first who finishes wins.

• In "Valentina Memory", players in turn search for color tiles, trying to find the six needed to cover their subject card.

The suggested age is not for the complexity of the games, but for the topics.

name: Dad Joke Face-Off After Dark
description:
In Dad Joke Face-Off After Dark — a "not-safe-for-work" follow up to the party game Dad Joke Face-Off! — players sit face to face and take turns telling jokes. Read a dad joke off of your card and do so WITHOUT SMILING OR LAUGHING, while trying to get your opponent to crack. Sounds simple? Get your friends together for a grown-up game night and see who laughs — or doesn't laugh — the most!

Continue to face off with other opponents to see who has the best (or worst) sense of humor with the (kinda dirty) game you can't help but laugh at!
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling

name: Cheese
description:
The cheese in Cheese is a foam block, with numerous cylindrical bits of it sliced and removable. Players take turns flipping the cheese block, trying to get it to land in particular ways, but not such that the nibbled corner is up while the cheese is on its broad face! If you are successful, you mark the success of your wager by removing bits from the block of cheese, which alters the way it flips through the air.

Scoring:

landing on the broad face, mouse nibbles face-down, 1 point
landing on the long edge, 3 points
landing on the short end, 9 points


After each successful flip, rather than collecting your points, you can risk losing them by flipping again, in order to approach the goal more quickly. The first person to 12 points wins.

name: I Spy Preschool Game
description:
I Spy Preschool Game is classic I Spy fun for preschoolers! Players match riddles with pictures. Interlocking pairs ensure only the correct matches are possible. Riddles and photographs from the popular I Spy book series.

Safe for toddlers with no small parts. Promotes matching, reading and social skills. There are 3 ways to play. Versions are included for beginning and advanced players.

No Reading Required

Contents: 12 interlocking matching pairs

name: Puchar Europy
description:
Original Polish board game about Football Cup of Europe. Includes 32 teams which won National Championships in 1983/4 season. They are divided in three groups of power.

In the game are six original dice. They are used to draw a result of matches. Teams from the most powerful group use the best brown (0,1,3,3,4,4) and red (0,1,2,2,4,5) dice. The second group uses yellow (0,1,2,2,4,4) and green (0,1,1,2,3,5) dice. The worst group uses blue (0,1,1,2,3,4) and black (0,0,1,1,3,5) dice.

Board shows a football field. Puchar Europy based on Road to Wembley.

name: The Jetsons Game
description: Be the first to collect an Elroy card and all three pieces of the Jetsons family member that matches your pawn.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: The Trojan War
description:
The Trojan War board game is a recreation of that epic struggle between the mighty trade city of Troy and the alliance of Greek city states. In this unusual game the mighty Greek army must establish itself near the city of Troy and lay siege. Storming the mighty walls of Troy being a virtual impossibility, the siege of Troy shifts the war to a conflict over food. Can the Greeks starve out the Trojans? Can the Greeks themselves pillage enough food from the surrounding villages and towns to keep their own massive army fed? Can the allies of Troy relieve the besieged city and rush much needed supplies into the city before getting slaughtered by the Greeks surrounding the city. Can the Trojans strike a bold attack against the Greek main camp and break the siege completely? Will the Trojans dare use the Trojan Horse gambit?

Representing all of the heroes from this desperate war, with special rules for Hero units. Achilles, Hector, Ajax, Paris, Memnon and all the rest...

Striking a careful balance between homage to Homer's epic and known historical data of the period, the Trojan War presents a very realistic look at what the real world war between the Ionian Trojans and Mycenaean Greeks might have been like.

Affordable at a suggested retail of $15.95

Comes with:
1) 17" x 22" 4 piece game map on thick index stock
2) 8 page Rule & Scenario booklet
3) Score pad with 30 nation sheets
4) 1D10
5) 135 plastic playing tokens
6) 135 playing token stickers
7) 8 1/2" x 11" pull out map of Troy.
8) 12 Weather Effect Cards.
9) Handy Dandy Box.
mechanics: Area Movement, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Mechadrome: Heavy Metal Combat
description:
Hundreds of years from now, the greatest sport the galaxy has ever known will explode on your screens as everyone watches their favorite teams of giant Mechs beating each other to scrap. Mechadrome is a "Mech Combat Gladiator Arena Skirmish Game" set in the far future where man and alien races have come together, forming teams that do battle in arenas set in abandoned, war-torn cities and industrial zones.

The rules are simple, fast & fun and you may build your Mechs with a wide variety of devastating weapons, or use our own pre-made teams like the Terran Titans or Team Bushido. The game features a variety of scenarios such as Capture the Flag or No Mech's Land, the objective will always be different, so no game will ever be the same.

Mechadrome Mech models are available in 28mm scale, and made from traditional resin.

A board game set in early 18th Century Scotland. You are a clan chief in the Highlands vying with your friends for wealth, power, and influence.

The game is turn based and allows for players to control areas of the Highlands, with combat, cattle theft, negotiation and trading being the primary ways players interact.

Cards add variability to game events and player powers.

Players can make and break alliances and barter on turns.

(Kickstarter funding for this game was cancelled on 12-AUG-2014 due to low response.)

name: Clockwork Armada
description:
Clockwork Armada is a naval miniatures game set in an alternate reality of flat worlds and pseudoscience, where ships sail on the upward rushing winds of space.

Each player takes command of a fleet of warships from their chosen faction, choosing what specialized cruisers and escort squadrons to combine into a synergistic force. A unique flagship is chosen to lead each armada, providing it with special Directives to enhance the abilities of nearby ships.

A game of Clockwork Armada plays out in a continual rotation of alternating activations. Ships will board, ram, and fire at each other, using stat cards to keep track of the damage done to the different areas of a ship. A set of segmented Course Rulers is used to determine the maneuverability of lumbering capital ships and nimble corvettes.

A shared mission and individual objectives give each player multiple means of scoring enough victory points to win the game.

name: A Bad Day for Donuts
description:
Bake your donuts and send them off to battle to the death. Which baker can rise to the occasion and reach the sweet sweet taste of victory!

During a turn in A Bad Day for Donuts, draw two donut cards, select the best donut to bake and send out onto the game board, then roll to reposition your donuts on the game board and initiate donut fights against enemy pastries (other player's donuts). Play out the fights with dice and use stored-up advantages at key moments to give you that edge in battle.

Each donut has a "baker's point" value that is collected by the winner at the end of a donut fight if that donut no longer stands. Collect a baker's dozen of points to win!

A Bad Day for Donuts will be launching on Kickstarter March 3rd, 2016!!!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Accumulus
description:
Nanodaption of Ahead in the Clouds.

If you haven't already noticed, Nat has been making tiny versions of our already tiny games. Now he takes on Ahead in the Clouds with just one card (plus rules and tokens). This is resource management in a very simple, elegant form.

—description from the publisher


Based on Ahead in the Clouds by Daniel Newman.

Use your limited actions to condense and convert the four basic resources, shared between both players. Bank an action for later or flip the card with a Cloudburst to bring different actions and contracts into play. Time it right to send them out and fill contracts. The first player to fill 3 contracts wins.


Released in the March 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

name: Exit-Game Wochenkalender 2022: Der Schnitter
description:
53 new puzzles - 53 possible victims of the reaper!

A must for all fans of escape games and challenging puzzles
There is a new task waiting for you every week
Puzzles alone, with friends or family
Dysturbia's last line-up is in mortal danger: a former killer of the Syndicate crime organization, who calls himself "The Reaper", is running amok. He wants to eliminate all enemies of the cartel on his own within a year. Police, public prosecutor's office, journalism - anyone who still stands up for law and truth in Dysturbia will be targeted by the assassin!

Your detective agency Dyscover is also on the hit list. After all, the reaper grants his targets a week's hangover: every Monday he hides a riddle somewhere in town. If you find it and solve it by Sunday evening, he will spare his next victim. Otherwise it has to die. Take your chance!

name: It's a Wonderful Life
description: Trivia/board game based on the popular movie. Object is to be the first player to lead George through his life by collecting 5 different friends and family cards and an $8000 card.

name: The Erie Canal
description: More like 'Spin and Move' since the randomizer is a spinner instead of dice, players compete to make the most money delivering goods on the Erie Canal. Each player starts at a different end of the canal and navigates the waterway, trying to make the most profit and avoid fines. The Erie Canal lets you relive trade and travel during the 1830s on one of America’s greatest canals, the E-RI-E! Encounter locks, weigh locks, tolls, fines, and the many hazards found along the canal in this interpretive and delightful game.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Domicolor
description:
Domino variant with colors and special tiles.

Aim of the game
Scoring as low as possible by getting rid of tiles with high values.

The tiles
The game consists of 70 cardboard tiles with an unusual shape: 3 colored hexagons are arranged around a central hexagon that has a number printed on it. There are 8 different colours, and each colour is assigned a value from 1 to 8. The number printed on the central hexagon is the sum of the values of the three coloured hexagons on that tile (e.g. a blue-blue-red tile would have a value of 11 as blue = 4 and red = 3).

Game play
The tiles are shuffled and each player is randomly dealt 7 tiles, which he/she puts in front of him/herself face up. The remaining tiles form the draw pile. Players take turns adding one of their tiles to previously laid tiles. Tiles always have to match in two colours, and the new tile has to be laid so that it touches only the edges of the previously laid tile. Players must not fit tiles into each other, there must always be a hexagonal gap between two tiles. A player who cannot add a matching tile continues to draw tiles from the draw pile and adds them to his/her tiles until he/she finds a matching one.

A round ends when a player has gotten rid of all his/her tiles. Each of the other players sums up the point values of their remaining tiles and scores are written down. After a previously agreed upon number of rounds, the player with the lowest score wins the game.

One of Ravensburger's Traveller-Series games.

name: Chicken Limbo
description:
From the back of the box:
Line up with your friends as you listen to the singing chicken clucking a song. Then bend down low-under the chicken legs you go. Backward, forward, silly walks, too. Six positions in all to do. But don't touch the chicken. If you do, you're out! The last player left is the winner!

Kids try to limbo under the "legs" of the chicken.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Top Spot
description: Be the first to get three spots in a row and you win! But watch out... Overlapping cards let you cover each other's spots! This tic-tac-toe variant is composed of two-colored cards (red-blue, red-blank, blue-blank, or blank-blank) and allows for some strategy as each player holds two cards and chooses which to play.

name: Jamestown: The Jamestowne Survivor Game
description:
"The Family game of Cooperation and Survival" is a historical game based on the founding of Jamestown.

"Developed in cooperation with the Association for the Preservation of Virginia Antiquities (APVA) and the Jamestown-Yorktown Foundation, this game has players taking the role of English colonists, eager to succeed in the New World."

The date is May 1607. You must manage resources while working together to ensure the success of the colony. To win you must have at least two English colonists alive on Jamestown Island at the end of turn 12.

name: UNO: The Wizard of Oz
description:
An UNO variant themed around the 1939 Wizard of Oz movie.

Plays like UNO except...

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The Rainbow Rule/ Card which allows you to peak at your opponents hand.

[From the back of the box]

Follow the Yellow Brick Road to countless good time with the Wizard of Oz Edition of UNO.

112 Custom Cards feature Dorothy, Toto, the Scarecrow, the Tinman, the Lion and many more of your favorite characters from the classic 1939 movie.

Same great UNO play PLUS the exclusive Rainbow rule which allows you to peak "somwehre over" your oppoentn's shoulder and look at their cards.

It's going to take brains, heart and courage to be the first player to yell "UNO" and win the game!
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Disney Princess I Remember Game
description:
The classic match game with a twist!
Place all your Princess pieces on the game board spaces. Flip over a card and try to find each of the Princesses' enchanted friends and objects! Collect the most Princess pieces and you win!!
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: How to Train Your Dragon: Dragon Training 101 Board Game
description:
From the back of the box and paraphrased from the rules:

This Dragon Training 101 Board Game is set in the mythical world of burly Vikings and wild Dragons [seen in the film How to Train Your Dragon]. As Viking teenagers living on the island of Berk, fighting dragons is a way of life Be the first Viking to Train your Dragon and reach the center training ground to WIN!

Players race to complete their 6-piece puzzle (aka "train their dragon) and reach the space in the center of the board. Players roll the die and carry out the instructions in the space on which they land. Spaces may cause players to gain or lose puzzle pieces or tokens which can protect them from losing a puzzle piece.

Contents:
1 Game Board
4 Pawns
4 Dragon Puzzles
1 Deck of Shield Cards
1 Dragon Bag
1 Die

name: Disney Song Challenge
description:
In this game, players have to sing songs about their favorite Disney movies.
One player player the role of the judge and, each turn, flip a card with the name of a Disney movie on it. The other players have to be fast and the first one to stand up and sing a song from that movie wins the point. If the judge thinks the song is not complete enough to win the point, he spin the wheel and the singing player will have a additional challenge to complete to earn the point. Then the next player in clockwise order becomes the judge and the turn starts over again. The game ends once a player reaches 5 points.

—user summary
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Pok√©mon Battling Coin Game
description:
Battle your Pokemon monsters with coin-to-coin action in this fast and collectible battle game.

Each player selects three coins to battle with. One at a time they are flipped over and spun. Both players stop their coins and push them together, then compare what wedges on the coins come in contact. If your wedge is greater, your opponent's Pokemon is knocked out! The player who knocks out all of their opponent's Pokemon wins the game!

Gotta catch 'em all!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Fantasy, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme

name: KRAFT Macaroni & Cheese Game
description:
Satisfy your cravings with the KRAFT Macaroni & Cheese Game! Roll the dice and add them together, then play the noodle cards that match. Keep an eye on Cheesasaurus Rex as he boosts his way higher up the Noodle Meter, but make sure you don't run out of noodles! The first person to play all of their cards OR the last person with leftover noodles is the mac & cheese winner! It's cheesy goodness your family will love!

—description from the back of the box

This is one of the three games included in the "Variety Game Pack" box from Big G Creative.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Math, Party Game

name: Feng  Shui Game Pack
description:
One player plays the god Yin, the another the god Yang. Players have a selection of square tiles divided into three types: Chi, Remedy and Sha tiles. The basic tiles are the Chi tiles, which are used to develop the flow of Chi across the board. They come in eight types: ten each of connecting tiles which take the chi energy from one edge of the square to one two or three other edges. There are a further eight Chi ending tiles, two each of four deigns which are needed to terminate unneeded Chi paths. There are also eight Sha tiles, two each corresponding to the the four Chi tiles. This can be placed upon the corresponding opponents tile and thereby blocking the flow. However, a player can overcome these blocks by using the Remedy cards, again two each corresponding to the four Chi tiles.

Each player draws a hand of four tiles (called a reserve) and each turn they can place one tile on the 8 x 8 board. (This is decorated with a Maltese Cross, which it appears only has a psychological effect, as there is no reference to it in the rules.) Starting at the entrance to their respective palace, each player seeks to develop a flow of chi to the other side of the board. As they play a tile, each player can replenish their reserve from their stock. If they are unhappy with their reserve they can replace up to the entire four tiles of the reserve, which then constitutes the entirety of their turn.
publishers: ArsEdition, Edizioni Il Punto d'Incontro, Stewart Tabori & Chang

name: Protzen
description:
from the review:

•6 suits, with cards #'d 1-9 (Polaroid snapshots on cards of various 'stuff' - houses, cars, boats
•Each player also has 2000 Euros (also cards) to start the game

In turn, each player is the 'Show-Off'... and plays against the table, ala Blackjack. The Show-Off is dealt 9 cards, which must have no more than 3 of one suit (re-deal if he does have more than 3 of one suit). Once the dealer has settled his hand, nine cards are dealt to the other players.

Three rounds ensue... the Show Off plays 3 cards (must be different suits) and (in game theme terms) challenges the other players to out-do him with their stuff. Players play 3 cards from their hand and must do one of 3 things to "keep up with the Joneses":
1. play 2 cards which match in suit, of which one of those cards are higher in rank (3rd card does not have to match)

2. play 3 cards which do not match suits AT ALL, which the total value is higher than the Show-Off's 3 cards)

3. play 3 cards which all match in suit, regardless of value

Once we've determined if any players have "kept up", we throw out all the cards played and the Show-Off lays down another 3 cards (from his now 6 card hand). Same thing happens.

This is followed by the 3rd round, which consists of everyone's remaining cards.

Now, to score this thing:
if you can't match the Show-Off in the first round, you pay him 500 euro... if you get to round 2 but can't match there, 400 euro... round 3, 200 euro. If you match him in round 3, you get 200 euro from him for the two card match,
400 euro for the different suit match, and 500 euro for the three card match.

Everyone gets to be the Show-Off one time (or more with fewer players).

name: Gingerbread Man Game
description: Players are trying to build a gingerbread house by rolling the dice to move around the board and collect pieces to the house which fit together like a puzzle. Players have complete freedom to choose among the many paths. First one to collect all of the pieces and move back to the gingerbread house at the center of the board wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Way Things Work
description:
How do machines move heavy loads? What is a fulcrum and what is it for? Why does a car move faster when the incline is steeper?

Based on the popular book of the same name, this game enables players to conduct experiments, figure out solutions and test their knowledge.

Players will need to use memory, strategy, learning, observing and math skills to solve the problems and complete the game.
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Pocket Trivia: Movies
description:
Test your Knowledge - Amaze Your Friends - Have Fun!

Hoyle's Movies Pocket Set Contains 835 questions and answers about your favorite movie stars, films, directors, soundtracks and scripts.

One question is read from each card. The person to correctly answer the question gets the card. Once the 52 cards are collected, the person with the most cards wins.

Set of 6 Pocket Trivia Sets
-Movies
-Music
-Baby Boom
-Sports
-Gen-X
-Television

name: Set Sail!
description:
Set Sail! is a fun, fast-paced card game for the whole family that draws players into the Age of Sail. Be the first to exploit the resources of the new world!

Play is fast as all players simultaneously build ships and set sail! Ships are built by playing cards from your deck in order onto ships shared by all players. Play the last card on a ship to set sail. The first player to use all his or her cards wins!

Featuring original illustrations inspired by the artwork and national flags of the period, Set Sail! educates as well as entertains. It only takes a few minutes to learn and features a number of rule variations to intrigue players of all ages.

name: Der geheimnisvolle Spiegel
description:
The young magicians are back in Der geheimnisvolle Spiegel (The Mysterious Mirror), exploring a house and seeing what they can find when they look in the mirror. Even better, they want to get their fellow magicians to guess the shapes of what they draw in the mirror!

To set up, players each take a magician tile and slide it into the bottom of one of the tile ladders; they also shuffle the 46 "magic symbol" tiles, each of which shows a line drawing of a familiar item, e.g., candle, butterfly, arrow, spider's web, etc.

The starting player draws a tile, takes the magic wand, and "draws" the image seen on this tile onto the back of the large "mysterious mirror" with the light of the wand. The other players try to guess the image drawn; the first player to do so gets to draw with the wand next, while the previous drawer places that tile into the bottom of her tile ladder. Players keep taking turns this way until someone pops her magician tile out of the top of the ladder, winning the game.

With two players, Der geheimnisvolle Spiegel is a co-operative game, with players taking turns drawing an image that the other player must guess. If a player draws three times and her fellow magician still can't guess, then the tile is placed into a third tile ladder. If this ladder fills before one of the magician's ladders, then they both lose the game.

name: 12 O'Clock High
description: An historical card game (in the spirit of Naval War) involving aerial conflict using the fighters and bombers of World War II. The WWII aerial action card game. 2-6 players use cards depicting warplanes built by Germany, England and America to protect their homelands while bombing opposing players into submission.
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II

name: Â∞è„Åï„Å™È≠îÂ•≥„Å®„Åµ„Åó„Åé„Å™„ÅäÂÆ∂ (The Little Witches and the Mysterious House)
description: Â∞è„Åï„Å™È≠îÂ•≥„Å®„Åµ„Åó„Åé„Å™„ÅäÂÆ∂, or The Little Witches and the Mysterious House uses a string to connect the witch to its spiritus. The white outlines of the spaces on the game board show circles, triangles, and squares; each of those shapes has three colors inside it. To complete a magical circle, the teacher tries to place exactly six footprints on the six identical shapes that have a particular color. The teacher cannot place a footprint where a student is standing. Students may move (only one end of the string), pick up ingredients, or flip footprints. Teachers are trying to complete circles. Students are trying to earn group points by disrupting the teacher's plans.

name: Monopoly Junior: Shrek 2
description:
Travel around the board buying your favorite landmarks from the movie Shrek 2. The game is over when one player runs out of money.

For 2 - 4 players Ages 5 and up
categories: Children's Game, Economic, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Trivial Pursuit: Country Music
description: Trivial Pursuit's Country Music edition. This is a small card-pack intended for traveling. It is not subdivided into specific categories.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Music, Party Game, Trivia

name: Ultimate Muscle: The Kinnikuman Legacy Battle Card Game
description:
A card game based on the Ultimate Muscle cartoon. Use techniques and assistance to put your opponent's deck into their discard pile. First to run out of cards loses.

Comes with one "Micro Muscle Wrestler," similar to those in the M.U.S.C.L.E. Mega Match boardgame, except in Transparent Blue or Transparent Red.

Package includes a mat(required for the game), Ten card pack, and a random figure.

name: The Maze of Ishtar
description:
This obscure game is similar to the German "Das verrueckte Labyrinth", but the maze is much more complicated. Up to 4 adventurers try to collect 4 items from the 4 corners of the maze and bring them to the center. Each of the complex tiles can be turned through magic during the game, an ingenious idea is that 2 tiles can be "locked" and prevented of being turned by having a pawn in-between them.
Each player commands "himself" and a smaller "explorer" pawn, which explores the tiles and collects spell cards.
Fantasy-themed, but essentially an abstract race/maze-game (which doesn't totally work, but is sort of interesting).
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Maze, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Line Drawing, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Historiallinen Helsinki
description: Historiallinen Helsinki (Historical Helsinki) is an educational game that brings the history of the Finnish capital city alive. Unfortunately from a gamers' point of view the game is rather traditional and childish roll and move -game, where players try to collect a complete set of building cards from different eras. The cards are full of historical trivia about the buildings and thus the game is certainly interesting in historical sense.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Terminator 2: Judgment Day
description:
Race to collect Terminator parts (arm and chip) and computer files, and then be the player to destroy the T-1000 cyborg.

First,you must run a frantic race around the board to find three high-tech equipment tokens.
As you rush to complete your mission, you must fight the dreaded T-1000, an incredible liquid-metal cyborg from the future. A roll of the battle dice will determine your success. Be the first to melt the T-1000 in a vat of molten steel and win the game!

Contents of British edition:
1 Game Board.
4 John/Sarah Conner Playing Pieces.
1 T-1000 Piece.
5 Stands.
12 High-Tech Equipment Tokens.
48 Cards.
3 Dice.
1 Rules Booklet.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Trivial Pursuit: Biographies Edition
description: The Biographies Edition contains 1,200 new questions in all the familiar categories for play with the master game, or it can be played as a stand-alone game using special dice and score sheets included in the game box.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: There and Back
description:
In There and Back, a game published in England c. 1930s, players attempt to score points by building a sequence of towns leading back to the town that started the sequence. No publisher is listed anywhere in the instructions or on the box, but it's of typical professional quality for the period. The cards are approximately 1" x 3", a rather unusual size.

A new edition of this game was published by Gazebo Games in 2006.
publishers: Clifford Toys, Gazebo Games UK Ltd.

name: Rail Race
description:
Game components: Game board map of Britain, 6 metal steam locomotive playing pieces, route cards, incident cards, dice and a dice shaker.

Object of the game: Travel from a south coast town to a northern town and back. The route cards determine which towns must be passed through. The incident cards contain events that can hinder movement.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Flight
description: The theme is air travel along four Imperial air routes. Each route comprises an aircraft card and five destination cards valued sequentially from one to five points . For example the yellow route starts with a Douglas Skymaster card and then in order: Tripoli; Khartoum; Kisumu; Johannesburg and Durban. All routes end with a ‘Safe Landing’ card valued at six points. A player may play a destination card on any route, but in sequence. Routes can be interrupted with ‘Fog’ and ‘Customs’ cards. These in turn can be canceled by respectively: ‘Alternative Route’ and ‘Passport’ cards. The game ends when the first ‘Safe Landing’ card is played. Points are then awarded for playing the ‘Safe Landing’ card. Points are also awarded for having been the first player to play all of their cards. Points are deducted for cards still held at the game end. The rules suggest playing a number of games, the winner being the first player to score a hundred points.

name: Scrabble Sentence Game for Juniors
description: This is a game where children put sentences on the board and try to get the most points at the end of the game. There are two sides on the board. One side has the sentences printed on them, and as the players complete the sentences, they get chits from the kitty. The other side of the board is blank and the players form their own sentences. They would get one point for each word in the sentence. Recommended for Ages 6 - 12.
publishers: Puremco, Selchow & Righter, The Games Gang, LTD

name: Monopoly: Ultraman
description:
Ultraman is a creation of the 1960s and a huge part of popular Japanese culture. Various incarnations of Ultraman battle an assortment of weird monsters.
The Ultraman Monopoly edition has Ultrapods instead of houses and Ultratowers instead of hotels.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Funny Ha-Ha!
description:
From the publisher's site (freely translated from Finnish):

The incredibly funny joke game!

Funny Ha-Ha will make you laugh in a matter of seconds! Even though to win this game you are supposed to not laugh. The game contains hundreds of jokes of different categories; animal jokes, restaurant jokes, Swedish jokes, school jokes, hospital jokes... Tell a joke, make up a funny face, play the laugh track. The main point is to make your opponents laugh and collect the points. Funny Ha-Ha is a true source of laughter for the whole family. All you need is a cassette player and a hilarious gaming session can begin. But remember, if you are planning to win... DON'T LAUGH... DON'T EVEN SMILE!

name: DeRail
description:
From Rules:
Welcome to DeRail, the railroad game engineered for both simple play and strategic challenge. As players lay cards on the gameboard, trips along the authentic track segments build up scoring points. the game board changes with every turn as players lay cards and move train game pieces.

name: Jungle Mix: The Lion King
description:
In this game of hide and seek, players must try to find Simba's friends Timon, Pumbaa, Nala and Rafiki, displayed on 24 cardboard chits. The chits are hidden inside three compartments in the game box that are covered with lids.

On your turn, roll a die and try to find the animal it shows by lifting one of the lids.

The game involves mainly luck and only a little bit of memory.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Boing, Boing Tigger
description:
A children's game for ages 3-6; containing 1 very active Tigger-figure and 12 objects.

Tigger is planning a trip and there are lots of things he needs to take with him; his hat, walking stick, scarf and lots more! But will he be able to carry everything? Load up Tigger, but don't be the first to make him bounce! Who can hang the most objects on him he needs for his walk? This game is based on the Winnie the Pooh series. Languages: Dutch, English, German, Italian, French.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Blue
description:
From the rules: Blue is from the series Factor-5 and is the first jigsaw in which you can compete against other players. You must quickly find suitable pieces to make the jigsaw and then swap the pieces which are the wrong color - you will be surprised by how many possibilities there are.

The game consists of 5 nearly identical jigsaw puzzles of 48 pieces each. There are multiple objects in the picture on the puzzle which are different on each board. All the pieces are then mixed together. Players race to complete the puzzle gaining points for first, second etc. In the second part of the game, players swap pieces to correct errors subtracting incorrect pieces from your score.

name: Speed Buggy Game
description:
Roll and move, start-Finish game. But a couple of interesting strategy rules that takes it into an advanced children's game.

Players use a the built-in spinner. They must move their piece in a straight line. Players may not move over or through other players. Also any player who reaches a wall and has extra movement loses a turn. As a result there is some strategy to play when you try to block the other players.

A simple but enjoyable game.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pusher's Street
description:
It's an Italian board game about drugs. Mechanics are like Monopoly, but the curious thing is the topic... Players are dope dealers trying to buy and sell all kinds of drugs and at the same time they have to avoid police.

This board game is set in an underground fantasy world. It concerns the buying and selling of so-called "soft" narcotic substances. The aim is to be able to pass the "go" with 2 "Charas" pawns, in a complex circular path by amusing vicissitudes and it won't be easy because, in addition to the other players who have the same objective, they will have to deal with the Police who monitor the game path.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Monopoly: St. Louis Cardinals Collector's Edition
description:
This is Monopoly but based on the St. Louis Cardinals MLB baseball team.
It contains 6 pewter peices.
Published at a time When Mark McGwire was on the team.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Iskelm√§: Parhaita Kotimaisia
description:
A Finnish pop music trivia game, produced in co-operation with the radio network Iskelmä. Mechanics are very similar to Trivial Pursuit but as an added extra the game comes with a CD with 150 song samples; before advancing to the central circle and winning the game, a player must listen to and correctly identify at least one song. (If a CD player is not available, a player that lands in the CD circle can freely choose the category of a question.) A later edition had a DVD with 200 songs instead, and a third one omitted the CD/DVD along with the whole category completely, and has only the first four categories.

The categories of the questions are:

1) Songs
2) Lyrics
3) Artists, bands, lyricists, miscellaneous
4) Years, competitions, charts
5) CD/DVD (samples)

Game designer is uncredited, but the questions have been compiled by Pekka Nieminen and the music is by Studio Tauko/Yrjö Buckbee.

Note: "Iskelmä" does not have a direct translation in English but the German term "Schlager" has broadly the same meaning. A good example is Eurovision which is often described as a schlager competition.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game, Trivia

name: SuDoku: Die Spielesammlung
description:
SuDoku: Die Spielesammlung is a set of six games which use similar Sudoku-like rules to govern placement of tiles.

In each game, players have identical sets of tiles (numbered 1-9 multiple times) and each turn play one which is randomly drawn. Certain defined sections of the board can only have one of each number in them.
